Unfortunately the only reference to these caps comes in the parts list and I only realized their utility when I read a previous review.Cons- This unit sounds more like a leaf blower than a vacuum.  There is a high-pitched whine in addition to the motor sound.  It is far and away the loudest vacuum that I own, including very powerful corded models.  The sound is so loud and objectionable that I can only use the unit with hearing protectors. This vacuum was not designed primarily as a carpet cleaner.  It does not have a beater-bar and its suction is insufficient to do a good job on carpets.  It is OK if you want to pick up some crumbs, but you will have to leave true carpet cleaning for a regular, more powerful, vacuum. All the attachments just slide onto the end of the wand.  It is a tight fit and there is no locking mechanism to ensure that they stay in place and are properly oriented.  The fit is so tight that staying in place is so far not a problem, but could be with use.  Since the tools just slide in place there is no mechanism to properly orient them, which is necessary so that the handle of the unit does not have to be held at an odd angle.  One just needs to rotate the tool to prevent this, but it is annoying to have to make this adjustment every time the unit is used, especially since the fit is so snug.  I have had to put a line-up mark of the wand and tool to simplify this task, but this should have been part of the design.

This is the second of the three-volume biography of Theodore Roosevelt by Edmond Morris.  It is an excellent book, which covers TRs terms as President of the US.  It is an excellent book  well written and informative.  There is a 40-page prologue that brings the story up to 1900, so the book stands alone even though it covers only a portion of TRs life.The book shows that Roosevelt enjoyed being President, and put a stamp on it like none other since Lincoln.  Few presidents have been more active in the job, more forceful or accomplished more.  He could point to: a reaffirmation of the Monroe doctrine with his own corollary, the construction of a canal linking the Atlantic and Pacific oceans, contributing to peace in Asia, and the building of a great naval fleet.  His domestic record included new railroad control legislation, a food and drug law, improved worker safety and much more square deal legislation.

This is the first of Morris three-volume biography of Theodore Roosevelt. It covers his life from birth until he was made President of the US upon the death of William McKinley.  The book is very well written, making  TR come alive.  The writing is both interesting and informative and I highly recommend the book to all those interested in US history and Teddy Roosevelt.

This book is an illustrated history of the Spanish-American war.  It contains black and white photographs, drawing and maps and interesting text.  About half the book consists of these illustrations.  All of the war in covered  the naval battles as well as the land battles and events in the Caribbean and the Pacific.  The text is generally superficial with a lot of quotes from the participants.  It is not, however, a detailed analysis of the war, but mostly just of the war itself and the men who fought in it.  Theodore Roosevelt and the Rough Riders are discussed, but are not the main focus of the book.I recommend this book to those interested in US history, military history and those interested in pictures of the fighting of the Spanish-American war.  Those looking for a scholarly analysis of the conflict may be a bit disappointed, but should be more than compensated by the wealth of pictures, maps and drawing that the book contains.

This is an interesting and well-written book.  It is a highly detailed biography of the life of Cornelius Vanderbilt - how he built up his steamship and then railroad empires, and his impact on the US.  It also covers his upbringing, marriage, and family. I enjoyed the book, but at times I found the level of detail a bit overwhelming and that some judicious editing would have, for me at least, raised this from a book that I liked (4-stars) to one that I might have loved (5-stars).  I recommend this book to anyone interested in US history, biography and railroad history.What is in the book  The book is divided into three sections, each of which is subdivided into many chapters.  These sections were:1) Captain 1794-1847.  This section details the earliest years of Vanderbilts life, from his birth to middle age.  This section details his boyhood and how it shaped his life.  It discusses his early life on Staten Island and how he became a steamboat captain and then owner of steamboats. The section discusses his marriage to his first cousin Sophia and the upbringing of their 13 children.  It discusses the disappointments that he had with his younger sons, but better relations with his sons-in-law.  I enjoyed this section the most of the three as in many ways it was the most exciting and gave me the most significant view of how Vanderbilt became the legendary Vanderbilt.2) Commodore 1848 1860. This section discusses the rise from Captain Vanderbilt, the captain of steamboats, to Commodore Vanderbilt the owner of a steamboat empire.  Among other things it discusses his involvement with the transportation to California - by steamship down the Atlantic to Central America, across Central America by various means and then by steamship on the Pacific to California.  Vanderbilts preferred route was through Nicaragua, instead of Panama, and the book describes many exciting incidents that occurred as he tried, unsuccessfully, to establish this as the land part of the trip to California.  It also discusses his steamboat empire and how this raised him to be called Commodore, then the highest rank in the US Navy.  (This was an unofficial title as Vanderbilt never served in the Navy.)  This section discuses the grooming of his oldest son to succeed him and the problems with his younger sons.3) King 1861-1877.  This final section discusses Vanderbilts efforts to have the US employ his steamboats during the Civil War, and his eventual sale of his steamboats so that he could concentrate on railroads.  There is a lot of details here concerning his Harlem, Hudson and New York Central railroad lines and of his struggles to consolidate his railroad empire. This part of the book contains a lot about his struggles with men like Daniel Drew, Jay Gould and Jim Fisk and goes into detail about the Erie War.  It also discusses his second marriage, after the death of Sophia, to a woman some 45 years his junior and the ongoing problems with his son Corneil, and his growing acceptance of his oldest son William as the inheritor of not only the bulk of his estate, but as the one who was to control his vast empire on his death.  This section also discusses a lot about the 19th century stock market, and the impact of railroads on the US.

This is an extremely bright bulb.  It produces 2170 Lumens of light versus only 700 for the 65-Watt equivalent LED bulb that I have also used and reviewed.  These bulbs are a bit larger in diameter than 65-Watt incandescent bulb or a 65-Watt equivalent bulb.  They have a maximum diameter of five inches versus about 3.5 inches for the 65-Watt bulbs and about 4.5 inches for a 120-Watt incandescent bulb.  I mention this because this type of bulb is generally used in a ceiling can fixture, so one should be sure to measure the can diameter to make sure that it will fit.  It easily fit into my ceiling fixture and I was greatly impressed because:1. The bulb is not only very bright but has a nice white color compared to the yellowish color of most of the other bulbs that I have.  Furthermore, the bulb does all this while consuming only 25 Watts of power.  This is a lot of light, and may be more than is required in some applications, particularly when multiple bulbs are used in close proximity, in which case I would recommend a 65-Watt equivalent LED bulb.2. The bulb has an extremely long projected life (23 years if used 3 hours/day), but there is no way to confirm this at this time.3. The bulb is dimmable, but only for some dimming systems, which are noted in the packaging.4. Like all LED bulbs, this one is instant on, unlike compact fluorescent bulbs that are initially quite dim.5. Like all LED bulbs these bulbs contain no mercury.  While compact fluorescent bulbs only contain a little mercury, the hundreds of millions of them that will end up in land fills are poisoning the environment and should never have been promoted as a replacement for incandescent bulbs.

This is an entertaining and informative book that reads like a novel.  It is a fascinating study of betrayal  betrayal of ones country and the personal betrayal of ones friends.  The betrayer was Kim Philby, perhaps the most important soviet spy and the betrayed were Nicholas Elliott, who unknowingly covered for Philby when questions were first raised about his being a spy, James J. Angleton of the CIA, Philbys wife and lastly the whole British upper-class.  The book tells of these betrayals with the skill of the novelist that the author is.  It also tells of the blindness of the British who could never believe that a man such as Philby could be a spy, in spite of the fact that in the 1930s he was openly a communist.  It also tells of the blindness and arrogance of a man like Angleton who believed that he was so smart that he could not have allowed himself to be one of Philbys important sources of information.  This is another of those stories that would be unbelievable if it were not true.I recommend this book to anyone interested in the history of WWII, the cold war and to those who like to read non-fiction books that are as entertaining as any work of fiction.

I must say that I was greatly impressed by all aspects of this bulb, namely:1. The most important characteristic of a light bulb is the amount of light it produces versus the energy it takes to produce this light.  This LED bulb produces 700 lumens, while consuming only 12 watts of power, and is sold as equivalent to a 65-watt incandescent bulb.  I used this bulb to replace a 65-watt incandescent bulb that was rated as producing 755 lumens.  However, possibly because of the difference in the color balance between the two bulbs, this LED bulb appeared brighter than the bulb it replaced, while consuming only 18% as much power.2. A second important feature of a bulb is its lifetime.  This LED bulb is rated as having a 23-year life, when used three hours a day, or a life of about 25,000 hours.  The incandescent bulb it replaced was rated at 2,000 hours.  There is no way for me to currently verify the 25,000 hour life claim, but I will modify this review if the bulb fails in very much less time than this.  I should also note that compact fluorescent (CF) bulbs are also rated as having very long lives, but in my experience the claim of long life for a ceiling spotlight CF bulb is highly overrated.  This is because of the heat generated in this type of bulb when it is used in a ceiling, base up, configuration.  It remains to be seen if the LED bulb being reviewed here will suffer from the same problem.  The CF ceiling bulbs that I have are rated for 10,000 hours versus 25,000 for this LED bulb and draw a bit more power (15-watts versus 12-watts), for a slightly greater lumen output (750 lumens versus 700 lumens), but appear no brighter.3. The bulb was dimmable as advertised.4. The packaging was impressive and laid to rest any qualms I had about having a light bulb delivered in the mail.5. The bulb was instant on, unlike the compact fluorescent (CF) bulbs that I have used.6. Unlike CF bulbs, this LED bulb contains no mercury to pollute the environment.The instant on feature and lack of mercury feature are true for all of LED type bulbs, and as such are not specific to just to the bulb being discussed here, but they are nonetheless important considerations.  I have always found the slow increase in intensity of a CF bulb to be highly annoying and one reason why I have ceased using them.  A more important reason for not using a CF bulb is that they contain mercury - a small amount to be sure, but when hundreds of millions of them end up in the landfill they pollute out water supply.  I take my dead CF bulbs back to where I purchased them for proper disposal, but I doubt that most people do likewise.I consider the governments decision to effectively ban incandescent bulbs by requiring them to meet extremely high efficiency standards. to have been a very unfortunate piece of legislation because a few years ago CF bulbs were the only reasonable replacement for the incandescent bulbs. These new LED type bulbs are competitively priced when their extremely long life is considered, and most importantly they eliminate the mercury problem.  I am very happy to see such high quality bulbs such as readily available, and hopefully they will drive CF bulbs off the market.

Trying to discuss the Standard Model of nuclear physics and how the Higgs particle fits into this paradigm is not an easy task.  This book did an OK job in explaining this, but not as clearly as I had hoped it would have.  I have a reasonable technical background and I have read quite a bit about the Standard Model, so I found the treatment generally clearly written, but a little sketchy as to details.  However, I suspect that someone without a technical background would find the book over their heads, even though it contains no mathematics.I found the short Epilogue to be the best part of the book and in my opinion the book would have been greatly improved if it were expanded or if there was an appendix that summarizes the Standard Model in a little more detail.  While I have rated this book four-stars, I have my reservations about how useful this book would be for a reader with little or not technical background or previous exposure to the Standard Model and I would rate it at only two or at best three-stars for that audience.What is in the book - The book treats the subject from a historical perspective, starting with the idea of symmetry and how this relates to physical laws.  While this discussion was initially very clear, it shifted into a discussion of symmetry in Group Theory, of Lie Groups, without any mention of what Group Theory is and exactly what a Lie Group is.  I think that an appendix covering this subject would have been very helpful.  I think that much of this material would be difficult at best for someone without some background in this mathematics and the physics associated with it. The book then shifts to the historical development of the Standard Model.  Since I was familiar with this material I found this to be clearly written, but sketchy, perhaps too sketchy for someone with no familiarity with this material. The final sections of the book discuss the machines that have been developed in order to investigate the atomic nucleus, culminating in the development and operation of the Large Hadron Collider at CERN.  This part of the book would probably be the most interesting for someone that might have been frustrated by the mathematics and physics discussed in the rest of the book.

These are indeed tea towels, and as such are meant to cover a teapot or dish of scones, and are not primarily to be used as absorbent dishtowels. I was thus not disappointed by the fact that they were not very absorbent or as useful as a terrycloth dishtowel - I did not expect them to be such. However, they were in my opinion only just OK as tea towels.The stripe was a dull gray and not what I would describe as more olive, as shown in the picture. Rather, the stripe looked washed out and quite dull. These towels are indeed linen, but they were quite thin and not very luxurious feeling. They came in a plastic bag and would not be very suitable as a hostess gift. The lack of a box, or nice packaging, may be due to the fact that being a Vine item they cannot be gifted. However, if you purchase these and they do not come in a box you may be disappointed by their unsuitability as a gift.

This is why I found this book so distasteful:  it's a caricature of a person with an illness.  It blithely bypasses the emotional aspects of a man suffering with Asperger's.  (And yes, Autism can cause intense negative feelings, depression, and loneliness among its numbers.)  As an educator, I taught a young man with Autism.  He was nothing like Don, the protagonist in the book.  His brain was incapable of thinking like most of us and could not grasp the social nuances attributed to Don.  Even those who are mildly afflicted just don't react in ways we expect.  I know of another individual who lives in his own world and is far removed from Don, who the author would have us believe is simply a step or two from 'normal' living.  And I have watched the painful humiliation and isolation of two other children with Asperger's.  Their lives and emotional well being have been scarred by our society's rejection of them.This book is written by someone who has no understanding of the thinking, feelings, and reactions of social 'misfits'.  If you care about someone on the Autism spectrum, you won't enjoy The Rosie Project.

The concept is terrific and lets your imagination run wild with the various ways this cookie can be decorated:  frills, laces, pearls, colors, etc.  That said, be aware of two drawbacks:  it is not firm (after all, it is made of tin) and if you apply too much pressure, it can lose its shape.  Also, it needs to be hand washed and dried immediately after use.  If not, it can rust.  Treat it well and it should last a long time.

This is an eye-catching gift for those with a penchant for history, law, and novelty items.  It is not crafted as a fine piece of china; however, it is a delicate item.  Be very careful and read the directions that come with the mug.  You will see that it CANNOT BE WASHED IN THE DISHWASHER.  If you do, the Supreme Court's decisions will literally wash away--forever.  Rinse out the mug after using it to minimize the amount of washing and handling it requires.  Use a soft sponge and a bit of soap to wash it.  That's it.  And it should last for a long time.I previously bought another 'disappearing' mug close to a year ago.  It is still in good shape and draws amazed comments when someone sees it change for the first time.This is a wonderful gift for lawyers, history teachers, law students, para-legals, etc.  It's also a terrific conversation starter for all of us.

This is an eye-catching gift for those with a penchant for history, politics, and novelty items.  It is not crafted as a fine piece of china; however, it is a delicate item.  Be very careful and read the directions that come with the mug.  You will see that it CANNOT BE WASHED IN THE DISHWASHER.  If you do, your Civil Liberties will literally wash away--forever.  Rinse out the mug after using it to minimize the amount of washing and handling it requires.  Use a soft sponge and a bit of soap to wash it.  That's it.  And it should last for a long time.I previously bought another 'disappearing' mug close to a year ago.  It is still in good shape and draws amazed comments when someone sees it change for the first time.This is an interesting way to re-familiarize ourselves with our Bill of Rights and to see how they are disappearing.

Author Alice Hoffman once again succeeds (but only partially)  with her lyrical prose, giving us a vivid description of the island of St. Thomas, her pen painting it in water-colored impressionist shapes and hues. Settings are life-like, yet surreal.  The reading experience is of stepping into a painting, much like Alice through the looking glass.While plot typically is driven with events, they become minor points.  What clearly drives this story is its protagonist, Rachel.  Rachel, as a child, vexed her own mother so, that she damned her with the ages-old curse, of someday being tormented by a child like herself.  She was a dutiful daughter--to a point--but clearly, lived her life as she saw fit, defying the  tenets of her society.Hoffman's storytelling excelled for about the first half of the book.  Life on the island, its native inhabitants (slaves and freed men), and the European immigrants were fascinating.  Descriptions of people, dwellings, foods, tropical plants, politics, clothing, etiquette, customs, medicinal herbs, and travel all brought the reader into this story of historical fiction.  We saw life through Rachel's eyes.  Then, without warning, the perspective  changed.  This was no longer Rachel's story.  Hoffman brushed her aside to bring us (one assumes) the real reason she wrote her book; namely to introduce to us Jacobo Camille Pissaro, the father of Impressionism--one of her sons.  It left me feeling adrift, as if I were abandoned as the solitary inhabitant of an island, watching the ship on which I was traveling, sailing off without me. Until this moment, this was a five-star book.  Then, Rachel's other children were neatly stored away, like so much memorabilia in trunks never opened.  As Camille's presence grew, they retreated to ghostly insignificance.  Hoffman lost me here.  If her intention was to create the background story of Camille's mother, it would have been better done in the form of flashbacks, leaving him as the protagonist.  It's not that her writing style and abilities changed, it's that the focus did, and I didn't like it.  That dropped my rating to three stars.If you have enjoyed reading Hoffman's other stories (such as The Dovekeepers), you will like her thorough research, style and adroit storytelling in The Marriage of Opposites.  Just be aware of the story's sudden metamorphosis into a completely different tale.  Hence, a rating of four stars.

If you're intent on learning how to play Mah Jongg, this book is a great help.  Yes, you can learn from other players, but if you still need remedial help (I did!), get this book.  Author Elaine Sandberg writes plainly, in uncomplicated sentences.  She has organized the chapters in the best possible way for learning.  Each chapter has a summary and then a small quiz at the end.  You need to do them, as they recap what you've learned and you can determine where you need to go back and re-read.Take her advice and set-up the hands.  It will familiarize you with the various possibilities.  I took it a step further.  I set-up hands using this year's card (not the dated one she supplies at the back of her book).  Then using the method she recommends (position tiles on rack by suits and numbers first, in ascending order; then look at the card, finding which section is the most opportune one with which to play your hand), choose the hand you want to play.  I did this, but with a variation.  I asked a knowledgeable Mah Jongg friend to come over and look at the four racks I'd set-up.  I then explained to her why I chose to play the hands I'd selected.  She listened, and then either agreed, or pointed out different ways to look at the tiles and play a different hand.  Sometimes, it was within the same section, sometimes not.  Using the book and a friend's help makes the lessons even more meaningful.The most important lessons I gleaned are:  how to set-up the rack (to better select the hands); familiarize yourself with the 50 different possible hands; and (for a beginner) do not change hands mid-game.  Allowing yourself to lose only strengthens your play, by seeing a hand through to its end.  After you have gained confidence, try to switch hands if your original choice isn't working for you.Aside from Ms. Sandberg's book, the next best advice I can give you for learning is to play with kind, non-threatening players.  Seasoned, no-nonsense, cutthroat players will not be patient and you will quickly become a Mah Jongg drop-out.  My group is patient, willing to teach, and helps me to re-hash each hand I play at the end of every game.  They are encouraging, supportive, and kind.  Without them--and the book, I would have given up months ago.  Really.  So, get A Beginner's Guide to American Mah Jongg.

I remember when home scales weighed so much you started wondering how much weight you lost just by trying to move one of them.  Finally, a light-weight scale!  It was so easy to get started; just pull the little plastic tab out of the battery compartment and youre done.  Then, simply place the scale on a hard surface (bathroom floor).  (Is there anyone who doesnt put the scale in the bathroom?)  Next, step on the scaleand moan, cry, or jump up and downnot on the scale, pleaseas your weight is revealed to you.Using the scale is as easy as walking.  Just step on it.  My only complaint is that I wish the reading appeared for a longer moment on the scale.  I sometimes have to get a second reading because I missed it the first time.This scale comes with an app that keeps track of your weight and also your BMI.  I have tried the Nuyu app and it was simple to install.  I did have to set my current weight twice for some reason.  Thereafter, it was accurate.  (I knew because I had recently been weighed at my doctors office.) Also, since I paired the scale to my smartphone, I thought it would just update my weight to the app on my phone.  It doesnt.  You must first connect to your cell phone and the nuyu appa minor annoyance.  It would be nice if the nuyu app could retain the information, but alas, you must log that in yourself elsewhere.  I believe the app will help me keep track of my weight.  Now if only the scale and/or the app could help me skip dessert that would be great!

If a friend who's in the cosmetics business hadn't convinced me to try this, I would never have bought it.  I thought that a washcloth was all I needed with cleanser and water.  Wow, was I wrong!  The Clarisonic Mia2 gets rid of clogged pores and leaves my face far cleaner than my old method.I use my cleaner (about the size of a dime) on the brush head and it is enough to do my face.  The brush lasts about three months or longer.  There is also a firmer head (available for purchase) for body cleansing.I like the compact travel case that comes with the unit.  And instead of a bulky charger, the handle attaches (via a thin electric cord)  to a small charger.  It takes up little space and that's good for daily use and when traveling.

This cookie cutter was well made with the exception of a small, rough edge on the top near the right foot.  I will try to sand it down.  It won't, however, mar the cookies, as it's not on the cutting side.Copper is a soft material, so be careful not to press too hard, pushing it out of shape. Wash and dry it by hand to keep it in good condition.  Putting it in the dishwasher will eventually lead to discoloration.

Tina Fey has a marvelous sense of humor.  She's self-deprecating and doesn't put down others.  She writes well--not just comedy routines--and lets the reader see how her interests in theater and comedy evolved.She's the kind of person I'd like to have lunch with--and then regret that it has to end.

I ordered this in three different sizes, not knowing which one would fit.  I found the waist to be much smaller than my usual size--at least  1 1/2" too small.  If you have a large waist, order up one size.  Now that I have the right waist size, I will need professional tailoring to take in the hips.The photo of the model made me think the legs on these pants were somewhat fitted in the thighs.  That's not the case.  All three sizes I ordered were bulkier than the photo led me to believe.  I will have the legs tapered, too.I bought the blazer, skirt, and pants in the same fabric and color, wanting to have many wardrobe options (for a pantsuit, skirt suit).  If not for that, I would not keep the pants.  The tailoring will be expensive.The pants are lined and will require dry cleaning.Please note that all the wool Pendleton items I ordered arrived quite wrinkled.  Even steaming in the bathroom wouldn't remove the wrinkles.  A professional pressing is needed.

Buying a blazer online is not easy to fit.  If you have shorter arms than most, maybe the petite size will work for you.  For me, it was a great fit.  Just order up one size.  For example, if you normally wear a size 10, order the petite 12.  I found that the shoulders were a perfect fit and sleeve length didn't need shortening.  In addition, the blazer hits my hips at just the right length.The blazer is lined and will require dry cleaning.Please note that all the wool Pendleton items I ordered arrived quite wrinkled.  Even steaming in the bathroom wouldn't remove the wrinkles.  A professional pressing is needed.

The quality of the Pendleton Worsted Lana Skirt is good.  I ordered the blazer and pants, too.  I find that the waist on the skirt and pants is a bit snug--by about 1 1/2", compared to what I normally wear.  As a result, I ordered the size 10 and will have it taken in through the hips.This article is lined and requires dry cleaning.If you don't wear your skirts above the knee, there is more than enough length in the skirt to keep you modestly covered.Caveat:  This remark is not about the skirt, but the shipping.  My Pendleton order arrived quite wrinkled.  Since I'd ordered three other items, this is not just a fluke.  All of them arrived the same way.  I tried leaving them to steam out in the bathroom.  It didn't work.  Professional pressing is needed.

This label maker has both negative and positive points, but it is the lack of economy that makes me dislike it so much.  I'll explain below.POSITIVES: Easy-to-use Clear instructions QWERTY keyboard Variety of tape widths Variety of colors, designs, and fonts Operates with either 6 AAA alkaline batteries or Mi-MH batteries Can also operate with an adapter jack (AD-24-ES) but, is not included ($27.99) Additional items can be purchased; ie:  label tapes (varying prices); hard case ($19.99) Comes with assistance:  internet, telephone, some service centers Tapes are 8m long, unless otherwise statedNEGATIVES: Placing the margins set at their narrowest, allows only one side of the margin to be narrow.  The opposite side is one inch in length. Attempting to resolve this issue via internet proved fruitless Extensive wait time for technical assistance via phoneA call to Brother for technical assistance to modify this margin revealed that there is no further narrowing of the margins.  The PT- D 210 is set this way and it cannot be changed.  This means that for every label you print, you will waste one inchalways.  At the cost of these label tapes, this waste is not satisfactory to me.  The fault is not with the machine, but its key accessory, label tapes.Brother stresses registering your PT-D 210 and offering assistance.  Because of these components, it is important that you know about getting help from Brother.  I could not get an answer to my question via the internet.  My experience with phone technical assistance was 21 minutes of wait time before my call was taken.  That is an unreasonable period of time to wait for a question to be answered.I really wanted a battery powered label maker and was anxious to try Brothers label maker PT-D 210.  It failed to impress me because of the waste of margins (loss of money) and a frustrating amount of time spent trying to get technical assistance.  Its reasonable price should not entice you to buy itunless, of course, you dont care how much the label tapes cost or potential loss of time.  Take a pass on this one.

This was the first  Gabriel Allon story I read in Daniel Silva's series (14 so far).  I have enjoyed Silva's books before and that's why I bought this one.  It's so good that, I want to read more of this series.  I'm hooked.The author is an excellent storyteller.  He keeps the plot turning with unexpected events and locales.  Characters are well-drawn and believable.  Silva's use of dialogue is easy and natural and allows the story to progress without being choppy or stilted.Sometimes I read fiction based on disturbing events:  the crises in the Middle East, the lack of women's rights, and WW II, etc.  In between books I need fiction that's less distressing.  THE HEIST is perfect.  It's realistic, yet fiction that let's me relax--but not too much, as Silva keeps me involved and turning pages.

If you haven't tried it, don't poo-poo Poo-Pourri Before-You-Go Toilet Spray.  This product, as its name states, is used prior to using the toilet.  It's a novel approach to de-stinking the bathroom.  Instead of covering-up odors, it traps them in the toilet--under the water--before they can become noxious smells.  The only thing it can't control is the smell with the release of gas.  But, it greatly improves the 'smell-ability' of one of the most used rooms in the house.The Juniper Woods scent (juniper, eucalyptus, citrus) really has a woodsy aroma.  If smells make you think of colors, this one would be green.  It lingers for a little while even after the toilet is flushed.I like that it doesn't have a sweet, floral fragrance.  Another plus is that it isn't a layer of odor on top of a foul one.  It actually eliminates the bad one.This is an environment-friendly product, as the manufacturer claims, "NO harsh chemicals, aerosol, parabens, phthalates, or formaldehyde; All stink-fighting good stuff!"  I like that.The four ounces bottle states that there is enough for up to 200 uses.  I disagree; it's more. The manufacturer suggests using three to five sprays per use.  I find that two are sufficient.  That makes it cost-efficient in comparison to other odor eliminators that aren't nearly as effective.The bottle is attractive enough to leave out and it's so much smaller than an aerosol can of spray, leaving more space in the bathroom.In fact, I can find only one negative.  My bottle arrived without a bottle top.  I think that was an oversight in quality control.  And the only reason I would want a top is to be able to carry it in a purse/briefcase/suitcase.Beyond that, I really like Poo-Pourri Before-You-Go Toilet Spray.  I think I'll try  the Royal Flush scent next time.  It's packaged to be for 'Royal Gents', with the blend of eucalyptus and spearmint.  Then again, the Original scent (lemon, bergamot, lemongrass) is appealing, too.  Or maybe theDeja Poo (white flowers and citrus) or Vanilla Mint, or...

Author Judith Keim is new to me and I bought this book on a whim.  I alternate between 'heavy' reading and lighter stories.  This one was perfect for a fun read.  Not only is this an interesting tale, I can see it becoming a chick flick, too.Keim gives us characters with whom we can bond: a flamboyant, older woman; a middle-aged newly divorced woman, unsure of herself and her future; their daughters; and people who come into their lives.  The premise is one many of us can relate to; divorce and its aftermath.  Life for these women takes a variety of twists and that's what makes the story interesting.If you are looking for a beach read, this is perfect.  Traveling?  Need something light?  Get BREAKFAST AT THE BEACHHOUSE HOTEL.

Powerfully written, this is a tale of both a very old woman and a teenager.  They seemingly have nothing in common.  Author Christina Baker Kline weaves her chapters of the lives of both, alternating with their stories.  While we think their lives run parallel to one another, they definitely converge in a most unexpected way.Baker gives thorough character descriptions, not just of our protagonists, but the minor players, too.  She deftly paints the settings, allowing us to settle into the picture right alongside the characters.  Her use of narrative and dialogue propel the story at the perfect pace.When you want to continue reading and not be interrupted, you know the tale is a good one.  Not only that, I didn't want the story to end; I liked being in Vivian's and Molly's world.
While it does the job, I find it to be overly bulky and the ergonomic design doesn't make it any more easy to use than a 'stick' model.  It comes with a small brush to clean the head--a plus.

This is a difficult book to rate.  The storytelling rates three stars, but the addition (at the end) of others' perspectives about the author, makes it worthy of four stars.  Then too, the subject matter is sensitive and hard to read.Many of us will think, how could a Jewish woman marry a man who would serve in Hitler's Nazi army?  Then again, what would WE do to survive?  This is Edith Hahn Beer's account of her life before, during, and after WW II.  Appalling, fascinating, distressing--it's a true story of a Holocaust victim.

I already use Crest's 3-D toothpaste, so I wasn't sure how well these Whitestrips would perform.  What I found was that my teeth lightened a few more shades.  But the real bonus is that the stubborn yellowness near the gum line  is just about gone.  Overall, my teeth really look so much better; lighter, brighter, whiter.I can see why Crest suggests not only the toothpaste and the mouthwash should be used together, but that, the Whitestrips complete the job.  I'm sold!

Maybe it's the cover photo,or the publishers' hype, but we definitely couldn't judge THIS book by its cover!  If you think this is a fictional beach-read, take a pass on this book.  This is a pseudo-scientific memoir of an Ivy league Ph.D. mommy living among her case studies.Yes, author Wednesday Martin has the creds--scholastically and as a successful writer.  And yes, she attempts to provide insight into the world of the wealthy and their social practices.  And initially, it works.  But somewhere as her 'experiment' progresses, the line is blurred and the scientist becomes one of the very primates she is studying.Frankly, I thought it would be interesting to learn how the uber-wealthy live.  What I read was more reminiscent of middle school cliques:  exclusivity, snobbery, and downright meanness.  And for all of our social advances with women's equality, this group is totally dependent upon their husbands, both socially and economically.  Their children's successes become THEIR successes--the standard against which they are measured.  Can you imagine the pressures placed on them by their parents!This is the adult version of being a copycat.  Shoes, clothing, handbags, jewelry, multiple homes, elite vacations, exclusive schools, hours spent daily in body exhausting exercise and perpetual dieting.  This group subscribes to Gloria Vanderbilt's rule that a woman can never be too rich or too thin.  If this is life as a rich and powerful matron, no thanks!If the author had only used her experiences to write a fictional account of life among the Park Avenue Primates, it would have been a far more interesting read.  There are no fully developed characters--no one with whom we can bond as readers.  And, with the exception of a personal loss, not one individual has empathy.  This is a pathetically lacking group of women; socially, intellectually, and personally.  For an experienced author, Martin falls short.  Don't waste your time or your money on this one.

This is an exceptionally well-made cake pan.  It has substantial weight for even baking and its darker surface allows for better browning.  The inner surface is smooth, so cakes release without tearing.  (Be sure to coat the interior with cooking spray before adding your batter.)  As with all cake pans with holes in the middle, it makes sure that the cake will bake evenly.I like the dramatic, deep swirls of this pan.  I tried to get three different flavors and looks by alternately 'striping'-in chocolate, orange, and vanilla batters.  When baked and unmolded, the chocolate was beautifully dark and different looking.  However, despite putting orange coloring into the batter (to differentiate it from the vanilla), the two tones were nearly identical.  The cake can be glazed or dusted with 10X sugar.There is only one point that doesn't please me.  When placed on a plate, the tips of the swirls (the bottom of the cake) have a sharp, jagged appearance.  It almost makes it look unfinished.  This is just my perspective and should in no way be taken as a negative about the pan.Nordic Ware is a brand you can trust.  I have had two other Nordic Ware Bundt pans for many, many years and I've always been pleased with their products.  Whether this is your first Bundt pan, or an addition to your collection, you will be pleased with the look and compliments of the Nordic Ware Platinum Collection Heritage Bundt Pan.

This book is exceptionally well-researched and documented.  It is a 'coffee-table'-sized book about the life of Abraham Lincoln, containing photos and documents you have likely never seen. Lincoln was an anomaly for his time.  He developed an acceptance and appreciation for Jews early in his life and fought to change perceptions about them early in his career and in his presidency.  He felt so strongly about including them that, he changed American thought of our being a 'Christian nation' to being 'one nation under God'.He studied the Old Testament and frequently quoted from it.  It is believed that, the story of enslavement and the eventual Exodus is responsible for his desire to end slavery in our country and to embrace all people--whites, blacks, and Jews--as equal Americans. We think of Lincoln as the president who freed the slaves, but really, there is so much more to him and to his presidency.If you have an appreciation for (authenticated) history and good writing, you will want to read LINCOLN AND THE JEWS.

Author Julie Sarff's THE HEIR TO VILLA BUSCHI is a mystery, yes.  But it's also written tongue-in-cheek, and the word 'farce' comes to mind.  There's intrigue (Who knew that the owner of the villa had fathered a child--and his heir?), a bit of romance, and food--all set in Europe.  This makes for a perfect 'beach read'.

This is one of the earlier 'Jack Reacher' titles that I read by author Lee Child.  Simply put, I was hooked.  Child is exceptional at pacing, plot, dialogue, and narrative.  He definitely is a proponent of 'show--don't tell'.  While he gives us enough character descriptions and background information, he doesn't allow them to overwhelm the story.Jack Reacher is the protagonist whom trouble seeks.  He always finds himself in situations demanding the skills he learned as a military cop.  He's smart, clever, and uses his size to his advantage.Each story features Reacher in novel situations.  As readers, we can try to figure out motives, next moves, and outcomes, but Reacher is always steps ahead.  If you enjoy being engrossed in a story and matching wits with the hero, THE ENEMY is a book you will want to read.

Almost perfect!  Thats the HP Envy laptop in a nutshell.  It is darn near perfect.  The HP Envy is aptly named as you will be the envy of everyone once you get this laptop.  This laptop is fast, with its 2.5GHz Intel i-7 CPU and 8GB of high speed RAM.  This laptop has many more great features yet is priced reasonably at around $800.Some laptops in the $600 - $800 range skimp on the display.  The HP Envy has a 1080P high definition display that is also a very accurate touchscreen.  The display is powered by a reliable Intel HD Graphics card which will more than adequately suit your needs, from video watching to even light gaming.  So, this laptop will let you watch Netflix or Amazon, while using another screen for MS Word, and have Skype Video Chat all at once.  You can even play games that dont require expensive video cards.  If you are looking for a gaming laptop, however, then you might be disappointed.The webcam works perfectly, even in bad lighting.  Some laptops have a lag with their webcam, but the Envys has no lag and comes ready to use with free software.So many laptops on the market consider two tiny speakers a sound system.  The HP Envy will easily satisfy your inner-audiophile with its beat audio, that includes a built-in subwoofer!  How cool is that!  Im not referring to a lame, simulated subwoofer.  Its a real bonafide subwoofer in the laptop!Theres plenty of room on the Envys hard drive for your music and movies because this laptop has a terabyte hard drive.  Thats a 1000 GB!  Some other nice features are the backlight keyboard, USB 3.0, and as previously mentioned, a full HD Display which is also the best touchscreen I have ever used!Still not convinced that this is the laptop for you?  Then, lets discuss the few cons of the HP Envy.  The built-in fingerprint reader offers an easy and interesting way to login to your laptop and websites.  However, it is also a nuisance.  Your left hand will tend to turn on the fingerprint reader when you type.  I solved that by disabling the fingerprint reader.My biggest gripe with the HP Envy and many other popular laptops is that it is a complete pain to upgrade.  HP clearly does not want us to upgrade the laptop by ourselves.  The (seemingly ridiculous) amount of screws and easily damaged exterior plastic shell was a challenge to overcome to say the least.  My son, however, was not content to have me pay an authorized HP vendor to upgrade my HP Envy.  If you are insistent on upgrading your HP Envy laptop, then know it is a bumpy road to completing your goal.All in all, the HP Envy gets four-and-a-half out of five stars.  This lack of a half-star is for the difficulty in upgrading the RAM.  But this is becoming increasingly common with todays laptops.  YOU CANNOT DO BETTER at this price level.  If you are looking for a laptop that more than meets your work needs and satisfies your entertainment needs, then get the Envy!

The Hoover Commercial CH50400 is perfect for the purpose for which it was designed; cleaning a large area of varying floor types and heights.  Please keep in mind that this is a commercial unit and the review reflects that.  This means it only reviews the vacuum as it pertains to what it can do; not what it cannot do compared to a standard residential model.  If all you need is to clean large areas of varying surfaces, then this is the vacuum for you.  That's it.  That's all it does.  It has good power, it's lightweight, and has a super long cord.  There are no lights, no hose, no attachments; just a powerful, easy-to-use vacuum.The bag is HEPA rated and disposable.  A quick search on Amazon puts replacement bags at about $4.50 each, but they are quite large and if used in a residence would need infrequent changing.  Assembly was practically non-existent; just pop the pre-assembled handle into the unit and put in one screw.  It comes with a fairly long cord that nearly allowed me to clean the whole house without switching plugs.  Longer stand alone cords can be used, but I would recommend consulting the table in the owner's manual to ensure the correct gauge is used with the vacuum to avoid any electrical issues.There are also a quick release hook for the power cord and a sturdy carrying handle.  There is a "stair cleaning handle" in the front of the unit down by the bottom of the bag holder, but I got a back ache just from looking at the directions which has a drawing of the person picking up the whole unit to clean each tread.  Just remember that the name says it all; Hoover Commercial.  If you need all the doodads, bells and whistles, then just pass on this.  But if you need a basic vacuum that will last a long time, then this one is for you.

The PowerStroke PS14133 1700PSI Electric Pressure Washer does an excellent job as a residential pressure washer.  Its directions for assembly and usage are clearly written and it's quite easy to use--for both women and men.We used it to clean mold off our sidewalk and the faux stone columns of our patio.  It cleaned dirt off the pavers and can sometimes get rid of the small weeds that grow between the stones.It's important to note that, since this operates with electric power, precautions should be taken as it also involves water.  The electric cord will probably not be long enough  to reach all the places you want to clean.  This means adding an extension cord.  The directions include the warning that, if using an extension cord, the coupling needs to be raised well above the water area to prevent electrocution.So, why does it rate four--and not five--stars?  Despite its five-star performance, we considered storage of the unit.  After all, most of the time it will be sitting in your garage or shed.  We find one fault with the PowerStroke PS14133.  The long wand sticks out, taking up more storage space.  And most of us need more--not less--storage capacity.  If it were configured more like the PS14120 (less PSI, amps, and wheel base), the wand would be stored vertically.  If it were possible to rate 4.5 stars, that would be an appropriate rating.  But since we can't, and it would be misleading to tell you it worthy of five stars, we must rate it as four.

The Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5 Tablet is my first one.  I read research by professional techies, pored over recommendations at blog sites, and asked many others what they enjoy using for a tablet.  The overwhelming response was the Apple brand.  That said, the next best choice was the Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5 Tablet.Since I use an Android phone and dont have Apple products, it seemed pointless to buy a Tablet that would not seamlessly sync with my other electronics.  If you are an Apple user, you would probably be wise to choose one of this brands products.I love my Samsung tablet!  It was quite easy to learn how to use it.  The size and light weight make it a pleasure to use and carry.  The color is vivid; the clarity is sharp, with a resolution of 2560 x 1600.  Samsung lets the user determine the screens brightness.  As a result, it can be used both indoors and out with ease.The sound is sharp and I find no problems with it.  Watching a movie and hearing its content is a pleasure.  There is no sense of muffled sound at all.The tablet connects to my WiFi at home.  If I take it out, I can connect via my phone.  And battery life is remarkably long lasting.  After doing emails, reading, and practicing how to use it, my battery power (after three days) is a strong 56%.I like the touch screen technology and when writing emails, it has the ability to learn my writing style; often offering words before Ive even fully typed or selected them.I initially wanted to use my tablet to take pictures while on a trip.  It has more pixels (8 front facing) than my older Canon camera.  My phone can take a comparable picture, too, as compared to the tablet.  Money had to be considered, also.  So, I had a choice; I could buy a camera or a tablet.  I opted for the tablet, choosing to take pictures with my phone.  The Samsung Galaxy allows me so much more than a camera.  I can do emails, read my Kindle books, watch movies, listen to music, play games, and write.  Yes, it would be nice to have an extremely good camera, but this was the best choice overall.Whether this is your first tablet purchase, or youre replacing one, the Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5 Tablet is one you can select with confidence.

Author Nicolle Wallace follows the axiom of writing what she knows about; and she gives us an intense, realistic, and personal look inside the White House with her new novel, MADAM PRESIDENT.  She brings the cloaked, inner workings of the presidency, the press corps, and the West Wing to readers with an intimate style.  Drawing upon her years as a White House insider, Wallaces skills and writing are at their best when shes dealing with political strategy.Wallaces protagonist is a female US president who is forced to deal with multiple acts of terrorism on American soil.  As a woman, she must be seen as a strong leaderbut not so strong as to be void of emotions and the ability to connect with the electorate.  Her professional and personal lives are constantly scrutinized by the press.  Its a delicate balancing act and President Charlotte Kramers equilibrium endures many blows.The novels best features are fast-paced plot development within a 24-hour period, and allowing readers to experience events from the perspectives of multiple key characters.  It was during these periods that the story was most enjoyable.I wish the first 30% (read on my old Kindle, so no page numbers) had been written differently.  The need to give the reader back story was solved with narrative.  This telling and not showing detracted from my overall enjoyment.  As engaging as the remainder was, it impaired my overall impression of the novel.  If Wallace did it to pare down the number of pages, then I think it was a poor choice.  Dialogue is a powerful tool to drive plot.  It would have enhancednot hamperedthe readers connecting with the characters and seamlessly allowed for back story.  Since Wallace writes realistic dialogue, she would have excelled with this aspect, too.If you have ever wondered what its like to work inside the White House, MADAM PRESIDENT paints a vivid picture.  And if youve been curious about the careers of national news correspondents and the behind-the-scenes machinations for TV broadcasts, this is the real deal.

My hairdresser uses this on me (fine, thin hair) and if I didn't see the results for myself, I wouldn't believe it.  The spray provides a protective barrier, allowing the high heat of a flat iron (450 degrees) to be applied--without burning my hair.  The end result is that I can use the flat iron frequently without causing damage.  Hair looks glossy, too, and not at all weighed down, nor greasy.  I no longer have ruined ends.  Previously, I had to snip them off between haircuts, or they looked like fried and sizzled bits.Using this product about three times a week, I get at least three months' use from one can.  When traveling, I bring along a much smaller version.

This ceramic spoon rest is well made and is large enough to accommodate a large spoon, such as a soup ladle.  The curve of its bowl catches any drips without a mess, while the elongated neck supports the stem of your utensil.  The graphic is accurate (as to what you see on your computer screen) and the predominant color is a soft yellow, with shades of brown and small amounts of black, purple, and merlot.  This would be a lovely addition to kitchens that are traditional/transitional in decor.  It can be washed in the dishwasher or by hand. I'm very satisfied with my purchase.

First-time novelist Anne A. Wilson can add me to her fan list.  If you read Lee Child, Patrick Lee, or Alex Kava, youll want to read Wilsons HOVER.  It takes a genuine Navy helicopter pilot who worked with SEALS to write with her depth of understanding and realism.Protagonist Sara Denning is a multi-faceted character.  She has a side like any one of us; with insecurities, driven to excel, and striving to make it in a mans world.  Then theres the Sara with frightening fears; so crippling they can paralyze her in the most desperate situations.  Will they destroy her career?  And what about love?  Why is she so determined to deny herself what she craves?Through Sara, Wilson vividly portrays life on a carrier.  Whether its training exercises, flying a helicopter transport, or sexism, she writes with an authentic voice.  We can almost smell the engine oil, hear the chop-chop of the helicopters blades, and feel the towering waves rocking the massive carrier.Wilson nails the components of a great story; giving us a tight plot, replete with danger and unexpected turning points.  Dialogue has a natural flow, allowing characters to tell the story with little descriptive narrative.  Written in the first person, we not only have Saras dialogue, we have her thoughts, too.  The essential back story emerges slowly, pulling readers deeper into Saras psyche.It might be easy to dismiss these characters as super-human.  But the reality is that, they exist; these are the men and women who defend our country and protect us.  And that makes HOVER all the more genuine.  This is a fascinating page-turner you wont want to miss.

Understanding that curries can be composed of various ingredients, I was willing to try something new; Maggi's Thai Style Green Curry Paste.  When I opened the (nearly one pound) plastic tub, I found a thick, dark green mixture.  Sniffing it, I couldn't detect any one specific aroma.  I thoroughly mixed the contents and tried a small taste.  The first sensation was overwhelming saltiness, followed by a mild heat.  It was after that that I got a very small hint of ginger.If I'd known this, I wouldn't have planned our dinner around this paste.  Too late, I diluted the saltiness and added layers of flavoring: coconut milk, julienned strips of fresh ginger, and (lacking oranges, I substituted) kumquats to the chicken and noodles.  It was not a memorable meal.  I won't be using the green curry paste again. If you prefer much less salt and rely on stronger flavorings (beyond jalapeno peppers), this is probably not something you will enjoy.  Remember, your taste buds may react differently than mine, so it's not the product itself that is bad, it's just my own reaction to it.

This is an ingenious device that actually works!  Now it's possible to hit my trigger points all by myself--and the Q-Flex.This arrived yesterday and I used it twice.  This morning, for the first time in years, the trigger points on the tops of my shoulders are not rock hard. There's improvement in the scapula area, but I'll need to use the Q-Flex more to get the results I want.  So far, though, this simple product is amazing for the relief I feel.The Q-Flex is quite lightweight.  It has small, pointed 'knobs' (thumbs) at each end.  When you apply pressure with them to your trigger points they work just like someone's hand would in performing accupressure.  The foam-cushioned grip makes it easy to hold onto the Q-Flex.  To use it, you place your hands (in close proximity) on the grip, moving the 'knob' to the exact spot needing accupressure.  The brief manual explains that the pressure should not cause pain and directs how to use it.Of all the methods I've tried to relieve pain at my trigger points (short of chiropractic adjustment and deep-tissue massage), the Q-Flex is the most effective.  I plan to try it at the base of my skull (as per the manual) when a migraine is coming.If you are plagued with muscle pain in spots that you can't reach, you may want to give the Q-Flex a try.  I can see using it at home, the office, and even on long car trips.  It's light enough to pack in a suitcase, so you can take your pain reliever with you when you travel.Update:  I get cluster migraines and had the opportunity to  use the Q-Flex with them.  Unfortunately, for the first one, I waited too long and it didn't help.  The second time I tried it much earlier (onset of aura and muscle spasm).  It definitely helped to break up some of the spasm at the base of my skull.  In my opinion, this is definitely worth a try--especially if you can alleviate pain without use of medication.

First-time novelist Stephanie Clifford delivers a powerful story. The setting of upper-crust society is so vividly portrayed that, readers will feel as if they are peeping behind the curtains of a fantasy stage, with characters unlike any they have ever known. This world has its own set of standards regarding etiquette, dress, and social responsibility. Extreme wealthand the older the money, the betterand the right schools provide entre into the tightly guarded world of the elite.Thanks to her fathers newly acquired wealth from his law practice and her socially desperate mother, Evelyn Beegan went to the right school. Lacking old money and an illustrious genealogy prevent her from securing her place among the privileged pack. Armed with a good education, her only objective is to be welcomed into this snobbish set. Frankly, as a reader, it was difficult to sympathize with our protagonist. It is only as we waded deeper into Evelyns troubled, dirty waters that it was possible to like her. Evelyn's social swimming upstream was improbable and staying afloat was impossible. Watching her drown was fascinating.Author Clifford knows how to play with her readers emotions. She takes us from feeling distanced, to outright dislike and disgust, and finally, to acceptance of Evelyn. Clifford ably handles the parents, Barbara and Dale, too. Its no wonder that their doses of superiority and humility have not given Evelyn a sense of balance. The reader cannot help but come away with radically changed notions of who they really are.Stephanie Clifford is a magna cum laude graduate of Harvard and an award-winning The New York Times reporter. She is being called the 21st centurys Edith Wharton and it is a well-deserved comparison. She writes eloquently of lives most us will only read about. Emotions, settings, and dialogue flow effortlessly. Cliffords writing peels back her characters layers, giving us interesting personalities and a story that was disappointingonly because, regrettably, it had reached its final page.One can hope that, EVERYBODY RISE is the first of many novels for Stephanie Clifford. Move over, Edith Wharton

I bought three of these to use in a large, enclosed room.  After reading about its use to help with allergies and asthma, I decided to give them a try.  I put tea lights into each salt pillar.  (They have been drilled out to accommodate that size candle.)  The glow they produce from within the salt pillar is very pleasing to the eye.I used them on a day that had me sneezing and wheezing from too much pollen.  I admit that I was skeptical, but figured it was worth the try.  I stayed inside the room, reading, for about a couple of hours.  To my surprise, my sinuses quieted down.  The sneezing stopped and I breathed well.Now I'm thinking that I should buy a much larger one (like the electric one in my doctor's office) for our home.Whether you want the Himalayan Lights for health reasons or simply for their beauty, they will make a good addition to your office or home.

OXO does a wonderful job of product design.  This is a name I look for repeatedly, as I know they pay attention to quality, durability, and design.This scrub brush is no exception.  The handle is comfortable to hold and the rubber grip gives your hand better traction that its inferior counterparts.  The bristles are very durable.  OXO provides lots of them, to make cleaning faster and more efficient.  I use this brush on the tiles in the shower to get rid of soap scum and mold.  It also makes fast work of cleaning around toilet bases, too.It's nice to know that, in the age of shoddily-made throwaways, OXO is the exception.  OXO obviously takes pride in its quality workmanship, giving us tools that are intended to be used for a long time.

The smaller width of the brush allows you to concentrate on a much narrower surface than a broader scrub brush.  To that extent, it does the job quite well.  The plastic bristles are fairly long, placed close together and are far stiffer than a typical scrub brush.I was thinking this brush would be more along the lines of our stiff bristled BBQ brush with its metal bristles.  But, using that on tile and grout would damage their surfaces. ( I guess bleach and elbow grease, along with this brush are what's needed.)  While definitely better than using an old toothbrush, this isn't quite what I'm looking for, to really clean white grout and restore it to its original shade.  However, it certainly helped to lighten the darkened grout.If you need to clean a small number of tiles and/or their grout lines within a larger area, this will work. Be aware that, if you have large hands or plan to use it for more than a few minutes, it could use a better design.  A broader handle for gripping would make its use easier.

A fascinating hypothesis is the basis of this book; it was a house slave that brilliantly executed paintings for which her mistress was given credit. While the author contrived to put the background story into motion at a modern day meeting, nevertheless, it was a fascinating account.  This historical fiction was a page turner that I didn't want to end.  Tara Conklin is an author I'll gladly read again.

I bought Bob's Red Mill Almond Meal/Flour with confidence, as I have used other products from this company and liked them.  Let me tell you why I bought it.  I wanted to make a pastry (almond crescents/horns) that requires one pound of almond paste.  At my local supermarket this sells for nearly $1/ounce--far too costly!  I looked at Amazon's price and determined that I could make almond paste for less than half that price.The box came well-packaged and swiftly with Amazon Prime delivery.  I made two pounds of almond paste from just one bag of almond flour and will freeze the second pound for making marzipan.  The remaining three bags are stored in freezer bags in my freezer and will eventually be used in pie crusts, cookies, etc.The almond flour blended perfectly with the other ingredients and produced an excellent paste.  The quality was very good; there were no dark spots (from almond skins), the flour had no lumps and appeared to be fresh.This is a brand you can rely on and I do--again and again.

Miracle Gro is a name that's trusted for quality gardening products.  So, I was willing to give this hose a try.  I am not disappointed.  The hose is fairly lightweight for its 50 feet.  The brass coupling is superior to those that offer similar hoses with plastic couplings and are more reliable to last over an extended period of time.  (I live in a zone with months of heat and high humidity; only time will tell.)I have used this hose to water potted plants and wash windows.  It performs well.  I did not turn on the faucet to full pressure, nor did I use the hose with a pressure attachment.  I don't know how well it would last if these are important criteria to you.Over the course of many months, I will be better able to give you a fair assessment of its usefulness and longevity.  Since it is well-made, light in weight, contracts compactly, and capably transfers water from the faucet through the hose, it rates five stars.  I can only hope it lives up to the Miracle Gro name.

If you believe in the aphorism that with age comes wisdom, then please take advantage of my decades of cleaning expertise.  I'll eliminate all other methods except the two most modern ones; Bissell steam mop and the new Hoover Cordless Floormate BH55100.If we rate each method based on: Convenience Ease-of-Use Time-on-Task Supplies Needed Floors Dryness Floors Cleanlinessthen the only two reasonable methods remaining are the steam mop and the Hoover Cordless Floormate.  Lets compare them (below).Steam Mop  Bissell Cordless Floormate BH55100Has electric cordEasy-to-use, small head gets into smaller, narrow spacesAmount of time is about the sameWater only is neededTakes less time to dry, as the steamGets floor very clean and sanitized with steamFloor pads must be washedHoover Cordless Floormate BH 55100Has battery with about 3 hours charging time Larger head that is limited in small/tight areas  (ex:  behind toilet)Amount of time is about the sameOutstanding job of removing waterWater and a floor cleaning solution are neededGets floor very cleanEmpty dirty water container into sinkIf you have mostly open spaces with very few tight ones, this is a fabulous way to clean your floors.  For the few spaces where the head can't reach, it's worth the convenience of this little gem to do those others with a different method.The battery operation allows this floor cleaner to work hard for a half-hour.  It takes at least 30 minutes of charging time to get the battery capable of another several minutes' worth of cleaning.  For a full re-charge, the battery took 1 1/2 hours.  Should you have a large home with bare floors, you won't be able to finish without re-charging.  (I called Cusomer Service to see if it is possible to buy an additional battery.  I was told that it costs $99.  That's a prohibitive amount for a small convenience.  I bought a second battery for my Eureka stick vacuum and that's why I asked.) The charger has lights that tell you how much the battery has charged; with three lights indicating it's fully charged.  At that point, the light goes out altogether and you know you have 30 minutes of cleaning time for your battery.  When I received my Hoover Cordless Floormate, I anticipated it would need three hours to charge.  I was pleasantly surprised to find it required only a half-hour, as it arrived with a partially charged battery.  After depleting the battery's charge, I put it on the charger at 3:00 pm.  It took 30 minutes for one (of the three) lights to appear.  At 4:25 pm, there were two lights and when I returned home at 5:30 pm, there were no lights showing, indicating that the battery was fully charged.Additional Comments:  In addition to emptying the dirty water, you will occasionally need a new filter--a small nuisance in return for a very wonderful  floor cleaning machine.  The handle folds down to make storage easier.  The battery and charger need to always be kept plugged-in for instant use.  The weight of the Floormate is about 12 pounds and it has a plastic casing body.  I purposely cleaned a room without vacuuming first--not a good idea.  Dirt and hair then had to be carefully removed from the plastic bristles of the brushes.  Always operate your Hoover Cordless Floormate after the floors have been vacuumed.The packaging for this item was superb, maybe overkill.  The Floormate was in its factory box, placed within a protective box and was then packed into an even larger box with packing materials to make it airtight.  Short of being crushed, nothing could harm it. I received my Hoover Cordless Floormate as an Amazon  review item.  There was a note attached from Zach, the team leader of the group that developed this product.  He asked for feedback.  Here goes:  Zach, I really like your invention--a great product!  Our family will enjoy using it, as it makes our floor cleaning easier.  I have a request; can you make a very small (additonal) head that cleans in very tight, narrow spaces, too?

I bought these out of desperation for cheese buttons, as two of my three old ones are no longer are usable.  These looked whimsical and thought they would be an interesting way to keep guests' hands off the cheese as they helped themselves.  They'll do the job, but I don't like them.The legs are too stubby and they splinter the hard cheeses as they're pushed into them.  The sheep, goat, and cow heads aren't cute.  Actually, they're lacking in details and aren't adorable at all.If I can't find what I'm looking for, I'll order the stainless steel or acrylic buttons and stop trying for 'cutesie'.

Anita Diamant's RED TENT made me a fan of her work.  THE BOSTON GIRL is very different, but very good.  It's told in the first person; a grandmother being interviewed by her granddaughter for an assignment.  It took a little while to settle into Addie's (grandmother) story-telling, but once into it, I had to read it to the end.I dislike spoilers and re-hashing synopses within reviews.  I'll just say that Diamant shows us that, despite generational distances, we all share the same experiences while growing up:  our siblings' very different personalities, parenting styles, dreams for our futures, first loves, regrets, and wisdom that comes with age and simply living. This is a story all of us can relate to.  As a matter of fact, if you're a member of a multi-generational family, share this story with them.  It's a wonderful way to learn about their own childhoods and to find the ties that bind despite the age gaps.

This book is a dog; as in "Where, oh where, has my Jack Reacher gone?"  Seriously, this is the first Jack Reacher book that hasn't kept me turning pages until the end.  Come on, Lee Child, I've been a big fan until now!The lead female character is Casey--Ms. Nice.  (Really? "Nice"?  Aw, c'mon!)  The author portrays her as childish, anxiety-riddled, a buffoon versus our super-hero, Jack Reacher.  In previous novels, Reacher was a hero because he was believable.  Impossible situations and quirky habits made each story engrossing and engaging.  In this story, we've been presented with a caricature and that's where Lee Child has let us down.I often read reviews prior to selecting a book, but found the Jack Reacher series such an enjoyable escape that, it wasn't necessary to seek professional opinions.  If you read the snippets of reviews on its Amazon page (such as Stephen King, Kirkus, Library Journal), you'll think this is as good as any of Child's previous works.  Don't be misled.

Since there is no way I could eat each of these flavors and post this review in a timely fashion, I enlisted the help of family and friends.  With multiple sets of tastebuds, here are our impressions. Flavors are not the standard ones of cherry, orange, lemon, etc. Flavors of bubblegum, cotton candy, root beer, pink lemonade rated highly Flavors of blueberry cream and strawberry shortcake had (for some) an artificial taste of the fruit These lollipops are larger than the typical ones  that are flat or dimensional (Tootsie Roll Pops) Plastic stick has a better feel than a paper one Peanut-free and kosher are nice for those to whom it is important to knowI see these as children's treats for a special occasion, as they are in the range of $.50 each.  Do the flavors appeal to adults?  Yes, but how often would you want one?  If quality of product is an important issue, these rate quite well.

I tried to conduct a simple experiment using Dr. Brandt's Do Not Age product.  I applied it twice daily to only one side of my face and neck.  To the other side, I stuck to my daily regimen of Clinique's moisturizer.  To be fair, I asked my husband and friends if they saw any difference between the sides of my face (specifically skin smoothness and small lines).  No one could discern any visible differences.  Maybe it was the fact that, I already use moisturizer and my skin wasn't dry.  Or, that my moisturizer already was handling the softening of tiny lines.  Perhaps it's not that this product doesn't do its job, it's simply that on skin already cared for, there is less improvement to see.Frankly, I think my moisturizer is doing a fine job and have no reason to switch to this product.  If you aren't using a moisturizer, you may want to try this one and see for yourself how it affects your skin.

This cookie cutter is easy to grip and doesn't have sharp points that can hurt you.  The cutting edge stays away from your hand and only cuts through dough--not you.  The cut is clear, sharp, and does an excellent job of making a gingerbread boy.

I had a Garmin nvi 256W for several years and the flimsy power cable eventually failed on me. I tried a cheap off brand cable for a few dollars and it never worked because it made the GPS think it was plugged into a PC.  I smartened up and bought this REAL Garmin power cable and its much better than the original. It is more rugged and seats in the cars power socket much more easily and firmly.Also, I recently bought a new Garmin nvi 55LMT and the power cord is identical to this one. Dont mess with off-brand clones  buy the REAL Garmin power cable.

I really like San Francisco Bay Pumpkin Spice for a seasonal coffee. The coffee is round and full tasting without that slightly artificial flavor that I sometimes got with Green Mountain. This is a full bodied, good tasting coffee with a pumpkin spice flavor that adds a little surprise to it.It has a very nice aroma and makes a great second cup of coffee in the morning after I have a Fog Chaser - San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser, 120 Single Serve Coffees. Its also a good after dinner coffee.I usually buy San Francisco Bay coffee directly from SF Bay in larger quantities because its economical. Ive tried nearly all the San Francisco Bay single-serve coffees and I have never found a single one that is disappointing.

I take a lot of wildlife photos (frequently with a telephoto lens) and many times it is impractical to carry a tripod into the woods on a hike and this monopod solves helps the problem in a number of ways.- It extends and locks anywhere from its collapsed length of 21 all the way up to 72 (higher than a standard tripod) and this makes it so much easier to use the cameras viewfinder and focus without bending or hunching down to camera level on a standard tripod.- The quick release head securely locks the camera into the monopod. Its easy and fast to break out the monopod, extend it, and snap the camera into the mount if the subject youre looking at might move away.- The 4-section leg is STURDY. I can extend the sections to make up any length I want and the locking mechanisms are strong.- At 10-ounces its incredibly light.AND HERES WHAT ELSE IT DOES: because the monopod has a cushioned grip and a wrist loop and the leg is so strong and rigid, I can easily use the monopod as a hiking stick. Theres no need to carry it separately even though it comes with a carry bag.I only wish the tripod and monopod designers would agree on a standard quick release head. As it is, the heads on my two tripods and on this monopod are each different. If they were all the same, I could quickly switch between tripods and monopod with no fuss.  But thats something the manufacturers will have to work out between them.Bottom line: I love this monopod!

With goats and chickens this is a good tool for barn cleanup and I can even scrape the tough stuff off the floor. The blade is only about 12 wide but lets me use more pressure when I have to scrape. The 48 handle is long enough to easily get under roosts.The shovel is a little heavy to pick up and toss stuff into a cart and because theres no real grip on it, it can be a little awkward to use. Ive taped up parts of it with friction tape and this helps a lot - either way, its a very, very handy scoop and shovel and I use it almost daily.I have a number of Truper tools. They are tough and well-made and very economical and as good if not better than more expensive equipment on the market. I bought this shovel (and other Truper tools) at my local farm and feed store. Prices vary so shop around.

Ive been using these rolls to seal moving boxes and cardboard shipping cartons and this tape is excellent for these jobs. The tape adhesive grabs immediately and the tape doesnt loosen or peel even under high humidity conditions. The tape itself is incredibly STRONG and doesnt break. I can start to seal a carton, pull the tape tight and lay it down and it lays down perfectly flat and tight. The tape will never come off that box. Because the tape is so strong, I only have to tape one layer on a box flap instead of taping it two or three times (like with some other bargain tapes Ive used).  This makes it very economical.I usually use these in a hand-held dispenser and if the end of the tape ever gets loose and sticks back on the roll its no problem to peel it off and start over  no more shredding and wasting tape trying to get it off the roll.I buy these rolls at a local big box store. Prices vary so shop around.

This is a simple, rugged, handsome watch and I love it. Ive worn this watch daily for about 25 years now and it still works perfectly and still looks good. I wear it when working and when Im all suited up for a dressy event. The dial is high-contrast white on black and its luminescent. It is not a watch for a space cadet and I do not need split-second countdown timers or a tachometer on my wrist when all I want to do is see the accurate time when I need it.I do not care for, or use, the perpetual date calendar because it's manual and I always forget to reset it when the months change to 28, 30, or 31 days.
