I absolutely loved how the story developed, and more importantly how it ended - with a strong vision and beautiful homage to the characters I'd grown to love.

Just Dance Disney Party was one of my girls' favorite games on our Xbox 360, and probably the one we missed the most when we upgraded to Xbox One. Fortunately it was (mostly) worth the wait.The Kinect 2 for Xbox One is a much more responsive piece of hardware. While the old Kinect struggled to see kids (especially those under 8yo, for whom it was not rated), the new Kinect easily handles my 5yo and her 4yo cousin. It's both more responsive and more forgiving, which makes this a much more fun family game.Curiously, though, while the old game had an even mix of popular Disney Channel hits and movie classics, Disney Party 2 is exclusively Disney Channel faves (you can get "Let it Go" on Just Dance 2015). So while the little ones will have a blast dancing, they may not be as familiar with all the songs. Hopefully they'll have a classic pack DLC soon?Here's the launch lineup:Austin & Allie: "A Billion Hits", "Can You Feel It", "Chasin' the Beat of My Heart", "You & Me"Descendants: "Be Our Guest", "Did I Mention", "Evil Like Me", "Rotten to the Core", "Set It Off"Liv & Maddie: "What a Girl Is", "You, Me, and the Beat", "Better in Stereo"Teen Beach 2: "Fallin for Ya", "Gotta Be Me", "Right Where I Want to Be", "Twist Your Frown Upside Down"Other: "Take on the World" (Girl Meets World), "You Had Me at Hello" (Girl vs Monster), "Time of Our Lives" (I Didn't Do It), "Keep it Undercover" (K.C. Undercover), "Cruisin for a Bruisin" (Teen Beach Movie), "Too Much" (Zapped)

This is Rob Thomas at the absolute top of his game, and it is powerful.  Pairing a rich melody, alt-rock rhythm, and heartbreaking lyrics, Her Diamonds is not only amazing for Thomas fans, but its sure to earn him some new ones.

Beginning with Songs from the Big Chair, I've had each TFF album on release date (yup, even Saturnine and Raoul), so I've followed their pop singles, "their" post-breakup work, and their reunion piece.  This is a dynamic band that's so much bigger and more talented than jus their "Shout" fame, and since its release in 1992, this has been my go-to album to introduce people to Curt and Roland.That said, it's been 23 years since this album came out, and 14 years since the last remaster, meaning Tears Roll Down is still clinging to 256kb sound.  By contrast, the standard now is a 320kb sample.  For the average listener on an average system, there won't be much noticeable difference, but for audiophiles it's a little disappointing, especially for a band that built its entire reputation on brilliant instrumentals paired back to pitch-perfect vocals.For newcomers to TFF, there are several different "greatest hits" options.  Like I said, I think the breadth of this collection is the best sampler of their iconic years, but this is the album that uses the 2001 remasters, making it better sound quality than Best of... or Shout:The Very Best of....  There's an interesting compilation from 2010 called Mad World which has each of their singles AND the corresponding B-side, giving a snapshot of the band's growth and some collectible songs that are challenging to find elsewhere.  However Mad World also blends TFF's top-shelf songs with some less-amazing tracks (don't get me wrong, "less-amazing" for TFF is still better than most bands' very best), making it a roller coaster to listen to.By contrast, Tears Roll Down encompasses just The Hurting through Seeds of Love when the collaboration was at its peak and gives the proudest moments - on and off the charts - of this amazing band.
An amazing, luscious, sexy song right up to the point when some guy comes on rapping about his "mini chub".  There is a radio edit without the A$AP Rocky section that I wish Amazon carried.

We picked this up for my 5yo and 8yo to supplement their Lego Friends Sunshine Ranch set (which is fantastic - I highly recommend it!).  Like most little girls, they are fascinated by ponies and while the Ranch has a great assortment of corrals, burr brushes, and stables, this set adds another foal, wash basin, hay, and feed bottle.  For less than $5, it's a great little addition (or freestanding stocking stuffer), and the included instructions are very easy to follow (though some of the pieces are the one-pip bricks that can be challenging for the youngest builders).If your girls are more into caring for the ponies than ranching them, the Vet Clinic or Vet Ambulance are in the same series and each have a veterinarian to help take care of your new foal.

My 5yo received the Lego Friends Animal Hospital and an Amazon Gift Card for her birthday, so this was a great inexpensive supplement.  She loves the details like the bow for the puppy's hair and the little stick for her to fetch.Lego made a great call including the seesaw, since that gives her and the puppy something to interact with, making this as much a true play set as a building set.  The down side is about half of the 65 pieces are little one-pip bricks, so the number of actual building Legos this set contributes to a larger collection is pretty small.In sum, it's cute, inexpensive, and a great little gift or stocking stuffer.

So your first impulse will be to think of this as little-kid Twister, and it kinda is with some significant differences.The biggest difference is that only one kiddo is on the mat at a time.  This is good in that there's no accidental butt-in-face positioning, but bad in that means only two kids are ever really playing - the one on the mat and the one making the calls.  I found this wasn't an issue with the 3-year-old crowd, who worked collaboratively on both fronts.  The five- and six-year-olds were far more interested in getting points and winning, so the time they were "out" was not really fun for them.  So definitely better toward the youngest end of the recommended age spectrum.The game is played similarly to Twister, with a stack of cards replacing the spinner.  This tells the player things like putting their left hand on Cubby or their right foot on Nellie.  Now I am not as up on my Doc, Sofia and Jake supporting characters and apparently I should be, but Wonder Forge was kind enough to print everybody's names on the mat so I can keep up.This is a fun game for the 3- to 5-year old crowd who are big enough to reach all the spaces but young enough to enjoy this game's simplicity.  Much older than that, though, and you're probably better off with traditional Twister.

With my first two kiddos we went through quite a few play sets finding what did and didn't work.  And while each child is unique in that regard, Fisher-Price has done a really nice job of making a playset that both my baby niece and nephew love.As a parent, let me start with the fact that the music is much more subdued and tolerable than many of this set's competitors (including others by Fisher-Price).  That alone is worth the cost of entry for me.  For the kids, the huge amount to see, do, and interact with almost overwhelms their little attention spans.  My niece was putting the ball in the right to watch it come down, then started playing with the roller on the left, then got into the light show, and by the time she got back to the ball-drop on the right it was brand new for her (don't worry, kiddo - at my age I have the same reaction sometimes).  As the kids get older, there is a fun little set of games for them to play along with, but for the 6-month to 18-month-old crowd this playset is probably best for, those activities are a little advanced.The build of the set is quite sturdy and it will not tip over, even with a toddler leaning against the bar.  The assembly instructions could be a little clearer, but it wasn't difficult to figure out or put together.  It does need four C batteries.

This is the type of well-made little art book that is quirky enough to grab interest without commanding a serious time commitment.  This book is great for a hostess gift or a guest room bedside table.The book is a small hardback, about as tall and wide as my outstretched hand.  Each page has a social animal's portrait on one side and a one-page biopic on the other.  These are grouped loosely into chapters like "Top Dogs" and "Odd Ducks", themselves furthering the animal puns found throughout.  The make of the book is traditional sections glued to the spine, but Sasquatch went the extra length to sew each section together, ensuring it will hold up for years.  The cover appears to be woven and screen printed, with the title and subtitle reverse-embossed.While it's not the sort of book designed to enlighten or reread, it's exactly right for quick amusement and is perfect for a fun gift.

As an add-on for the Lego Friends' house, Bunny and Babies delivers on its cuteness promise with a momma bunny and her two baby rabbits.Like many Lego sets these days, this inflates its piece count by using many tiny parts.  The general rule for specialty Legos is that the bricks run about ten cents each, so this is a little over that valuation.  But paired with our inexpensive Lego Friends Vet Ambulance and LF Lego Friends Veterinarian set, our girls' absolutely love it!This set barely comes with enough bricks to make the little bunny enclosure, to it's not a very good stand-alone toy.  If you pick this up, definitely consider also grabbing one of the above vet sets or the companion Puppy Training and Little Foal sets.

An intimate, aching song that shows why country is the indisputable genre of heartbreak.  The slightly out-of-sync percussion mirrors the message perfectly, so kudos to the production team on the technical skill behind this artful single.

We have quite a few Barbies and what I have to assume is every Disney princess, so adding Mal to the otherwise-cheery mix was an interesting choice.  But my girls loved the Descendants and were absolutely thrilled to have her in the family (she's really a good-girl in the end, so it's okay).Mal is Barbie-height with separate tiara, shoes, and wand/scepter.  Her dress is actually really well done, even against some of my wife's collector Barbies, so this will be a good addition to every girl's collection.

Well, our Max came with two left feet.  Literally.  And since you cant attach one of the left feet to the right leg because it doesn't fit, our Max looks a little more "special" than fierce.Which is unfortunate because problem #2 is that Max doesn't fit back in the box.  So Max (or Special Max, if yours comes like ours) gets to ornament a shelf in your home.  I'm sure there's no chance little kids will lose all of his tiny little pieces since they're unboxed, right?So we pulled Special Max from his bookshelf home to play on Family Night, and did our best not to joke too much about his unfortunate condition.  To play, there is a ladybug-lever at Max's base that you pull, which causes him to spin around and land on a "random" spot (parents and astute children will quickly find the pattern).  If there is a game piece there, it is removed from the game.  Pull Max's arms back up to reset him and you're on your way.Things were going well for about 8 minutes, until my 5yo pulled the ladybug-lever back and it broke, rendering the game useless.  So in less than 10 minutes of fun, Special Max became Decoration Max, and his bunny rabbit game pieces became Barbie's new pets while we played at the Dreamhouse for the rest of Family Night.

After the seemingly-out-of-nowhere success of North Carolina's Delta Rae, studios scrambled to find other amazing alt-country acts to fit that classic country-meets-modern-folk sound.  Enter If Birds Could Fly, a street-smart band with from Virginia's Appalachia with bluegrass roots and whiskey-strong lyrics.While phrases like "dancing on our graves" directly evoke Delta Rae's Dance in the Graveyards, and "feel the waters rise over me" evokes DR's Bottom of the River (itself evocative of The Civil Wars' Barton Hollow, IBCF has a more traditional bluegrass undertone with prominent banjo and fiddle over its darker beat.  I came to the band after discovering their brilliant performance of "Soak My Bones in Whiskey" and this single sold me on the album, and I've loved every note of it.

1:27 Mins If you already have a LeapTV system and are looking to pick up a game, then I think you'll like Frozen quite a bit.  If you're like me, coming to LeapTV as a newbie thinking it's like Nintendo Wii or Xbox Kinect, boy are you in for a disappointment.The game is set up as a series of mini-games, from sledding with Olaf (which my 5yo is playing in the attached video) to ice skating with Elsa to jewelry-making.  I'm not sure "educational" is the word I would use, since the quest questions are either right or wrong (in the one in the video, she has to click on the numbers in order from 6 to 10), so it's more like a test than a lesson.So here's where it goes down for me: we have been using Leapster with the kids since the first LeapPad and have had every generation of Pad and Tablet since.  I am accustomed to their 10-years-out-of-date graphics and their cellphone-quality games for $30.  In fact I have come to expect it.  But I've also come to expect things that work, and the LeapTV - and parts of this game - just don't.  For example, in one game the Kinect-esque camera engages and the kids are supposed to wave their hand over the right answer.  Except no amount of adjusting the lighting, her clothes, the camera, or anything else seems to make it register well, so any time the answer is on the top of the screen my 5yo is out of luck.  Likewise the game itself crashed on us a couple times, kicking back to the LeapTV home screen without the cartridge option and requiring a reboot.  I haven't had these problems with the Pad/Tablet games in years, yet here we are with a decade of experience under their belt and LeapFrog seems content to push out products of diminishing quality.Which, in the end, is really too bad.  The idea is good, and the Frozen game gets three stars because (despite all the crashes and frustrations) my 5yo still loves it, but I really think a Wii or Kinect could be a better choice.  Both are more fun, more stable, and can grow with the kids, and if they're really into Frozen, both have "Let it Go" on Just Dance 2015.  But if you already have a LeapTV and you're already familiar with the challenges, then go for it.

I'm a big Grover Cleveland fan (most popular President in U.S. history - sad that he's relegated to the "lesser-known" category) and really hoped this would bring a little wit and wisdom from him and the other non-spotlight leaders.  Unfortunately these quotations are even less memorable than some of the presidencies to which they belonged.Often the "memorable quote" should be a sentence or snippet, but we're given a whole paragraph in which to find it.  This lack of editing at times seems intended to give context, but is most often just a treasure dive.  An example is this quote by Calvin Coolidge:"But there is another element, more important than all, without which there cannot be the slightest hope of a permanent peace.  That element lies in the heart of humanity.  Unless the desire for peace be cherished there, unless this fundamental and only natural source of brotherly love be cultivated to its highest degree, all artificial efforts will be in vain.  Peace will come when there is realization that only under a reign of law, based on righteousness and supported  by the religious conviction of the brotherhood of man, can there be any hope of a complete and satisfying life.  Parchment will fail, the sword will fail; it is only the spiritual nature of man that can be triumphant."The memorable quote therein is simply the last sentence and could have been edited thusly. Which isn't to say there aren't also one- and two-line quotes, but this sort of large-block quoting happens unnecessarily often, making it seem like either lazy editing or an effort to make the book longer.  In either case it renders the book less useful or fun to read.All of which would be a three-star "it's okay"-rated book UNTIL the biggest crux of my issue: there is no citation or sourcing at all anywhere in the book.  Absolutely nothing with which you could verify the quote, or even put it in context (was it part of a State of the Union speech, a stump speech, a post-presidency memoir?  Nothing).  That's where this book really plummets from a three-star book to a one-star one.  While I appreciate Mr Dell for attempting to compile this historic reference, without citations I have to take at face value that it's not a partial or complete fiction.  Without citation it's not a history or a reference book (as it's currently categorized), it's just somebody's say-so.
An amazing, luscious, sexy song right up to the point when some guy comes on rapping about his "mini chub".  There is a radio edit without the A$AP Rocky section that I wish Amazon carried.

I actually picked this up for my Triumph, since there are few things more important on a motorcycle than tire pressure (on a car, important - on a bike, life-saving).  The fact that I was able to get a multi-tool with a flashlight and a tire pressure gauge in the same pocket-sized unit is fantastic!First, and most importantly, it's a tire pressure gauge.  Like I said, I get that's not critical in your car and if you're off by a few pounds here or there you probably won't notice.  On a motorcycle, a few pounds off can be the difference in landing a corner or lagging in a pass - it's a huge deal.  So accuracy is paramount.  Before I trusted this gauge on its own, I brought along my old gauge, and I verified the reading with my professional gauge at home.  After several weeks and a dozen readings, I'm confident that DBPower's claim of "within 1lb psi" is true, since in every case but one it was exactly the same.  Note: it does not claim accuracy in sub-freezing temperatures, but I'm not riding when it's that cold anyway.Once I was confident with it fulfilling its primary purpose, I played with the gadgets.  The flashlight is great for inspecting the belt, as well as nighttime stops.  While the packaging doesn't indicate how strong the flashlight is, it's definitely more like a 200-lumen small LED flashlight than a full 2000-lumen torch.  Having the vice-grip and screwdrivers is definitely handy prying any rocks from the tire, while the window-smashing hammer and seatbelt cutter are probably good to have in a car, but not as useful for a bike.The whole tool is just over 6" long and weighs about 3oz, so it's substantial but still small enough to tuck away easily.  I use mine pretty regularly now, so I just keep it in my jacket pocket, though it fits easily under my seat, too.  For a car driver this is a good little gift; for a motorcyclist like me it's a great one.I received a free manufacturer sample in exchange for an unbiased review.  Fortunately, I like it enough to have bought one for my brother, too.  Definitely earned its five stars.

Sanderson is at his very best when weaving a tale of heroes-teetering-on-the-edge-of-chaos.  While The Well of Ascension droned on with character development for its first 42% (thanks, Kindle) and eventually found its footing, The Hero of Ages starts strong and stays that way.  It is a deliberate tour-de-force of an author passionate about the tale he's telling.Without giving anything away, The Hero of Ages picks up a breadcrumb trail of clues you read in the first two books and takes you on an unexpected journey.  While there are some awfully-repetitive internal monologues from Vin and Sazed, Sanderson's resolution to this trilogy is easily one of the best, most satisfying ends to a series I've ever read.  It's no wonder he was picked to complete Jordan's WoT series.  Definitely check it out!

I purchased the competing Electrohome EAAC470 USB dual-charging alarm clock last Christmas for my wife, but it has a couple of critical design flaws that I hoped this iHome would correct.  And it mostly does.First, and perhaps her biggest annoyance, is that the Electrohome is super-lightweight.  Which should be good for a travel alarm clock, but also means that any tug or nudge of a connected device causes it to easily slide off the dresser since it has absolutely no weight resistance.  The iHome is only slightly heavier, but with better-designed grips on the bottom it does a much better job of resisting movement.  This also means smacking the snooze button doesn't send it careening, although that was a clever way for the Electrohome to get my wife up in the mornings.Second, the Electrohome has a blindlingly-bright blue display.  Even on its lowest setting we usually end up flipping it face down to hide its omnipresent blue glow just so we can sleep.  The iHome has a MUCH smaller display which does a reasonable job of dimming to a sleepable level.  It supplements the smaller space with a large, front-facing speaker that offers a cleaner sound quality than the Electrohome.Which brings me to the only downside of the iHome: its much-smaller screen.  While most digital alarm clocks these days have gone for big, easy-to-read screens (the kind that prevent having to find my glasses first), the iHome screen is tiny my comparison.  And since part of the screen is used for notifications and icons, the actual time-telling part is pretty small compared to most competitors.  If you're like my wife and you go to sleep and stay that way, it won't matter to you.  If you're like me and you wake up regularly and want to know the time, this could be more problematic.The USB charging capability is not the fastest, but it's nice to be able to keep the phone on the nightstand without occupying another plug.  The 3.5mm input jack worked perfectly with my HTC and her Fire Phone.

My girls are pretty wild over all things Barbie or horses, so put the two together and it's a no-brainer.  The new Barbie Saddle-and-Ride is Mattel continuing to up their "wow" factor, and it's accomplished in spades.  My 5yo's literally said "wow!" when Barbie mounted the horse and started riding, and even my usually-cynical 9yo wanted to play with it.So here's the down side: the staying power of Barbie has always been her universal appeal to imagination.  She goes to the beach, then gets in her VW bug and drives to her dream house/castle where she lounges at a table with friends before going parasailing.  Same doll, lots of things to do.  The "problem" (if you will) with this particular Barbie is that her joints don't move like other Barbies, her hand is permanently attached to her rein, and her legs are too far apart for most other Barbie vehicles.  So suddenly you have this (pardon the pun) one-trick-pony Barbie in your collection.  Don't get me wrong, it's 5-star amazing at what it's supposed to do, and it definitely won the girls.  So while its limited functionality not a deal-breaker to many homes, especially those with a large Barbie collection already, it is something parents on a smaller space or budget constraint might consider.

We live at the beach, so my girls (8yo and 5yo) have grown up on a steady stream of surf, Frisbee, and bean bag toss.  We bought the full-size version from Viva Sol a while back and on receiving this mini edition I'm glad to see the same attention to detail.This set is about 1/4 the size of the regular regulation-size boards (5"x10" vs 24"x48").  It is made from a richly-stained walnut veneer over a pine frame which is beautiful, durable, and lightweight enough to be easily portable.  This mini version is a little small to put on the ground and play a regular game of bean bag, but is perfect for rainy days when we're indoors as it easily converts to dining table into a game table.  The eight included beanbags are weatherproof canvas, so no worries about them.My girls also invented Bed Bag, putting a base on each of their beds and throwing them across, which made them squeal with delight and is now their cousins' favorite sleepover game.

My 5yo and her friends have really been getting into Scholastic's new Branches series, which takes beginning chapter books and illustrates each page.  By creating a long story rather than a running theme, Branches are a little more advanced than something like Frog and Toad, while still using illustrations to engage early readers who aren't quite ready for pages of prose.That said, Sparkling Jewel is easily the least interesting of the dozen or so Branches books we have.  The girls absolutely love the fast pace plots and chapter-ending cliffhangers of Dragon Masters and Stardust Friends.  In fact, quick character introductions and a quick pace are the hallmarks of the Branches series.  Sparkling Jewel trades that away for far too much character development, which means sometimes pages go by without much actually happening - a real deal-killer for youngsters today.Beyond the pacing problems, Sparkling Jewel wanders constantly.  Storied from Tori's point-of-view, the narration wanders incessantly - in a three paragraph spread early on she talks in complete non-sequitur about having to spend the summer at the ranch, her favorite pony, her sister, her mother, her grandmother, the new pony, back to her favorite pony, a cat...  While that frantic topic-bouncing undoubtedly sounds like my 5yo's inner monologue, it makes following what the author is actually trying to convey very difficult.  I can't help but be reminded of Miss Piggy's classic line: "Why are you telling me all this?"  "It's plot exposition, it has to go somewhere."Sparkling Jewel should've been a hit with my girls.  It has a great premise, a sisters-as-pro/antagonists, ponies, and pseudo-danger.  Unfortunately it gets so mired in its exposition that it fails to drive the plot.  Hopefully the author visits some of the other Branches books for an idea of how this can be better balanced.  Sparkling Jewel isn't a bad book per se, but it's not good - and there are definitely better early-reader choices even within the Branches family.

After my 5yo received the Pinkie Pie Sweet Shop, which is part of the new MLP Pop Ponies collection, I was a little worried this would be that same poor quality.  Fortunately it's made for the "normal" Ponies and is actually one of the best-made MLP playsets we have.This set comes with Rarity and a host of accessories for her shop.  Rather than detail the interior, Hasbro included interchangeable cardboard insert that allow kids to make it look like different parts of the shop.  Someone trying on a new outfit?  There's a fitting room background.  Need to get cleaned up?  There's a powder room background.  This has the effect of keeping it highly-versatile and less expensive, which is really smart.The whole thing clips closed and has a handle for easy carrying, making this a near-perfect toy on-the-go (just have to keep track of all the little accessories).  It's part of the Cutie Mark Magic collection, so if you play with the CMM app this'll unlock more to do.

My girls have pretty much all of the blind bag Ponies, so it's fantastic to have a playset scaled for them.If you're not familiar, the blind bags Ponies are tiny (think: those little prizes you got from the machine at the grocery store for a quarter when we were kids).  This barn is about 8" tall and maybe 10" wide with an open two-level back and is modeled in the cartoonish 2D style.  While I love that there's finally a playset to fit our collection, it's a little disappointing that the inside of the barn isn't detailed (really at all), so we ended up using stickers from a sticker book to give it some character.  It comes with Granny Smith and Crimson Gala (both rare Ponies to be found), and some tiny accessories.If you're looking for a playset that fits the "normal"-sized Ponies, this is not it.  If you're like us and have quite a few of the minis, this set will be perfect.

My 5yo and her cousin are VERY into MLP, so I picked this up hoping it would be the Pony equivalent of the Barbie Dream House.The Ponies are (obviously) not as tall as Barbie and friends, and Canterlot is scaled accordingly.  Like the Dreamhouse, or our popular-with-the-girls Disney princess castle, Canterlot is a huge playset compared to the toys.  Sitting at 2 1/2 feet tall, it's about half a foot shorter than the castle and designed completely in the cartoonish 2D style.  It's not the most durable toy you'll own, but it's about what you've come to expect from Hasbro and is significantly sturdier than last year's Rainbow Kingdom Playset, so I'm glad to see Hasbro bringing some quality back, even if it still has some room to improve (our left door to the castle will not stay on for anything).This set plays well with the "normal"-sized Ponies, and is thematically built for the Cutie Mark Magic Ponies.  It'll be a little big for the new Pop! Ponies.  It comes with Princess Celestia and Spike, and if you're gifting this I would recommend Rarity and Princess Luna as add-ons.  While it's still not quite the quality I would like to see, it's easily the best MLP playset currently on the market.

Like many parents, I've tried to introduce my kids to my old favorite toys.  While some, like Lego, haven't really changed much (having differing faces aside), K'Nex is really at a whole new level for my girls.My parents still have some of our K'Nex, so last month when we were visiting, my 8yo, 5yo, and I pulled them out to play.  What I noticed immediately on receiving these new ones is that they're not only much more vibrant, but the build quality is much better.  Even when they were new, my old clips would sometimes bend or snap, where the new ones seem designed to take much more abuse (and believe me, my girls can give it).The engineering is also excellent.  No matter what angle or idea we had, there seemed to be a perfect piece for it.  While the range of connections is why I always preferred K'Nex over Tinker Toys, the addition of strong female characters really helps inspire my girls.  It also seems to be K'Nex answer to GoldieBlox (which I can't get my girls interested in at all), and with sets like The Inventors' Clubhouse, which comes with a motor, and the Home Designers' set, which encourages engineering and architectural design, I really like where K'Nex is going and we will definitely be getting a few more sets from Santa this year.

This 2015 version of Mattel's My Password Journal has some significant improvements over the old version.For starters, and probably most importantly for people who had the old one, there is a major improvement in the voice recognition.  Where before the password had to be said with EXACTLY the same tone (and background noise), the new version does a better (not perfect, but better) job of filtering background noise and is significantly more forgiving of the tone.  Fore example, when my 7yo tried to open her old Password Journal, if it didn't open the first time or two she would get frustrated and that frustrated tone would ensure it would not open at all.  This journal is more forgiving in the first place, and even if she gets frustrated it still responds about half of the time.Now let's be real, this isn't a real diary-type journal.  It's definitely a gimmicky toy, so if your little one is looking for something more secure, an old-fashioned locking diary may be a better bet.  For the gadget girl who likes to fiddle with tech this is a fun toy, complete with invisible(-ish) ink, a "hidden" (in the most obvious way) compartment, and the namesake verbal password.  The journal book itself is small, but my 7yo took it out and keeps random notes to and from friends in there instead.  When she pressed her friends to try to get into the journal, it says "intruder alert!" and they all giggled wildly, scheming of ways to keep secret notes from their nemesis: little brother.Of course there's a password bypass on the back, which means it's never really secure.  Which is fine, a 7yo doesn't need to be keeping secrets from her parents anyway.  ;-).

These Pridebit Kitchen Scissors attempt to be the Swiss army knife of kitchen cutlery, but it mostly stumbles over its own functionality.Foremost I needed a good kitchen scissor, and with the Pridebit coming in half for easy cleaning I hoped that attention to design and detail would convey throughout.  The problem is it's not very good at being kitchen scissors.  It's significantly duller out-of-the-box than any pair I've owned before, and its thick sheet made it difficult to sharpen.  Furthermore it can only open about wide enough to snip before running into the bone cutter divot.  So as a kitchen scissor that isn't good at its primary function, it already wasn't making my favorite tools list.  But I decided to try some other features for kicks.The curiously-included flat-head screwdriver is both a little thick for most kitchen screws (most pots and pans use phillips head anyway), and the ability to use it means carefully holding the bladed side of the knife.  The bottle opener is designed like an old can punch (remember those?) but is a little too shallow for modern caps.  The nutcracker fails to use any leverage, making it far less effective than a free-standing nutcracker.  The vegetable peeler sort of works, but it's actually easier to peel vegetables with the blade of the separated scissors once you sharpen them.Now I don't fault Fitbit for these design choices.  This seems to be an imported product that several manufacturers on Amazon have discovered, including Modern Utensils, Greentisory, and Iron Gadget.  And my experience with Pridebit as a company has been great communication and a strong desire to deliver on customer service.  I think they just need a better product.I received these scissors as a free manufacturer sample in exchange for an unbiased review.  While I'm sure they were hoping for more stars, I just want to reiterate that rating is solely for the scissors and not Pridebit itself.  Pridebit's Julienne peeler is fantastic; these scissors not-so-much.

I'm kind of big into GotG, so I bought several of these to donate to the Boys & Girls Club backpack drive our local Gap was sponsoring.  Not gonna lie: when I got them I kinda wanted one for myself.  These are a full-size backpack with a HIGHLY-reflective coating over the print which makes them great for early-morning bus stop loitering.  Accented with black-and-orange, this just seemed like a really cool backpack.But I did the right thing and donated it.  Because some kid out there deserves to be the cool kid, and this is definitely a cool backpack.

Sweet and sexy, Marina's take on "Whatever You Like" is about as personal, vulnerable, and perfect as a pop ballad can get.  Beyond her latent vocal talent Marina has an unprecedented sense of timing, landing each word in a precisely-paced arrangement that keeps the listener desperately engaged.

These are great gift tags with lots of different uses.  I like to re-use gift bags and these gift tags can easily be added on to use the bags again and again.  They would also make cute labels for place settings.  The cardboard is nice and sturdy.  The brown is nice and neutral so it will match most things but you can also easily paint it to match whatever you want.I received a free sample of this product from the manufacturer.

This detector comes with a battery and the hardware you need to mount it to the ceiling (two screws and two little mounting brackets).  It was quick and easy to install.  I like that it has both a loud beeping sound and flashing lights.  Most people will hear the alarm just fine (it's really loud) but it's nice to have the flashing lights there as well.  If you are hard of hearing or wear headphones a lot around the house the flashing lights are especially important.I received a free sample of this product from the manufacturer.

This oil smells great and really does help to clear up your sinuses.  The smell is very pleasing.  It is important to note that this should not be used around babies or toddlers as both peppermint oil and Eucalyptus Globulus can be dangerous for babies/toddlers.  For adults it works great.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

This light is perfect for closets, pantries, or other places where you want a light but don't have access to an outlet.  It's also perfect for a kids room since you don't have to worry about kids pulling it out of the outlet.  To set it up you slide off the back piece, insert the batteries, then slide the back on to cover the batteries, slide the switch over to turn it on, and place it wherever you need it.  There are sticky pieces you can use to stick it to the wall or you can just set it down somewhere.  There are three settings:  on (the light stays on all the time), off (the light is off all the time), and automatic (there is a motion sensor that triggers the light to turn on then it automatically turns back off).  The switch you use to change between on/off/automatic is on the back of the light.  If you've attached it to a wall then it can be a bit of a pain to change it so you'll probably want to just leave it on automatic.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

This is a great running belt.  It's big enough to fit everything you need but still small enough that it's comfortable to wear.  It would also work great for carrying your passport while traveling.  It has a large pocket that zips open/closed and inside that pocket is a smaller pocket where you can slide your smartphone.  There is an opening on the front for your headphones so you can easily listen to music while jogging.  The fabric is waterproof which will help keep your phone safe in the event of rain.  It is important to note that while the fabric is waterproof the case itself is not completely waterproof-there is a small opening at the start of the zipper on the back and there is also the opening where the headphones go through (there is a rubber piece here that stays closed when the headphones are not being used).  While these openings are not big enough to be a concern with rain getting if you were to completely submerge the case in water some water would get inside.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

This cable works well for charging my iphone.  The cable itself is nice and strong and should hold up well over time.  The part that goes into your phone is nice and small so it should work well with most cases.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

This is a nice consistency and lots of fun for toddlers (and even grown-ups!) to play with.  It's also very very easy to clean up.  All it takes is a wet cloth to wipe it right off skin or hard surfaces, you don't even need soap.  It also rinses right out of clothing with no staining even on light colored clothes.

These are easy to trim down to whatever size you need.  I had no problem cutting them down to size using regular household scissors.  Once they are the size you want you just stick them under the furniture and they help keep the furniture from sliding around.  They do not attach to the furniture (there is no glue or other sticky substance to hold them in place like there is with some other furniture pads) but I found they stayed in place just fine and helped to keep the furniture from sliding.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

There are 4 parts to the bottle:  The bottle itself, the fruit infuser basket, the top, and the bottom.  You fill up the fruit infuser basket then screw it onto the bottom of the bottle, then screw the bottle onto the bottom, then screw on the cap.  If you want you can also use the bottle without the fruit infuser basket, just leave it out and screw on the top and bottom.  This bottle is relatively small and lightweight so it's easy to carry around with you.  The top and bottle both screw on securely so there are no leaks.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

I own other glass water bottles but I end up not using them much because I'm always concerned that I'll drop them and broken glass will go flying everywhere.  I really like the way this bottle is designed because the plastic shell eliminates my concern about broken glass going everywhere.  Even if this bottle breaks the broken glass will all be contained within the plastic shell.  The glass bottle slides into the plastic shell and then you screw on the top and bottom pieces of the bottle.  This makes it easy to clean the bottle since everything comes apart and is easily accessible (plus it's dishwasher safe!).This bottle is tall and thin so it's easy to hold with one hand and fits well in the cup holders in my car.  The top has a locking mechanism that you slide to one side to lock the lid closed (it will still stay closed even when unlocked unless you pop the lid up).  I haven't had any issues with the bottle leaking.  The opening that you drink out of is towards the center of the bottle and can be a little tricky to drink out of without spilling until you get used to it.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

This review is regarding the car kit. This kit comes with everything you need to build the car including a screw driver. The instructions are printed on the back of the packaging and are pretty basic. If you look at the item description the 4th picture down shows you the instructions-it's just what is shown in the picture nothing else. There are no words just pictures and each picture includes multiple steps. While I was able to figure everything out and the kit came together exactly as pictured it was definitely a challenge. The kit is intended for kids ages 6 and up but it's doubtful that a 6 year old would be able to put it together without significant adult assistance especially when it comes to figuring out the directions. That said it's a great project to do with your kids and my son and I had a lot of fun putting it together.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

I used this to make Vegetable Dalia.  It's simple and easy to make (basically just wheat dalia mixed with chopped vegetables).  It's traditionally a bland dish that is served to people who aren't feeling well or young children but you can easily add extra spices to it for a tasty side dish.  This is good quaility wheat dalia.  I love that it's organic and GMO free.I received a sample of this product at a discounted price.

This is a cute case.  It comes with a plastic screen protector (just peel and stick), a small microfiber cloth to clean your screen before putting the screen protector on, and a stylus in the same color as the case.  The case opens and closes with a magnetic closure.  Once you open up the case one side has a flexible plastic shell to put your iphone in and the other side has slots to store your cash and credit cards.  You can fold the case up to create a stand for your phone which is a nice bonus. The outside of the case is somewhat brighter than in the pictures and the leather doesn't look quite as natural as it does in the pictures but it's still cute.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

I'm very happy with the quality of these gloves.  They are easy to get on and off, fit well, and don't tear.  They provide a nice snug fit which makes it easy to work with them on.  I use them mainly for cleaning and am able to clean as easily as if I wasn't wearing gloves while keeping my hands protected.  The material is on the thinner side but is still strong and I haven't had any issues with them ripping or tearing.

This armband has plenty of room to fit all of your essentials.  I can easily fit my 4.7 inch iphone 6 with a thick case plus my keys and cash with plenty of room to spare.  I like that there are separate pockets to keep your stuff organized (there are two big pockets that zip open/closed and each of the bigger pockets has a small pocket inside it).  There's also some padding in-between the two larger pockets so I don't need to worry about my keys scratching my phone.  There's no opening for my headphones but I just leave the pocket unzipped a little and run the headphones out through there and it works fine.  The armband is comfortable and stays in place well.  It will fit a wide range of arm sizes.  You can hear the zippers banding against the side of the case when you are running but it's not too loud and doesn't bother me.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

These are really nice glue traps.  The glue is nice and strong and will easily hold mice or bugs in place.  While it's best to keep it out of reach of your pets it's nice knowing that even if they do get into it it's not going to kill them.  You can either lay the traps flat or fold them up into a tube.  I like the option of folding them into a tube because this helps keep people and pets from accidentally coming into contact with the glue and it also makes it much easier to dispose of them once you are done with them.If you are renting and trying to prove to your landlord that you have a bug problem these things are awesome-just put one down to trap the bugs then either photograph it or put it in a plastic bag to give to your landlord.  No more arguing over the bug problem.  :)I received a free sample from the manufacturer.

These are very durable but still fun to chew.  They are a solid piece of rubber (they are not hollow) but they have some give to them.  They are perfect for older kids who like to chew/mouth things.  You can easily attach these to a lanyard or pacifier clip (such as the booginhead pacigrip pacifier holder) so they don't get lost.

These crochet hooks are incredibly comfortable to use. The rubber handles are nice and soft with a little bit of give to them making them super easy to hold without putting any stress on your hands. The top section of the rubber handle is shaped to make it easy to get a good grip. They remind me somewhat of the special grips you can put on pens/pencils to make them easier for young children to hold. They are both easier to hold and more comfortable than traditional crochet hooks.The kit includes 9 different hooks. The sizes are as follows: 2.0mm, 2.5 mm, 3.0 mm, 3.5 mm, 4.0 mm, 4.5 mm, 5.0 mm, 5.5 mm, and 6.0 mm. The size of each hook is stamped into the handle and the different colored handles make it easy to quickly grab the hook you want without even having to check the size.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

I am very happy with the quality of this armband.  The fabric is nice and soft so it's very comfortable to wear.  The armband is easy to adjust and stays in place well.  The touchscreen protector is nice and thin and I had no trouble operating my phone when it was in the case.I bought the case designed for the 4.7 inch Iphone 6 and tested it without a case, with a thin case, and with a thicker case.  Without a case:  It was easy to put the phone in and take the phone out of the armband.  With a thin smooth case:  It was easy to slide the phone in and out of the armband.  With a textured thin case (the speck candyshell):  It was a little more difficult to get the phone in/out of the armband due to the texture on the case but it was a good fit once I got it in.  With a thick case (otterbox defender):  It was difficult to get the phone in/out of the armband.  I was ultimately able to get it in but if you plan on using a thick case you'd be better off ordering the larger size armband (the one designed for the 5.5 inch iphone).I received a free sample of this product.

This is a nice sturdy cable.  It is very durable and the long length means it will easily reach wherever you need it to.  It comes with two plastic covers that slide over the ends of the connectors to protect them when the cable is not in use.  I tested it with my play station and it worked well.I received a free sample of this product.

Plot:  Bear has never been to the library and doesn't see any reason to go.  He already has 7 books and doesn't need any more.  Mouse wants to go to the library so Bear reluctantly agrees to go.  Once at the library he sends mouse to look for a book about pickles.  Bear keeps talking louder and louder even though mouse and others remind him to use a quiet voice at the library.  He finally decides to leave but just before he's about to go he hears the librarian reading a story out loud.  It's a very interesting story and he decides to listen to it and ultimately checks the book out of the library.  It turns out libraries are actually lots of fun and a good place to go.What my kids thought:  My kids both enjoyed the story and found lots to laugh about.  It's relatively short so even younger kids should be able to sit through the whole story without losing interest.

The first time I planted a garden I didn't think to label anything because I was sure I would remember what I planted where.  Of course I promptly forgot what I had planted where and had to wait until the plants grew to start guessing at what was what.  I've since learned to use these garden tags so I can keep things straight.  These have plenty of space to write on and were easy to write on with a Sharpie.  They are nice and sturdy so they are easy to stick into the ground and they stay in place well.I received a free sample of this product.

This belt has tons of different uses:  It works great for running, other forms of exercise, and yard work.  It's also a great way to carry your cash and identification while traveling or while out dancing or doing other activities where you don't want to carry a purse.  It's nice and thin so it's easy to hide under clothing as long as you are not trying to carry anything too bulky.  The pouch is a nice compact size that stretches to accommodate large items (such as a phone).  There's enough room to easily carry your keys, cash, identification, and a smaller phone.  The material is soft and comfortable to wear even while exercising.  The belt adjusts to fit a wide range of waist/hip sizes.  The pouch is waterproof so your items will stay dry even if you get caught in the rain BUT there is a very small opening at the top of the zipper track where water can get through if the pouch is submerged under water so this would not keep items completely dry if you tried to go swimming with it on or something like that.  I got caught in a huge rainstorm while wearing this. I was completely soaked but everything inside the pouch stayed dry.  It's a great storage belt.I received a free sample of this product.

I bought this as a replacement battery for the HP Pavilion dv6 2150.  It works well and was easy to install and is completely flat/level when installed.  The only minor complaint I have is that it is difficult to get the battery back out once it is installed.  It seems like it may be just a tiny bit too big and as a result the release mechanism gets jammed making it difficult to get the battery out.

I've tried compression sleeves before but found them too uncomfortable to use on a regular basis.  These are thinner and not quite as tight as the other compression sleeves I've tired so they are more comfortable to wear but are still effective.  They help reduce leg pain and swelling while working out and are also great for traveling or for people who are on their feet all day.I received a sample of this product for testing and review.

My kids and I love all of the Little Critter books.  Me Too! is one of our favorites.  My kids find it hilarious and I love the lesson it teaches them.  Throughout the book Little Critters little sister is always asking to join in whatever he is doing or share whatever he is using.  He always lets her share even though he's not always happy about it.  Finally at the end of the book his little sister has a piece of candy and he asks her to share with him and she does.  As with all of the Little Critter books the illustrations are very detailed and there's a lot of humor to be found in the contrast between the written word and what the illustration shows happening.

These are easy to cook and make a nice high protein addition to any meal.  They can easily be served as a vegetarian main dish or they also make a tasty side.  Put the Dal in a pot of water and boil until soft.  Coat a separate pan with oil and saute some garlic and onion then add in a can of chopped tomatoes then whatever spices you'd like (you can find basic curry spice or garam masala at most mainstream grocery stores) then add in the Dal and mix it all together.I received this product at a discounted price for testing and review.

I cook some traditional Indian dishes but also cook a lot of traditional American dishes.  Chana Dal is easy to incorporate into all types of recipes.  It's a great source of protein making it a great choice for vegetarian dishes but it also works well in meat dishes or as a side dish.  Most recipes call for soaking the Dal overnight or using a pressure cooker but this isn't really necessary.  To cook:  Rinse the Dal under running water until the water runs clear.  Put Dal in pot, add about twice as much water as Dal and 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon baking soda then bring to a boil, reduce to gentle boil and cook until soft but not mushy.  The baking soda helps to soften the Dal when you haven't had time to soak it or use a pressure cooker.I received this product at a discounted price for testing and review.

This armband is made of nice soft fabric so it's comfortable to wear.  It stays in place well without slipping down my arm at all.  It fits the Iphone 6 (4.7 inch) either by itself or with a thin case.  If you have a thicker case such as the Otterbox Defender you will need to take the case off to fit it in this armband.  This is advertized as waterproof but it's really water resistant-there are two cut outs on the back plus the slit that you slide your phone through on the back.  There is no way to seal these and water can definitely get through them.  The front of the case is plastic and does provide a good amount of protection so you should be fine if you are jogging in the rain or something like that but you definitely can't submerge the case under water or anything like that.  The front of the case has a gray reflective strip and the back has bright blue piping around the cutouts and along the armband.I received a sample of this product for testing and review.

Chickpea flour is gluten and grain free and can easily be substituted for all purpose flour in many recipes to make them gluten and grain free.  It has a slightly nutty flavor which makes it a particularly good choice for breads, pancakes, and muffins.  It also works great as a breading for deep friend vegetables or a coating for meats.  To make deep friend veggies:  Mix chickpea flour and water to form a thin batter, dip veggies in this, then fry.  To use as a coating for meats:  Mix chickpea flour with your favorite spices, dredge meat in the flour mix, then a wet mix (water, or oil, or egg, or milk or some combination of these) then in the flour mix.I received this product at a discounted price for testing and review.

I've been using these discs for quite some time now and I've never run into a dud.  I'm always able to burn to them with no problems and more than 5 years after I started using them I'm still able to play the discs with no errors.

I've purchased this ink many times over the years and have never had any problems with it.  The only complaint I have is the fact that the printer tries to tell you that it's out of ink long before it's actually out.  If I replaced the ink as soon as the printer told me to I'd be wasting almost half of my ink.  I just continue printing until I see the quality start to deteriorate and then change the ink.

This is fun to play with on its own or with one of the Go Go Smart play sets.  You just push the button on the top of the lion's head to trigger lights and sounds (the button looks like the top of the lion's mane and lights up when pressed).  You can also turn the head from side to side.  The lion is the perfect size for little hands and even very young children can push the button to trigger the lights and sounds.  As children grow they discover more ways to play with these toys so you will get a lot of use out of them.  Very young children will be drawn in by the lights and sounds and the toy is small enough that even a 9-12 month old should be able to hold the toy in their hand and push the button.  Older children will have fun playing with these animals on the sets you can buy to go with them.

I love the idea of a single cable that is compatible with multiple devices. This is so much easier than having to hassle with different cables. I'm also happy that the two plug ports are secured together so I don't accidentally lose one of them while using the other. The cable is nice and sturdy and the flat design means it doesn't get tangled up as easily as some of the other cables I have. Great product!I received a sample of this product for testing and review.

This is a thin, flexible screen protector that is easy to install (just peel and stick) and so far has stayed in place with no peeling. It's thicker than other plastic screen protectors I've tried in the past but I'm still able to use my phone with no issues. It comes with an alcohol prep pad and small microfiber cloth so you can clean your screen before attaching the screen protector. My box also included a small stylus which was a nice added bonus.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer.

This is a cute case that will provide some protection for your phone without adding much bulk.  The case fit well and the cutouts all line up properly.  It was easy to pop the case on and off the phone.  The back is clear plastic with the design imprinted in it and the sides are rubber.  The back will help prevent against scratches and the rubber bumper on the side will provide some protection from drops.  It's not going to provide as much protection as something like a Lifeproof case would but it's not nearly as bulky as a Lifeproof case and much nicer to look at.I received a sample of this product for testing and review.

My kids and I are big fans of the Little Critter books.  The pictures are very detailed and the story is sure to amuse both children and adults.  In this story Little Critter and his Grandma go to the beach.  In typical Little Critter fashion the day doesn't go quite as planned but everyone has a great time anyway.  For example:  Little Critter picks up a seashell for his grandma but it turns out there's a hermit crab living in it.  I highly recommend this book.

This is a cute book and a good way to start up a conversation with young children about the importance of helping others.  Emily Elizabeth has a friend named Tim.  Every day Tim tries to do a good deed for someone.  One day he asks Clifford and Emily Elizabeth to help him out.  They are excited to help but things keep going wrong.  For example:  They help a woman paint her fence.  Clifford is very excited when they finish and wags his tail back and forth.  He accidentally knocks over a can of paint and it gets all over the woman's house.  They keep trying to do more good deeds but things keep going wrong.  Finally at the end Clifford successfully rescues people from a house fire and puts out the fire without causing any additional problems.  They all get a medal for their good deeds.

This has a nice strong flavor and I love that it's organic and GMO free with no added ingredients.  I use ginger powder in lots of different dishes including this delicious crock pot Chicken Korma:4-5 boneless chicken breasts cut into bite sized pieces1 large onion coarsely chopped2 tablespoons ginger powder2 teaspoons curry powder1 teaspoon ground coriander1/2 teaspoon ground cumin4 garlic cloves, minced1 teaspoon salt2-3 large baking potatoes, peeled and cubed1 can diced tomatoes undrained (14.5 oz)1/2 cup craisins2 bay leaves1 cinnamon stick1/2 cup milk or yogurt plus 1/2 tablespoon butter1/2 cup cashewsHeat a tablespoon or so of oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.  Add chicken and saute until lightly browned then put in crock pot.  Add onion to pan and saute 2-3 minutes.  Add ginger and next several ingredients through garlic and saute 2-3 minutes then add to crock pot.  Add the next several ingredients through up to and including the cinnamon stick and stir everything around.  Cook on low for 6 hours.  Remove bay leaves and cinnamon stick.  Stir in yogurt, butter, and cashews and let stand for a few minutes to heat.  Then serve with rice and naan (you can find naan in the frozen section at most grocery stores and some also have fresh naan available).Sample provided for testing and review.

This set is made of very thick plastic and is incredibly durable.  We've tried lots of different sets over the years and this is one of the few that have held up over time.  The rope is very sturdy and you can easily carry a bucket full of water or wet sand with no strain on the handle.  I also love that it's made from recycled plastic and is Phthalate and BPA free.

Whoever designed this is a genius!  With most pop molds I have to run the mold under warm water for a minute or two in order to get the pop out.  With this one you just push up on the underside of the pop and it pops right out.  This also makes cleaning easier since you can just pop it inside out for easy cleaning.  They are also the perfect size for young kids.  With the larger molds my kids never eat the whole thing and I end up wasting a lot.  These are about the size of an ice cube and are great for young kids.

My kids enjoy the stories on this DVD but the menu drives my kids and I absolutely crazy.  The DVD starts off with several advertizements which you can skip through.  Then you get to the menu which you cannot skip through.  The menu consists of Sir Topham Hatt, 4 different engines, and Harold the Helicopter coming out to give you very very lengthy descriptions of all of the different menu options you can choose from.  The whole thing takes at least 5 minutes, is incredibly boring, and you cannot skip it or fast forward through it.  No one wants to sit through this nonsense every time they want to watch the DVD and it drives us crazy.

I am very happy with the look and feel of these pants.  The pants have an elastic waist and would be a good fit for a US size 6 to a US size 14.  They have two long tassels that hang down the back of the pants and are designed to be wrapped around the waist and tied (when they are not tied they are as long as the pants themselves and go all the way to the ground).  The pants are on the longer side and will likely need to be hemmed if you are on the shorter side.  I'm 5'8-the inner layer of the pants hits right at my ankles and the outer layer hits on the top of my feet.  They are very light weight and perfect for summer weather.  They are very comfortable but still look great.I received a sample of this product for testing and review.

I've tried several different brands of washable nursing pads including: TL Care Organic Cotton Nursing Pads, NUK Reuseable Nursing Pads, Philips Avent Washable Nursing Pads, and Bamboobies Washable Nursing Pads. The Bamboobies are my favorites by far and are well worth the extra money. The TL Care pads are just okay-they are nice and soft but small and not very absorbent.Absorbency:-The bamboobies are the most absorbent followed by Philips, then TL Care, then NUK.Feel:The NUK pads are really scratchy and uncomfortable. The Philips pads are soft and comfortable although not quite as soft as the TL Care pads. The Bamboobies are really nice and soft. The Philips and TL Care pads are smooth cotton while the Bamboobies have a velvet feel to them.Leak Proof:The Bamboobies do the best job at preventing leaks-they absorb more than the other pads and also have a backing that keeps the milk from going all the way through the pad. The rest of the pads are okay for small leaks but larger leaks will go right through the pads and start soaking your shirt.Quality:The TL Care pads arrived with several loose threads and lots of other threads have come loose over time in the wash. The pads still work fine but it's annoying. The other pads have held up well.Other:The TL Care pads tend to bunch up when I'm wearing them and don't stay in place very well. The NUK pads also bunch up a lot and don't stay in place. The Philips pads have a lace backing which helps keep them in place. The Bamboobies don't bunch up and stay in place pretty well.

I tested this using an iphone 6 (4.7 inch) with a Body Glove Tough Suit case on it (which is a relatively thick case).  The phone fit with room to spare and I was easily able to operate the phone while it was in the case.  The top has two locking clips to seal it shut.  I submerged the case under water in my bathroom sink and everything inside stayed completely dry.  The case also comes with a lanyard and an arm band to use to carry it both of which are removeable.  The arm band slides through a slot on the back of the case and velcros on.  It's nice and thick and feels very secure.I received a sample of this product for testing and review.

We have the Camelbak Kid's Eddy bottles and the Contigo Kids Autospout bottle. They are pretty similar and we like them both but have found that the Contigo is more durable than the Camelbak. The major difference between the two is the bite valve. The bite valve on the Camelbak wears out pretty quickly-it either rips when I'm pulling it out to wash or my kids bite through it. You can buy replacement valves so you don't have to replace the whole bottle but it's still a hassle. The bite valve on the Contigo is more durable so it's harder to bite through and less likely to rip.

I've tried several different brands of washable nursing pads including:  TL Care Organic Cotton Nursing Pads, NUK Reuseable Nursing Pads, Philips Avent Washable Nursing Pads, and Bamboobies Washable Nursing Pads.  The Bamboobies are my favorites by far and are well worth the extra money.  The TL Care pads are just okay-they are nice and soft but small and not very absorbent.Absorbency:-The bamboobies are the most absorbent followed by Philips, then TL Care, then NUK.Feel:The NUK pads are really scratchy and uncomfortable.  The Philips pads are soft and comfortable although not quite as soft as the TL Care pads.  The Bamboobies are really nice and soft.  The Philips and TL Care pads are smooth cotton while the Bamboobies have a velvet feel to them.Leak Proof:The Bamboobies do the best job at preventing leaks-they absorb more than the other pads and also have a backing that keeps the milk from going all the way through the pad.  The rest of the pads are okay for small leaks but larger leaks will go right through the pads and start soaking your shirt.Quality:The TL Care pads arrived with several loose threads and lots of other threads have come loose over time in the wash.  The pads still work fine but it's annoying.  The other pads have held up well.Other:The TL Care pads tend to bunch up when I'm wearing them and don't stay in place very well.  The NUK pads also bunch up a lot and don't stay in place.  The Philips pads have a lace backing which helps keep them in place.  The Bamboobies don't bunch up and stay in place pretty well.

These are nice quality foil star stickers.  They can be difficult to peel off even for an adult and are definitely too difficult for a young child to peel off.  They stick well and are nice and shiny.

Pros:-My kids really enjoy these and have lots of fun with them.-The color wipes off easily as long as you wipe it right away.Cons:-It can be difficult to clean up if you wait too long.  If I wipe everything up as soon as my kids are done with their bath it will easily wipe right off with a little water BUT if I wait until later to try to wipe it off I have to spend lots of time scrubbing to get it all off and it can sometimes take several cleanings to get rid of it completely.-The crayon portion is very short, only about a third of the length of the tube.-If you push the crayon all the way to the end it tends to fall off when you are using it.

This is a nice poster.  It's printed on typical poster paper and is a good quality print.  It comes rolled up in a heavy duty poster tube with the ends stapled on.  It was pretty difficult to open the tube to get the poster out but it was in good condition with no damage from the shipping.  I do wish that these came in a larger size.

*ARC provided by author for honest review*  Broken Heart by Angel Rose is the first book in the Broken Heart series.  In this story Angel introduces us to Jenesis, the broken lead female character, Michael, then dominate lead male character, David, the father figure Jenesis always wanted but never had and a handful of other supporting characters. This is not your typical love story.  This story has so many different emotions; anger, sorrow, hate, hurt and love all intertwined with endless lies, deceits, and abuse.  Jenesis is a very broken untrusting young woman who comes from a childhood full of verbal abuse, physical abuse and domestic violence.  When her parents lives are tragically cut short she runs away to New York to start a new life for herself.  However tragedy follows her to New York where she is unable to escape her horrible violent nightmares. Jenesis meets David and their relationship blooms full of father daughter love but then she meets Michael and falls head over heals in love and borderline obsessed. It just so happens that David and Michael can't stand each other adding another layer of drama.  The author takes you on a roller coaster ride full of drama and despair, and tells a story of how everyone is intertwined and how their lies not only affects their own lives but everyone else's. Throughout the book the author constantly has you second guessing whether or not you actually like the characters and Michael is definitely not book boyfriend material.  This is a great debut novel and very well written.  There are some typos and grammatical errors but nothing severe enough to take away from the story. The story is very fast passed and told in the the first person through Jenesis' point of view.  There is very hot sex scenes and very graphic violence throughout the book. I recommend this book to everyone over 18 who is not sensitive to abusive situations. This story does end with a cliffhanger.  I give this book 4 stars and can not wait to see what the author has in store for the next novel. I hope that the supporting characters all get their own books as well because with some developing I really feel that a couple of the other characters can have great stories.

*ARC provided by the author for an honest review*Something for the Pain by Victoria Ashley tells the story of Tripp and Alex, in their alternating POVs. Best friends for years, Alex and Tripp have a relationship that is unparalleled. They have been there for each other for tragic life events, happy times, and everything in between.Alex would drop everything for Tripp, his little firecracker, whenever she needed him. So when Tripp asks him to move in with her and her sort-of-boyfriend, Lucas, he is unable to say no. But what will it end up costing Alex? For years, he has been sleeping his way through the female clientele that flock to his tattoo shop, all the while harboring an intense attraction for his best friend. Hes not willing to sacrifice everything for a taste of Tripp...because certainly, he cant keep her as his own.For almost a year, Tripp has been happy with the arrangement she has with Lucas. Unwilling to commit to him, each are free to see other people- though only Lucas has taken advantage of it. At the one year mark, Lucas wants her to commit to being exclusive, but theres something holding her back...Alex. She cant deny her attraction to him, but she also cant risk his friendship. Certainly their emotional connection is more important than hormones, right?So when one night, Lucas suggests something that Alex has thought about constantly, he has a decision to make. Can one night with Tripp get her out of his system, or will he lose his heart in the process?This woman has always been my something for the pain, and losing her will feel like dying...Something for the Pain is sexy, a bit angsty, and has a male lead that any girl would find swoon-worthy. Theres no question in my mind that the reader will almost always be in Alex and Tripps corner, but will they come to their senses and give it a shot?I would rate this book 4 stars. There is minor violence, good writing, and some sexual content.

This ARC provided by the author for an honest review.Love to Hate You by Isabelle Richards. The conclusion to the two book series. Simply put. AMAZING.Her style is near perfect, in that it draws you in, keeps you in and sweeps you away from your everyday life. Her character are deeply developed to where you will feel what she needs you to feel for each character at each moment of the book.This is the conclusion to Ari and Chases story.They may finally be past the bull. The incessant fighting. The bickering. The competing. Finally able to concentrate on their love for one another. But fate is a fickle friend and when you think all is going well that is when fate throw you a curveball. For poor Ari and Chase they get curveball after curveball.A crazy ex, Jenna, who wont go away and has lost all sense of reality. A heartbreaking illness to Aris dad the football hero, Aiden. A lost girl, Ari, with a need to getaway and a stupid boyfriend, Chase, who lets her go. A hurt ex-boyfriend who turns her away and instead of seeking support from those she loves and that love her she parties with a former loser from her tennis days. Hurt, humiliation, lost in life. So many emotions run rampant through this book that it is hard to see how these two could ever end up together.Every move these two make leads to more pain, more hurt, more turmoil. But they will need to buck up and hope their love is enough to overcome all the obstacles that befall them.Isabelle Richards has become one of my favorite writers. After her Fates trilogy not this series it is hard not to see pure talent and amazing storytelling on the pages she scribes.This is a 5 star read for me! Thats right, 5 stars. This book, this series. It is MUST READ. Isabelle Richards is MUST READ.

ARC was provided by author for an honest review.Chasing Cassidy by D. Kelly. My 1st book read by the author. A true love, fight for romance novel. Beautifully written, with hot, steamy sex, told in alternating POVs by our two leads, Cassidy and Zach.Cassidy Pope has known Zachery Stafford since they were six years old. That is also the same time when her life changed at home. It is when they moved into her dead grandmothers home and her father beat her and mom did nothing to stop it.It is also the time when she made a best friend, Zachs twin sister, Rylee and her best friend and true love, Zach.After years of physical, verbal and mental abuse at the hands of her father and the abandonment of her mother. Cassidy is a mess. She has been taught that love doesnt exist. Though Zach and his family have loved and shown her love from the start, her upbringing negates that in her eyes.When Zachs mother, a pretentious privileged b*tch, does the unthinkable and runs Cassidy off on her wedding day to Zach, Zach is tired of her running and has plans to show and prove to her how much she is loved and that it does exist.Following her to Hawaii, he lays the ground work on proving to her that she is worthy of him, the Stafford name and all that goes with it. But with her childhood and his mothers relentless attacks, Zach has his work cut out for him. Luckily with the help of his sister Rylee, his dad and the unlocking and telling of secrets he hopes she can make her finally see and believe what he has tried to show and prove to her all her life.I loved this book. I was swept away in the love Zach had for her. I usually hate the lost woman character but Cassidy is written in a way that you cant help but feel for her and fall in love with her yourself.I highly recommend this to romance reader. To readers of good books in general. D. Kelly keeps up interested throughout and we root hard for Zach and Cassidy.5 stars is my rating and I cant wait to read more by this author.

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *Songbird is written by bestselling author Sydney Logan. Her writing style is amazing. This book is a contemporary romance bordering on the uber sweet fairy tale variety.Callie Franklin for the most part is a good girl. A hard working reporter who is looking for love and doesnt do one night stands. Ever.That is until her friends wedding weekend. Frustrated with her bridezilla best friend she heads to the piano bar the night before the wedding. There she runs into a hot sexy stranger and goes against everything she believes in and after the hottest night of sex she has ever had she is left humiliated when she awakens to the stranger gone. Without even a goodbye. Dejected. Humiliated. She heads to the wedding breakfast and there her humiliation intensifies when she sees her sexy stranger. He is the missing groomsman from the rehearsal dinner the night before. Devin McAllister.Devin doesnt do dating. He doesnt do relationships, they lead to strings and heartbreak. He likes uncomplicated and simple. Just sex. Just pleasure. Nothing more.At the wedding, Callie wont even look at him. When he finally gets a chance to dance with her sparks ignite again. This time he leaves a white rose and a goodbye note. Callie is once again pissed at herself for breaking her rules no matter how hot and sexy Devin is her eyes.When life throws Callie and Devin a curve ball, forcing them together once again, things get very interesting.I really liked this book. I prefer a more realistic love story. This was a little too fairy tale for me. That is only my opinion, which does not take away from the book whatsoever.I liked the dual POVs. There was no real violence and the sex was eluded to but never really graphically told.I rate this book 5 sweet stars!

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *Indecision by Elizabeth Grace is a short romance novel of 200 pages. It centers on Jackie Davenport, a 911 operator. She loves life. Loves sex. Loves fun. What she doesnt like is attachments. Commitments. She is haunted by a past experience and isnt willing to relive that pain again. That sense of loss.Jamie MacTavish is a new cop in town, he hasnt had the pleasure of meeting or learning of Jackie. That changes one night when he pulls his cruiser up to trying to change her flat tire. He is arrogant, annoying and commanding way pisses her off immensely. She in hand has him hard in his trouser and eager to learn more about her.As infuriating as he was she cant stop thinking about him but he is everything she fights to avoid. When his domineering ways lead to a basement tryst he starts to break down her walls. The sex was hot, steamy, and more then she has had.As they spend time together her walls start to crumble. That is until he innocuously tells her of his dreams. His desire to be SWAT. That is too much for her and she hastily ends it all. Her father was a cop, killed while serving and protecting and he wants to be SWAT. No way, no how, not for her. She is gone.When circumstances occur she realizes she was in far too deep but it may be too late and all she can do is fight for the man she loves and hope he will forgive her.Loved this romance novel. Great character. Loved the writing style.5 Cop-a-licious stars!
