* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *After the Storm by Faith Andrews is the second book in her series, following Man of My Dreams. This is Noahs story. Told a few years later. His life now in California.After being spurned by Mia when she took back her estranged, cheating husband he fled to California. Where he started a construction business that has become hugely successful with the help of his annoyingly sweet best friend, Blaze.He has primarily concentrated on work, dating a no-no, only hook ups and one-nighters. When he hires a beautiful, smart, hard worker for his office all that may change, whether he wants it too or not.Blaze constantly is putting it in his head to go after Willow. Usually in annoying way but still he sees the connection they both have for one another. One night at a bar she makes a play but he shoots her down. Why, he isnt sure himself. Events unfold that night where Blaze is attacked and severely injured. Thus throwing Willow and Noah into working more closely together. This leads to him having to fight harder and harder with the temptation that Willow is. She is perfect but still he fights.Eventually a kiss leads to more and they grow closer. But, Mother Nature decides to step in. Hurricane Sandy hits NJ and he rushes home to check his family, his friends, and his own house. All is working fine till a run in at a school being used for the recovery, a run in with Mia. And Declan.The bleep hits the fan. Willow runs home. Noah is made to decide what he wants to do, what he wants in life.This was a sweet, lovely romance that had me eagerly turning page after page.5 stars

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *Countdown to Killing Kurtis by Lauren Rowe is a departure from her brilliant series, The Club. This standalone novel is a dark, twisted, thrill ride with so many twist and turns.The story centers on Charlene Wilber who comes to be known as Buttercup Bovier later in the book. The story is told in past and present flip flopping chapters that lead to the present story while shedding light on her past.As a child Charlene is brought up by a big-dreamer dad and a drunk of a mom. Her dad fawns on her, tells her she is destined for greatness. He doesnt believe in normal schooling, so he home schools her but really he only has her read a lot of books.When a fight between her parents leads to him fleeing to California to set up his big idea and a promise to come back for her, she is heartbroken. When a new man later comes into her mothers life, man who is helping her stay clean by the way. Buttercup cannot stand for it and her devious actions lead to her being put in the foster system. Here she is just waiting to age out, move to Hollywood, find daddy and become a star, like her idol, Marilyn Monroe and her foster friend Wesley coming out soon after.In the present we find Buttercup in Hollywood, she meets a porn director/producer who is immediately smitten with her. He is use to the power of using women but when he learns of a secret about Buttercup his interest escalates to a new level. Not only romantically but career wise also. He promises to make her the star she believes she can be, while loving her.Married now to Kurtis. She believes all her dreams are coming through. But slowly evidence leads her to find out everything is smoke, mirrors, lies and deception. Daddy is in California but they cant be together for a year due to his actions in the past. Kurtis soon after marrying reveals a side to himself that Buttercup cannot and will not tolerate. Throw in the fact Kurtis is sleazy with one of his actors and you have Buttercup ready to pounce. Plotting his demise.A year and he will be dead. The plan is in place. Sweet Wesley in here. Her dad is will carry out the plan when he is free to do so in a year. All is planned.Then the twist and turns begin.Hang on people, this is one twisted wild ride!I loved this book! I loved the twisted mentality of Buttercup and her seeming denial that her thoughts and actions where normal, logical.I highly recommend this book to readers who love wild stories, darker themes, and a little twisted romance or two.5 sweeter than sweet tea stars!!!!!

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *What happens when you love someone so much it hurts but at the same time you hate them maybe even more? Well in this case you get Isabelle Richards book HATE TO LOVE YOU, book #1 in the series.Ari is a professional championship caliber tennis player. Chase is an up and coming NFL quarterback. Their parents were athletes and friends. Ari & Chase have known each other from what seems like birth. They grew up friends but their severe competitive natures made them fight at everything. Games, sports. You name it, it became a competition. Even, eventually love.The story is told in the present with snapshots back to the past. These characters are written so that youll love them one chapter then hate them the next. Perfectly fitting.On Chases biggest day, the NFL Draft, his act of chivalry leads to Ari, her room, her bed, her virginity. But in the morning she is gone. Chase isnt happy, not with her running and not with her thinking it is a one off.When he finally convinces her to take a chance, they decide to keep it secret from everyone. This is added undo pressure and leads to many misunderstandings, fights, breakups. Then Chase screws up royally, only he doesnt know he has and Ari runs yet again.Their actions after that seems more for spite then moving on. Hurt grows. Hate grows. That all changes when a family emergency brings them back together in the same city. Where chase was the one with feelings now its Ari but how? After so many years.Whats she to do? What will Chase do? .... book 2, LOVE TO HATE YOU.This book was outstanding. Great leads, great secondary characters. Gripping and enticing story line. It was a one day read for me. For those points I give this 5 love/hate stars.

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *FREED by Kimberly Bracco is the epilogue-like conclusion novella to her UNINHIBITED series. It was released in Sept 2015 and is a fitting wrap up of a great series.Tanner and Ashleys love story was a wild ride. From crazy exs, to a unplanned pregnancy, to accusation of man-trapping, to a horrific crash and losing an almost full term baby, to Tanner doing everything he needed to, to win back the love of his life.Ashley was a strong female lead throughout the series. Tanner was great male lead but his insecurities almost cost him the girl he loved. Now in Freed they are happily married and Ashley is pregnant but alas all is not right. Her fear of again losing a child is causing struggles. While Tanner works to assure Ashley everything will be OK, Ashley is only more worried and fragile in the fear of another loss.Through in the unwelcome return of Tanners bitchy ex who does wonders to ruin Ashleys self-worth  and poor Tanner is going to have to go hardcore in assuaging his lovely wifes fear and ego.I loved this series. The writing style, the flow. It was just a great ride. A spinoff series is coming starring secondary characters, Alex & Quinn.I highly recommend this series and obvi, this book, to all readers of the romance genre.5 happily ever after stars!

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *INSIDER is book one in the Exodus End series by amazing author, Olivia Cunning. The series is a spin off from the Sinners series, as Dare the leader of the band is brothers with Trey of the Sinners series.Toni Nichols is a shy, virgin, homebody who took care of her special needs little sister and wrote articles for her mothers company from home. That is until she is given the prime job of following the band and writing an interactive book she had an idea for.Logan Schmidt is the bassist for Exodus End, a player and an adrenaline junkie. If he isnt feeling it on stage, then he is bed with a groupie or two and if he has time away from those he is enjoying risky activities like sky diving and motocross.This all changes when Toni shows up at the buses to start following the band. The band and security expected Tony, not Toni. Once they allow her on the bus the guys open and wild personas are nothing like what she is use too. It doesnt take long to feel out of place and it only takes slightly longer till she loses her V-card to mega-slut Logan. When he discovers he took her virginity he is shocked and doesnt know what to do. So he does what any moron man does he walks out.The story centers on Tonis inexperience and open thinking, her self-doubt, her insecurities and her crazy mother and boss. We also have Logans insane jealousy, he punches a bandmate, his fear of loving her and just keeping it casual and the lack of faith he has in Toni when it hits the fan.I really love most all of Cunnings rocker books. My only knocks on this book was the naivet of Toni and her forgiving those who wrong her so quickly.I am giving this a big 5 stars.

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *Outside by Michelle Mankins is the first book in the Rock Stars, Surf and Second Chances series. This is the story of surf and rock God Lincoln "Linc" Savage and sweet tenderhearted Simone "Mona" Bianchi. This novel tells a story of love, hate, abuse, passion, tragedy, heartbreak and devastation.When Linc and Mona first meet Linc is on the path to becoming a top professional surfer and Mona is a talented college student whose only wish is to perform on Broadway and finally be free of her extremely controlling and possessive father. When Linc and Mona first see each other it is instant attraction and addiction to one another. Once their romance startes, even if they do not have the support of their families, they are determined that they will make the best out of the time they have together before she returns to college and he goes off to wow the world as a professional surfer. They plan to stay faithful to each other while apart and will eventually live happily ever after together. The only problem with their plan was after a horrible accident during an afternoon surfing Linc was left unable to to compete professionally, and after Linc lost surfing he lost himself. This started a fast spiral to end of the passionate romance that he and Mona had found during their summer together, but no matter the amount of heartbreak or heartache either went through their love for one another never died.Now fast forward 15 years and now you have a Rock God Lincoln and a surf shop owner Simone. Linc has not seen Mona since their horrific breakup all those years ago but now he's back and wants a second chance. Mona has to decide if she can risk her heart again on the man who has already smashed to pieces.The story is told in both Linc's and Mona's point of view and in the first person. The author does an amazing job switching the story back and forth from the past and the present while tell the story. There is so much pain in this book that you are taken on an emotional rollercoaster that really doesn't end until the end of the book. It honestly took a while for me to get into the story but once I got into it I was hooked. Although I am not a big fan of Lincoln and the story was frustrating at times I did enjoyed the book as a whole, with that being said I give Outside 3.5 stars. There were some grammatical errors throughout the book that did take away from the story some and I believe that if fixed would raise the rating for this novel. The author did leave the story open for not only more books in the series for all the supporting characters but for possibly more of Linc and Mona. This book does contain very hot sex scenes and physical, verbal and physiological child abuse.

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *Loving Sadem by Gemma Rice is the sequel to Loving Misery. Loving Sadem is a great story but has some parts that will leave you wondering. Loving Sadem is about what happens between Jared, Sean, and Holly.Jared is a band member in Misery and has some problems he is dealing with but he is in love with Holly. But does he love her enough not to hurt her? Jared does some things that puts Holly in danger and she does not feel safe with him.Sean has been in love with Holly since he first saw her but has not pursued anything with her until recently but she is with Jared. Sean also owns a club's one that Holly works for and another that is bdsm club that she is not aware of. He has a dark side to him and he thinks she has one too. Sean is willing to do anything to get Holly back even if it going along with her terms.Holly is in love with one man but no longer feels safe. She is also starting to fall in love with another man. But she does not want to give up on Jared so she comes up with a plan to see if he is willing to give up his bad habits and be there for her.What is the plan that Holly comes up with? Which one of the guys will she fall in love with and really wants to be with? Will Jared change his ways?Gemma Rice does a great job with Loving Sadem she has great characters and storyline. This is a four star read. Loving Sadem is book 2 and there is another after that will continue the story.

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *Well Im giving my first 6 star rating to a book. It goes to Emma Chases Sustained, book #2 in the Legal Briefs series. It can be read as a standalone, as the main character was a secondary character in the first book. This is a beautiful HEA romance novel.Jake Becker is a rising star defense attorney. His is also a player, who hits it and quits it. He doesnt do complicated. Hell he doesnt even date but to bad his world is about to be turned upside down.After a health scare Jake decides to try the dating lifestyle, actually meeting, getting to know and like a girl before he bangs her. Nothing sparks his interest until a chance occurrence. He is pick pocketed by a witty 9 year old who he chases down and instead of handing him over to the cops brings him home. There he comes face to face with a stunningly beautiful woman, Chelsea, the boys aunt.Turns out she is the custodian to him and his 5 other brothers and sisters after their parents were killed in a car accident a month earlier. She is in WAY over her head but doing the best she can and for some unknown reason, to himself, Jake is eager to help out where he can.As we go through the book situations arise were Jake plays the hero and also the goat. The characters are strongly built so that you cant help but love them. The kids are cute and funny as hell. This story just hit a homerun for me. I couldnt put it down. Id try and then I would find myself gravitating over to my tablet and starting to read again.My only negative about the book, the parents were killed a month ago but the emotional grief is almost nonexistent, but honestly that is knit picking. I just happen to be finicky like that.

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *Breaking Love by MJ Summers is book 2  in a series of stand- alones  called Full Hearts.There wasn't really that much given in book 1 about Luc so I had no urgent need to read more about him. However I am glad MJ wrote his story and I am glad I read it.What I loved most about this book is the character Megan. She's a single mom and she actually puts her son first! Megan tries to keep her relationship with Luc separate from her personal family life. It works for a little while because well life happens. Luc has a chance to be a knight in shining armor, tossing around his money and sweeping Megan off her feet but he doesn't do it in the traditional ways. Instead, once Luc realizes Megan is what he wants forever he helps her with her family which means more to Megan than flashing the  cash.As with any good story there has to be a villain. The only villain in Breaking Love is time and self preservation. Both Luc and Megan learn that while life might be tough, it's how you handle it, the choices you make that helps you become the person you are.I am looking forward to reading the other stories in this series as MJ Summers has me intrigued.3.5 stars

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *Weightless by Gia Riley is the continuation of Sophie and Kiptons story.Sophie has never really known what happiness was until Kipton came into her life. She couldnt imagine life without him in it. But when it is time for Kipton to graduate and move away for his new job, it leaves Sophie worried about their future. When the past is brought back into Sophies life, she has to decide if she will fight the darkness that has plagued her mind or let it consume her.All those nights I spent wishing for someone to love meyou found me. Excerpt from Weightless.Kipton hates that he has to move anywhere away for where Sophie is, but knows that in order to give Sophie the life she deserves, he needs to have a job that can support them. His love for Sophie runs deep and he never wants her to forget that since he is afraid that being away from her will bring back bad memories for her. He will do whatever it takes to keep Sophie safe and make sure they get their happily ever after, unless their pasts clash and make impossible for their dreams to come true.Shes the easiest love Ive lived and I wont ever let her slip through my fingers. Excerpt from Weightless.Weightless is the second book in the Begin Again series. This is not a standalone novel and Lighter has to be read first. I really loved reading this book. I enjoy seeing how much Sophie and Kipton have grown from the first book and throughout this book. Long distance relationships, no matter the miles between are hard and I love how supportive they were with each other. This book will keep you will keep you reading from beginning to end! I give this Weightless 5 stars!Written by Gabby for Summers Book Blog.

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *Lighter by Gia Riley is a story of a girl learning what love is and a boy fighting for the one he loves.Sophie hasnt lived an easy life. Her past is nothing but pain, anger, and failure. Her only escape is gymnastics, and it leads her to the school of her dreams away from all that seem to cause her grief. She doesnt know it, but college changes her life in unexpected way or is prepared for. Sophies roommate, Cara, is just who she needs to bring her out of her shell and show her what it means to have a real friend. What she doesnt need is a distraction, and Caras brother Kipton is just that. Though she cant stop thinking about him or wanting to be with him, she tries with all her might to. She never want to let someone get close enough to her again to risk being hurt, but with Kipton, she finds keeping her walls up harder then she thought.Hes taught me love doesnt need a motive or an excuse. It can simply exist. His is the most patient kind of love there is. Excerpt from Lighter.Kipton never had a problem fitting in and getting what he wanted. He thought this final year of school was going to be a breeze, but he got the shock of his life when he met his sisters roommate. Sophie was unlike any girl he had ever met. She made him feel things he has never felt before. When he realizes that there is something is holding here back from being with him, he has to decide if he wants to fight for her or let her go. But Kipton is a fighter and he is know that this could be just what he needs to get what he has always wanted.Youre my home, Sophie. Wherever you are is where I want to be. Excerpt from Lighter.Lighter is the first book in the Begin Again Series. This book is not your everyday romance novel. It is fill with so much emotion that makes you smile, cry, laugh, and angry. I wasnt certain how I felt about it in the beginning, but as I started to understand the depth of the characters and how it all came into place, I couldnt put it down. I love with a capital L Kipton. He was so patient and understanding to Sophie that I was always swooning over him throughout the whole book. I would definitely recommend this book to everyone and cant wait to read more from Gia Riley. I give this book 4 stars!Written by Gabby for Summers Book Blog.

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *Ryker by Sawyer Bennett is book four in A Cold Fury Hockey Series. Ryker will have hooked and laughing and upset and what some people will do when they are mad. Ryker is about Grey who is the leagues first women General Manager and Ryker who is the goalie for the team and if they can overcome some obstacles and be together.Ryker is the goalie for the Cold Fury. He is recently divorced and raising his two daughters. Ryker was traded from his old team for beating another team mate for sleeping with his wife. Well Grey is the one who scouted him and now he stands behind her being the GM of the team he thinks she has what it takes to be that person. Ryker takes up for Grey when people bad mouth her for being a woman GM. But then things start turning for him and he wants more than just a working relationship with Grey.Grey is the new women GM of Cold Fury and she has taken a lot of criticism for being a women but she wants to make history and show people that women can be GM's for hockey teams. She has meeting with all her team members and outlines what she plans to do but when she meets with Ryker she is left with feelings she has never had before. But she wants those things but she does not want to jeopardized her working career.Will Ryker and Grey be able to overcome some of the obstacles that face them with Grey being GM and Ryker being her employee? Will things be hard for them once the truth comes out or will everything be ok? I suggest that you one click and read to find out just how this relationship will work out.Sawyer Bennett is a great writer she writes with good character descriptions and story line. Sawyer will not leave you disappointed with this story it will give you everything you need to enjoy the story. I am giving this 5 stars because it was great and i really enjoyed Ryker and Grey's story.

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *I had the pleasure of reading PLAYING WITH FIRE by author Lexi Ryan. This is my first book by Ms. Ryan and certainly not my last. This novel came close to being my 1st 6 star rating for Summers Book Blog.The story begins with Dr Phoenix Nix Reed seeing a ghost of her past, a past she has been running from since her 17th birthday. Shaken, she almost had forgotten that Max Hallowell who has come over to fix her broken garage door. Once fixed, sparks ignite and they spend a hot, steamy, and passionate together.Trouble is Nix doesnt feel she is worth of a hot guys love. Her two previous loves marred her confidence in herself. So while Max tries to get closer, Nix is adamant of fighting her wants and running in the other direction.But when more incidents from the past start happening they are pushed together. Phone calls, a fire on her lawn, visits from her past friendly and unfriendly alike. This is an intense thriller/romance where Lexi Ryan hints to most being the antagonist.We even have a 2nd potential suitor in Cade, a cop from California. Who has interest in Nix. Much to the dismay of Max and her friends.When this book lost its 6th star was the ending. The climactic ending fell way short for me. It builds and builds till we are the point of the finally and then end chapter and its over. I think with a few more pages and action of the ending this would be one of the best books of the year. Other than that this was a great read5 stars from this reviewer.

* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *Ruin and Rule is the first book in the Pure Corruption MC series.This book is  NOT a happily ever after...yet! While I havent  read anything else by Pepper,  I truly hope she writes a HEA for the main characters:  Cleo and Art! I would love to see other stories about the brothers in the Club as well.  I also hope (really really hope) that Wallstreet is as good and trustworthy as Art thinks but I have a bad feeling about him. Pepper Winters provides hope for her characters as well as the reader! She writes a devastating love story. The roller coaster of emotions are felt right from the start. I was intrigued with this story from the beginning  when Cleo-Sarah aka Forgetful Girl wakes up and doesn't remember anything! I love that she was sassy/strong despite not knowing  anything.  I was intrigued by Art aka Kill,  by what he could be hiding throughout the whole story. I also felt devastation and heart broken that two characters were so badly broken inside. I tried to go to bed after starting this story and wondered all night what was going to happen to them. After finishing it I'm floored. My husband looked at me like I was crazy. No no no this can't end like this!  The truth was despicableI can't imagine what will happen and can't believe I have to wait until 2016 to find out!!I absolutely loved this story (wished it could have had  a happily ever after, but I will wait patiently for the next book and continue to wonder what could happen!)5 stars and lots of recommendations!

**ARC provided for an honest review**Crossing the Line (Without a Trace Book 2) by Ally Bishop is the prequel to Inside the Lines (Book 1 in the Without a Trace Series). This is a story of finding love after great heartache with someone totally unexpected.I sometimes cringed when it comes to reading romance novels because of the "insta-love" factor. This isn't a problem in this book, which I greatly appreciated. There are plenty of hot, sexy scenes in this book like a certain bathroom adventure that takes place, but they do not take over the plot. There is plenty of non-sexy action taking place in between which I really enjoyed. This is not one of those books that rely solely on sex scenes.The main character, Ella is a young woman living in NYC with her brother Noah. Together they run a dinner mystery theater called Elementary. Ella is the mastermind behind the theater productions and her brother helps run the company along with being the star of the productions. A high profile attorney by the name of Ian Crane has booked an Elementary show for his birthday. Ian is handsome and totally not what Ella expected when she meets with him to discuss the details of the party. Ella and Ian spend a few hours together going over details of the party and during that time, they find that they have some things in common and things get "steamy". Down the line, they hit some bumps in the road and situations that were unknown come to light.Overall, this book was pretty good. The book is written well and although I felt some of Ella's inner thoughts were sometimes annoying I found her to be likable and real. The other characters, like Ian and Noah were also relate-able, although Noah is a bit on the promiscuous side, but what hot, young guy making it big in the city isn't? The one co-character, Lux (from book 1), seemed a little out there. She's a dominatrix in a relationship with a guy that's not really spoken about. She is however, a good friend to Ella and Noah and pops in every now and then throughout the book to offer a shoulder to lean on and/or advice. The romance is pretty believable and I found myself rooting for Ella and Ian throughout the story through their high points and more so during the low points.I give this book 3 stars, not because it is a bad read. It's a good read. The rating is mainly because of the time jump. I just felt that there was something to be desired in between that jump, like what happened with Ella and Ian during that time? What was Noah up to? What made Ella and Ian come to the decision they came to? Just a few things I want to know as a reader.I'm hoping there will be a book 3 and that it will be about Noah.  I'm curious to know more about him, what secrets he has and what the cause of his constant promiscuity was.Thank you Summer's Book Blog and author, Ally Bishop for giving me the opportunity to read Crossing the Line and offering my review.Written by Melissa for Summers Book Blog.

Writing (Poor, OK, Good, Great): GreatIs there violence (No, Some, Graphic): NoSexual content (None, Some, A lot): SomeNarration (first, second, third, alternating): Alternating* ARC provided by the author for an honest review *One Night With a Billionaire by Jessica Clare is the final novel in the Billionaire Boys Club Series and it is a perfect example of how Clares writing has only gotten better over time. Fans of the series have been waiting for this novel ever since the 3rd book in the series introduced Cade Archers life-long crush on Daphne Petty. Now that we have finally reached the point to hear Cades story, I am so incredibly happy to announce that his love interest is NOT spoiled, drama queen Daphne.One of the best things about this novel is how Clare forces Cade to recognize some harsh truths about who he truly is and the type of person he deserves to share his life with. Kylie is such a breath of fresh air and I honestly would have cried if Cade ended up staying in love with Daphne. Kylie is pleasant, witty, and entirely unaware of her own self-worthto the point that she allows Daphne to be openly cruel to her by sticking her with the nickname Fat Marilyn after claiming, You look like a fat Marilyn Monroe. Or Bettie Page. You know they dont like big butts here in L.A.  Despite Daphnes cruel behavior and selfish desires, Kylie truly considers Daphne a friend and tries to protect her from being hurt by Kylie and Cades blossoming relationship.Cade and Kylie both must overcome the challenges of their past in order to have a real opportunity to be together, but they are both stubborn enough to put up a good fight. I really love the dynamic between Cade and Kylie throughout the story. In the past, Cade has seemed a bit stuffy and almost nave when it comes to his judgement of others (namely Daphne). However, when he is with Kylie, Cade comes across as charming, fun, and attractive. He lets his guard down and is surprisingly down to earth.How much of this was the real Cade and how much was alcoholic silliness, she wondered? Either way, she loved it. She was having a blast. She usually wasnt ultra-playful in bed, being too self-conscious to really let her hair down. But how could she possibly be worried about how she looked when this drunk, heavenly man was pretending to strip for her, complete with burbled music? It was freaking adorable.--Excerpt from One Night With a BillionaireThis novel was very well-written and will please fans of the series and new-readers alike. I recommend it to people who have enjoyed the previous books in the series or to new readers who are looking for a refreshing and fun novel with a billionaire hero and a sassy and energetic heroine. 5 Stars!

A Forever Kind of Love by Ellie Wade is the second and final book in the Choices series.  A Beautiful Kind of Love must be read prior to A Forever Kind of Love.A Forever Kind of Love is a continuation of Jax and Lilys story from A Beautiful Kind of Love, but is told from Jaxs perspective rather than Lilys.  You get Jaxs POV from when they were kids, teenagers, college students and to where we left off in A Beautiful Kind of Love.  So there is some repetition in events but with Jaxs thoughts and feelings.When Im with Lily, the cloud of stress that weighs on me like a heavy fog lifts, and I can finally breathe.  She makes everything okay, bringing me back to my center where the chaos sleeps and the peace lives.Excerpt from A Forever Kind of LoveLily and Jax have always been destined for each other.  As they both get older, they confirm that they are the one for each other.  They get torn apart, but their lifelong friendship means more to them than anything else.  They have both been there for each other when they have needed each other the most, regardless of how much they might have been hurt by the other.A true friend is one you can go extended periods without seeing or talking to, yet the moment you are back in touch, its like no time has passed at all.  I suppose that can be said for any real relationshipExcerpt from A Forever Kind of LoveI absolutely loved reading this book!  And after reading A Beautiful Kind of Love, I was dying to read the conclusion.  This book isnt just a love story; its a story of true, life-long friendship that only few people experience.  This book was amazing to read and so moving.  There were tears as I read parts and definitely a book hangover.Writing: AmazingIs there violence? NoSexual content: YesNarration: Jaxs POV5 StarsWritten by Amber for Summers Book Blog

Legacy by Stephanie Fournet is an amazing standalone novel. Legacy is the gripping story of Corinne who is deep in the midst of grief over the loss of her boyfriend.  Corinne isnt eating, interacting, working (shes an artist) or even sleeping well.  She is so grief-stricken that her family is deeply worried about her.Enter Wes, Corinnes boyfriends best friend.  Wes is everything that Corinne despises.  Hes a gym rat, constantly picking up women, lackadaisical, and just irresponsible, so she thinks.  Wes thinks Corinne is an uptight, stuck up snob who hates his guts, but he will honor his best friends request.Wes finally caught the desperate sadness he best friend felt about the prospect of losing his own life.But if I cant I need to know that you will look after her. Excerpt from LegacyWes ends up moving in to Corinnes and basically saves her from herself.  Wes imposes rules to help Corinne get through her grief basically.  She must eat, she must exercise, she must paint; tough loving her out of her grief coma.Of course, Corinne is resistant.  Wes is everything she doesnt want to like.  But she is able to accept his help over time and his guidance to making it through her grief.  Maybe its because he isnt her family and isnt willing to let her fail or say no or get buried by grief.  Either way, Wes is that friend all of us need in the darkest of hours and want to celebrate with on the highest of highs.This book is a HEA that is written from the third person POV.  There are so many heart-wrenching emotions in this book and it just gives you the feels!  Anyone who has experienced loss knows exactly how Corinne feels and can identify with her or unrequited love will identify with it also.  You can almost see Corinne go through the stages of grief as the book progresses. This book gave me a HUGE book hangover and quite some teary eyes!Written by Amber for Summers Book Blog

Everly by SM Shade is the first book of the Striking Back series ending on a cliffhanger that leaves you slack jawed and scratching your head.Writing (Good)Is there violence (Some)Sexual content (Some)Narration (first)Everly is sassy, outspoken, and nurturing. Due to her time in foster care she has learned to take care of herself and developed into the stubborn and independent woman that she is today. Her time in foster care definitely warped her outlook on herself and relationships. She knows she's not ugly, but she doesn't see herself as anything special. She knows people don't stick around, so she avoids relationships. That is until Mason Reed waltzes into her life at one of the most bizarre and terrifying moments of her life, seeing her beauty and proving that he wants to stay.Mason is possessive, demanding, and growly. Alpha to the max, charming as sin, and sometimes over the top. With his muscles and tats he's eye candy perfection. But he's more than what meets the eye. He's caring and sweet, protective and loving. He's everything Everly didn't know she was looking for, and Mason is out to prove he's all she needs.Can Everly move on from her broken past and trust Mason wholeheartedly? Can she allow him into her heart as well as her bed? Will Mason open up and break down his own barriers to reveal his past? Or will their pasts and unspoken truths rip them apart?Everly is witty and charming. It had me laughing out loud at times. It was also shocking and nerve wracking. Mason had me swooning and lusting like mad. Bossy and protective and possessive. Everly' stubbornness had me banging my head at times, but she won me over with her one liners and feisty attitude.The whole bank scene had me scratching my head. Because I should have been scared for them, but I couldn't help but giggle at the situation and swoon over Mason. All the while hoping everyone is okay. It was an odd mash up, but worked so well.SM Shade has a winner on their hands. Witty, sassy, shocking, sexy, and sinful. A perfect combination to keep me on the edge of my seat waiting for answers and for what was going to happen next. And that ending? Never in my wildest dreams did I think that's how Everly would end. I was left with my jaw on the floor, desperately swiping over, hoping "The End" wasn't really the end...but it was! I cannot wait for answers in Mason, which is the sequel.Written by Alycia for Summers Book Blog

Survivor's Guilt is one of the stories that will touch your soul and remain with you long after you have closed your kindle. Written in such a quiet powerful way that the emotions it invokes will creep up on you and have you crying and ultimately smiling.Happiness, tragedy, triumph and life lessons peppered along the way .. Cassy Roop has provided us with an unforgettable story of what happens when a horrific circumstance is actually the catalyst for a life journey like non other.When two people come together and learn the power of healing, hope, forgiveness and love.It is a story to be read, savored and honored.Loved every single moment of this 5 star read and highly recommend that all lovers of romance read it immediately !

**ARC provided for an honest review**This book is a must read for 2015Clarissa has done it again with this book "this book has a dark, twisted, disturbing and yet extremely captivating and engrossing tale about love, betrayal, hurt and sacrifice."The Mind games these two play are of the highest caliber. Vanessa and Miles came from messed up backgrounds. Miles didnt have a chance, he was abandoned, didnt have good foster parents, and the children around him bullied him. Vanessas mother was evil and at every turn was trying to make Vanessa into the spitting image of herself or a doll. Vanessa is very naive and broken. She doesn't know how to stand up for herself and lets everyone walk all over her.Vanessa liked Miles from the beginning and she fell for him hard when he beat the crap out of a boy for bullying Vanessa. She was scared but thrilled at the same time.Miles became Phoenix when he became a hitman. He killed and he got a thrill out of it too. He had no remorse and thrived on killing people for a pay check.I love how Clarissa goes back and forth from past to present. We get glimpses of the past where Vanessa and Miles (Phoenix) didnt always hate each other, and we get to see what happens when their love turns to hatred.Does Phoenix (Miles) end up getting his revenge that he has been after for years? Will we see the demise of Vanessa? Or will Phoenix have a change of heart when he finds out some of the truths that will unfold.Phoenix wants to get revenge on Vanessa when he got out of jail and he wasn't going to hold anything back. He was going to mistreat her, and make her suffer before he killed her.Vanessa knows that the day will come when Phoenix would come looking for her and she was scared because she knew that he wanted revenge.You will just have to read the book to find out I highly recommend this bookWritten by Tracy for Summers Book Blog.

**ARC provided for an honest review**Whispered Truths is the first book in the (Truths) series.  It is slated as a contemporary romance, but after reading it, it is definitely YA, with a little bit more maturity.  This book is about love, loss and friendships that can withstand anything.I found myself so enthralled in this book from the first few paragraphs. Myah Wilks has had a crush on her longtime friend and hottie of her school since the third grade. She does not think that there would ever be a chance for them to be together, but when suddenly he starts showing up in her same classes, she thinks quite possibly, there might be a chance he feels the same way.Kyle Cooper has secretly been half in love with Myah for as long as he can remember, but something is a bit off with her. She is not the same spunky girl she used to be, something has happened to her and he does not know what it is. Seeing other people to mask their feelings seems to work until they are paired up with each other for a project that these feelings can no longer stay hidden. But with Myah' s less than desirable home life she has trust issues and has walls built around her that only her closest friends , Lisa, Sarah and Stewie know the reasons why.Well Kyle's finally had enough of waiting around for Myah to realize that they have something special he goes after her head on. While Myah is going through struggles with her evil mother, Kyle steps in, with the help of her friends to be her protector. Their love story is one that fairytales are made of. In addition, their first time together, OMG I was swooning over Kyle Cooper. The love and tenderness in that scene was so amazing.This book does have a bit of suspense, a little angst and the sexual encounters with Myah and Kyle were very tastefully done. These are a great group of friends and I am looking forward to the continuation of their stories in the series.This was a very enjoyable read and something the YA will definitely want to read. I have given this book a four star rating.Written by Laura for Summers Book Blog.

**ARC provided for an honest review**Wild Pitch by Sloan Johnson is the first book in the Homeruns series. What if dreams are meant to change?, the tag line for the book sums it up nicely. Both Sean Tucker and Mason Atley dreamed of being professional baseball players. Both working their way up through the ranks in the farm system into the majors. A friendship forged with trust, dedication and love. Even playing for opposing teams their friendship never dwindled.Both however have their secrets. For years Sean has only admitted his sexuality to Mason, the one thing he never told him was his true feelings towards Mason. Sean has never told his team mates he is gay, knowing some may not approve. He has kept his secret well hidden, until one night when Mason tells Sean his secret. He is bisexual. He married The Ice Queen to try to live a normal life. He wanted the wife, kids and everything else that came with it. Unfortunately, his long absences caused one too many problems.Mason, finally able to admit his true feelings to Sean opens up a whole new world of sexual tensions between the pair. Not wanting to ruin their friendship, Sean tries to convince Mason to take it slow. Refusing to go too far whilst he is still married, always making sure this is what Mason really wants. Neither want to risk their friendship on a one night stand.The pair try to keep their relationship secret, but secrets have a way of coming out (no pun intended). Some start to notice small things, which leads to finding other hiding similar secrets. The couple need to find a way to be together whilst playing on separate teams, leaving each other apart for potentially months at a time. Can a relationship withstand that?This is the first book I have read by Sloan Johnson and I must say I really enjoyed it. The characters where definitely loveable, right down to Masons parents and Seans sister. There are quite a few comical moments throughout the book, adding to the seriousness of the couples tense circumstances. It was a book that kept me wanting more right till the end, even then I wanted to know what happened next. I look forward to reading other books by this author.Written by Joanna for Summers Book Blog.

**ARC provided for an honest review**Unforgettable (Beachwood Bay #8) by Melody Grace picks up where the novella Unmasked ended. This finishes Noelle Olsen and Ash Callahan story.Following her night with Ash, Noelle disappears into the night leaving a sleeping Ash with only her phone number. Neither had any expectations of going any further than this one special night they shared.Listen to your heart, believe in a brighter tomorrow, and always, always leave room for dessert, the final words from her beloved grandmother.Noelle, the normally level headed lawyer ups and leaves everything behind in the city to return to the bed and breakfast her grandmother loved so much. Her parents have much to say about this complete turn in her life, but she finally finds a peace that has always been missing from her hectic life. Always aiming to please everyone around her, Noelle has put what she really wants to one side. Following her night with Ash she decides to finally do what feels right to her, not everyone else. This means moving to the small coastal town of Beachwood Bay.Believing they would never cross paths again, Ash visits his family and friends for a much needed vacation from work. Never did he think he would run into the one woman he hasnt been able to get out of his mind. When his personal life and work collide Ash has to choose which one he needs the most.The pair definitely have chemistry crackling between them, it is there from the start. Neither of them really know anything about the other. Ash doesnt trust easily, he worked his whole life for his family, he has never done anything solely for himself. Can his siblings make him see that he now needs to take this opportunity do make himself happy and that his life should not evolve around his real-estate business?This seems to be the concluding part of the Beachwood Bay series. It is a sweet romance with a few bumps in the road causing the main characters a few problems along the way. I really liked how it allowed readers to catch up with all the other couples featured earlier in the series. It gave a nice yet finality to the series. This can be read as a standalone, but it would help to piece together how the other couples came together in previous books, but it is not necessary.Written by Joanna for Summers Book Blog.

I love history and I love science, so when I was offered a chance to try this bulb for an honest review, I jumped at the chance! See, waaaay back when electricity was Brand-New and only the Rich and Innovative People could afford it, lamps were designed to FEATURE the bare bulbs...they were NEVER hidden! It was only when we began to take electricity for granted and light bulbs became mundane, that we began to "hide them" under lamp shades. THIS bulb brings back the Magic and Excitement of the Dawn of the Electric Age by putting a bare bulb front and center again.I had a Candlestick lamp base that I use a Flickering Flame Bulb inside of during the holiday, so I had the absolutely perfect display base to display this bulb. And 'Oh!", how gorgeous it is! Many other reviewers have mentioned the "chandelier effect" and that is the most accurate way to describe this marvel of science and technology: it simply glows like a bottle of captured fireflies! The bulb itself is larger than a regular light bulb but I figure that "How Else?" could you get all that beauty into a normal sized bulb?Unlike the original tungsten filament bulb, this is a Cool Touch LED bulb so it is miserly in consuming power yet brilliant in concept. The glow is gentle and enjoyable; you won't be getting "sunspots" in your eyes from enjoying it.I find it so wonderful that companies are marrying the coolest features of our technological past with the coolest features of our technological present. :D

My hobby is cooking so my kitchen is my sanctuary. NOTHING goes into my Inner Sanctum that doesn't delight, entertain or tell a story about who I am. When I was offered the chance to order this clock and given the opportunity to choose my own colour (stainless), I instantly knew that I had another decorative chapter to the story of my life.I was a bit worried, before it arrived, that it would be TOO LARGE and take over the small wall that it's displayed upon. But, once I received it, the clock is the perfect size: not too big, not too small...it's absolutely "Just Right!" I delight in the true-to-life sized utensils and two things in particular make me smile: it has Serving Pieces along with regular Flatware...and...the hands of the clock are a wee knife and fork! THAT is the feature that blew me away the most...the extreme attention to detail is a sure sign of a company that cares deeply about their products.I took the photos of the clock outdoors, so that you could see the highly reflective surface and details of the utensils. It's well constructed, not flimsy in the least, and has a hook on the back for easy display. AA batteries are required to power it up.I've seen other Utensil clocks but have passed on them because they were so boring: just regular flatware and regular hands on the dial. But, it was the added details to this clock that really enchanted me and continue to bring a smile to my face every time I gaze at it. :D

We live in a very old Greystone in Chicago, which means a warren of hallways, doors and plaster walls. There were only 2 rooms in our entire house: the dining room and living room, that could get a decent signal from our modem. Most of the remainder of the house had from 3 to 0 bars on our Wi-Fi signal. I've tried many other repeaters with NO SUCCESS...they all ended up at the Goodwill. Now, with THIS model by Motoraux, we FINALLY have the ability to check emails and stream videos/music in every other room! Set up was very simple, directions are clearly written; all told, it was about 30 minutes for our set up. We have the fastest speed internet that Comcast offers but it still couldn't make it around all those corners and plaster walls. Now, we've brought our 110 year old home into this Millennium!

This combination set of lenses from RIVBOS is such a great deal! I've already ordered another set for a present for a landscaping friend of mine and this set is going to be used by my outdoor-enthusiast son. If you are active outdoors, you quickly learn that one type of sunglasses does NOT work for an entire day outside! I personally have FIVE pairs of sunglasses cluttering up the dashboard of my truck, to be used in bright sunlight, bright fog, cloudy but bright days, and some just to look foxy. This kit could reduce all that mess into one sleek hard-shell case! I only wish that they made a more "fashion-forward" design for women that wasn't so sporty looking.The kit  comes with an beautiful hard case that has an easy to grab textured surface. Inside, it holds the glasses frame and the 4 spare shades, as well as a soft pouch wherein you can carry the glasses around. Theirs room inside for also also  a lanyard, microfiber cleaning cloth and a booklet which talks about under what conditions you would want to use the different lenses, the percentage of light they let in..etc.The lens change out is super easy: pull one off the frame, push the new one into the frame. You do get fingerprints on the lens while changing them out, so it is handy to have that cleaning cloth handy. I like the Half Moon design of the hard-shell case because it easily fits into a fanny pack on the back of your bike seat.  This is a GREAT DEAL and would make a wonderful gift for an outdoor enthusiast. I received a sample to try out and provide an honest review.

I'm old. And I have a very physically demanding job that tuckers out "kids" half or more my age. I'm a landscape architect and in one day, I can help load, unload and spread 200 forty pound bags of mulch for a single job! And, that doesn't include the weeding, digging,  planting, and watering that is all part of a single installation! So, at the end of a normal work day, I am barely able to move and have a bottle of Advil stationed everywhere: work bag, glove box, medicine cabinet and by the kitchen sink. I know the health risks of not only over-dosing on pain relieving pills but also just the mere fact of taking the minimum per day wears out your organs.So, what to do regarding painful muscles and the desire to ease that pain? THIS massage unit! It came completely dissembled but I got it up and working (without reading a single direction) in 5 minutes flat. The plastic massage balls were a wee bit difficult to get started in the pre-formed holes but that's normal when you are screwing plastic into plastic; at least that's been my experience when I'm constructing plastic items that need to be screwed together. There is a rope on one end that you hold onto while holding the other end of the wand with your other hand; you position the massage balls over your hurting area and then gently pull the cord back and forth to create the massaging action.This is a very light weight wand and easy to hold for an extended length of time, but not "light" as in cheap. I mainly use it on my shoulders and lower back and the relief is fantastic...and drug free!  What I also appreciated is the four different hole positions on each side of the bendy wand so that you can truly customize where you place the massage balls.This is a nice unit that comes un-scewed so that you can easily travel with it in your carry on luggage. I'm very pleased with this pain relieving massager. :DI received a sample device for an honest review.

I am one of those rare women who HATE carrying around a purse all day long, with everything falling into a Black Hole Pit at the bottom. I'm a landscape architect by trade and maybe that's why I love my business and personal life to be exceptionally well organized. What I use as a "purse" during the day is a Coach Messenger bag with loads and loads of specific pockets to keep things instantly at my Beck and Call.This highly functional and exceptionally well designed Slim Credit card wallet fits right into my lifestyle! I ordered the colour listed as "Orange" but please note: IT IS NOT ORANGE as you and I think of the colour "orange". Do a google search for the colour "Burnt Sienna" and THAT is the true colour of this wallet.For the man or woman on the go who pays with debit or credit cards and only needs a *pinch* of Mad Money, this is perfect! The cards fit nice and securely in the slots and the interior can hold a couple of $20.00's for places that don't accept cards (lots of Mom and Pop cafes are Cash Only). This can slide into the tiniest of clutches and keep your cards safe. It's also just the right side to slide into one of those ultra-thin passport holders that goes around your neck.The stitching is superior; not a slipped stitch or nick, anywhere! It's true leather, in a pebbled finish and the little logo is an elephant with Dumbo-sized ears...very cute.If you are a Secret Santa and don't know what to get that guy or gal, or you need to supplement a Stocking Stuffer or slip a little "something extra into a birthday card", I can't think of a better way to impress your friends with a functional yet stylish gift.There are already such nice photos of the product that I chose to not take any more; I couldn't have added anything to the pictures. :D*I received this fine wallet for an honest review, good or bad. Fortunately, it is such an exceptionally well made wallet, writing a good review was as easy as could be!

This is the second type of Moscow Mule Mug that I was selected to review by Livin' Well. The first set was the Hammered Pure Copper Mugs and we are absolutely in love with them! I did a considerable amount of online research to see what drinking out of pure copper would do to your body and with different drinks; if you restrict the amount of acid in your drink (no sodas or citrus-heavy drinks) than you're "Good To Go."However, there may be a lot of people that still feel concerned or squeamish about any possible negative reaction with an acidic drink, or they simply like the looks and ease of a Stainless Steel interior. Than for those folks, THIS is the mug for you!I put this version of the mug through the same rigid tests that I did the pure copper mug:(Side-note: I used to be the China/Crystal/Fine Bar Ware Buyer for Dayton's, back in it's heydays. As such, I know the EXCEEDINGLY STRICT guidelines that I had to put all future purchases through, before they made it onto our sales floor.)Two such tests that apply HERE are:1) The Balance Test: how does a knife/fork/mug/stemware hold up to being handled? Does it have GREAT balance or does the item want to immediately fall from your hands? If there is a handle, how is it joined to the main body of the item? Is the handle comfortable to hold?2) The Lip Test: how enjoyable...or not...is it to drink from that champagne glass? or mug? or other item designed for beverage delivery? Do you smack your nose each time you lift it up to your lips? Is there poor finishing involved on the lip of the beverage holder? How does it hold? Does it want to tip over when full? Do liquids dribble down the side?The mug arrived beautifully wrapped in bubble wrap, in it's own box.It is literally "A Thing of Beauty." It's very, very evident that Saint Jacques cares deeply about their product and wants YOUR business! The finishing on the pure copper mug was impeccable; not a scratch, dent or nick to mar their reflective beauty. The handle "handled" well, passing the Balance Test while empty and now it was time to pass "The Lip Test". (after washing it in warm-sudsy water and towel drying) In my photo, I took a side-by-side photo of the plain finish mug vs the hammered mug and you can see that the light dances off of and plays with the pattern of the hammering. If this is important to you or you are going to be serving your Mules outdoors where the light is brighter, this might be a consideration in which set to order.Perfection! I first drank water, simply because it's 'free'. No nose knocking. No dripping liquids slipping down the side. Handle was beautifully balanced with a Oh-So-Handy and comfortable spot for your thumb to rest on the lowered part of the handle, next to the mug. Now, it was time to "Kick The Mule!" and test it for what it was designed for.After mixing the ingredients, I let the mug get cold, and silver condensation soon cloaked the outside. I drank a sip and the *tingle* that I received must surely be through some Mad Science Alchemy of Copper being a super conductor of cold + acid. What.A.Pleasure.!!! It passed with FLYING COLOURS!!! I can only imagine how deliciously Satyr-like one must feel to have this drink, on a blisteringly hot day, and drift away into another realm. Sadly, I tested mine out on a blustery 42 degree day with drizzle. LOL I still enjoyed the "Mule's Kick", however.I received a matched set of the pure copper mugs for a fair and honest review, of which this is. It was an honour and pleasure to try out this well-crafted and heirloom worthy mug.Here lies the recipe: (please note: NOWHERE in my hamlet was alcoholic ginger beer sold, so I had to make do. It still was sublime!)As the traditional Moscow Mule recipe suggest the liquid ingredients are:1/2 ounce lime juice2 ounces vodka4 to 6 ounces ginger beerTotal amount will be 7-9 ounces plus 1/3-1/2 cup of ice cubes. A typical Moscow Mule is about 14 16 ounces. So any copper mug less than 12 ounces or too more than 20 ounces is not adequate for a Classic Moscow Mule recipe. I suggest anyone who wants it get a copper mug with a volume between 16-20 ounce.

I read most of the reviews before I wrote mine, just to judge how other kitty cats responded to this nice stand. It seems that older or adult cats are ambivalent but for my Norwegian Forest KITTENS, they went !Bonkers! over it!  If you've ever seen or known a Norwegian Forest Cat, they are STRONG CLIMBERS with specially adapted claws for fast and strong climbing. I watch the TV show with Jackson Galaxy, "My Cat From Hell", and one thing I learned is that there's 2 kinds of cats: 1) Hiders/Creepers and 2) Climbers. My kittens and Mama cat C.L.I.M.B.!!!  I also took a *tip* from a friend who is a cat breeder and I rubbed a small bag of dried catnip into the entire surface...what cat/kitten can resist THAT temptation?!I currently have four kittens almost ready for adoption and this stand has been a God Send. They climb, jump, and clamor over the entire surface and have become so aggressive with hanging from the dangling balls that they've actually ripped two of them from the rods! I'm cool with that as I simply made sturdier "dangly bits" and tied them to the end of the rods.Regarding the rotating scratching cylinder, they like to lay on their sides and kick it with their back feet, pulling themselves forward. And it's guaranteed hours of humourous kitten watching as each one of them tries to become "King/Queen of the Hill" by claiming the two perches and shoving their competition off of it.It was super fast to put together and I appreciated that they enclosed an Allen Wrench with the kit to make it easier to assemble. So far, they haven't tipped it over but they are young kittens, not heavy adult cats, so it is sturdy for it's current use. The Mama cat seems less interested in the stand but she keeps a watchful eye on them as they are enjoying it. Honestly, I think she's like any Mum who takes her tykes to a play park; using this time to relax and catch her breath from all that Kitten Care.For the price and the footprint, this is a VERY NICE and highly affordable stand what would work with most people's pocket books and would fit in even a small studio apartment. >^..^<

Even though our Jack Russell Terrier is young, I still ordered this to not only augment his regular Eukanuba kibble but also to "Test The Waters" and see if he'd even like a "Senior Dog Food", which our cat's turn their nose up at (senior cat food, that is).Happily, this blend also met with his instant gratification so we're happy that we can tick that worry off of our list with good doggy care in the future. We plan on just switching his kibble between regular and senior every other day to keep him fit, trim and also use to the taste. I like that the kibble is small for his tiny mouth and that it doesn't fly all over the floor as some brands of kibble seem to do.

I have a handicapped neighbor who has great difficulty bringing her large pit bull to the vet for check ups, so I always volunteer to help her. The problem was, she only had super long and thin leashes so it was an exercise in futility to get "Chico" into the car as he wound around and around our legs, under the truck's carriage, or just reeling him in off of this long leash.I intentionally ordered THIS leash from other reviews that mentioned how handy it was to have a VERY STURDY and short lead to load dogs into the car, etc. We keep Chico on this leash during the entire vet visit because my friend has such bad R.A. in her hands; it helps her hold him and calm him down simultaneously. We also started to use it when we bring Chico to the groomers to get his ears cleaned and nails clipped. The groomer was very impressed with the quality and strength of this short lead leash.I'm happy that some dog lover invented this very necessary addition to standard leads and leashes. :D

I love my pets like most people who dote on them but I also love paying my mortgage and car payment on time. I already buy healthy and pricey cat and dog food for my Fur Babies and don't deny them special treats but at an astronomical price of at $4.60 cents a piece, these treats are utterly un-affordable for most people. I have a small Jack Russell Terrier and the package recommends that you can break the 3 part treat into 3 smaller pieces, I guess to save money. But, like many others have mentioned, the broken pieces are SO small and dogs are wont to "inhale" their food, that I was terrified of having him choke on the small hard piece.So, I gifted him an entire 3-point Nutri Dent, which he tossed around like a stuffed toy for a bit, and then consumed the entire thing in 5 minutes, flat!  All I could think of was how long it took my minimum wage friends to earn $4.60...literally a half hour of their life...gobbled down in 5 minutes! I love that my dog loved the treat but I can't justify the cost. Instead, I'd rather buy a whole fryer for that amount of money, put it into a pot for a couple of hours time, and come out with several natural "treats" and meals for my spunky pup, including the broth.Nice idea but this is a Rich Person's Indulgence for their pet. :(

I travel each week and stay at motels 3-4 days of each week. To save money and make my life a wee bit easier, I stay at budget motels and part of that "budget" paradigm is that there's ZERO FRILLS that come with the places I stay at. That means NO COFFEE MAKERS, among other niceties, so I just bring my ancient 12 year old Mr. Coffee Maker with me and *bingo-bango*... coffee brewed right in my room, first thing when I wake up.I bring ground coffee with me but there are times that I ache for FRESHLY ground coffee...there's just NO comparison between coffee that's been pre-ground and sitting around in a can vs. beans that you grind and within a minute, add to your coffee basket for a nice, hot brew.So, when I was offered the chance to try out this Off The Grid/Personal-Sized Hand Coffee Mill, I jumped at the chance to be able to enjoy freshly ground coffee while On The Road.When it arrived, it's in a nicely illustrated box that show & tells you about the product and how to set it up. Inside, the two main units: the handle and the coffee container, are each cocooned in plastic bubble wrap, preventing any and all scratches. (see my photos for size and components; soda can is for perspective) The main canister breaks down into 3 parts: the lid with the hole in it, that fits over the bean hopper; the bean hopper itself where you load up the beans; and the canister at the bottom with TWO handy "see-through-windows" on the sides, to gauge your ground bean progress. The handle makes up the 4th part, which is separate from the main body.I had NO problem taking the parts apart and getting them ready for a TEST GRIND, giving everything a nice wash in sudsy water and then wiping them down well so they were bone dry. Prior to grinding, I took the Scientific Route and measured out just "how many ounces of ground coffee" I normally put into my brew basket: it came to 4.5 dry ounces, so that was my identical target with the grind.I then measured out 4 dry ounces of French Roast beans into an empty paper filter, and used the filter as a "funnel" to fill the bean chamber: BRILLIANT...it worked like a charm with nary a bean spilled. Mind you, because of the grinding apparatus, the hopper only could hold TWO of the FOUR ounces of beans, so I had to do two grinds.I proceeded to begin turning the handle on the grinder, with it placed on the counter.Within seconds, I realized that I needed far more leverage than what the counter would provide so I sat on the couch, placed the main body of the grinder between my thighs, held the grinder body steady with my left hand and began to crank away, at a  rotation of 1 crank per second. It was a very leisurely crank, as I knew that would be my "norm".Soon, I could ~smell~ the beans!!!! Oh, what joy! I stopped grinding, opened up the bottom hopper and the most lovely of lovely coffee grounds were encased inside: smelling like Heaven on the best day! The grind that the mill was pre-set on was a very fine espresso grind and I just kept it there for the experiment.  It took 2.5 minutes of leisure grinding to complete the first of two 2 ounce fills of the bean hopper; after I dumped the filled grounds hopper into my paper filter, I refilled the top immediately with the remaining 2 dry ounces of beans and kept on doing "the daily grind." Within 2.5 more minutes, I was done.I then proceeded to brew up that coffee to see if it really differed from pre-ground to hand-ground. Oh, and did it deliver!!! I can FINALLY now have freshly ground and brewed coffee in my motel room any time that I want to commit 5 minutes to loading/grinding/re-loading and doing the final grind. Clean up was a snap as I only washed the ground hopper and used my blow dryer to blow out the bean hopper. The website suggest cleaning the entire thing weekly; I don't know if I'd go that far, as I think a Once A Month deep clean/wash/dry would suffice.The weight is very light but NOT cheap nor chintzy, so you can pack this in luggage or a brief case and not feel much added weight at all. It is VERY well constructed and aside from the noise associated with the ground beans, there is NO other squeak-squawk-or noise. The handle slips on very well to the cog that extends from the grinder and NEVER slipped off or even hesitated. This is one exceedingly well made coffee mill!Who would this be perfect for? College students. Coffee purists who want a GREAT cuppa, at work. Hunters.  like me. Back Packers. And the list goes on and on and on.I was offered this mill for free, to try it out and provide a fair and very honest review. It surpassed ALL expectations and if I had not received a sample, I would have bought it outright! A thoughtful gift for your Coffee Addict Friend, with a bag o' beans provided, of course!

I'm really surprised over the harsh reviews of this book! Wow, talk about a Buzz Kill, which is just the OPPOSITE of what you think when you hear the word "Disney". The #1 complaint that I've read is that it "...doesn't have Anna or Elsa". Oh, Boo-F'ing-Who!!!! Seriously, Folks??? If you are any kind of on-line shopper and can READ (thanks to a 3rd grade education), you can see from both the product's description and the photos ON THE COVER, that Anna/Elsa/Frozen is NOT part of this book! What "is" part of this book are the following: Aladdin, Disney Princesses, Toy Story, Mickey and Minnie, Monsters, Inc., Wreck-it Ralph, Planes, and Captain Hook. The "Frozen" franchise has it's own separate book; it would be interesting to read reviews of that one to see if anyone's complaining that Minnie or Aladdin aren't included?I knew EXACTLY what I was ordering when I read the product description and took advantage of the "Look Inside" option that amazon provides. A book that describes "party suggestions" is naturally going to be Craft-Conscious and also have loads of projects, of which this book does, in aces! You can choose from the simplest skill set of gluing a jewel onto a ribbon to look like Jasmine, to creating a GIANT pinata that looks like a building for a Wreck-It-Ralph party. Instructions are super simple; no, there are no step-by-step photos but again, if you can READ, you can clearly create each project.Recipes are pretty simple and straight forward: my two favourites are the Cut-Out Pita Animals and the Skull Watermelon. There are some that are more complicated and if you have both the time and skill set, you're sure to be pleased with the outcome.BUY THIS BOOK if you like Disney characters, Disney characters featured on the cover and have ANY kind of craft talent, at all. And for some of the simpler recipes, get your kids involved in making a Theme Day, which is what I'm using this book for: to entertain my wee ones when they come over for a visit. I'm NOT limiting this book to birthday parties; it's too cool for a Once A Year Event. :D

Since the invention of the Smartphone/Tablet, many items that we used to use every.single.day. are now relegated to the "dust bin" of life. Items such as independent digital cameras, alarm clocks, analog phone, transistor radio....even a wrist watch....are now part and parcel of your average Tech Device. But, like many other people have discovered, having those "independent items" to use, divorced from your power hungry Smartphone and it's chronically drained battery is a Good Thing to re-embrace.I'm one of those people.I travel for a living as a landscape architect. Four days out of each week I live out of motels so that I can design/consult/and install landscapes around the Midwest. After years traveling and gleefully "dumping" all that stuff and weight of that stuff, I'm slowly adding back INTO my suitcase some items that just make far more sense to have around then constantly relying on my Smartphone.One of those things is a normal/regular/"plain ol' alarm clock". I ordered mine in the zippy and fun Turquoise Colour; I suffer from "Black-Tech Overload" and was delighted that this clock came in so many colour options. Size-wise, it's about the size of a can of soda but weighs far less, making it easy to carry about in your luggage.There are SO many features of this clock that I LOVE:1) "Just Right Size": not too big/not too wee/ not too heavy...like Goldilock's and her bed, it was "just right".2) LARGE FRICKIN' NUMBERS!!! My eyes are old, so having large numbers that I can read without fumbling for my glasses at night is a bonus! There's the option to have either a 12 or 24 hour time display.3) It's NOT "just" a clock but also tells you the date/year/temperature (in F or C) and the posted alarm time, not just a silly "bell" icon like smartphones use.4) Set Up is brainless! A very detailed and thorough Instructions Manual comes with the clock but I didn't have to open it up to set the entire clock; I only read through the manual to write this review. As some people have mentioned, the clock doesn't allow you to "go back" if you're a heavy handed programmer; you WILL have to cycle through 60 minutes or 100 years if you blow past the number. I blasted past the minute set-up by not paying attention and had NO PROBLEM going through the minutes to find the one I needed. I sure don't fault the clock for my lack of attention span.5) I also REALLY LIKE that this clock takes normal batteries, meaning, "NO CHARGING VIA A USB MICRO CABLE!" I am already drowning in cables and devices that DEMAND to be charged via a port...I literally can't handle one.more.thing. that is tied to cables. I get around the Environmental Concern by only buying batteries that can be recharged to avoid filling up landfills; I'm guessing that the power drain from this clock is minimal and will only need recharging once a month.6) Alarm sound: It starts out with 1 beep, then builds up to 2 beeps and then it increases in pattern and intensity. I am a light sleeper so in the first couple of seconds, I'm awake and reach for the clock to flip UP the bar that shuts off the alarm. The SNOOZE cycle is every 5 minutes; I tested it out for 30 minutes and it was accurate in coming back up to cycle.7) I intentionally have the Low Light Sensor set up because I wake up several times a night from an ancient back injury and check the clock each time to see when I can take my next pill to counteract the pain I live with. When I used my smartphone, I was always fumbling for it's small/flat size, often dropping it under the bed, or "compelled" to check emails/alerts...breaking up my sleep cycle even more. I'm an Adult and I know better than to check emails at 2:30 am; now, this Low Tech Clock keeps me away from them and sends me right back to sleep.This clock is a Win/Win for so many reasons: light weight/does the job/very affordable/pretty colour range. In "The Old Days", you could walk into ANY retail store and pick one of these up; nowadays, merchants have forced us consumers to shop on line for what we need. I'm just glad that ZHPUAT listens to it's audience and provides us with a device still sorely needed in today's high tech world. :D

WOW!!! When in the world, when you order an item, do you get/receive MORE than you ever expected? Rare, indeed!When I received these sunglasses, I didn't even know "what" it was that I was opening, because the metal mesh fiber storage case was SO "tech"...it honest to goodness looked like another Bluetooth speaker that I'd have ordered! LOL  But nope!, it was the case for an entire extravaganza of Sunglasses Goodies. :DLet's start with the case: it's LARGE!!!! Unless you travel around with a backpack or duffle bag, this is NOT going to work for you to carry around with you in your average bag/brief case. This is the kind of case that you either leave in your truck/car or at home, and make the right decisions at the start of the day as to "which" lens/accessory you need. However, if you are going camping/backpacking, there is a very sturdy clip on the side, whereby you can attach the case to the exterior of your pack. The dimensions are 7" across the length by 4.25 " width; it is 2" thick. Once you get over the cool exterior's texture, you unzip a very sturdy zipper to reveal the "Oh My Goodness" bounty of what's inside!Comes With Hard Protection Box, Special Design for this Fashion Glasses Kit, Lined With Sponge.1* Sport Glasses Frame5* Lenses(The Black One is Polarized Len) mine had polarized; clear; yellow; blue; and a dark grey. According to the pamphlet, there are 10 types of lens available for these glasses!1* Hard Protection Box1* Elastic Sport Belt1* Lenses Pouch1* Cleaning Cloth1* Movement Head HarnessThere's a teeny tiny 1.5" x 2.5" card, showing a rural road that states: "TEST: Wear glasses to see the beautiful pattern." Well, I don't know if I was being 'punked' or not, but I viewed the card through ALL of the lenses and saw NUTTIN'. Guess I flunked THAT test. LOLChanging them out is a piece of cake: simply slide down the lens in the sun-glass frame and slide up another lens. I used my fingers to get a better/solid grip and then used the lens cloth to remove any smudges. Each lens comes enclosed in a reusable plastic baggie.I work outdoors for a living so I rely on good lenses to keep my eyes healthy. But, in a 10 hour work day, weather conditions can change, A LOT, so having one pair of glasses to change with the hours never works out well. I love that I can finally wear the same frames all day long, and change from a yellow lens for rainy/foggy conditions, to a clear one for protecting my eyes from dust when using the leaf blower, to the polarized lens when the sun finally makes a roaring come-back later in the day. The frames are REALLY comfortable: the temple bars hold them nicely to your head (I have a very large head for a chick!) and the nose piece does NOT leave those ugly "nose dents" that cheaper glasses are wont to do.Price-wise: I don't know how they do it! The case alone should be the price of this entire ensemble; instead, you receive the case, the 5 lenses, the frame, a dust cloth, lanyard to attach to the frame and the motion headgear. If you need an IMPRESSIVE gift for a man or woman who spends a lot of time enjoying the outdoors, you can NOT go wrong with this set! RIVBOS really cares not only about their customer's well-being but also the well-being of their product: the case has actual slots in soft foam to make sure that they are stored safely.All my adult kids are Outdoor Nuts and I already know what I'm ordering them for their Stocking Stuffer: THESE glasses! I don't know what else you can buy for under $20 that provides so much *bang* for your hard-earned buck!I was offered the chance to receive these glasses in exchange for a fair and honest review. I've worn them for over 30 hours now and have field tested them in all the weather that Michigan can throw at them, except snow...which I'm sure will come before Halloween! They really passed the Landscape Test and I'm delighted to wear them.

I'll gladly admit it: I LOVE DISCO! I was a young bride when it roared onto the scene in the late 70's with "Saturday Night Fever" bringing it to the national forefront.
