In any case, my situation was desperate, so I picked up a bottle.Upon getting it home, I took it into the bathroom and emptied a portion into the festering bowl. It was a light, watery and largely uncolored liquid, quite unlike the thick, sticky oddly-colored popular brands. My reaction was negative. There was no way this watery stuff was going to clean that filthy bowl. I let it set for about an hour and then returned with my toilet bowl brush determined to carry out the onerous task. Whisk, whisk, whisk and the bowl gleamed. I was absolutely dumbfounded! This is a hard water region and the bowlstains always required scrubbing. With this stuff, one wipe and they were gone. Amazing! Astonishing! It was, by far, the best bowl cleaner I had ever found, and the cost was bargain basement. The next time I visited the store and tried to pick up some more, none was available. The same thing happened on the following trip. Then one day, it was back. I picked up ten bottles. It was that good. I've been using it ever since."The Works" is an amazing unsung product. I've never seen an ad for it and I don't see the product in most stores. Evidently, the advertising is largely word of mouth and the product can be hard to find. But if you're ever interested in getting your bathroom bowl as fresh and sweet as a spring breeze with an absolute minimum of effort, give it a try.Gary Peterson

I have two cats, one cat litter box, a 42-pound bag of clumping cat litter and a tendency not to clean the box often enough. In fact, one time I let it go so long that the box was just one clump. LOL! As such, I tend to break a lot of litter scoops trying to remove some of the larger lumps. I know, it's all my fault, and I ought to take better care of the box. However, at my age, I doubt that I'm going to reform. Plus, the cats seem to be very tolerant and don't complain. Well, I've gone through a lot of scoops in the seven years I've had the cats. The latest scooper has held up well. It seems to be made of a tougher plastic and has lasted a lot longer than the less flexible ones that are made of brittle plastic. I don't recall where I bought it, but this little scooper has a price tag on it that is about half of the listing price here. As such, the lower price plus the tougher construction makes it a good value. Perhaps I should go to one of the stainless steel scoopers, but this one is pretty good for plastic and I tend to be somewhat cheap.Gary Peterson

Not too long ago, I had a lady over-night visitor and she left a couple items in the shower of the guest bathroom. One was a 8.45-ounce tube of  John Frieda Luxurious Volume Conditioner. Well, I have short hair and I don't ordinarily use a conditioner. I can't resist trying new items, however. So, I've used after three hair washings. I have no negative comments. No positive ones either, I might add. Again, I don't use items like this. My friend has long delicate blonde hair and it must work well for her and I'll have to somehow get it back to her. It has a nice, very light fragrance, I might add. I'd judge it to be excellent, but it could use a better test than my short crew-cut.Gary Peterson

Not too long  ago, I had an overnight woman visitor and she left a 3-ounce bottle (plastic) of Dove Go Fresh Body Wash in the guest bathroom shower. I'd never heard of the product, but I like to try new items. So I tried it. Several times. Nice, fresh, good lather, very light scent ( it's made with cucumber and green tea). Works well. Very refreshing. Hmmmm. I'll have to somehow get this item back to her, but If I see it on any shelves in the future, I'll definitely consider buying it. The bottle is just the right size for my travel kit.Gary Peterson

A few years ago I noticed that my large toenails were discolored. I thought nothing of it, but someone said that I had toenail fungus. Toenail fungus? What next? Anyway, I put up with it because it didnt seem to be doing any harm and I always keep the nails under cover.A more recent lady friend noted my ugly nails and said I really ought to do something about them. She gave me a small bottle with a small brush and said I was to apply the liquid several times a day. The liquid was FungiCure. I painted the nails on an irregular basis ever time I managed to remember it (about once every three days or so for about the next month). Then, earlier this week, I looked at the nails and the discoloration was almost  entirely gone and the nails looked much more healthy. This FungiCure Broad Spectrum Anti-Fungal liquid had apparently done the job. Great! The nails not only appeared better, they also looked better. They felt better too. I dont know, as yet, if my fungal problems are over, but theyre certainly much better.Gary Peterson

I take daily low-dose (8 mg) aspirin and have for many years. I don't use it as a pain reliever, although it might work fine if needed for that purpose. I use it to thin my blood. I have an occasional irregular heartbeat and the doctor said that condition can lead to the formation of blood clots. He wanted to put me on Warfarin. I read the warnings and looked for some other way. I found baby aspirin and asked my doctor about it. He said it would probably work, but wouldn't be as good. That suited my temperament well. In any case, I've been using it for years and years and have experienced no difficulties.I've use a wide variety of brands. but I guess they're all about the same. I settled in on Kirkland Signature because it was the least expensive. I purchased it at Costco and got this 2-pack on my latest visit. At one tablet a day, this pack should last for two years. This seems like an excellent buy, even at the higher Amazon price.

While shopping at Costco the other day, I noticed a table of colored Puma V-neck Tee-Shirts. Nice. Good soft feel. Nice, somewhat unusual colors. They seemed a little off a little off the standard hue, but maybe it was just the Costco lighting. In any case, I could use another Tee-Shirt, so I picked one up. Mine was "Large" and it fit me perfectly. It draped the body well and I liked the Little Puma sewed into the front. It was a slightly off-red color. Hmmm. I liked the shirt so well, I went back and picked up a second blue one. Nice and attractive, well-fitting garment, I may go back for a couple more.Gary Peterson

In the late Fall of 1970, I read the book "Vitamin C and the Common Cold" by Linus Pauling. I found the book to be very interesting, followed his instructions and went eight years without a cold or case of the flu. I was astonished in that. for me, at least 2 or 3 colds per winter season were "normal." Much later, I became much more interested in the immune system and started eating probiotic foods, mainly yogurt along with my more normal intake.. I was very pleased with the Vitamin C plus yogurt regimen and told a lot of people about it, much to their disinterest and/or disbelief. However, I've had great resistance to infectious diseases and I'm very pleased. I someone doesn't want to listen, that's their business and I won't press the matterMuch later, I discovered probiotic capsules containing up to one billion bacterial units and started taking them. When I retired, about 4 years ago, the elderly man in charge of my folder remarked that I had more unused sick leave hours of anyone he had ever checked out or heard about over his entire career. We get extra retirement credit for unused sick leave time, I should add, and I got quite a bit. At about that  time, I switched to a Trunature Digestive Probiotic capsule containing 3 billion units and I've been using them for about 3 years. I found them in a package of 100 capsules at Costco. Alas, about a year ago, they disappeared and I went back to the 1 billion count capsules. Then, about 6 months ago, some more Trunature Capsules (those reported on here) containing up to 10 billion units each made an appearance. I grabbed them in an instant and have been taking them ever since. I'm amazed at the results.A person might want to use these probiotic capsules for two different reasons. One is to remain free of infectious diseases. I've been almost  free of such ailments for the past 4 decades, and my semi-public Kaiser Permanente health records might document my statement. It's hard to prove, however, I might be just an extraordinarily healthy person. Then again, it might be my nutritional awareness and special care. Who knows?A second factor related to my probiotic regimen might be my bowel record. For me, constipation has been rare and very mild. I'm almost never overly runny either, unless I have eaten something that disrupts my system and that only lasts for a day or so. When I go into the bathroom and sit down, that little rest typically lasts under a couple minutes.So, all of this might be regarded as non-scientific hearsay. I'm a PhD scientist, by the way, but not in the area of nutrition and/or medication. I'm a geologist and deal mostly with rocks. If my information might be of help and/or use to you in any way, I'm delighted. As for my own feelings, I'm impressed!Gary Peterson

I received a packet of SuperSeedz Gourmet Pumpkin Seeds (Somewhat Spicy) as one of my "stocking stuffer presents for Christmas this year. It was a 5-ounce bag, whereas this offer is for an 18-ounce  bag. Exact same product! Boy, these things are good! Nice toasted taste! Spicy, but not too spicy. Good range of flavors. Lots of iron, zinc and protein. No sugar and low salt. Cholesterol free and allergen friendly. My kind of healthy snack! Delicious! The best pumpkin seeds I've ever had!Gary Peterson

One of my minor "stocking stuffer" presents for this past Christmas was a 16-ounce (454-G)  jar of Duerr's Premium Blackcurrant Preserves imported from England. It figures. My gift giver was from England. Boy, this stuff is excellent! Wonderful taste! I've used it mostly for mixing with Plain Fage non-fat greek yogurt. Good mix! The preserves are a little high in sugar for my tastes, but the low sugar content of the yogurt really makes the taste of the berries stand out and the mix is far superior in taste to the available "fruit in the bottom" yogurts. Here, the berries really  stand out as delicious! Yum! I'm going to have to try this again and try some of the other flavors of Duerr's Preserves.Gary Peterson

I was looking for a Christmas present for my 6-year-old son and settled in on a pair of stilts. Well, wouldn't you know it, Amazon was out of the brand I wanted. An alternate suggestion was this Fisher-Price Pogo Stick. It seemed like something he might enjoy. Ultimately, he did, but he was a bit bewildered at first. Now, he's off and bouncing, but there'll still be a period of time before we remove the "training pad." In any case, he enjoys it. The toy seems sturdy and well built and the durability should be good. He weighs 46 pounds, so the pogo will be good for some time up to the 60-pound upper limit. It's a nice toy for a young kid and should get him a lot of needed exercise, quite unlike his electronic games..Gary Peterson

I first bought a Casio watch (chronograph) in 1982 when I began running and needed a timer for racing. I loved it. This is my fifth Casio. This is a wonderful watch, but they don't last very long. The timepiece itself is excellent. The biggest flaw is the watch band breaking. Flexing a plastic band for fastening it on and off will ultimately crack and break the band. Be careful. Open and close it with the least flexing as possible and the band will last much longer.  A second flaw are the buttons. They can be hard to operate and become stuck with the least amount of grime. This one is very hard to operate for me (I'm 77), however, my small boy (age 6) with his tiny fingers can seem to manage. Such is life. Despite these difficulties, it's a wonderful watch and I will continue to buy them. In any case, it's a marvelous timepiece!All of my other Casios were black, as  are 99 out of a 100 that you will see. This time I spotted this red one and decided to try it for a change. I like the color and it's amazing how many people will spot it and comment. Go figure. The color makes no difference in the workings,  of course.Remember the days when everything seemed to be made in Japan? Well, I do and Casio products were some of those things. Casio is still a Japanese brand, but my red Casio is stamped "Made in China." Go figure. Hopefully, it will be as good as the Japanese ones.Gary Peterson

I have a Brazilian Pepper tree in my front yard. Some people consider it a Southern California weed, but I rather like it. It's about 20 feet tall and has an equal spread. The branches are flexible and droop over giving the tree the shape of a large green umbrella. I have it trained to have a straight, tall (about 10 feet) trunk. To keep it in this shape, the bottom of the drooping tree branches have to be trimmed back about once a year.I've used a variety of tools to trim back the branches, but the best I've found is the Fiskars Pruning stick. I can walk around under the tree and lop off all the drooping branches to the height I want (usually about 8 feet above the ground) to give it the umbrella shape. The top always remains unaltered. I've used a variety of cutters to perform this task, but my latest acquisition (the Fiskar pruner) is by far the best. The cutting gismo can be easily adjusted to a variety of angles. The cutting blade (quite sharp) is activated by pulling the handle down or pulling a cord which runs through the pole. I mostly use the handle. Neat. Very handy. Makes trimming the pepper tree real easy. Why didn't I discover this handy trimmer years ago?The illustration, by the way, includes only about 1/3 of the total tool and doesn't include the pull-down handle. I bought mine in a nearby garden shop, so there was no problem. I'd have trouble figuring it out from the accompanying illustration. In any case, it's easy to use but it doesn't reach as high as some of my previous pruners.Gary Peterson

Im in the process of modifying my diet and trying to exclude all manufactured sugar, or at least as much as I can. Bottled (or canned) drinks are a problem. I like flavored drinks and I try to choose as many as possible without artificial sweeteners. Recently I  discovered 8.4-ounce cans of Perrier Sparking water coming in three flavors. I chose the Lime Flavor. Nice drink! Good, almost bracing flavor. Crisp and tangy. Has a total lack of sweet. Ill be getting more of these and trying the other flavors too. Just what Im looking for!Gary Peterson

In recent months, Ive been trying to modify my snack menu to include a better mix of ingredients, including a lack of sugar. I found these Way Better Tortilla Chips at a nearby Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Market. They have about a half-dozen varieties and I chose a 1.25-ounce pack of the Sweet Potato Chips. Theyre good. Nice and crisp. Good corn-chip flavor. They have salt, but are not overly salty. They have low fat and moderate fiber. Nice shack. Im looking forward to trying the other kinds.Gary Peterson

I was given this Gildan tie-dyed Tee Shirt by a Lady Friend from Joshua Tree, California. I probably wouldn't have bought it for myself. I'm much too conservative! Mine is just like the one shown, but it has "Hi-DESERT ROCKHOUNDS (of the Morongo Basin) and the club logo printed in black across upper third of the front. Seeing the rock club gathered together is quite a sight!In any case, quite apart from the artistic design, it's a nice, soft well-constructed tee shirt and should give a lot of good wear. It takes a bit of courage to wear an item like this as it grabs a lot of attention and generates comments, not all of which are complimentary. It took a little while, but now I enjoy wearing it out and about. I might add that I'm 78 and few people of my age would wear it. Such is life. I rather enjoy it. Nice garment!Gary Peterson

While browsing the snack shelves at my nearby Fresh and Easy Market, I spotted several types of Crunchies Freeze-Dried fruits available in 1.5-ounce bags. There were five servings in a 1.5-ounce bag. Not much of a serving, if you ask me. I chose a bag of Mango Snacks.Interesting snacks. Low sugar. Tasty. If I had a complaint, it would be that the individual chips were very inconsistent and varied from hard and brittle to crush to powder consistency. They varied quite a bit in taste also.Thats all right. It made a good five-serving snack.Gary Peterson

About a year ago, I bought a Philips Sonicare twin pack of electric toothbrushes. I dont know why I would buy two brushes as my wife and I are now separated. A lapse of thought, perhaps. In any case, I bought them at Costco and the price was right. It turns out that the two-pack was right in that one of the toothbrushes gave up about a month ago. Im still annoyed, I might add.The Sonicare is quite a good toothbrush. Im quite pleased with them, except for the early demise of one. Are these things Made in China? Just joking. It does a good job, according to my dental tech. The heads are long lasting, much longer than a  conventional toothbrush, and it comes with an extra brush head, and a couple travel cases. Nice set.The feature I best like about the Sonicare is the two-minute timer. I focus on brushing the four quadrants of my mouth (top, bottom, one side, the other side) for 30 seconds each. This is much longer than in using my conventional brush and can only be for the better. All in all, Im very pleased, but Im docking the rating by a pint for the failure of the one brush.Gary Peterson

Ive been on a diet for about 8 months now and Im very pleased with losing about 25 pounds with very little effort. Its called the SOS Diet - Stop Only Sugar. However, I still like to snack so Ive been seeking out sugar-free (also refined carbohydrate-free items) for such indulgences. One such item is Seapoint Farms Dry Roasted Edamame in some small (1.58 ounce) bags which I purchase at a nearby Fresh and Easy Market. My latest bag is a spicy Wasabi variety. I dont particularly like soybeans, but the added flavoring helps a lot. These things are spicy, to be sure, and the soy bean taste is well masked. Theyre quite good. The only problem I have with them is that theyre quite unevenly flavored. Some are mild, and just as I like, and others are excruciatingly hot. I mean, at time I have to squeeze my eyes shut  and top breathing for a while. Its more than I can take. If you like this typeof wild flavor, they by all means indulge. Other flavorings are available. I should add.Gary Peterson

My nearby Fresh and Easy Market now shelves Pepperidge Farm Goldfish Crackers in two varieties (Cheddar and Whole Grain). Ive always liked Goldfish. They taste a lot like Cheezits, but seem lighter in flavor, which I prefer. I buy mine in these nifty 2-ounce cartons. Theyre just right for a serving and theyre easy to stack away on my pantry shelves. Nice combination. One thing I like is that they are a snack item but they have only a trace of sugar (less than 1 gr/serving). My boy (6) loves them too and theyre one of the  better snack alternatives. I usually get the Whole Grain type because it induces less guilt feelings about snacking.Gary Peterson

My nearby Fresh and Easy Market recently introduced a line of Zevia Diet Soft drinks. Ive now tried about a half-dozen: Cola, Cherry Cola, Ginger Root Beer, Creme Soda and a few others. Quite good! Nice tastes. Not overwhelming. I particularly like the colas. Te drinks strike me as superior to other available diet sodas. Period. Not overly costly. I now pick some up every time I go to the store. Good product. Please note that my store only carries 16-ounce cans and this item, as listed, is 12-ounce. No difference.Gary Peterson

My nearby Fresh and Easy store has a good variety of gourmet candy items and I like the variety of chocolates, particularly the very dar chocolates. This week, a new one arried in the form of about a half dozen kinds of Chocolove X O X O X Bars. I chose a 3.2 ounce bar of Strong Dark Chocolate (70 % Cocoa content). Quite good. Rich, dark taste, but not overly bitter. Very smooth to the chew. Almost melts in your mouth. Not overly sweet (8 gr sugar per serving). Very nice treat.Gary Peterson

My boys 6th birthday was nearing. His Grandma put a video of him playing a kids school Drum Set on Facebook. Upon viewing it, my decision to get him a drum set for his birthday was instant. I looked through Amazon and found this 5-piece Gammon Set in metallic blue. It was perfect and the price was right. The drum set arrived in three days and I was amazed!The set took a lot of time and effort to assemble. Im unable to follow instructions and the parts and pictures were all I had to go on. It worked. I got it set up in two days of part-time tinkering. The set looked nice, appeared sturdy and sounded well. Ill have to get someone who knows drums to fine-adjust the sounds.The set appears well made and sturdy. Time will tell. When my boy saw it and started playing it (read: beating it), he was just ecstatic. "This is the best present ever," he exclaimed three times during the evening. The feeling of joy on his part was just overwhelming, and well worth the cost of the drums. Drum lessons are now in order. It was the most-appreciated gift Ive  ever given anyone. Trust me!Gary Peterson

I enjoy Daft Punk music and have since I first discovered it about five years ago. Nice stuff! There's captivating beats with real fine melodic intervals interspersed. Wonderful listening. Good dancing too. Vocals are sparse and simple, but quite effective. I own most Daft Punk CDs and DVDs including the wonderful "Random Access Memories" which picked up the Best Album of the Year Grammy. It earned it.More recently, I discovered the "Musique Vol. 1" album. I already have about half the songs on this compilation disc, but I bought it anyway. It focuses on Daft Punk music turned out from 1993 to 2005 and most of my stuff postdates that so I pick up a lot of the early stuff, in addition to the repeats.The album is nicely done and the songs are appropriately mixed in a good order for my listening. I seem to like almost all Daft Punk music, but here I especially enjoyed "Around the World," "One More Time," "Robot Rock," "Technologic" and "Human After All." The others are good also and I'll probably learn to like them more as I continue to listen. This early Daft Punk music has a more stiff, mechanical feeling to it than the recent "Random Access Memories" disc. The latter sounds less "computerized" and has a lot of traditional instruments employed including a lot of guest vocalists. I take it that this is the direction that Daft Punk will go in future issues. It's nice stuff, and I'll be looking forward to it. In the meantime, this early Daft Punk compilation fills a nice void in my CD library.Gary Peterson

I've been troubled with minor pimples and blackheads for my entire life. It's no big deal, but I'd like to get rid of as many as possible. I remember that when I was a teenager, my mother had one of these little steel pimple removers and it worked well. Hence, I spotted the Rosallini Blackhead remover and I ordered one. It took over a month to arrive and I was annoyed by the time it finally got here.The blackhead remover doesn't work very well with me and partly it's my fault. Using it requires close vision with a mirror. As a teenager, that was no problem. However, as an adult, I've gone through many changes in eyeglasses and now wear bifocals. My vision, either with or without the eyeglasses is insufficient. Second, the elongate remover is completely straight. I cannot get the little hole on the blackhead because one or another part of my face is in the way. I would regard this as a basic design flaw. So, the long-awaited blackhead remover has failed in every way. I'll rate it as two stars, because my weak vision is not the fault of the tool. If you can use this thing, I wish you well.Gary Peterson

I listen to a lot of music and most would fall into the "Popular" category, as opposed to to "Jazz" or "Classical," although I listen there too now and then. I don't particularly care for "Metal" or "Country," but even there lurks some good stuff. For example, I've always had a fancy for Metallica and I own three albums including "S and M," their gig with the San Francisco Symphony Orchestra (quite a good DVD, I might add). With "Country," I enjoy listening to "Bluegrass" now and then and I enjoy watching bluegrass musicians perform. Well. not too long ago, a Facebook friend called my attention to a "Fade to Bluegrass" CD featuring Iron Horse. It's a "Bluegrass Tribute To Metallica" and is very highly rated. After reading just a few of the Amazon reviews, I just had to have it. I've been very satisfied from the first play.What can I say? It's a collection of 10 well-known Metallica songs done up in fine  fashion by an excellent bluegrass combo. Who would have ever thunk? You just have to hear it to understand and when you listen, you'll probably have a smile on your face. I particularly enjoyed "The Unforgiven," "Nothing Else Matters," "Fuel," and "Enter Sandman," but all of the songs were exceptionally well done by a very capable combo. It might take a bit to get used to Metallica songs without a drummer, but the rest of the bluegrass instruments fill in to provide a fine rhythm section. The harmonized vocals are really, really good. I'd say your enjoyment of the album would be enhanced if you liked bluegrass music and had a tolerance and familiarity with Metallica. Neither is really necessary. It's just good music. Relax and enjoy!I had a friend over who enjoys music. I didn't indicate anything about my new album and just put it on. A few bars into "The Unforgiven," a puzzled look appeared on her face. It quickly changed to bewilderment and she stated "I know this song." I said "Think Metall..." That was all it took and she had it down. We both laughed and enjoyed the rest of the album.Gary Peterson

I have an ongoing intermittent problem with a rough and irregular speaking voice. It often bothers me when I'm talking to classes or speaking to groups of people or, sometimes, just when I'm trying to carry on an extended conversation with an individual. It's not  a sore throat, such as comes with cold. It's probably more a problem with my vocal cords. In any case, a cough drop can provide relief. The question is, which cough drop? I've tried a lot of them over the years. The best I've found is the Halls Triple Soothing Action Mentho-Lyptus drop. So, whenever I can be expected to do a lot of talking, I carry a small handful of these in my pocket. They're quite soothing without overly tasting like medicine or a type of candy.Gary Peterson

I review a lot of things for Amazon and have been doing it  for about ten years. As such, I'm ranked toward the top of the reviewers list and I get a lot of offers to review things, mostly books of one kind or another. I turn down about 99% of the offers in that I just don't have the time. Every once in a while something comes along that catches my interest. The San Francisco Salt Company, for example, asked if I might review a couple of their specialty salts. I agreed to do it and they suppled me with  two five-ounce packets of the products.The first was an Alder Smoked Sea Salt and I reviewed it a couple months ago. It was really distinctive and I loved it. Next was a Black Hawaiian Lava Salt. This one I find a little puzzling. It's dark black in color and looks more like pepper than salt. Evidently, the color is provided by activated charcoal which has anti-oxident properties. It's quite a good salt, but I can't see any other particular advantage over other good sea salts. It's a novelty, that's for sure, to have a quality salt on your eggs that looks like pepper, but the novelty wears off in short order. In any  case, it's quite a good tasting salt, much better than the typical commercial salts. It will be put to good use and I would buy it again. However, it's nowhere nearly as distinctive as their Alder Smoked Salt. I thank the company for allowing me to sample these two interesting and distinctive gourmet salts.Gary Peterson

I bought this grenade decal sticker for the back window of my pickup truck. I know it's a grenade, but I'm not certain of any deeper meaning. Hopefully, there is none. I have a white Toyota Tacoma Pickup, and they're very common. On a large parking lot you might be able to spot a half-dozen of them. As such, I bought a couple distinctive decal window stickers in that they show up at distance and enable me to identify my truck without having to walk over and check  the license plate. My decals work fine and are a big help.Gary Peterson.

Several years ago, I became aware of seaweed as a snack. I picked up a small package at Trader Joe's and later at a nearby Fresh and Easy Market. I liked them  and repeated the purchases several times. More recently, I was shopping at my nearby Costco Warehouse store and found a big package of 10 0.6 oz packets of Roasted and Seasoned Seaweed. Well, if I liked the others, why not try it.The roasted Seaweed was quite good. It was lightly flavored (slightly fishy) and salted and rather tasty. It almost seemed to melt in your mouth. An individual packed was five servings and the whole thing only amounted to 100 calories. No sugar. Just a light salt. They're rather interesting and tasty and I usually eat about a third to a half of an individual packet at a sitting. It's a tasty munchie that doesn't amount to much of an intake.Gary Peterson

When I go to Costco, I always pick up a variety of snacks Specifically, I was looking  for sugar-free snacks. In the nut section I found these Bhuja Nut Mix Snacks. They were very low sugar and had a lot of peanuts, almonds and cashews in addition to peas, chick peas and a variety of other things. The taste was both salty and spicy. Not bad, but not one of my favorites either. They'll disappear, but not overly fast. They were nice and fresh and crunchy, I might add and they fit my "Stop Only Sugar " Diet.Gary Peterson

Many years ago, I was a  runner. I used to race every weekend and I've completed 11 marathons with a best time of 3:27. I finally gave up marathoning at about the age of 50 because of recurring sore ankles. I continued running for  another 20 years but finally gave it up altogether at about the age of 70. The problem was sore ankles, particularly the left ankle. Those ankle problems continue until today and I'm now 77.The ankle problems are no big deal and I'd do the whole thing over if I had the chance. I take some minor pain medications when they act up. One of my favorites has been Bengay Pain Relieving Cream. It helps.A couple weeks ago, I slipped on a stairs and gave my left ankle a good  twist. Now, it really hurt and the Bengay didn't seem to help much. I was mentioning this to my Mother-In-Law (from Russia) and she  suggested Alezan Cream For Joints, a product from Russia. Okay, I decided to try it when I discovered it was available on Amazon.The Alezan Cream is sorta like the Bengay in that it comes in a plastic tube, I put a little on a hand and then rub it in to my sore ankle. Afterwards I put a sock on that leg to control the Alezan over night. Acually, I have no idea if this is the correct way, in that the Alezon comes only with explanations, cautions and instructions in Russian. Such is life.I'm really surprised that I've had excellent results, much better than with Bengay. The next morning, my ankle is pain free and walking  around on it was much  easier. What a relief! I can't imagine that a topical salve,  such as this,  does the damaged interior any good, but it certainly makes it feel a lot better. I plan to continue until my ankle feels better and then keep a supply around in case I ever injure it again.Gary Peterson

In the past couple years, I've really enjoyed Blue Diamond Almonds, and especially of the Smokehouse Flavor Variety. I buy them in big jars at a nearby Costco Store. This time, when I was shopping at Costco, I discovered an additional BOLD Wasabi and Soy Sauce Variety in a 38-ounce plastic container. Well, I had to try it!These are good, real good! I might like the Smokehouse Variety sightly better, but these would be a close second. They have a certain breath-taking intensity, to be sure, but are mild enough that most people will enjoy them. My jar was nice and fresh and delicious. My only problem is stopping the eating. Oh well, nuts are supposed to be good for you, aren't they? These sure taste good!Gary Peterson

I really enjoy Daft Punk music and have for at least  ten years. This last Summer, they has a smash hit album out ("Random Access Memories") and I got  this decal for the back window of my compact pickup. It looks nice. Most people have no idea what it means and probably think I'm a daft punk of some type of other. So be it. Those in the know understand.

Sometime during the Fall of 2013, I decided to set my furnace thermostat at 65F and just leave it there until turning it off in the Spring of 2014. San Diego doesn't get very cold during the winter so the furnace would seldom be running. It's not much of a sacrifice to comfort. In fact, it's rather nice to have cool air around you and something that hasn't been dried out by a furnace. Now and then it gets bit chilly and for those times I had a couple light-weigt  fleece jackets.I went close to a month into this winter heating plan when my mother-in-law gave me a Mountain Hard Wear Ghost Whisperer Down Jacket (Silver Color) for a Christmas present. Nice. It was ultra light-weight and weighed barely more than a normal long-sleeved shirt. It was warm and comfortable without being hot or feeling like a heavy jacket. It felt good inside or outside the house. Zip it up and it resisted mild winds quite well. I could put it on as a liner under a heavier jacket for added warmth during real cold episodes. For traveling, the entire jacket was so small and light that it would fold up and fit in one of it's own pockets. Easy to care for. This is a real "cool" jacket. I love it!Gary Peterson

Not too long ago I bought and tried a bag of hemp seeds. They packed a nutritional punch and mixed well with other foods. Then I couldn't find them any more. Now, on my latest trip to Costco, I found this 1 pound, 8 ounce bag Nature's Earthly Choice raw shelled Hemp Seed. Into the cart it went. I find all kinds of uses for this stuff. I add it to my yogurt. I add it to soups and stews. I stir it into various dishes. It has no sodium, a good fiber content and loads of protein. The fat content is somewhat high, but it's all the good fat. This stuff is hard to beat as a dietary additive.Gary Peterson

Some time ago I used to enjoy a 180 almond snack which I got at Costco, but then they stopped carrying it. Just recently, I found this Almond Rice Pops With Blueberries in a 17-ounce pack. It's very similar but it a slightly different product, I'd guess. Well, in any case, they're good, real good. Nice and fresh and crispy. Good tasting too. Of course, they're oven baked and whole grain. The sodium content is low and the fiber content is adequate, Good snack!Gary Peteron

Here's one of those handy impulse items you find at the front when you walk into Costco. It's a Contigo 2-pack of Vacuum-Insulated Travel Tumblers. Neat. I've needed this but didn't know where to find them. They're aluminum, come in a variety of colors and hold 14 ounces of cold or hot fluids. I use mine for coffee, at present.I use my Tumbler in two ways. One is for auto traveling. I can put hot coffee in it and it will still be drinkably hot after four hours. Good for taking short trips. Second, in the mornings I make a pot of coffee and drink a couple mugs. There's always another mug left over. I pour it in one of the tumblers. If I feel like having a hot cup of  coffee in the afternoon it's there, with no additional preparation. Handy. The mugs are spill and leak proof and easy to clean.Gary Peterson

Good! Real Good! I found this Princess Pickled Asparagus (26.5-ounce jars) at Costco and I couldn't resist. Well, the asparagus is wonderful/ It's crisp and tasty and a treat that's low in calories. Mmmmm, good!Gary Peterson

I discovered these little snack gems near the chips isle at my nearby Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Market. Somersaults with Sea Salt, they were called. They're crunchy nuggets baked with sunflower seeds and assorted toasted grains. How could I resist? Into the cart it went. I first bough a smaller bag, but then one night I discovered these boxes on the bargain shelves with the price slashed. Evidently, the store needed some extra shelf space.These little nuggets  are really good!  They have a rich sunflower seed taste. They're about the size of a thick quarter and they chew up real easily. Delicious taste, or did I already mention that? They have a nice salty taste, but aren't particularly high in sodium. How do they do that? They're high in fiber and protein. the fat calories are high, but it's the veetable fat. No trans-fats or cholesterol. Man, these are an excellent snack! I'm going back for a few more boxes while they're still on special.Gary Peterson

I like iced tea, and particularly unsweetened iced tea. As such, I was delighted to find this one-gallon (3.78 L) container of Tradewinds Slow Brewed Iced Tea. It's labeled as "unsweet tea" and that's the case. Real nice flavor. It's brewed and not made from concentrate. This is good stuff. Nice flavor and goes down real easily! I'm delighted to have found it as a new item in a nearby Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Market. I''ll be back again and again for more. Good stuff!One word of warning, and it won't be included in the rating. The bottle is huge and won't fit in my fridge in a standing position. the only way I can get it in the fridge is lying on it's side. Be careful to get the top screwed on straight. I didn't one time and had 3/4 of the bottle drain out into the fridge. Big mess! My  fault, not the tea. These bottles are large and inconvenient. I rebottle mine and it's much handier.Gary Peterson

San Diego tap water smells a bit and leaves a lot of white crud in the glass if evaporated dry. It's mostly from the Colorado River. But, what the hey? Why should I buy supplemental minerals if Colorado River water already contains a good variety? In any case, the city says it's safe and I'm unaware of any major problems. Well, there's the taste. My wife feels differently about such matters. She's from Europe and nobody there supposedly drinks tap water. It's considered disgusting. Proper drinking water must come in a bottle and be collected from some important and well-known springs. Besides, she seems to have elevated perceptions in taste, smell, sight, hearing and all other senses. In any case, to keep peace in the household, I agreed that we would drink bottled water. We gradually settled in on Kirkland Signature bottled water. The price was right! Well, now even that isn't good enough. My wife seems to have discovered Fiji Natural Artesian Water which comes in attractive rectangular bottles and is imported all the way from the South Pacific. It costs several times as much as regular brands, but that's part of the appeal. It's the best, she claims. It's so smooth and goes down so easy, she says. Now other bottled waters, although OK, are not nearly as good. No, Fiji Natural Artesian Water is the water for her. I must admit that it's excellent, but the cost is way too high.Gary Peterson

Well, I discovered these little gems near the chips isle at my nearby Fresh and Easy grocery store. Somersaults. Hmmmm. Pacific Sea Salt. Crunchy nuggets baked with sunflower seeds and toasted grains. How could I resist? Into the cart it went.These little thingies are really good! Rich sunflower seed taste and very tasty. They're about the size of a thick quarter and they chew up real easily. Delicious taste, or did I already mention that? They have a nice salty taste, but aren't particularly high in sodium. How do they do that? They're high in fiber and protein. the fat calories are high, but it's the good fat. No trans-fats or cholesterol. Man, these are an excellent snack! I'm going to eat too many!Gary Peterson

I've had Teas' Tea before and I thought it was excellent. This evening I spotted a lone bottle in the beverage shelves of a nearby grocery store and I just couldn't resist picking it up. Excellent! Nice and smooth, Goes down so easily. Unsweetened. Light Green Tea flavor. Who could ask for more?Gary Peterson

My nearby Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Market has a lot of gourmet items, too many for me to keep track of. They also have a clearance rack, a place where they sell the last of items they're trying to discontinue. I always check it out for bargains and sometimes I find some real gems. That was the case tonight. I found about a dozen 26-ounce jars of Farmer's Garden by Vlassic Kosher dill spears. They just looked to good to pass by. They were good. Excellent! Nice and  crispy. Excellent light garlic taste. Wonderful-tasting spices. And with a small assortment of carrots, red peppers and garlic cloves in the bottom of the jar. Real good and the price was attractive enough that I'm going to pick up some more next time I'm back.Gary Peterson

The author is an excellent writer, easy to read but I didnt find this interesting.Maybe the main reason is that the real people kept clashing with the fictional persona given them.This is a Hollywood gossip column expanded into a book.The result is a soap opera where reality kept colliding with fiction until I gave up and stopped reading.

APBA (APP-bah) is the oldest baseball game starting in the 1950s and still going strong.That says there is a large devoted fan base allowing you to find items and opponents without much difficulty.The company maintains a website and there are a number of blogs devoted to the game.All of this gives a new player plenty of places to find answers to questions, advice and a favorite team.This is a review for the Basic Game where most people start with a few ending at the Master Game but most adding basic game items to an individual comfort level.The Basic Game is designed to expand, as you play, adding features to increase realism.This version of the basic game contains all the major league teams for one season.After building a team and setting a starting line-up, you determine your pitching and fielding value.Each at-bat, roll two dice, cross-reference this to the batters card for a value.Find this value on one of the situation boards; adjust for pitching or fielding, and that is the play.This sounds very complicated but it isnt!Each situation from bases empty to loaded has a board.Boards are divided for pitching and fielding to yield realistic results.This game has all the boards in one spiral bound oversized book making them easy to find and read.One dice roll is usually one play, making a game about half an hour.WHAT HAPPENED?  Occur with results requiring a second roll, rare but real fun.Sacrifices, bunts, hit n run are all here in the base game.When you are ready to add, this game is ready to use: Individual fielding ratings Ball park differences Playing a 3-game series Playing a full seasonInside the box are the oversize boards book, four baseball teams, two dice and a cup, a playing field, score sheet and rules.With individual players, you can build teams or see how a 1930s team does against a 2000s team.APBA has a newsletter and usually gives subscribers a yearly gift, scribe and enjoy.
APBA makes a great baseball game but the All Star editions are a subset of the real game.  Their is little more than hitting here, check the full base game first.
This is over priced and available elsewhere much cheaper.  The APBA teams and seasons are a great addition to your game.

APBA (APP-bah) is the oldest baseball game starting in the 1950s and still going strong.That says there is a large devoted fan base allowing you to find items and opponents without much difficulty.The company maintains a website and there are a number of blogs devoted to the game.All of this gives a new player plenty of places to find answers to questions, advice and a favorite team.This is a review for the Basic Game where most people start with a few ending at the Master Game but most adding basic game items to an individual comfort level.The Basic Game is designed to expand, as you play, adding features to increase realism.After building a team and setting a starting line-up, you determine your pitching and fielding value.Each at-bat, roll two dice, cross-reference this to the batters card for a value.Find this value on one of the situation boards; adjust for pitching or fielding, and that is the play.This sounds very complicated but it isnt!Each situation from bases empty to loaded has a board.Boards are divided for pitching and fielding to yield realistic results.This game has all the boards in one spiral bound oversized book making them easy to find and read.One dice roll is usually one play, making a game about half an hour.WHAT HAPPENED?  Occur with results requiring a second roll, rare but real fun.Sacrifices, bunts, hit n run are all here in the base game.When you are ready to add, this game is ready to use: Individual fielding ratings Ball park differences Playing a 3-game series Playing a full seasonInside the box are the oversize boards book, four baseball teams, two dice and a cup, a playing field, score sheet and rules.With individual players, you can build teams or see how a 1930s team does against a 2000s team.APBA has a newsletter and usually gives subscribers a yearly gift, subscribe and enjoy.

HALO building sets always result in an impressive model and this is no exception.The Scorpion's Sting is an UNSC tank with many movable parts including guns and the turret.HALO tanks are a challenging but fun build resulting in an enjoyable addition to you collection.With 616 pieces, this set is well priced at about nine cents a piece.This is not Lego with the numbered bags.  This is Mega Bloks with a couple of bags and you have to sort the pieces into what each step needs.A good thing is all instructions are available on-line and can be blown up to help see details.The selection of figures and personal weapons is excellent making this a very attractive item.

Charmin introduced itself with a clever commercial but they kept customers with an excellent product.This is about sixty cents a roll, a very good price for a product that we have to have and will use.Inside the box are four packages of 12 rolls making this easier to handle and store.This is a quality product at an excellent price whats not to like?

This set has a visual impact with black buildings on a white background.Matching accessories complete the impact while being useful.The shower curtain is 100% polyester, with a nice substantial weight to the cloth and is machine washable.It can go into the dryer on low.The soap dish, cup and lotion dispenser are a heavy plastic that will hold up under daily use.They drilled the soap dish allowing air to circulate and help dry the bar of soap.The lotion dispenser holds a medium size bottle of lotion.White shower hooks are included.

I expect this book to be a finalist if not the winner of the Bachelder-Coddington award.This is a gorgeous, loving, and full-color look at a national treasure that is part of the construction of how we see this battle.The whole is contained in a physically handsome oversized book that is a pleasure to hold.This is both a history of and a close look at the restored Gettysburg Cyclorama that is on display at the park.Cycloramas are huge oil paintings, 40 by 400 feet, which were very popular prior to movies.Displayed in specially constructed buildings, patrons use a covered walkway to enter the viewing room.From a platform about 12 feet high, surrounded by the battle, most were awe struck.The first two chapters cover the creation of a cyclorama and how their display.These painting weigh about six tons and require a team of artists months to complete.Paul D. Philippoteaux painted four Gettysburg cycloramas for display in America.These chapters cover the for profit business and what happened to these cycloramas when the profit ended.Lastly, they tell us about the restoration project that restored the current Gettysburg cyclorama to its original condition.Chapters 3, 4 and 5 tell about the hidden portraits and details of the Gettysburg cyclorama.As Philippoteaux learns about the battle and to sell tickets, he made changes to the existing cycloramas.Changing the painting caused changes to the souvenir program too.However, since it is easier to change a program than a painting, differences accumulate and the author gives us some intelligent ideas on these.The balance of the book is a detailed look at the cyclorama based on the ten Tipton photographs.Each chapter opens with a two-page section of the cyclorama.The next page contains the original Tipton photo with a modern color photo taken from the same height.These two photographs address how we are preserving our parks and can make you question improvements.The next page is a full-color view of the section of the cyclorama with a key.The balance of each chapter is an explanation of each key with blow-ups and modern photos.Each chapter has endnotes.The book ends with a Bibliography and full index.This book is a joy to read while exploring the details of the cyclorama and seeing the hidden messages.

While Pathfinder character decks are designed for a series, they can be used with any of the adventure games.You may find a duplicate character; the Afro-American female appears in Rise of the Runelords character deck and as a character in the base game Wrath of the Rightness.Additionally, you may find some changes in presentation of information but all the needed information is there.Each game contains four new characters for use in the named game increasing playability and allows more than four players in a game.You must have a Pathfinder base game to use these cardsThis is a good set of characters with two cohorts, weapons, spells, armor and monsters.

While Pathfinder character decks are designed for a series, they can be used with any of the adventure games.You may find a duplicate character; the Afro-American female appears in Rise of the Runelords character deck and as a character in the base game Wrath of the Rightness.Additionally, you may find some changes in presentation of information but all the needed information is there.Each game contains four new characters for use in the named game increasing playability and allows more than four players in a game.You must have a Pathfinder base game to use these cardsThis is a good set of characters with two cohorts, weapons, spells, armor and monsters.

While Pathfinder character decks are designed for a series, they can be used with any of the adventure games.You may find a duplicate character; the Afro-American female appears in Rise of the Runelords character deck and as a character in the base game Wrath of the Rightness.Additionally, you may find some changes in presentation of information but all the needed information is there.Each game contains four new characters for use in the named game increasing playability and allows more than four players in a game.You must have a Pathfinder base game to use these cardsThis is a good set of characters with two cohorts, weapons, spells, armor and monsters.

This is the shaving soap I like the most and use most.The masculine sent and good lather makes shaving a pleasure for me.This refill is an exact fit for the wooden bowel, unwrap it, drop it in maybe shift it a little with a finger and you are good to go.

Small battle histories are a favorite of mine.  These are the battles where we see what combat was really like.A small battle captures the feelings of isolation, communication problems and intelligence failures that are a part of any battle but seems clearer here.In the hands of a skilled author, a small battle history is both an informative and enjoyable read.This book is an exceptionally good account of Butlers June 9 raid on Petersburg, the planning, personalities, battle and aftermath.The Army of the James is not one of the great Northern armies of the war.  Saddled with a political general as commander and trapped on the Virginia coast, they became a replacement pool.Butler understood what the situation could mean for his future planned an operation to retrieve some of his reputation as a general.Improperly garrisoned, Petersburg is a critical link in the supply chain for Richmond and the Army of Northern Virginia.Butler plans a raid that will overrun the garrison, destroy the bridges over the Appomattox River and get back to the safety of his lines in about 36 hours.Why this did not happen as planned is a fascinating story of how things go wrong.Central to the story are the old men and boys that fight to save their city at Rives Farm.This is one of the few battles where civilians fight veterans during the war in sight of their homes.Hal Jespersen provides excellent maps to complement the authors very readable text.Illustrations and photographs grace almost every page reminding us that these are people.Footnotes, at the bottom of the page, a full index and Bibliography mark this as a serious history.Lastly, this is a physically hansom that is a pleasure to hold and read.A book that can be proudly given as a gift and will be a joy to receive.

The basic set contains illustrations and information about playing the four characters in this set.While not necessary for enjoyable play, they will allow for up to six players in a game.The deck contains 110 cards divided between the new characters and 13 weapons, six armor, eight monsters, seven barriers, 18 henchmen, 14 blessings, eight ally, 13 spells and nine items.Monkeys Paw, Potion of Night Vision and Potion of Striding are new items.New allies include a carbuncle and mastiff, joining an aklys, battle aspergillum and flaming heavy pick in weapons.Crowe is a human male Blood ranger is a strong fighter, who plays as a mauler or spell ranger.The sorcerer Seoni is a human female starting with five spells and four blessings, with the role of element master or corruptor.Adowyn, a human female, is a hunter with a wolf cohort.  She has a good starting mix of weapons, spells and blessings for her role as pack leader or blight scout.The only non-human is Shardra a female dwarf shaman with a lizard cohort.  A total of 10 spells and blessings fit her role as a visionary or sprit guide.The box art illustration on the Amazon page is not the same as the box art for the item.The two characters on the left are not in this set.  Crowe and Seoni replace them.

I am not a Magic player but my son is and this was his choice for a birthday gift.The nine packs contain a mix of the current new cards with some extras that can be useful for a player.My understanding is that this is the box to buy after a player has the Deck Builders Toolkit.These two boxes give a player an excellent chance to build a winning deck.The additional Lands in this box supplement and support this set in building a deck.The Players Guide is a full color booklet  with all the cards in this set and write-ups on the major characters.

Playing Dungeons & Dragons style games requires someone to act as the dungeon master and direct the game play,The Pathfinder card game system replaces a dungeon master with a deck of cards allowing all players to play or allowing real solo play.Pathfinder enjoys a large established presence with a number of blogs that support play with discussion, advice and answers to questions.This is invaluable to the new player as a guide and teacher.D&D style games are NOT easy or quick to learn, their and a number of rules that need to be mastered.Additionally, a sequence of play is important along with an understanding of monsters, weapons, spells and any number of items.This game is no exception!  You will need to study the rules, think and investigate to master this game.This is NOT a quick an easy game for casual play but a relatively in-depth dungeon crawl with a full story line, interesting characters where thought and planning will pay off.Someone said this is just flipping cards.  Im not sure they really got into the game or tried to understand play.You need to understand the abilities and limits of your character(s), quickly select a tactic to deal with monsters and take advantage of wins while dealing with setbacks.Overall, this excellent game works with a group or alone.Wrath of the Righteous is a base game, containing the items needed to play this game.  The game contains one introductory adventure and the first installment of the Worldwound adventure.If/when, you buy additional items; you need to stay with the Wrath of the Righteous title.Currently, there are three base games available each a different adventure.Each base game comprises additional characters and adventures building to completion of an adventure.Each base game has five or six additional adventures available for separate purchase.Character decks will work with any base game giving you more options and adding depth.This can be an expensive but very rewarding gaming experience.If you want a dungeon crawl and cannot always have Dungeon Master this is an excellent choice.The game has depth, plenty of options and will provide hours of enjoyment.This is a well-supported system with the potential for almost unlimited expansions and a substantial active group of players.

If you are new to the Pathfinder world, be aware that these are not used in the card game.It is a multiple game product with books, card games and figures.Make sure you are buying the item that fits which type of game you have.I have the card game and these would be useless to me.

My wife and I open our mail over coffee in the afternoon.I opened the box and she started reading about the game.Next, we were looking at the puzzle cards.She started punching out counters as I put the feet on the trays.Two hours later, we stopped playing to fix dinner.This is a simple game easy to understand and a great deal of fun.Six cards make a puzzle that all players need to solve within a timeframe.Players get and lose points for a number of easily understood reasons.Each puzzle is a round six rounds are a game.Quick logical thinking is the key to winning but no one really loses as players easily score points for partial solutions.Game components are heavy cardboard with a plasticized finish.The game balls are heavy and solid enough to quickly build with and the game try holds them in place.This well-designed and built game is great fun and worth having.

Duel Packs are one of the best buys in the Krosmaster Universe, with two figures, special dice, counters and a map.They are a full stand-alone game that is an expansion for Arena too.The included game involves the Queen of Thieves stealing from King Nidas and is a fast and fun encounter.The two figures are excellent, both very detailed and useful for Arena.

When you move beyond reading about battles and leaders, you quickly discover Earl J. Hess.Chances are you will have read some of his battle histories but are now ready for his how and why books.This author is one of the few authors to look at how and why the war worked as it did.In doing so, he helps us understand some of the silly decisions and/or question some of the standard assumptions.These books give us an understanding of the environment the officers and men fought in and the reasons for their decisions.The American Civil War saw the transition from the smooth bore to the rifled muzzleloader.Rifling and bullet design resulted in a weapon that was lethal way beyond a smooth bore.However, battlefield conditions, the ability to communicate and human abilities worked to keep combat at about 100 yards.The author looks at how liner tactics were an efficient way to fight during the war.Additionally, the book looks at formation for regiments to corps on and off the battlefield.The training of both officers and men is well documented with a good discussion of the books available and how they differed. Last is a section looking at how the training, theory and formations worked during battle with examples drawn from reports.This could make for a sleep inducing book except for the authors skill as a writer.The author grabs and holds are attention with excellent intelligent writing that is easy and fun to read.Well place and easy to understand illustrations support the text.This is a scholarly history with endnotes organized by page numbers at the top of the page.A full index, bibliography and glossary of terms complete the book.This handsome well-made book is a pleasure to hold and to read.

This is one of the most impressive ships in the fleet.  The detail is excellent with varied coloring to add emphases.Small molded details and openings on the underside hull make this look built not molded.The addition of an X-wing Fighter is welcome.  Players tend to not have the number of X-wing and Tie fighters that we see in the movies.This is a Huge Ship with new rules for initial placement, damage location and movement, this expansion come with a special maneuver template.The transport is slow, hard to turn but capable of absorbing plenty of hits making it an interesting ship to play.The ship has two set of damage cards, fore and aft.  Each set is ten cards following the standard damage card rules.A three-part Evacuation of Hoth Campaign is our major chance to play this ship.  The rules state it cannot be fielded in 100-point squads of standard play.Mission 8: Rendezvous requires three Rebel Transports to play and is not something I expect to see happen.The rulebook would be improved by illustrating the special counters and placing them in a section.  Im still digging out what is what; most of the counters are part of the missions.There is a good set of upgrade cards and new X-wing pilots in the box.This is a good expansion but is best a late addition to your game because of the limited playability.

This is a very attractive steel chain with a solid clasp designed for everyday wear but nice enough for dress up too.I bought the 24 and am very satisfied with the quality and quick shipping, nine days from order to delivery.I have two inch steel cross on the chain and have no worries about it breaking.After looking at the chains on Amazon, I selected this as the best looking and best price.It was a very good choice.

This cross is an exceptional piece of male jewelry being both good-looking and practical.The titanium steel cross is enhanced by the black highlight makes a noticeable item when worn outside my shirt.The cross size is large enough to be noticeable but still can be worn inside my shirt as needed.The cross and chain come in an attractive gift box making this something that can be given without embarrassment.The chain is attractive but I needed something longer, as I think most men will.Overall, I am very happy with this item and am wearing it every day.

This is a strong ship able to both dish it out and take it.A member of the Scum & Villainy faction, this large ship can do a Sengor's loop, perform a boost action and drops bombs.The ship is well done with good detail and paint.Upgrades include an Accuracy Corrector, Inertial Dampeners, Proximity Mines, Seismic Charges and Dead Mans Switch.These add some options that may cause you to treat this ship differently on attack.The mission is excellent and will get a lot of playing.The only drawback is that one of these is not going to allow you to fully use its abilities.Two, three or four would make a formidable force that just might dominate the game.

Justified is one of the best shows television has ever had with excellent actors and great writing.The last season continues that tradition with several story lines, fine casting and even better acting.Ava trapped between prison and betrayal is being forced to take greater and greater risks as the Marshals service tightens the screws.Boyd is fixated on ten million dollars that would change everything for him and Ava. Raylan is dealing with his ex-wife, daughter, pushing Ava, catching Boyd and a new menace determined to take over Harlan.This season contains everything we love about the series, brings the story to a realistic ending, and is the cheery on top of the cake for your collection.This is a keeper series that can be watched more than once.

Several voids exist if Popular Civil War history, when we skip weeks moving from one event to another.While books do not have the armies magically disappear at Spotsylvania and reappear at Cold Harbor they say little about anything other than marching.Gordon Rheas brilliant history of the Overland Campaign introduced the North Ann River to many of us.Here is a more assessable history with all the essential information in a lively enjoyable book.That May, Lee set an army size trap on the North Anna River that would split the Army of the Potomac and isolate the parts.If successful, a substantial part of Grants army would be destroyed and the two armies would be about equal in size.Grant fell into the trap, recognized the danger and managed to pull back in time.This is the great What if of the Overland Campaign and possibly of the war.Additionally, this is some of Lees best work showing his planning skills and his ability to evaluate the other sides leader.We always get a lot of book for a buck in this series and this book is an exceptional value.First, you will not find this subject covered at this price anywhere else.The author writes well providing both information and entertainment.Hal Jespersen map contribution cannot be overlooked; his maps enhance any book by making the most obscure fields understandable.The good text is further enhanced with period illustrations, current pictures and portraits of the participants.A battlefield tour and a history of the preservation effort to save this battlefield round out this excellent book.

This is a great looking cross and chain, distinctive and very masculine.It makes a statement and will attract attention and comments.I feel it is to large for everyday wear and returned it.However, if you want a large very masculine distinctive cross, this is a great choice.

Custer creates problems for me. I recognize that he was an inspiring combat commander and built one of the better fighting units in the Civil War. He was willing to take responsibility and do what he felt right in the face of orders to the contrary. His decision on July 3, 1863, helped the Union turn back Stuart's Cavalry and while not winning the battle it did not hurt either. Sheridan and most other high ranking officers thought well of him and used his services to good effect in the closing days of the war. On the other hand, Custer may not have been bright enough to understand details like flanks support or take the time to consider the size of the opposing force. In the end, these details killed him and destroyed his command.James Donovan is as close to a Little Bighorn expert as we have, this is his latest and I think best book on the subject. As always, he does an excellent job giving us an intelligently written comprehensive account. This is a full account with background, campaign details and aftermath. This makes the battle all the more interesting with a full story. This is a good looking book, the maps a in the right places with good detail.

This is a well-written mystery, where the author walks that fine line between the reader quickly knowing who the murder is and the unlikely killer with skill.The result leaves the reader surprised but understanding the logic and clues behind the killing.The story is plausible and realistic with easily identifiable characters.Nothing is black & white as small incidents create questions and problems push the reader into maze of doubts.Multiple stories interact creating a single logical story line with a logical understandable conclusion.This enjoyable, satisfying and entertaining read should appeal to the majority of mystery fans.

In Nam, that indicated something was very very good and is a fitting title for a review of a book about Nam.In 67/68, I was a R.E.M.F. and quickly related to the story and the characters.The author has a good ear for dialog and the ability to create believable situations and people.The result is something that I read in one sitting.This is an excellent novella on Viet Nam, war and life that you will enjoy and wish to reread.I rank it with Better Times than These, The 13thy Valley and Sand in the Wind as some of the best fiction to come out of the war.

I dont think the average person will be able to tell this isnt a real stone.  The color, cut and presentation is consistent with fine jewelry.This impressive item is a real enhancement to a womans wardrobe.As with many pieces of jewelry, the chain is to short and light for the stone.You should consider replacing it with a longer and heavier one at the first opportunity.

This expansion adds several items to the game that both improve play and make the game more fun.Seeker zombies will give you fits, draw a seeker spawn card and all seekers on the board get an extra activation.Drawing a series of them will change the game, leaving you in a hole it not eaten.Human companions provide both active and passive aid depending on their classification.A companion is a gunman, handyman, searcher or sniper, each having specific abilities.Human companions play in the same general manner as dig companions do.Holes are a major new terrain feature taking additional movement points to exit which trap zombies.Holes and the new A-bomb zombie, from Rue Morgue, figure in one of the included missions.Planks allow survivors to get across holes and introduce diagonal movement and targeting.Seasons one, two and three each have five new missions.The box contains figures for four new survivors and their zombivor, eight human companions and 18 seeker zombies.If you do not have Toxic City Mall, rules for barricades and Ultrared mode will be new to you.This is a good expansion that you will want if you are playing often and have the full system.If you have started with Season 3, this is a necessary extension to fully play the main game.

Boba Fett made a big impression and became part of the Star Wars saga as an implacable foe dedicated to money.Including him and his ship in our games is a no brainer but getting such a valuable expansion makes it even better.The Slave 1 appeals to the eyes with good detail.It appeals to the gamer with a set of upgrades for weapons and people.Three named and one generic pilot, missiles, mines, cannons and defensive upgrades make this a valuable addition to the game.Additionally, the Most Wanted Expansion works with this expansion allowing Boba Fett to fight with that faction too.

This expansion fills a void and does a great job doing so.The nicely detailed Millennium Falcon comes with a good set of upgrade cards resulting in a ship that appeals to the eyes and is fun to play.Engine and shield upgrades coupled with two types of missiles are useful.People are an important part of the Star Wars story and this expansion is populated with important characters that enhance gaming.A good expansion that is worth having as both part of your collection and to play the game.

The Scum Villainy faction is an interesting development for this game giving us a third player in the civil war.We use this faction as a stand-alone group or fight for and against both sides depending on our mood.This allows Scum Villainy to raid and fight as a truly independent force.This expansion is a major addition to the game and to this faction.In addition to the two Z-95 Headhunters and one Y-Wing, the box houses some really useful cards.The major item is including Boba Fett as a Scum Villainy pilot.  You will need the must have Slave 1 expansion to use these cards but it is a great idea.The upgrades included in the box work with all factions adding real value to this set.This is a serious extension for the Scum Villainy faction, adding important ships, people and upgrades.

My Grandson has been playing Krosmaster with me.  Fascinated by the figures, he can grasp the mechanics of moving and picking things up but has problems with the tactics.This solves those problems with a Krosmaster game designed for children having the figures and colorful game tiles but simplified mechanics.The smaller game board and simpler games make it easier for my grandson to play even as he develops a foundation for the adult game.Additionally, the four figures have cards for Arena allowing me to use them there too.Choppy Sues sword is in two pieces.  The blade has a hole that fits onto a pin on the hilt in her hand.

My Grandson has been playing Krosmaster with me.  Fascinated by the figures, he can grasp the mechanics of moving and picking things up but has problems with the tactics.This solves those problems with a Krosmaster game designed for children having the figures and colorful game tiles but simplified mechanics.The smaller game board and simpler games make it easier for my grandson to play even as he develops a foundation for the adult game.Additionally, the four figures have cards for Arena allowing me to use them there too.Choppy Sues sword is in two pieces.  The blade has a hole that fits onto a pin on the hilt in her hand.

Just in case you have never ever heard of Zombicide, Ill give you a quick background.Something turns people into zombies that attack people and turn them into zombies.A few people, survivors, didnt turn and are now being attacked by the zombies.You and your team are working together to stay alive and complete a mission.Rue Morgue is the third standalone game in the Zombicie system, designed to be played either alone or with the existing games and expansions.Two new zombie types, helicopters, team actions and competitive play are the new items in this game.The optional competitive play changers players vs. zombies to players vs. players while zombies go after everyone.Team actions introduces a limited ability to have your characters act together.This adds a new level of decision-making and tactical considerations without undue complications.Helicopters have limited application in this game but could be an important expansion as we learn to use them.The new Skinner Zombie can spawn a crawler zombie when killed.The major zombie is the new A-bomb.  This is an almost invincible zombie with the ability to grab survivors and pull them into its zone.Add some new weapons, game tiles and survivors to a large box and you have Rue Morgue.One possible problem; there are no Zombivor figures included in this game; they are in the Lost Zombivors box, making this less than a full standalone game

More and more we are brewing our coffee using a Keurig not a coffee pot.The ease of use, consistency, the cup of coffee you want and only the cups needed have changed how we make coffee.They designed the new Keurig 2.0 system to refuse pods that are not Keurig pods; about five minutes on the internet will show you how to hack this feature of the brewer.The best feature of this brewer is the ability to brew a 4-cup carafe and single cups.The carafe is not included, allowing you to select from several providers and styles at about $30.The second good feature is the ability to get a stronger cup of coffee on request.The worst feature is the largest cup/mug is 10 oz., most systems have a 12 oz. mug.The second worst feature is the 40 oz. water reservoir, which is to small for this system.Like all Keurig brewers, it brews a great cup of coffee and the company supports their product.

Hello everyone,So I previously reviewed the original Bose SoundTrues and I absolutely loved them. They weren't perfect, but I thought and still think that they are excellent headphones for the price. The new SoundTrue Ultras refine three things from the original SoundTrues. With a new more expensive cost of $149.99, the new SoundTrue Ultras have improved noise isolation, higher quality audio, and a new design.So lets start with noise isolation:The noise isolation on the SoundTrue Ultras are superb. Bose now includes StayHear Ultra Tips. These tips are improved from the original StayHear tips in that they now have a round tip at the end. This round tip helps to create a seal that was not present with the original StayHear tips. With the new tips, noise isolation is no longer a problem and I no longer have to increase the volume all the way in a moderately loud environment. I've had a big issue with noise isolation on the original SoundTrue earphones and it's really great to see Bose fix this issue in the new model.People have commented on my video review of the new SoundTrue Ultras(video on my YouTube channel) that these new tips are simply rebranded StayHear Plus Tips found on other Bose earbuds. I don't know if this is entirely true, but regardless, the new tips are fantastic.People were also wondering if you could use the new tips on the original SoundTrues and the answer is yes. I have tested the tips on my OG SoundTrues and they fit no problem. It seems like Bose has the same tip attachment mechanism on the back of all of their earphones so the new tips should work on older Bose earbuds, but since I've only confirmed this with the old SoundTrues, I won't say anything factually. For owners of the original SoundTrues just looking for an upgrade in noise isolation, you can simply buy a set of replacement StayHear Ultra tips, which is great.Moving on to audio quality:Sound is drastically altered from the sound signature of the original SoundTrues. Like Bose advertises, lows are immensely improved. There is now so much more detail and presence in the lower frequencies than before. This brings details I wasn't able to hear with the older SoundTrues. Vocals are also much smoother and clear. The one thing to note though is that bass is still a bit lacking. It's there, but it's tight and lacking for my preference. For audiophiles, the SoundTrue Ultras may surprise them since Bose is notorious for not having reference-like sound.Unfortunately, while the sound quality is improved, it's kind of boring. It's the kind of sound I'm used to with something like the Audio Technica ATH M50 series, neutral and lacking bass. If you've tried them, you know what I mean. Soundstage is also virtually nonexistent with the SoundTrue Ultras.Lastly, design.Not much to talk about here but the new SoundTrue Ultras feature a new design. I like it. It looks more modern. Bose is still going with a plastic construction on the housing which I feel is the right choice. I'm not a fan of metal earphones since they tend to put weight down on your ears. Bose says they've improved durability for sweat and weather resistance. However, their website says that they would prefer you use the SoundSport model for more rigorous physical use, which implies that while improved in durability, these are probably not meant for the athletic lifestyle. Comfort is still relatively high with the ultra-comfy StayHear Ultra tips. Beside the new look of the housing, Bose has incorporated a T-Joint cable splitter. It's pretty much like before but because you've got plastic ends coming out of the splitter, it helps to keep the left and right cables more conformed to a shape. This just helps to prevent tangling and your cables getting to out of whack, which I appreciate. One last thing I want to note is that I wish the cable was a bit different.
