It's still pretty thin, which I don't mind, but it just feels cheap and meh.Overall, the Bose SoundTrue Ultras get a 4/5 stars from me. Like before, these aren't perfect, but they're well-rounded and make an excellent pair of earphones. For previous owners of the original SoundTrues, I wouldn't say that it is essential to upgrade to these. I would say that if noise isolation is your only problem, get a set of StayHear Ultra tips, and you should be golden.

Where to start..Protection: The Lumenair is a pretty thick case. The Note 5 by itself is already pretty big, but with this case, it's a bit too bulky for my taste. However, with that bulk, you are given added protection. The hard polycarbonate frame will help keep the inner silicon membrane intact as the silicon absorbs the shock from impact.Design: I'm definitely a big fan of the see thru polycarbonate back. It just looks really nice to see the original back of the Note 5 through the case.Cutouts: For cutouts, you've got the plastic button coverings for the volume and power buttons. They are extremely clicky and tactile, which is nice. The headphone jack, micro usb, speaker, and microphone cutouts are very precisely cut out but the cutouts are extremely recessed, making using third party accessories a bit of a challenge. The cutout for the SPen is also an issue. The top part of the cutout needs to be cutout a bit more as it blocks the S-Pen from coming out of the case. Definitely a serious issue if you are an active S-Pen user.Features: So the Lumenair is designed to be a "flashing" case. Meaning that it uses the Note's flash for producing a flashing effect on incoming calls or alerts. This is done by having a sliding piece of plastic cover the flash on the back of the Note 5. Although it's not something that I enjoy, for others, this may be a feature you're interested in. Especially if you're constantly losing your phone. Note, you can slide off the plastic covering the flash for when you need to use it as an actual flash. Another novelty feature is the glow in the dark silicon. The silicon membrane that you wrap around the phone before putting on the plastic covering features glow in the dark capabilities. However, in my testing, while it definitely does glow, it's a somewhat weak glow. For those particularly interested in this aspect of the case, you might want to look elsewhere.Conclusion: Overall, the Lumenair is a decent novelty case. It's definitely not a case for everyone but it does work as advertised. Some specific things to keep in mind: the S-Pen cutout denies access to the pen, the case is a bit thick, and the glow-in-the-dark silicon is not too bright.*Product was sent for free for an unbiased review*

There really isn't much to say about the EcoMoist screen cleaner kit. It does as advertised and does it very well. EcoMoist claims that the product is made of natural and green products, and even if that is true, I'm not sure if it makes a significant impact on a product category like this. Still, for those conscious of the environment, it's not a bad thing I suppose. I've only tried one other product in this field and that's the iKlear screen cleaning kit. Unlike the iKlear spray, the EcoMoist solution is noticeably scentless and wipes off much better than the iKlear, this is definitely a plus. One thing I do like about the iKlear kit though is the plethora of microfibers of different sizes and types. The EcoMoist kit comes with one black microfiber(very nice size by the way), but it's not the type of microfiber I prefer. I am someone who likes thinner and more silkier microfiber cloths rather than the towel like microfibers. This is completely personal opinion though so if you don't mind it, it's not something you should even take into consideration. Overall, the EcoMoist screen cleaner kit is nice. It's priced fairly and is a great product for someone who owns a lot of electronics and wants to keep them looking fresh.*Product was sent for free for an unbiased review*

For new Mac owners, the XSKN cover is perfect for learning useful and common OSX shortcuts. The quality is fantastic. Fit is also really nice and so you don't have to worry about the skin moving around. I do notice a slow down in typing and accuracy because of the rubbery feeling keypresses. For slower typers, this might not be an issue. Overall, I give the skin 4/5 stars because the craftsmanship is great but the slowdown in typing speed is sometimes a bit annoying.*Product was sent for free for an unbiased review*

I reviewed the After Effects model of this cover and while I gave that one 5 stars, I don't think I can do the same for the regular one. Like the AE model, this one has the same great quality and everything, but like I stated in my review of the AE model, typing speed is decreased for me with the rubbery feel of keypresses. I tried my best to get used to it but I just cannot type consistently fast with these covers. For the AE model, because it's very useful and specific for learning After Effects, I believe that it's a great tool and cover, but because this cover has no specific purpose, I don't think it's as useful as the other application-based covers. Still, I rate it 4 stars considering the price and quality.*Product was sent for free for an unbiased review*

The XSKN After Effects Keyboard Skin is pretty great. As an amateur video producer, I recently began to learn After Effects and while I do know some common shortcuts, I don't know all of them. I could teach myself by looking at the Adobe website but why bother when you can just get a keyboard cover like this. I think that visually being able to see a cheat sheet for all the shortcuts helps newbies like me learn much more quickly and efficiently than looking at a website. The quality of the cover seems to be really nice. Fit is good as well. My only con is that I noticed by typing speed decrease a bit with the cover. I used it for a few days to see if I could get used to it but it just doesn't feel as good as a naked keyboard. So what I do now is only use the cover when using After Effects rather than using it all the time. When using After Effects, I don't do a lot of typing, just shortcuts usually, so slow typing is not an issue. When going back to other applications though, I will take it off to get my normal typing speed back.*Product was sent for free for an unbiased review*

Here are my impressions on the Voix earphones.Regarding sound: Too much bass for my liking. There's so much emphasis on bass that it really drowns out the vocal experience for me. For the serious bassheads, you might find yourself to love these but they're way too bassy for me. Clarity is nice but like I said, we need to lessen the bass emphasis just a bit. There is also not much soundstage on these earphones.You do get a metal container/case for the earphones which is something you definitely don't see for earphones of this price.Design: I do like the design of the earphones. They look unique and they fit well in my ears due to how they're shaped. The cord is a flat tangle design which I like as well. The jack on the end is a bit large and bulky.The microphone/remote is pretty decent. Controls work just fine with my devices and the mic sounds average.Overall, I rate these 4 stars all things considered.*Product was sent for free for an unbiased review*

So to start off, being a previous QC15 owner, the QC25s are not overly better than the QC15s. I would say that the only reason to upgrade to the 25s might be the new design. However, for those who have never owned a QC15, you will love the QC25s.In terms of sound quality, the QC25s sound very similar to the older QC15s but the bass and clarity is improved on the new QC25s. Everything sounds much tighter with better fidelity.The effectiveness of noise cancellation seems the same to be quite honest.Comfort is still phenomenal on the 25s. The QC15s were incredibly light and comfortable, and the tradition remains. The QC15 was one of the few headphones I could wear for long, long periods of time, and I'm glad that the QC25s continue to be insanely comfortable.In terms of design, I much prefer the look of the new 25s. The 25s look much more modern and youthful, whereas the QC15s looked more executive and business-like.Another great feature with the 25s is that they will still work without batteries. The noise cancellation won't work of course, but you won't be stuck with no audio. In addition to losing noise cancellation, you do also lose some fidelity in audio quality, it still sounds pretty decent.Like the QC15s, the battery life on the 25s are still exceptional. I haven't done any extensive and scientific tests, but it can last quite a while.Overall, the QC25s are great headphones. People criticize Bose for being overpriced, but they really aren't. The QC25s don't sound as good as some other $300 headphones, but they excel in many areas(sound, comfort, design, usability) unlike competing products that excel in only a few(sound only), making the QC25s a balanced and well rounded product, and that's what makes it worth $300.

I have been using this vanilla bean whey protein powder as a breakfast smoothie.  I like to mix either frozen blueberries or frozen strawberries, 1% or 2% milk and blend in my Ninja blender.  Today I tried using a mix of coconut milk and almond milk instead of regular cows milk.  It was just a delicious.  I always select vanilla protein powders as I think the vanilla flavor is very versatile, as I can make a frozen berries and cream smoothie one day, or a frozen banana and raw cacao powder shake the next. As with several protein powders on the market this one has Stevia, which I would prefer it did not.  I can taste this sweetener in the smoothie and other food products with this ingredient. I would have rather it have no sugar or perhaps even Xylitol crystals (100% pure birch xylitol) instead. I have never liked the flavor of Stevia or similar sweeteners. That being said, when I mix it with my frozen fruit, it does mask the Stevia flavor some.  The smoothie is delicious and I really liked mixing my almond and coconut milk with it.This has 21 grams of protein, which is a bit less than the usual 25 in some other brands, but still a nice amount.  Women who are not pregnant should get about 45 grams per day and those who are breastfeeding or pregnant, need as much as 70-75 grams of protein per day.  My absolute favorite brand is Garden of life Raw (unflavored does not have Stevia), as they are a whole food / raw diet source with probiotics, however that brand only has 17 grams of protein (per ONE scoop).  This brand suggests using 2 scoops for 21 grams of protein.  I recommend this, but would suggest an unflavored version to also be available without any  Stevia or sweeteners. *I received this as a review sample for an honest evaluation.

This is a nice bamboo wash cloth set.  I love bamboo as it is antibacterial, antimicrobial, and so very soft.  We use bamboo cotton for our cloth baby wipes (used in a Munchkin wipes warmer with essential oils, coconut oil and natural castile soap).  We mix water, fractionated coconut oil, argan oil, jojoba oil, rose water, pure (non alcohol/non chemical) aloe vera and baby mild Dr. Bronners Castile soap for the solution.Bamboo is gentle to baby and feels nice in my hands when using it.  These cloths work wonderfully for cleaning our baby during his cloth diaper changes.  Regular cotton terry can often be scratchy and not the most comfortable to use.  The bamboo cotton set includes 6 wash cloths, and 1 yellow bib.  It is a very soft set and the stitching and edges are precise and secure.  I have not found any flaws in the set I received.I have not had this set for very long (a bit less than 2 weeks) so I cannot comment as to how long it will stay looking new, however it appears to be durable and if washed with gentle and natural based baby laundry soap, it should last a long time. Since these are used in our cloth baby wipe rotation, we wash these with our cloth diapers.  I use Nellies Natural Laundry powder and a small pouch of soap nuts.  I generally do not machine dry these since they go into the wet wipes container after washing.  I am sure they would do just fine in the machine on low to medium heat.  *I received this set complimentary for review, this is my honest opinion and evaluation.  This review is based on our family's experience of the set in the short amount of time we have had it.  I do recommend it, and like it.

I recommend this new baby set for a family member, friend, or your own baby.  I love bamboo as it is antibacterial, antimicrobial, and so very soft.  We use bamboo cotton for our cloth baby wipes (used in a Munchkin wipes warmer with essential oils, coconut oil and natural castile soap).  Bamboo is gentle to baby and feels nice in my hands when using it.  Regular cotton terry can often be scratchy and not the most comfortable to use.  The bamboo cotton set includes 1 hooded bath towel, 1 bib, and 2 wash cloths.  It is lovingly packed in a gift box with tissue paper and makes a beautiful gift.  It is very soft and the stitching and edges are precise and secure.  I have not found any flaws in the set I received.  I would have preferred the lettering under the bear to either be easier to read, or to have been not present on the material as it is a bit distracting.  I love the bear and think it is very sweet.  I have the blue set, the blue is not faded or too light.  It is a classy and attractive shade of blue.  I would have preferred the entire set to be blue, or perhaps blue with white bib and wash cloth as I am not fond of yellow.The hooded towel is a generous size and although this is best suited for newborn up to 12 months, this fits our smaller sized 18 month old.  I have not had this set for very long (a bit less than 2 weeks) so I cannot comment as to how long it will stay looking new, however it appears to be durable and if washed with gentle and natural based baby laundry soap, it should last a long time.  I recommend putting this in a delicates bag (such as for lingere, sweaters, or other delicates) and washing on gentle.  *I received this set complimentary for review, this is my honest opinion and evaluation.  This review is based on our family's experience of the set in the short amount of time we have had it.  I do recommend it, and like it.

This is a beautiful and well made skirt.  I have to say I was pleasantly surprised and am very pleased.  At the time that I received this, the largest available was xl.  I am wishing I got the xxl as I am entering my second trimester of pregnancy and sadly will not be able to comfortably wear this skirt for the duration of the pregnancy.I think this skirt is classy, feminine, and has a touch of vintage flair.  I adore the black and white stripe.  It reminds me of Audrey Hepburn, and would pair wonderfully with some bright red or pink shoes, with matching lipstick and black cat eye liner.  The skirt is thick and does not wrinkle easily.  The stitching and workmanship of the skirt is precise and lovely.  The zipper works as expected, without any hesitation.  There were no chemical odors and I did not find any flaws.  I recommend this skirt, it could be dressed up or semi-casual.  *This was a review sample, sent to me complimentary for my honest opinion.

These are a generous size and do help with freshening areas that need some help.  We have both of these hanging in our laundry room area in the back as our nearly 100 year old home has a musty aged odor at times.  I do not use chemical air fresher sprays, so this is a nice option.  These do not completely take away the odor, but definitely help.  Usually I have an essential oil (lavender or lemon oil) diffuser on in 1 or 2 areas of the home to also assist with any odor.I appreciate that these are in a burlap material and are about to be hung on a hook.  I would have preferred these to have the rope loops as other similar types of charcoal bags.  I also would have preferred these to not have any logo or writing on them.  Other than those small changes, I find that these work well for how we are using them.  **I was sent this product complimentary for my fair and honest review.  This is our personal opinion and experience.

Being a child of the 80s, I am very font of this nostalgic print.  I remember making mix tapes straight from the radio.  This is a colorful diaper and very suitable for a girl or boy (I think).  This diaper has been tested for a month.  To prep this diaper (and all our diapers) I washed on hot 5-6 times before use.  It is possible to prep this diaper less, however, I highly suggest the extra washes as this diaper has natural materials which contain oils that could lessen the absorbency and perhaps cause some mild repelling.  My baby has used this diaper frequently and we wash every night or every other night.  I do 2 full wash (hot) cycles (each with a cold rinse) and then a final (third) cold rinse.  I wash with Nellie's Natural Laundry Powder and a large pouch of soap nuts).  I hang the diapers to dry on my IKEA octopus hanger and dry the inserts on low to medium heat on the dryer (no dryer sheets) with 6 wool dryer balls.  The thing to note about this diaper is that since it is a sewn in insert (inside the pocket) it will take LONGER to dry.  Normally, my regular pocket diapers and covers take a short 8 hours / over night when hung immediately after washing on medium spin (we have a high efficiency washer without an agitator in the middle).  This diaper needs to be turned inside out and then hung.  It will most likely need 10-12 hours to dry when hung.  But to be honest, most cloth diaper users know that it is necessary to have at the very least, 24 cloth diapers to have enough to wash every other day (prolonging to wash longer than 3 days can cause some serious ammonia stink and set in stains) so for our family, we have other diapers that can be used while this one is drying.How this diaper is beneficial / different than others in our stash:This Happy Endings diaper is cute, but also functional and well designed.  I like having the option to put this in my diaper bag as a quick, already stuffed, diaper for on the go.  I also like how I can add an additional insert for increasing absorbency.  This is a fantastic night time option as well as perfect for long distance car rides when baby falls asleep.  The insert on this diaper is fluffier / thicker than my other charcoal bamboo / microfiber inserts, and while some may not like the added bulk, I welcome it.  My little one drinks a lot of water and so is quite a heavy wetter.  This "night night" insert is slightly larger / wider as well.  (as seen under another non night night insert from this same company)This diaper has has a sewn in 4 Layer soaker cream colored insert (2 layers of bamboo/2 layers of microfiber) as mentioned above.  I love the inner lining on this diaper.  It is a deep grey which not only makes it stain resistant, but the charcoal bamboo fleece is antimicrobial and antibacterial.  It is gentle on baby's skin as it does not keep wetness against their skin (which would cause rashes).I love the gentle fold over elastic / double leg gussets.  Crazily enough, not all brand of diapers have this.  (They really should.)  In my diaper reviews, I tend to compare these with brands I have (which are mainstream brands that other cloth diaper users might be wanting comparisons on as well). Our Bum Genius diapers do not have gusset, and this is the reason my love for Bum Genius has fizzled a bit  (I still love them, but they really need to improve the line with gussets). I have had some serious messes at the most undesirable times and places with my Bum Genius (at the eye doctor when I had both children and my husband was getting his eye checked and the bathrooms did not have changing tables.)  I would have been protected with gussets.  I also wish BG would improve their elastics, as even with normal, gentle, non bleach, non drier use, the elastics generally loosen and need replacing (by hand) after about 6 months to a year of use.  It is true, this Happy Endings diaper has only been used for a little over a month, however the structure of the elastics, as well as the added gussets seem to be superior to the BG.This diaper, and other Happy Endings diapers, have 3x3 adjustable rise snaps + hip snaps.  I love that the snaps cross over at the tabs (BG and many other brands do not cross over).  This is a big plus for our family! Often smaller babies need cross over tabs, and my 18 month old still uses this function. The snaps on this diaper function as my other diaper brands, and so far I have not had any splitting.This diaper is perfect for night time or day time.  You can use only the sewn in insert or add the additional insert.  I have not had any blowouts or leaking.  The stitching and overall construction of this diaper is nice and the price is reasonable at just under $15.  Sadly, more diapers are getting into the $20+ range, without necessarily being a better diaper.  I recommend this brand and really like the night time version of this diaper.*I did purchase this diaper at a discount, and this is my honest experience and review.  Please know that with cloth diapers, you may need to try a few different brands before finding the type or brand that works best for you and your baby.

This is another quality diaper from Happy Endings.  I honestly had no idea I would like this brand as much as I do.  The cloth diapering world is over run with the well known brand such as FuzziBunz, Bum Genius, Thirsties, and Rumparooz, that the lesser known diapers often do not get a chance to shine.  I have used cloth diapers on my little ones since they were about 3 months of age and have experienced most of the well known brands.  There are aspects of all diaper brands that are good and bad and some brands are definitely better than others.  Our favorites have been Thirsties and Bum Genius, with some recent additions from Buttons diapers.  The aspects of the above diapers that I like have been seen in Happy Endings, along with some improvements.Happy Endings diapers come in a variety of styles/types.  I like this feature as you can select a diaper for you and your babys individual needs, such as cater to the amount of absorbency inside (stuffing a pocket) or laying inserts on top of the diaper as an all-in-two version.  This diaper is a real cutie and reminds me a bit of the coveted Audrey diaper from Bum Genius (I will have it somedayif only people did not charge ridiculous prices for a harder to find print, sheesh, it is a diaper that will hold messy potty!)  At just under $15, this is a real gem of a diaper, and not just because it is adorable.This diaper has gussets!Bum Genius does not sadly and is one of the reasons I reach for this Happy Endings diaper along with my Thirsties and Buttons.  I select these over my Buttons diapers because the Buttons are basically covers that you snap a liner into.  Buttons (which is extremely similar to Best Bottoms brand) often bunch up on my baby and so those I end up using a hemp cotton prefold in, which is not always ideal.  So then, I end up reaching for Happy Endings diapers as they are super easy to use and so reliable.I like how they are different than my other brands because they have charcoal lining!Trust me, if you have not experienced charcoal lining, you are in for a treat.  In my experience, I rarely have to spray my charcoal lining diapers before washing.  Seriously, the solids come off so easy into the toilet.  (We are cloth- diapering mommys, we can talk freely here about mess cant we?) The charcoal bamboo is soft against babys skin, and does not hold wetness (which could cause rashes and discomfort).  The bamboo is antimicrobial and does not hold stink.  I absolutely love it.  The 5 layer charcoal bamboo insert is basically microfiber with charcoal bamboo on the outside (which makes it skin friendly).  You should never allow bare microfiber to be against babies skin as it absorbs to quickly and is harsh, which can dry babies skin and cause rashes.  This insert has 3 layers of microfiber between two layers of bamboo charcoal. Most cloth diapers come with microfiber inserts, and while microfiber is absorbent, to me it is rough and the material irks me when I touch it.  It sort of feels like Velcro to me and finger nails on a chalkboard.  But, when it is covered with bamboo charcoal, it is pretty amazing and works well for us.Better inserts!This diaper comes with a snap-in, 5 layer bamboo charcoal insert and has an extra pocket for stuffing is needed. I personally just add 1-2 inserts inside the pocket without laying anything on top, but with this diaper, customize it however works best for your baby.  In case you want to use this as an all-in-two diaper, here is how: the insert snaps into the top of the diaper which allows you to reuse the waterproof outer shell when only the insert is soiled (replace with another insert).This diaper has hip snaps and cross over tab snaps!This diaper is adjustable with 3x3 snaps + hip & crossover snaps, and fits babies 8-35 lbs. It is crazy, but many diapers do not have cross over snaps.  Bum Genius says they fit babies 8 lbs. and up, but we could not use them until our babies were about 11 lbs as we had slim belly babies.  My little one is 18 months and still utilizes cross over tabs.How long have I tested this diaper?? How do I wash this?I am extremely satisfied with this diaper.  The gussets are gentle against my babies legs and hold in messes.  The snaps are durable and have not cracked.  These diapers have been washed and used multiple times for a month (I always wait a fairly generous amount of time before posting a cloth diaper review since I would rather know how a diaper holds up for 1-2 months, instead of a mere week or two).  Cloth diapering can become expensive (at first) and I would hate to purchase multiple items only to hear that after a few short weeks the diaper does not hold up.  This diaper by Happy Endings has been thoroughly tested and loved.I prep my diapers with 5-6 hot washes BEFORE using (technically you can wash once before first use, but natural fibers have oils in them and it is best to fully remove them to increase absorbency).  Once we use the diaper, I wash diapers every night or every other night (using soap nuts and Nellies Natural Laundry Powder), and so when testing diapers, they get loved and used.  I wash 2 full cycles and then a final third cold rinse.This diaper still looks as great as it did when I received it.  The only difference is the charcoal lining tends to get white lint on it from time to time, as I use cloth wipes (baby wash cloths).  I keep a lint tape roller on hand for the extra fuzzies.  I do not dry my diapers in the machine.  I hang them on my IKEA octopus hanger.  These dry overnight.  The inserts dry quickly on low to medium heat with my wool dryer balls.*This was purchased at a discount for an honest review and evaluation.

Yodo makes a nice, budget conscious diaper bag.  They do still look like diaper bags and will not replace my love for Petunia Pickle Bottom and Storksak, but they are still a brand I recommend when you do not want to spend for a higher end bag, but yet want a quality bag that looks nice.  This diaper bag in blue is pretty and I love how the color is leaning towards a tiffany blue aqua.  The bag has accents of a blue toned silver which coordinates with the aqua.I have a large collection of diaper bags (larger than you would imagine as I mix and match according to my outfits, our activities that we have planned, etc.).  I have reviewed a few other products from this company and have been impressed.  The bags never smell like chemicals and the bags have precise stitching and overall construction.This diaper bag is spacious, yet remains lightweight.  It feels sturdy and has an assortment of pockets to suit even the over-packer.  I like that it is a glazed, glossy finish which makes it easy to wipe clean and makes me confident in rainy weather.  I normally use my PPB Cake bags most of the time, but when the weather is fickle, I need a bag that I can use when it is raining or when we will be at an event or activity where we need a bag that I do not have to worry about.  Although I never have set any of my bags on the ground, it is nice to know that this could be wiped clean if needed.  I would have preferred this to have feet on the bottom.I like how this bag has comfortable shoulder straps that are generous in length, as well as a messenger strap.  I appreciate that this included a changing pad and bottle bag.  I would have liked a hard wipes case to be included, but that is not a big problem.  This bag has several large outer pockets which make it handy for stowing snacks or a small teether or lovey toy.I recommend this bag and think it is a great option.  *I purchased this bag at a discounted price for an honest and thorough evaluation.  This was my personal opinion and experience with this bag.  I do want to note that my bag did arrived to me with a flaw on the lower area of the bag (a few pin holes and snagging).

I have the Aurora blue and I have to say the stock photo does not do this color justice.  The is far more beautiful and stunning in person.  It is a gorgeous almost tiffany blue aqua and is not the pale shade seen.  This ring is nicer looking than other silicone rings I have been seeing on Amazon and online. The ring is comfort-fit and slightly rounded and there are no sharp or abrupt edges.  There were no flaws to the silicone and the brand logo is very understated (which I appreciate).  I am a stay at home mom and generally only wear my wedding rings when we go out of the house, which for me, is 1-3 times per week.  (currently one car family for now)  I do not wear my wedding band or diamond engagement ring while cleaning, sleeping or showering, and with an 18 month old in diapers (and another on the way) i am not one to wear my nice rings with all the messiness that I often am cleaning up or experiencing (those of babies and toddlers know all THOSE kinds of messes far too well) And this ring is soft against baby, easy to wear and thankfully easy to CLEAN. :) I really like this ring and the size is great for me even as I am growing (I do not have to worry about my pregnancy causing me to have to refrain from wearing a ring (which might happen if/when I swell in my fingers).  *This was sent to me complimentary for an honest review and I truly think it is an excellent ring.

This ring is nicer looking than other silicone rings I have been seeing on Amazon and online.  I like how it is not two-tone or with a seam as some other brands apparently have (such as a grey with black stripe or blue with a stripe, etc.) I have noticed that those could potentially come apart as they appear to not be one continuous piece of silicone.  The storm grey is a perfect match to my husband's Titanium wedding band and looks believable from a few feet away.  The ring is comfort-fit and slightly rounded and there are no sharp or abrupt edges.  There were no flaws to the silicone and the brand logo is very understated (which we appreciate).  This is a great ring for those who work in a job where your finger or hand might get caught, (fireman, metal worker, cable line/ telephone line repair, construction worker, etc.) or just someone wanting something comfortable to wear to the gym (fingers gripping metal and weights).  It would be beneficial for bowlers or those who do sports.  My husband works in a busy hotel restaurant so this can potentially come in handy, but he mainly wears this to sleep (as his regular ring scratches his face with marks and sometimes small cuts on his forehead as he is a side sleeper and has his hand near his pillow/face).  He also wears this ring when doing recreational sports or working out.  *This was sent to me complimentary for an honest review and I truly think it is an excellent ring.

I always suggest trying natural supplements for assisting your body and mind. I am not fond of taking prescription medication unless absolutely necessary. St. John's Wort has been used for supporting a positive, healthy disposition and emotional well-being. Some people take this supplement as a preventative measure to keep their outlook on life pleasant and their mood happy. However some people that take it are trying to bring themselves out of a severely depressed state of being. It has been shown that St. John's Wort is as effective as some prescription antidepressants, and yet has fewer adverse side effects. This is a botanical herb (from the flower of the same name) and can be taken without a prescription.I personally had great results with taking St. John's Wort (not this brand but others) off an on over the years, but have not taken it since having my children, as in the last 5 years I had either been pregnant or breastfeeding and have always been leery of taking excess supplements unless directed by my doctor and absolutely necessary.  Since I am currently pregnant with my third child, I decided to have my husband try this product.  My husband has been taking this supplement daily for about 3 weeks.  He has not had any negative side effects.  He takes this in the evening with a few peanut butter Ritz cracker sandwiches and his other supplements.  It is possible that this is assisting him with mood and stress, but as with any supplement, I feel it is still to soon to accurately tell.  Most supplements need at least 2-3 months of persistent use for measurable improvements to be seen.My husband has been under a lot of stress with work, our decline in finances and the excessive need of expensive repairs on our home.  It is my hope that this might help him focus better, balance his mood, and have less stress.  *This was sent to me for honest review (at no charge) and this is his personal experience.

I did test this a few times for frothing milk in my coffee, and yes it works wonderfully, however I had other plans for this little gadget.  I already have a milk frother for our lattes, coffee and such, so I use this one by Kukpo to activate the saponin (suds, soap) in our soap berries / soap nuts.  Since we (my husband, myself and 2 little ones) are all sulfate and chemical free, and do not use traditional shampoo for our hair, my natural suds of choice is soap nuts.  My husband uses sulfate free shampoos with essential oils (sometimes I do as well, but I am picky)  I wash my hair in soap nut shampoo and even wash our cloth diapers and laundry in them (separately of course).  I have even made hand soap from soap nuts.  This frother is powerful and creates some nice suds.  This runs on 2 AAA batteries.To activate, I put about 6-15 soap nuts in warm water in a large pitcher and then use this Frother.  I was using the blender but that got a bit time consuming with cleanup and so I found that this was more convenient.  I like to add pure aloe vera to my soap nut shampoo for 2-3 times a week.  Once per month I add a flavored beer (such as pumpkin spice, raspberry, orange spice, chocolate, etc).  Beer adds a natural healthy luster to my hair and gives it added protein for strength.  I often add some amla and shikakai powder (Indian herb powder).This is a great frother and I use it several times a week. *I was sent this frother for evaluation and honest review.  Although I have had excellent results with my frother, my opinion and experience may differ from yours.

This is a fantastic product for the eye area and even the rest of my face.  I have tried a lot of these types of eye gels and a lot of them are similar.  I do like that this product is in an airless pump instead of a dropper bottle like a few of my vitamin c / hyaluronic acid / aloe based eye and face serums.The container is attractive with a nice label.  It is easy to dispense the product, and the airless pump keeps contaminants and light out of the product.  My particular bottle was fresh and feels nice on my skin.  I want to mention that this is not a cream as the description title would suggest.  This is indeed a gel and reminds me of aloe vera.  It is cooling and soothing and is not sticky or gummy.  I am able to use this before my makeup application without any concerns of uneven foundation.  This does not roll up on my skin prior to foundation application as some similar serums.  The fragrance is light and does not bother my nose when applied.I thought it was a nice addition for the company to add Frankincense to the product, which is a nice choice for a skin care product.  I use Frankincense in my natural, homemade based tooth pastes.  Frankincense is perfect for oral care as it has antiseptic qualities, and can assist with the prevention of and even heal existing cavities and oral infections.  When used in skincare, Frankincense can tone and tighten skin, and even help with smoothing fine lines.  This product has cucumber, aloe, vitamin e and eye bright, which seems to be in my other similar eye care products as well (all of which are beneficial for the delicate eye area and surrounding skin).  I liked how this product has Reishi which is not in my other similar skincare products.  Reishi is a type of mushroom that is often taken internally for boosting brain function, and is used for preventing and treating various diseases.  The use of this mushroom was used in ancient medicine and is gaining popularity today for anti aging and even cancer studies.I cannot make any claims to looking instantly younger, and I did not want to post a review until I had tried this several weeks (and in my case almost 2 months) but I do have to say it is a wonderful product and as good as (and perhaps significantly better) than some of the other brands I have tried.  The results of my using these types of serums have generally been good for other serums, but what I like about this one is the addition of the ingredients mentioned.  It seems the company has done some additional research and added some extra ingredients that can help with skincare and anti aging.  I still do have some darkening under my eyes, but that is due mainly to my lack of adequate sleep and genetics.  However for overall appearance of my skin (I use this lightly over my forehead, cheeks, neck, and area area) I do seem to have smaller pore size, softer skin and a healthy appearance.  Please note that I do drink a lot of water daily, never have smoked, and I am sulfate free, so I do not strip my skin with traditional soaps and chemicals.  I also try to apply argan, rosehip or jojoba oil at least once a week (often 2 times per week) after a deep cleanse with a sonic type brush.  For soap, I use a simple ingredient, all natural charcoal coconut based soap and konjac sponge.*I received this serum at no cost for an honest review and evaluation.  Please note that I only provide a good rating on items that I actual find beneficial to myself or my family.  It does not benefit anyone for me to provide a false review.

These are very comfortable pants.  I have the xxl in black.  I like these, they are breezy and perfect for lounging at home.  The material is thin, but soft and I have not had any issues with excessive wear.  I personally would not wear them out of the house as they do not look very flattering on me, but I wear these at home frequently. The waist looks incredibly small, but has a lot of stretch and fit me perfectly.  I am fairly tall at 5' 8 and these were long enough for me (in sock feet).  The seams and stitching on my pants is even and neat.  I can see these being well suited for yoga or relaxation exercise.  I highly recommend these pants.  *I received these as an evaluation sample at no cost for my honest review. I was really surprised at how much I like these pants as I have not worn anything of this style previously.

I like this spin mop and bucket set.  It is true, it may feel lightweight and may be on the cheaper side of materials, but I think it functions well.  I have used it several times and it is perfect for my needs.  I am a mommy of 2 small children that are walking and crawling on the floor and this cleans the floor while also allowing it to dry promptly (no over soaking the floor) so that they can walk on it again.  The light weight of the bucket is easier on my back even when it is full of water.  I often use one bucket for 2 small rooms and so this is easy to carry from one room to the next.We do not use chemicals for cleaning and so for this system I use my soap nuts that were soaked in hot water and then made into a liquid version (I use a milk frother to activate and make the foam).  I add some of that liquid to some hot water and fill this bucket to the recommended line.  Soap nuts are natural and low sudsing (so your floors won't have a sticky residue or need rinsing).  The water is not dirty in the picture, that is just the natural color of the soap nut water after it has settled.  For added scent you could use 2 drops of lemon or orange essential oil or even lavender.I like that the system includes 2 mop heads.  You can use one for dry mopping before you wet mop.  I have not had any shedding of the mop head and it was easy to snap together.  The handle easily screws together and has a foam grip for a comfortable hold.  I am 5' 9" and this was a bit on the short side for me to use, but I still like it.  I would have preferred to have a small extender (maybe 2-3 inches?) come with the mop (as an optional piece to use for taller users).The spinner works well and removes the excess water.  The mop head fits in the spinner but is a tight fit.  There is a locking mechanism at the bottom of the mop to make the mop go from spinning to stationary.  Over all this is a great mop for the price.  I am actually more likely to use this as it is easy to set up and break down each time.  The heads can be washed in the machine on delicate, and then I make sure the washer spins them mostly dry.  I am not yet brave enough to put the mop head in the dryer as I do not want to accidentally change the shape of the plastic.  I would not suggest this for cleaning a filthy home that perhaps you are restoring / renovating, as this might not perform well with heavy use, but for my needs it works great.  *This was sent to me as an evaluation sample, however this is my own personal experience and honest opinion.  Your experience may have been different than mine.

My husband takes one of these each evening with his other supplements.  He has not been using this long enough to see an increase of hair on his scalp, but supplements usually take weeks or months to show drastic improvements.  We do know that Biotin works for both of us.  We are trying natural methods for regrowing and thickening his hair that has thinned from stress and poor diet.  He also has some male pattern baldness as well.  He normally would take as many as 3 capsules of Biotin each evening, and so he is happy to try these instead since he already takes so many other vitamin supplements.  He thinks these Biotin Bursts taste delicious and I am hoping the ease of use, and the flavor will motivate him to take these regularly.  I tried one myself and agree it does taste good.  These are acai berry but taste a bit like grape in my opinion.  The chews are very fresh and soft which is maintained by the zip top resealable foil bag inside the box (and then individually wrapped).  These are not hard to chew and they do not stick to my teeth.  My husband and I recommend these.  *I was sent a box of 30 chews at no cost for an honest evaluation.

These grape teether toys are durable and cute.  The purple is bright with nice grooves for a nice sensation on baby's sore gums and teeth.  The green is a bright lime green and can easily be looped onto a toy leash / pacifier leash.  The silicone is food grade and I did not notice any strong odors with this set.  I like having the set of 2 so I can keep one in my bag and one clipped to the highchair when my baby is done feeding and needs to be entertained while we are doing dishes and cleaning up.  I have not yet tried putting these in the dishwasher, but I assume that these would do just fine on top rack in our munchkin dishwasher basket (where we put baby's dining ware).  I generally hand wash these but when we are on the go I clean with a disinfectant hand and face wipe.  My 18 month old likes chewing on these.  *I received these as an evaluation sample at no cost.  This is our personal and honest experience.

This is an incredible and PURE aloe gel.  Yes it does have a few preservatives at the end of the ingredient list, but that is necessary for this to have a decent shelf life.  It has much fewer ingredients than other brands I have tried.  I use this aloe gel everyday and for so many uses.  I use it on my face, on cuts and insect bites, I have used it for hair gel, I have used this for burns, etc.  It is a more liquid form of aloe than my previous brands.Baby Wipe Solution:My daily use of this is for my baby's cloth wipe solution.  We cloth diaper and use baby wash cloths in a Munchkin wipes warmer for wiping his bottom.  I use a few squirts of this aloe, Dr. Bronner's Baby Mild unscented castile soap, water, jojoba oil, argan oil, calendula oil, fractionated coconut oil, lavender essential oil and tea tree essential oil.  This is calming on his skin.Homemade Shampoo:Since I am sulfate free and do not use traditional shampoo, I use a mixture of soap nuts (activated in warm water and then used in my blender to make a frothy foam), water and aloe vera to wash my hair twice per week.  On the non shampoo days, I just rinse with water when I am showering.  Once a month I add a fragrantly smelling flavored beer to my wash mixture (such as pumpkin spice, raspberry, orange spice or even a chocolate brew.)This aloe is so nice and it does not have any fragrances or colors like the blue or green "aloe" I see at the local stores.  The only somewhat safe and somewhat pure aloe that I had been using was the "Fruit of the Earth" clear aloe.  However, it seems to have more chemical sounding ingredients: Aloe Vera Gel, Triethanolamine, tocopheryl acetate, carbomer, tetrasodium EDTA, DMDM hydantoin, diazolidinyl urea.  Some aloes have alcohol in them, can you believe it? This is alcohol free and so gentle and healing.I like that this InstaNatural aloe does with a pump, however after a few uses, the pump made the product squirt out fast and get on the counter and on my clothing sometimes.  So I decided to just use the flip top cap.  I love this product so much and although *I was sent this at no cost for my honest opinion*, I will be purchasing this brand of aloe from now on.  It is that good.  I am beyond impressed.

I like this toner, it does not make my combination skin dry, nor does it strip my skin to make it over produce oil in response.  It does not feel sticky on my face.  I am sulfate free and mainly use the oil cleaning method a few times per week to remove my makeup on the days I get out of the house.  I am a stay at home mommy to 2 little ones so when I do not leave the house my face is bare so it can breathe.  I do wash my face with a natural, simple ingredient charcoal, jojoba oil, calendula, aloe, and coconut oil based soap that is sulfate free and chemical free.  This toner is all natural except for the last few ingredients that are preservatives.I like to use this immediately out of the shower and lightly mist my face.  I let it soak in while I get dressed and then I apply vitamin c and hyaluronic acid serum each day (morning and night).  I only use this toner during the day.  It has a light citrus fragrance that is not over powering.  It does not irritate, sting or cause me any break outs.  I love the witch hazel, geranium essential oil, tea tree essential oil, aloe vera, chamomile and green tea added to the vitamin c toner.  Those are all ingredients I have on hand in my apothecary cabinet that are just lovely for my skin.  This makes my pores appear smaller and stay cleaner.  My skin is soft and feels refreshed.The spray is easy to use.  The only thing I did not like was the back of the bottle is hard to read due to the yellow and orange graduated, ombre like effect on the label.  *This was sent to me at no cost, for an unbiased and honest review and evaluation.  This is my personal experience and not everyone will have my results.

This is a nice product from InstaNatural.  The ingredients are of nice quality and I find that it makes my face stay clearer and have a natural, healthy glow.  The serum is bright orange, and while it does not color my face, I think I would have preferred it to be more clear and less sticky.  I do like the slight citrus fragrance.  I use this one mainly at night as it seems slightly stickier than other serums I have used.  Still, I have tried many C serums over the past 2 years and love how consistently good InstaNatural products are.  I apply this on a freshly washed face and finish with some Argan Oil or RoseHip Oil.This serum is packed with skin nourishing and healing ingredients.  Hyaluronic Acid and Niacinamide (B3) are 2 ingredients that I have had excellent results with.  I like having those ingredients included with my C serum so that I do not need to apply them separately.  The Niacinamide keeps my skin free of blemishes and lightens past acne red marks.  I am entering my early thirties and although I do not have wrinkles, I do have very large pores and some fine lines around my eye area.  I also have dark circles that I am trying to lighten.I like that this is in a dark amber glass bottle to block out light that may lessen the potency, and an easy to use dropper.  Despite this being a small bottle, it will last me a while as I do not need to use much.  I have tried this product for over a month and like it a lot.  I would prefer it to be less sticky.  Although the orange fragrance is pleasant, I would prefer it to be unscented.  Other than those aspects, I think this is a fantastic product and recommend it.  *This was sent to me for review at no cost to me, however this is my honest and unbiased feedback

This is a very classy scarf that would look nice on a man or a woman.  The size of the scarf is nice and wide, which I love.  It is soft and fuzzy with tassels on the end.  The weather here is still quite warm, but I know this will get a lot of use this winter.  I wear peacoats in the winter and this scarf will look very fetching.  I have a collection of vintage brooches and am excited to use one of my favorites with this when the weather gets frosty.  I like how this arrives in a gift box, it would be a nice gift for someone.  *This was sent to me as a review sample for an honest review.

This is a fantastic smelling (a hint of rich vanilla coffee--see the ingredients) mascara that has several lash fortifying and nourishing ingredients.  (natural based and botanical extracts and oils) This is not a dry, or overly waxy mascara.  My lashes are not crunchy or brittle feeling when this dries.  They stay full and soft.  It can smudge a bit at the end of the day (but to be honest, I have long days and generally do not go to bed (removing makeup at that time) until 2 am most nights--as this mommy of 2 little ones needs time to get chores, blogging and emails done).  I have some flaking under my eyes after a few hours, but not much to complain about.  I generally brush the little 2-3 flakes away when I see them, without disturbing the mascara on my lashes.  This is not waterproof but is water resistant.  I generally prefer water resistant as it is gentler to remove.  I oil cleanse my face and use either castile soap, African Black soap, or just plain jojoba, rose hip, or argan oil to remove makeup.  This removed easily when I wanted it to.I like the long and traditional bristle brush and often find these types work best for me.  I do have naturally long lashes and this did thicken them, but did not add length.  As mentioned above, this smells so nice and is so much better for the lashes than the chemical laden (sometimes paint like smelling) mascaras that are not so natural.  This is a smaller mascara tube, but that is actually a plus for me as I am bad about replacing mascara when it needs replacing.  I have about 10-15 mascaras in my rotation (varying from natural to chemical based) and they are all full sized.  It is nice to have a smaller tube to keep with me for travel, or even just to ensure I buy a fresher tube when needed.  You are actually supposed to toss mascara and eyeliner after 3 months, but to be honest, I keep them 6 months to a year.  This size will help me be better.I recommend this mascara (and the gel cream eyeliner from the same brand) and have been using it the past 2 weeks.  *I received this as a sample, however this is my honest opinion.

I am impresses with this eyeliner.  I frequently like to do a vintage inspired black cat eye look, and usually use my felt tipped Stila Stay All Day black liner (my "never fails me liner").  This gel/cream eyeliner by Endlessly beautiful works well depending on the type of brush used.  I have several options ranging from thin lip / eye liner brushes, long and wide  flat brushes, and short dense ones.  I selected the one with the silver end.  It is actually a lipstick brush, but is firm and dense and creates a neat line.  It is a little too easy to use too much product as this product is ultra creamy,  so I end up using the edge of the jar to skim some excess off the brush before application.  I then gradually make my line thicker or darker as desired.I tested this in weather that was early Fall, so it was still warm outside but not the 85-95 degree weather we had been having.  (so this stayed put despite my natural oily lids).  I think this may be even better for me to use this winter to ensure it does not smudge from the excess heat.  I wore this with frosty pale pink lids and used the natural mascara of this same brand.  I am new to Endless Beauty, but am impressed.  I have been sulfate free, and almost completely free of chemical based products for all cosmetics, except for some of my makeup.  Mascara and eyeliner have been 2 products that are difficult for me to find satisfactory in the natural category.  I usually have smudging or the product appears too light in pigment.  This is a dark black which is exactly what I want.  I love how it is made with 100% natural and partially organic Ingredients.  Several of these ingredients are very nourishing for skin and hair follicles.  (CastorSeed Oil, Coconut Oil, Grape Seed Oil, Vitamin E, and various botanical extracts: Oregano Leaf Extract, Thyme Extract, Cinnamon Bark Extract, Rosemary Leaf Extract, Goldenseal Root Extract.) I already use castor oil, vitamin e, and coconut oil for my face and hair, and am happy to see these ingredients listed.  Castor oil ad Coconut oil are fantastic for strengthening hair follicles and often thicker lashes can result from the frequent application of these oils.I have used this liner several times and recommend it.  *I received a sample jar at no cost in exchange for my honest review.

My husband uses 1-2 drops of this liquid Biotin in his daily coffee. It is a natural Vanilla flavor and so easy to use (we keep it right next to the machine).  This surprisingly does not add any strange texture or flavor to his coffee. He does use milk or creamer, and a touch of sugar. I have also tried this alone as a daily supplement and find that it strengthens my nails.  My hair is already super thick and long, so I cannot comment on improvement of my hair growth.  My husband has a very thin patch in the back of his head from stress and mail pattern baldness.  He has been using various natural based hair vitamins and some minioxidil  drops each evening for the past year.  I cannot comment as to whether this would help him on its own, but the combination of this and other products keep his patch from getting worse.  I definitely recommend it as it is easier (and much more pleasant) to take than pills.  I love that it is USA made and contains other hair, skin and nail nourishing properties.  *I received this at no cost for an honest review.

I like the over all style of these sunglasses as I am a fan of vintage inspired fashion and accessories.  They are a bit big for me, however they are very comfortable to wear.  I like the simple black color, but would have preferred them to be a shiny black instead of a matte finish.  They come with a nice draw string storage bag  (with an unfortunate placement of barcode sticker on the back of the bag that I have yet to be able to fully remove without sticky paper residue) and a microfiber cleaning cloth.  I do prefer to also use a clam shell case for glasses, in addition to a bag, and would recommend the company consider including one. I was surprised that these were sent in only a bubble mailer envelope with no box to protect these from being crushed in transit.  They did arrive safely without any issues.  These did not have any cheap plastic odor.  I like how they are polycarbonate, (which I have had for my own prescription eye glasses) as is light and scratch resistant.  I  have only had these a few days, but so far they function as expected.  The price is very reasonable.  *I did receive these as a sample for my honest inspection, evaluation and review.

I love these inserts.  We use a variety of cloth diaper types ranging from Bum Genius 4.0 one size snaps, Kawaii, Coqui Baby, Happy Endings, Thirsties hemp cotton refolds with covers and a few others.  These are super absorbent and very trim (even when I put 2 of these in his night diaper).  They feel much nicer in my hand than bare microfiber (bare microfiber tends to feel like hook and loop / Velcro at times and often attracts lint, hair and threads--not favorable).  Microfiber however, is a good material for absorption.  These inserts exceed my expectations and are better than traditional bare microfiber inserts.  These have the softness and extra holding power of bamboo.  These inserts are made up of 3 layers of bamboo terry and 2 layers of microfiber, and are antibacterial and antimicrobial.  I have yet to have any issues with residual staining or odors.  I am pleased with the generous size and overall construction of these inserts.  These have not become misshapen nor have they had any noticeable shrinking. They fit well in my pocket diapers and I have often paired one with a cotton hemp (size 1) Thirsties prefold for night use in a pul cover.I prepped these thoroughly before using by washing in the machine on hot for about 5 cycles.  This ensures that they absorb the maximum amount of liquid, and not repel or leak.  I dry these on low to medium heat in my dryer and have not had any issues.  We use Nellies Natural Laundry powder and I wash my diaper laundry either daily or every other day.  Any stains with liners (none yet for these particular ones) or cloth diapers, we brighten in the sun.  We never use bleach or brighteners on our diapers or inserts.I am pleased with these inserts and recommend them.  *I received some samples of these inserts for my thorough testing and honest review.

These are a great size for newborns, but also for my 17 month old cloth diapered toddler and my 4 year old.  We use one of these inserts for boosting absorbency of diapers for our toddler, but these are also a perfect fit in our 4 year old's night undies (Super Undies brand for bed wetting).  My daughter is 99% potty trained for day, but at night she has a tendency to wet the bed (most likely due to her always drinking so much water before bed and stalling for more a few times).  We use the cotton lined Super Undies that have a pocket for increasing absorption.  We love these inserts for that purpose.  For my 17 month old, I use this on top of larger charcoal inserts for when we need extra absorbency but not the added bulk of 2 large inserts.  I have used one of these in between a Thirsties hemp cotton prefold and then I lay the prefold inside a pul waterproof Thirsties cover (or other PUL brand cover).  These are great for both of my children.These wash well and dry very quickly.  They are antimicrobial and do not hold odors.  The dark color and type of fabric is stain resistant.  They are stitched neatly and seem like they will hold up well to daily washing and wear.  They do need to be prepped (hot wash cycles) several times before use (I generally do 4-6 cycles of hot wash with cold rinse).  They dry quickly by air dry or machine.  Ours do tend to get white lint frequently from washing and drying with our white baby wash cloths (which are solely used for cloth baby wipes in our warmer).  I have nothing negative to say about these.  They work well and the price listed is reasonable.  I do wonder why perhaps an even 10 are not included in the set, but its is not an issue.  *These were sent to me as a review sample, and this is my honest review and personal opinion.

AI2TM (All-in-Two) Charcoal Bamboo Diaper comes with an absorbent snap-in 5 layer bamboo charcoal insert and an extra pocket for your extra heavy wetter. Trim All in One design with adjustable Small, Medium, Large 3x3 snaps + hip snaps, fits babies 8-35 lbs.This is a great diaper that is very easy to use.  It is an "all in two diaper system" that includes a charcoal bamboo covered microfiber insert that snaps into the top of the diaper. This is also a pocket diaper that can be stuffed with an extra insert for overnight use and heavy wetters.  The idea of the top layered insert is almost like using a waterproof outer shell (cover) with an insert.  I use Thirsties covers with hemp cotton prefolds or charcoal liners and this is a similar idea.  When only the insert is soiled (but not soaked through or messy anywhere else) you can remove and add a clean one.  I personally do not use this method for these all in two diapers as I cannot wipe the cover clean.  My Thirsties (and other PUL waterproof covers) are obviously wipeable on the inside and seem better suited for this idea.  But if it works for your baby (perhaps a younger baby) then feel free to d what works.  For my little guy, (at night, extended length outings, or long car rides) we use a charcoal insert on the inside pocket and snap one on the top and when he has used the diaper, I rinse with the diaper sprayer (if needed) then separate all the inserts and put in our dry, closed diaper pail (using a Planetwise pail liner inside).  As seen in the stock picture, when using the snap on insert, there is some overlap over the tummy guard strip, and since we use a pocket insert as well, we fold about 2 inches under in the front for our little guy to allow the stay dry strip to keep his tummy dry as he has always been a tummy sleeper.  This also gives even more absorption where he might need it.  For casual day use, we just snap one on top, and do not stuff any insert since he gets changed every 2-4 hours.This has a very soft lining, it is the same charcoal fleece that is used on the inserts.  As mentioned, the inserts are a mix of charcoal bamboo and microfiber (5 layer charcoal bamboo with 3 layers of microfiber between two layers of bamboo charcoal). I have used these type of inserts for several months and prefer them to the usual bare microfiber.  Bamboo Charcoal has antibacterial qualities, is soft, resistant to staining, highly absorbent, and wicks moisture from skin.  The only somewhat issue (but not a reason to dislike) is that I often get white lint all over the inner liner and insert.  I am thinking it is from some of my cloth baby wipes (wash cloths) that are a bamboo cotton terry material.  The bamboo charcoal attracts the white fuzzier.This diaper has double gussets with soft covered elastic! LOVE! I always prefer diapers with gussets and wish our Bum Genius one sized diapers had them.  We love Bum Genius and most of our rotation is the snap 4.0 Bum Genius, but we have had messy problems around the legs a few more times that I would like to remember.  This diaper has been used about 5 times so far and we have not had any issues. My son is 17 months and about 22 pounds, with plump cherub baby legs.  We do not have any issues with irritation from the elastic.This diaper is cute for a boy or girl.  The background on this particular one is black and the star are very bright.  The yellow is slightly neon.  This is designed to fit babies 8-35 lbs.  It has 3 rows of 3 snaps as well as hip snaps.  (great feature)  This diaper washes well and the charcoal insert dries incredibly fast.  We hang our cloth diaper covers and shells on a delicates hanger (we have the octopus from IKEA) and sun diaper outside to freshen, dry and lift any staining on the white inner lining diapers.  I dry the inserts on medium heat in our dryer.  I suggest thoroughly prepping the diaper and inserts before using  For natural fibers, I usually wash on hot for about 4-6 cycles before using to allow for best absorbency.  We use Nellies natural laundry powder or soap nuts to wash diapers.I recommend the Happy Endings AI2 charcoal diaper.  It is holding up well after several prep washes and daily washing (we wash either every day or every other day and do a full cold cycle wash, cold rinse, then laundry soap wash hot, rinse cold, then extra rinse cold.)  We have not had any issues with odors with this diaper.  *I was sent one diaper in the stars pattern to review.  This is my honest opinion.

This is actually my first experience with a fitted type of diaper.  I have tried various brands of diapers and most everything from prefolds (hemp cotton Thirsties) with snap covers, Pocket diapers (micro fleece/ microsuede, microfiber inserts, hemp/charcoal/bamboo/cotton), all in ones, all in twos, etc.  I always prefer natural fibers for diapers.  This is a very soft and well constructed diaper and I am impressed with it.  It is 55% hemp 45% organic cotton and naturally anti-microbial.  It softens after multiple washes.  I prepped this diaper by washing on hot with Nellies Natural Laundry powder and did about 5 cycles.  I am used to prepping with multiple washes as I am growing my collection of hemp cotton prefolds and inserts.  This is a one sized diaper and fits approximately 8 to 38 pounds. The snaps are sturdy and adjust to a variety of shapes and sizes with 4 rise settings. There are 2 inserts: 1 shorter sewn-in (hourglass)  and 1 long snap-in insert (a generous 20 inches) with a unique cover flap that protects baby from the back of the snaps.  I love how these have the similar warranty that my Bum Genius diaper have, a full 12-month product replacement warranty.I use a Coqui PUL waterproof cover or one of my Thirsties covers.  (Love the Coqui ones as they are a seemingly more durable PUL material, however they do not have gussets like the Thirsties).  I find that this Bel Canto diaper works wonderfully as our night time diaper.  We add a newborn size charcoal insert inside this for added absorption.  You may not need to add this, but our 17 month old still breast feeds 1-3 times during the night, and so in the morning he has a really wet diaper.  This holds it all and we have not had any leaking.  We tuck in all of the Bel Canto fitted (under the pul cover) so that nothing wicks out.It has cross over tabs and as mentioned, a generous 4 rows of snaps for the rise.  The diaper is a natural cream color and is trimmed in a sage green.  The diaper feels well crafted and is one you will want to have in your rotation (perhaps maybe 2 or 3).  My 17 month old is roughly 22 lbs, see below for how these fit on him.  The orange cover is also from Coqui Baby and a great choice.  *I was sent one fitted Bel Canto 2.0 diaper for an honest, unbiased review.

This is a great diaper and has been serving us well for the past few weeks.  We wash every night or every other night, so this has had plenty of time on my little one's bottom.  When this arrived, I removed the inserts and separated them from the diaper and put this in the washing machine to prep.  Most diapers should be washed several times before using to get out any residual oils and chemicals, as well as increase the absorbency.  I usually wash in hot water (rinse cold) and then do 3-4 of those complete cycles.  I use Nellies natural laundry powder and sometimes soap nuts.  These are microfiber inserts so they do not need to be washed as many times as my hemp and organic cotton.  These come with a large insert that adjusts in size with snaps, as well as a smaller, newborn sized insert that can be used with the larger one to use over night or for heavier wetters.  I personally prefer hemp and organic cotton as microfiber feels a bit icky to my hands, but I am used to using it as we have used Bum Genius diapers with our daughter and now with our son.  Also, microfiber does absorb well, so I can understand why it is so frequently used with various diapers.  Being that this is a pocket diaper, you could switch out inserts with your desired material if you desire.  I often use a Thirsties hemp cotton prefold in size one, fold it over, and put the small infant microfiber insert inside the prefold, and stuff the pocket.This diaper has been washed multiple times and has not faded or shown any signs of defect or wear.  The stitching seems well done and the diaper feels well constructed.  The diaper does have a 3 month warranty.  I feel that is a little short of a timeframe, but it is still good to have.  Our Bum Genius has probably to most impressive warranty I have seen: they will guarantee their diapers for one year from the date of original purchase of new diaper.  These look similar to our other cloth diapers and the snaps work well.  I do like how Simba & Mama diapers have a cross over snap as both my little ones had to wait to use the Bum Genius until they were about 3 months of age due to their slim bellies.  The tabs are stretchy and sturdy with each diaper having a slightly different shade for their tabs as the rest of the diaper.  The color of my diaper was orange and I would describe the main area to be a creamsicle orange color, with the tabs being a brighter orange. (described as gold in the description).  It would be nice for a boy or a girl.I like how wide and easy the diaper is to stuff.  This allows for customizable stuffing depending on how much your baby or toddler needs.  You can put 2 large inserts if you need, or a prefold, or a hemp or charcoal insert if you like.  I like how it has the tummy guard (like our Bum Genius) as both my little ones have always been tummy sleepers, even in the wee months.  This diaper has white micro suede inner fabric which is soft and wicks moisture, helping to keep your baby feeling dry and with less irritation.  We keep our diapers bright white and fresh by drying outside in the sunshine (and even on cloudy days).  To extend the life of your diapers, do not machine dry the actual diaper (only the inserts).  The leg elastic openings are comfortable and have not left any marks on my baby's cherub thighs, nor have we had any leaks.  I generally prefer double leg gussets with diapers, however not all my diaper brands have them, and so far I have not had any issues with messes.  To give you an idea on fit, my baby boy is 17 months and roughly 22 lbs.  When using the Simba and Mama inserts, we use the large one snapped and the newborn one as well.Overall, I think this is a great diaper and I like how Simba and Mama includes a matching mini wet bag and fleece liner.  The wet bag can fit one diaper and is smaller than other wet bags I have used.  I had the perfect idea for it when it arrived.  It fits all of my breast pump parts for my electric single pump (bottle as well).  I am thrilled and the orange color looks great with the lime green on my pump.  The fleece liner is a cute daisy pattern (and I assume each diaper has a different pattern).  This is a micro fleece and allows liquid to go through the diaper and catch the solids.  This keeps the diaper stain free and easier to clean.  It is also fantastic for when you need to use diaper ointments.  We try to use cloth diaper friendly creams and ointments when possible, however, even those that are oil based could potentially build up and cause slight repelling.  I always recommend using a liner and so happy to have one included.  For the price of the diaper, 2 inserts, a liner and wet bag, this is a nice set.  I also love how Simba and Mama donates a diaper to a Mama and baby in need.  I would have preferred this diaper to have been made in the USA.  I recommend this diaper and find that it suits our needs.  *I received a sample diaper for the purpose of an honest review, all thoughts are my own.

Nine Things About the Movie "Blackhat"1. This was directed by Michael Mann, who is probably most famous for his 1995 crime classic "Heat". And "Blackhat" definitely has Mann's trademark cool look and feel. But something went very wrong somewhere. The movie seems like it was made by someone pretending to be Michael Mann.2. It's about a mysterious computer hacker attacking various places around the world for unknown reasons. The Chinese and American governments get together to catch the bad guy. In order to do that, they must release a buff, hunky computer hacker named Nicholas Hathaway from jail.3. This film is great proof that a movie can be complicated without actually being smart.4. There is a lot of cyber-jargon used in this movie. Computer experts say it's pretty accurate. They're the only ones that will know, because the movie doesn't really try to explain anything.5. Every 20 minutes or so, the movie slows down because the heroes have run out of leads. So Hathaway will look confused for a minute, get the "light bulb" look, and then tell everybody of an idea he just had that will lead the heroes down a new path. This path will last for about 20 more minutes. Repeat this step for about two hours, and the movie is over.6. There's also a completely predictable and unnecessary romance that develops between Hathaway and a teammate. It's supposed to add some emotional tension to the group, but all it really does is bring the movie to a grinding stop, wasting any momentum that the movie had built up.7. As the movie progresses, it gets more action-packed but less believable. The plot holes get bigger. And for an MIT computer hacker spending years in jail, Hathaway is surprisingly good in gunfights and knife battles.8. This movie was not only the first box-office flop of 2015, it's one of the biggest box-office flops in history. A week after being released in US theaters, its scheduled release in Australia was canceled - which is where the star, Chris Hemsworth, is from.9. This could have been a good movie. I don't know what happened. But in the end, it's just a way for computer geeks to fantasize that they're a sexy action hero with a girlfriend.

Nine Things About the Movie "Annie" (1982)[After watching the 2014 version of "Annie" I decided tonight to go back and watch the original 1982 version again. I hadn't seen it since I was a kid, and I remember loving it when I was little. This review reflects my adult perspective on the revisiting. I realize that this review will make a lot of die-hard fans very angry with me.]1. What did I just watch? OK, the songs are just as catchy as they were. And fine, Carol Burnett still rules.2. But the movie itself? The movie is utterly ridiculous. And weird. And there is entirely too much dancing. Most kids today wouldn't have it.3. I realize that this movie is based in the Depression, and is based on the original comic, which had different social standards. But I still find the movie disturbing in ways that were completely over my head when I was 11.4. This movie is blatant capitalist propaganda. It openly worships money and power, and demonizes the poor. It even manages to make fun of communism.5. I was horrified to now understand the context in which the song "Tomorrow" was used - to encourage the President of the United States to distract poor people from paying attention to their situation.6. In this movie, money is always the solution, and people are essentially property.7. Besides being classist, the movie is sexist and racist.8. The character of Punjab is a car crash of gasp-inducing stereotypes.9. But they all smile and sing about it, so that counts for something, I guess.

Nine Things About the Movie "Cut and Run"1. This is the final movie of Ruggero Deodato's so-called Amazonia Trilogy (after "Jungle Holocaust" and "Cannibal Holocaust").2. "Cannibal Holocaust", which is about a group of Western journalists being tortured and killed by savage natives of the Amazon, was so infamous that there was demand for a sequel. But Deodato didn't want to make "Cannibal Holocaust 2". So he made "Cut and Run", which is about a group of Western journalists filming drug runners being tortured and killed by savage natives of the Amazon. See the difference there?3. The plot consists of about three different stories that are as lost and confused as the journalists in the jungle. One of the stories is about a father and his missing son. One of the stories is about the cocaine trade. And one of the stories is a cheap rip-off of "Apocalypse Now". None of the stories are complete, nor do they mix well.4. 80's teen idol Willie Aames is in this movie. In clean-cut America, his good looks may have distracted everybody from his acting ability. But in Venezuela (where the movie was filmed), his terrible overacting made me laugh out loud.5.  Actually, a lot of this movie made me laugh out loud. All the acting is bad, the story is ludicrous, and the gore is everywhere.6.  Speaking of gore, this is Deodato we're talking about here. The only reason you watch one of his movies is to watch blood and guts and spears and knives. What's awesome is how elaborate all the decapitation and mutilation gore is, but when someone gets shot, they just fall over with no bullet holes.7. The movie is perhaps most notable for having the best depiction of a man being ripped in half by a jungle rope trap.8.  A young Eriq La Salle has a small role as a pimp, dressed all in purple. He later became the well-known and respected actor in the series "ER".  And the guy that plays the mutant Pluto in "The Hills Have Eyes" is here, too. He just pops up out of the water every now and then and kills someone.9. Make no mistake, this is a bad movie. But for fans of bad movies, it's worth checking out. And while it doesn't have the kick of "Cannibal Holocaust", followers of Deodato's career need to put this on their shelf.

[NOTE: I tried very hard not to give away spoilers in this review. If you want to see this movie, see it before you learn the actual story.]1. Most people (including myself) thought the trailer to this film was kind of vague and hard to remember; you couldn't really tell what it was about. People would say, "'Foxcatcher'? That's that weird movie about wrestling, right? And Steve Carell sure looks strange." But now I understand why. It's almost impossible to summarize the movie.2. The actual plot is easy to explain - two brothers, Dave and Mark Schultz, are Olympic gold medalists in wrestling. The younger one, Mark, is trying to get out of his brother's shadow and become his own person. Mark meets this really strange millionaire, John du Pont, who invites Mark to start a wrestling team on his ranch, and train for the next Olympics. Things don't go as planned.3. The plot is not what the movie is actually about, though. This is a subtle movie where some key points are shown through long, non-verbal scenes, or through short, almost throw-away lines of dialogue.
