So, just for fun, I looked up 1620 and found out that in July of that year there was a huge massacre of Protestants in the border region between Switzerland and Italy. Hundreds of people were just dragged out of their houses and killed. Such information definitely helps to put things in perspective for the voyage of the Mayflower. Things obviously were generally bad in Europe for Protestants at that time. No wonder the Pilgrims decided to risk everything and take their chances in a completely new and potentially hostile environment.The above is just one example of the sorts of relationships this book helps reveal.  I am finding this book to be both fascinating and highly entertaining.

I add a few drops of API Tap Water Conditioner to a small amount of water in my bathroom sink to rinse the chlorine out of my swimsuit.  I decided to try this because I was really irritated at how expensive swimsuit rinses are when they have the same stated purpose as this product: removing chlorine.  I swim three times a week, and therefore was going through a lot of the swimsuit rinse product, which is far more expensive due to both the basic price (per volume unit) and the amount that the manufacturers recommend using.A few drops of API Tap Water Conditioner completely remove the chlorine scent from my swimsuits, and (as far as I can tell) the product does absolutely no harm to the swimsuit fabric/dye.

I don't object to sensual content.  Honest.  If I did, I would have never bought this set.  But, that said, this set is just a baby step away from soft porn. If you're just looking for the sexy part and don't care too much about the plot part then you might like this set. I personally like a strong storyline and characters that I care about in the books that I read. To me, most of these stories were disappointingly short with little character development. Returned for a refund.

Katie Stewart has a truly original voice.  In Treespeaker, she creates a solidly realized imaginary world populated by characters that are well-drawn and all too human.  One can easily imagine that the world of the Arrakeshi people is not too unlike the world of actual Iron Age societies who populated the forested regions of the world in times gone by.The hero is Jakan, a sort of shaman, whose power to foresee the future and heal the wounded is derived directly from his pure faith in the forest god Arrakesh.  He is often tormented, and filled with self-doubt in his quest to do the right thing, but nevertheless, his faith carries him along the path that he believes that Arrakesh wants him to follow.The world of the Arrakeshi is horribly disrupted by the arrival of a man who, by all outward appearances, is good and charming.  Jakan is the only one who seems to realize that this man is not who he appears to be, and that he constitutes a huge threat to the world of the Arrakeshi.  Jakan pays a huge and horrible price when he attempts to warn his fellow villagers about the danger that has come into their midst.This is not the usual fantasy story that features knights and dragons. My only criticism is that I wish that some of the characters that were introduced in the last third of the book were a bit more fully developed. But, to be fair, maybe I just wanted the story to last just a bit longer.If you're in the mood for a truly original bang-up good fantasy story, Treespeaker might just be the book for you.

The Quartet ReWritables Mini Dry-Erase Marker set is a great concept but poorly executed.Pros:None that I can think of...  Oh.  How about this:  The black marker writes dark enough that it can be read from across the room.  Whooo Hooo!And, wow, I just thought of another one: The erasers work!  Stunning accolades, for sure.Cons:The yellow might as well be invisible, and the rest of the colors are too pale to be read from more than a few feet away. As I noted above, the only marker that can be read from a distance is the black.The magnets are so weak that they are close to being useless.  I have a Quartet ReWritables Daily Quick List  on my refrigerator door, along with the black marker.  When the door is closed the marker slides down the door and drops onto the floor.  I tested the magnets on the other markers and they were just as bad. The only solution that I can see is to super-glue a decent magnet to the black marker.Disappointing, to say the least.Update, June 2014: Even after I glued the magnet to the black marker, I was still not happy with it.  Within a very short time the color in the marker faded, as if it was already running out of ink.  I ditched the set and replaced it with Low-Odor Dry Erase Markers, Ultra-Fine Point, Assorted Colors, Set of 8.

The product is made of glass, not plastic, and the markings are clear.  The glass is thick, and it seems to be very sturdy.  I have only washed the shot glass by hand, so I do not know if the markings will fade when washed in a dishwasher.

The Ziploc Vacuum bags and pump work are a great way to extend the life of your favorite foods.I have been using the Reynolds 00590 Handi-Vac Vacuum-Sealing Starter Kit for the past 6+ years. I primarily use it for my cheeses. On average I have 5-7 varieties of gourmet cheeses and 3-4 varieties of cooking cheeses (block & grated) in my refrigerator, but being the only cheeseaholic in the family, I had been finding that my cheeses were getting spoiled faster than I could consume them. I toyed with the idea of a plug-in vacuum sealer, but it was just too inconvenient and un-appetizing after a good wine night. :o)  I had been using the Vacu Vin Wine Saver Pump with 2 x Vacuum Bottle Stoppers - Black to remove air from my wine bottles and had experienced great results, so when I found the Handi-Vac, I was overjoyed. The Handi-Vac has worked and continues working very well to extend the life of my cheese. It has just but one flaw  it uses 6 AA batteries. Batteries would last me on average 5 months with 5-6 weekly usages.As I started running out of bags, I came across the Ziploc bags which were cheaper and seemed to work similarly, however, they were incompatible with my Handi-Vac pump. I saw Handi-Vac to Ziploc bag adapters selling for about $20 and decided against them. I picked up a Ziploc starter bag from my local big-box and tried the manual pump  it worked even better than I expected. The manual pump is super effective and, unlike my electric pump, is only constrained in suction power by the tolerances of the pump construction and my strength. I was able to successfully seal a glass bowl to the point where the plastic bag was undistinguishable from the glass surface  and the seal held!I have bought a few starter kits for friends and family who love it, but sometimes complain about the seal not being effective. 99% of these complaints stem either from not sealing the zip properly, over-filling the bags or incorrect bag storage. Plan to use only 50-60% of the bag capacity, press the zip against your counter to seal it and keep liquids stored upright so that the liquid is not constantly hitting against the seal or zip.Besides cheeses, I use the bags for nuts and exotic dried fruits (figs, etc.). I have never lost a seal under proper usage/storage. The few times it failed was when I have accidentally punctured the bag through abrasion with other items  storage containers, refrigerator compartment doors/drawers, etc.I have successfully resealed the bags multiple times as I consume my cheeses. I have also rinsed and reused the bags especially when using with dry foods and they seemed to hold up well for one more cycle. I do not re-use any bags that have been used for soft, oily cheeses or liquids.Refills available in quart and gallon sizes.A definite Recommend! Great value for your money.You are now free to buy that large block of 24 month aged Parmigiano Reggiano! ;o)

303 is one of my favorite cleaning/polishing/protecting companies and the Quick Wax is no exception. It is a Carnuba wax based product and does an excellent job of polishing and protecting.I have been using  Meguiar's G18216 Ultimate Liquid Wax - 16 oz. and it has been working well for me. Without full stripping down the wax or cleaning with a clay bar, I tried the 303 on my truck after a regular wash. Having used 303 products previously, I know a little goes a long way, so I used the wax sparingly and it surpassed expectations  I definitely felt that the shine/gloss was deeper than what I have been getting with the Meguiars.My favorite Quick Wax feature  it is excellent at removing water spots.Pros:* Easy spray-on application* Great price* A little goes a long way* Can be used on Gel Coat, Clear Coat, Paint, Fiberglass, Plastics, Clear Plastics, Chrome and Stainless Steel* Formula provides UV protectionCons:* Carnuba wax based formula, versus Silicone wax, builds up over time and has to be stripped to regain the deep shine

There is a newer version of this drive which is near identical to this drive and the firmware enables slightly faster read/write speeds -WD My Passport Ultra 2 TB Portable External Hard Drive, Black (WDBBKD0020BBK-NESN).This is my 4th WD Passport drive and my first WD USB 3.0 drive. I use my Passport drives to backup my data/documents. I backed up my 1 TB video archive at transfer speeds as high as 100 mb/s. Read speeds were also in the same range - 110-115 mb/s.My earliest WD Passport drive (160 GB/USB 2.0) is about 6 years old and still works well. WD drives are an ideal backup drive because of their portability and reliability.The only think I miss are the custom neoprene cases that WD used to offer with the early Passport drives. Guess since the prices are about one third of the 2009 drives for 15x the capacity, I should just pony up the 5-6 bucks for the AmazonBasics Hard Carrying Case for My Passport Essential or the Western Digital My Passport Carrying Case - Black. ;o)Recommended - but only if cheaper than the new 2015 version.

I saw these loafers on a deals site and since I love Varvatos shoes decided to check them out. The deal on Amazon seemed too good to be true - a Varvatos leather loafer for 37 bucks?? With free shipping and returns?? I was skeptical, but decided to take a chance - Hey! What did I have to lose?The shoes arrived a day later and I was glad I took the chance. They are very well finished suede leather lined loafers with great attention to detail - for e.g., the leather extends to the top of the sole for a semaless finish, stiching along the sole of the feet and the inner liner is excellent.The loafers, keeping with the Hipster style, seemed a little narrow but they accomodated my broad feet just fine. The fit, for me, was perfect and they were nearly as comfortable as my other $300 Varvatos pair. I field test every shoe by wearing them around the house - this was the first pair that I wore and walked out of the house - the price-point might have had something to do with that too ;o). I was on my feet for 10 hours that day and my feet did not get uncomfortable nor did I get any shoe bites - a rare thing for an unbroken shoe!I wear a size 9.5 and this shoe is slightly snug - about a quarter of a size small. If I had to choose all over again, I would choose the same size as it has already loosened up a bit. The front of the shoe is slightly stiff - and I like that because it maintains its shape.The color of the loafers is stated as wood brown and is close to a pair of "camel" color shoes I had.Highly Recommended! Especially if you can get this at the $37 price.P.S.: I would rate this shoe 4-stars but the price of this shoe definitely pushed it to 5. I REALLY like these loafers!

The motorized Bug Vacuum seemed a little overkill for catching and getting a closer look at bugs, but recent bug-bite events in the family have made me re-consider my thinking. My son got bit by what felt like mosquito bites - they ballooned into boils. My nephew got bit by a small bug that triggered an allergic rash on his arms. I think capturing from a distance is a good idea - especially for the young ones.The Bug vac consists of 3 components that can be separated. An intake nozzle, an observation chamber and the motor. Suction is activated through a trigger and pulls in the bug through the intake nozzle into an observation chamber. For a closer look at the bug, you can flip a switch on the chamber (connected to a magnifying glass) that seals the front end of the chamber. You unscrew the observation chamber from the nozzle and the motor and are able to get a 3D 360 degree view of the specimen. Flip open the switch to release the bug.The Bug Vac is not too powerful and seems safe for small bugs/insects, but that also means you cannot suck in larger bugs as they can overpower the suction power. Additional features included a green LED light and a plastic carabiner.Little expensive price-point, but worth the cost for the hours of fun!Recommended.

The Stiga Supreme is a few levels above the base model and should work well for a mid-level player.The first thing you notice is the weight of the racket. It is very light - great for players who play infrequently to avoid fatigue. The blade uses Stiga's Tube technology (milled ridges) that are filled with different materials to customize features for the racket (spin, control, etc.). The racket is well balanced and Stiga's WRB technology ensures that the weight shifts to the point of ball contact providing additional power - which is great for newbies.I like this racket as it has a very good combination of speed (90), spin (92) and control (89). This is a great racket to grow into for someone who is starting off. The racket keeps up with the abilities of a new to mid-level player.This is not an inexpensive racket and I would recommend this for palyers who are passionate about table-tennis and play atleast a few times a week.

This is my 5th WD Passport drive and my second WD USB 3.0 drive. There is hardly any difference between the 2015 version and the 2014 version drive - except for a few mm shaved off the external dimensions and a little faster read/write speed (updated firmware).I use my Passport drives to backup my data/documents. I backed up my 1 TB video archive at transfer speeds as high as 120 mb/s. Read speeds were also in the same range - 125-130 mb/s.My earliest WD Passport drive (160 GB/USB 2.0) is about 6 years old and still works well. WD drives are an ideal backup drive because of their portability and reliability.The only think I miss are the custom neoprene cases that WD used to offer with the early Passport drives. Guess since the prices are about one third of the 2009 drives for 15x the capacity, I should just pony up the 5-6 bucks for the AmazonBasics Hard Carrying Case for My Passport Essential or the Western Digital My Passport Carrying Case - Black. ;o)Recommended.

The 30214 Clear Vinyl Protective Cleaner is a medium-shine, anti-static, UV protecting cleaner and polisher for all exterior vinyl surfaces including 'clear' vinyl. It is a worthy competitor to my favorite cleaner, the Pro Honda Spray Cleaner & Polish 12 oz.. I primarily use both products to clean 'clear' vinyl surfaces like my helmet visor and motorcycle windscreen.The big difference between the 30214 and the Honda cleaner is that the Honda cleaner is wax based while the 30214 is a non-alcohol, chemical based cleaner. They clean 'clear' vinyl equally well but the Honda does leave a little a wax residue behind.The 30214 is a very good product, but it cannot repair scuffed or scratched surfaces, though the gloss does do a good job of masking them.Cleaning and protecting is very easy. Apply the product directly or with a damp applicator. I prefer the damp applicator because it does not streak like the direct application. Buff to a shone with a clean cotton towel or smooth micro-fiber. Voila! You have a clean, UV protected surface.Recommended - 303 makes great products.Tip: Spray onto a well-wrung, damp, lint-free cloth/applicator and apply to surface for even coverage.Pros:* Non-alcohol, chemical based formula leaves a residue free finish.* Leaves a UV protected, anti-static, medium-shine finish. The gloss masks minor scratches and imperfections* Can be used on vinyl and 'clear' vinyl non-control surfaces* One of the few cleaners on the market for 'clear' vinylCons:* Little expensive at $13 for a 16 oz bottle

The Phantom Aquatics 1500 is built like a tank! It is an all metal construction which feels as robust as they come. It seems indestructible.I do not dive, so cannot review the depth performance but it works perfectly in my snorkeling application. I have always felt the lack of good light for photography while snorkeling and the PA 1500 works perfect for my application. It's 1500 lumens are bright enough to light up a 25-30 feet range. My photos have never been better.The XM-L2 CREE LEDs are the highest-performing, commercially available, single-die LED which delivers 20% more lumens per watt. This permits the PA 1500 a 20 hr run-time on two 3.7v 5000 mAh (manufactured advertised 4000 mAh) Li-Ion batteries. The flashlight's 3 levels and strobe function are controlled by a sealed magnetic switch that is easy to operate underwater.The flashlight loses 1-Star because of the lack of a manual and lack of markings on the flashlight and the charger. Is this a Li-ion only charger or can I also charge Ni-MH batteries? There are no instructions on turning on the strobe feature (hold down the switch when the flashlight is turned on) or on preventative care to ensure that the flashlight stays waterproof (ensuring alignment of O-rings and applying a thin coat of silicone grease to the O-ring and threads). I have used underwater camera/flash housings and so understand the pre and post care required for an underwater product, but what if I were a newbie? And shouldn't there be a disclosure of maintenance required for the product to function properly? I know divers are a super careful bunch, so the risk that they will not know/research/learn the product prior to diving is pretty low. But a manual for such a product is mandatory! The worst part is that there is nothing available online even after an exhaustive search.Recommended - but ensure that you research maintenance for salt/fresh water products.Weight: 1.45 lbs with batteriesPros:* Tough, all-metal construction* 1500 lumens are super bright* 3 light intensities with 1 Strobe mode* Good throw - Spot with a 25-30 feet effective range* Latest CREE LEDs are brightest on market and 20% more efficient* 20 hours run-time* Magnetic switch* Two 5000 mAh 3.7v Li-Ion batteries included. The manufacturer advertised 4000 mAh batteries* Charger with two charging voltages (3.0v & 4.2v) charges in about 4 hours (No manual, so not sure if 220-240V compatible)* Nylon holster, wrist lanyard and custom foam molded plastic case includedCons:* On the high-end of the price range for a 150 meter/1500 lumens dive-light* Care/maintenance instructions and/or manual not included - Big miss for such a product* Black Color - underwater products are shiny or have a hi-visibility color - Fluorescent Green, Yellow, Orange

The Pre de Provence men's shower gel smells amazing. It is reminiscent of classic European fragrances that I grew up with.My favorite colognes are European - A-Men By: Thierry Mugler 3.4 oz EDT Refillable, Men's, Paco Rabanne 1 Million By Paco Rabanne For Men Edt Spray, 3.4 Ounce, etc. The Pre De Provence fits into this fragrance profile. It is warm, sweet, rich, spicy and fresh. The fragrance's top notes are woody (cedar wood) with a little citrus, and it finishes into a mild leather and tobacco. I can smell lavender on the finish, but since this cologne does not have this ingredient, it might be the combination of the violet leaves and plum.Very little gel is required to create good lather and provide a great shower experience. You come out refreshed! The oil base keeps the fragrance lingering for hours and I have even caught a whiff of the fragrance when washing up after a 10 hour day.I did not use the gel on my hair. I did intend to, but when I removed the plastic/foam seal from the bottle top, it had disintegrated. I just did not feel comfortable.The price point might seem expensive, but it isn't since you need only about half the quantity of an average body wash.Recommended.

The Samsung VU3000 is a powerful, light-weight, feature rich vacuum at a good price-point.The VU3000 was an easy assembly - the canister and wand clicked ino the main unit and it was ready to go. The wand-handle has a small collar near the top that controls the suction power. You can rotate it to increase or decrease the suction power. The power and brush on/off switches are on the side of the canister - a little non-traditional and takes a little getting used to.There is no lever to unlock the VU3000 from its upright position. All you do is place your leg on the left side of the vacuum and push the handle down. The suction power is instantaneously noticeable and you almost have to turn the collar to reduce the suction to move the vacuum. The red (dirty) and green (clean) lights are helpful to ensure that the area is clean - I used to love this feature on my old Hoover. The vacuum does a good cleaning job on carpets and hard floors. The bagless canister has a good capacity and does not lose suction till it is about half-way full.A nice feature of the VU3000 is that the canister and wand separate easily from the base unit enabling portability to clean stairs, blinds, fixtures, etc.The VU3000 is not without its flaws. The suction is very powerful, but even with that powerful suction it does not seem to be able to pick up as well as my Dyson Animal. My thought is that the motorized brush might not be agitating sufficiently to complement the powerful vacuum. Another flaw is the usability. The placement of the operating and release buttons are a little tricky. The power and motorized brush buttons are on the side away from your line of sight when vacuuming. The canister release button (to remove for emptying) often gets activated when carrying the canister (cleaning blinds, etc.) and you are left with the canister in one hand and the wand in the other. Lastly, the release button to dump the dirt from the canister is located at the bottom which means that you have to use two hands to dump the dirt.If you can get past these few flaws, this is a great vacuum ar the sub $200 price-point.Recommended.Pros:* Powerful, adjustable suction strength* Canister and wand separate for ease of carry when cleaning stairs, blinds, etc.* LED lights signal dirty (red) and clean (green)* Bagless canister with good capacity* Does not lose suction till canister is about half-way full* Transitions from carpet to floor with no adjustmentCons:* Motorized brush might not be the most efficient - some dirt left behind* Buttons placement is not the best

The KIND Almond & Coconut bar is one of my favorite snacks. It is always refreshing and the coconut makes it taste fresh for me. None of the flavors are over-powering and the almonds add a nice crunch to the soft bar.The bars are all natural with 0g cholesterol, low sodium (25 mg), low sugar (12 g) and 3g each of protein and fiber. The 190 calories are a good mid-meal snack and it has become a replacement snack for me.I eat about 5 bars a week and have still not grown tired with this flavor combination. The 1-Star deduction is for the glucose syrup.Highly Recommended!

The TP-LINK Archer T9E AC1900 paired with a good AC router has vastly improved my desktop experience.My desktop is hard-wired into my router as it is the most prudent connection for me - they sit next to each other. Surfing/downloads/uploads to the internet has never been an issue as my 10/100 card has successfully managed my cable bandwitdh. However, transferring large files to my media server (equipped with a gigabit nic), over wi-fi, has been painfully slow. Since I already had the Linksys AC2400 4X4 Dual-Band Gigabit Wi-Fi Router, Optimal for HD Video Streaming and Lag-Free Gaming (E8350), replacing my desktop card, the bottleneck in my network, seemed prudent.Installation was simple. Plug into a PCI-e slot and you're ready to go. After restarting my desktop and connecting to the network, I transferred some files (0.5-2 GB size) to my media server at BLAZING speeds! My average transfer when hardwired was 5-11 mbps. With the TP-LINK, I was getting between 50-80 mbps - a 10-15x performance improvement. I also moved smaller files (10-100MB) to a USB 3.0 hard-disk connected to my router and I reached speeds of nearly 200 mbps.The only issue that I have faced are connectivity drops - which with the hardwire connection was never an issue. But the Linksys router is moody - so cannot completely blame it on the TP-LINK.Recommended.Pros:* Easy installation* AC1900 - claims speeds upto 1300 mbps* Dual band - 5 GHz & 2.4 GHz* 3 upgradaeable, omnidirectional antennas* Compatible with 802.11 a/b/g/nCons:* Little expensive at 80 bucks

The Hanover Newport Wicker Lounge set is our first set of real wicker. The real wicker has a great texture and looks rich.Setup took about an hour with the help of my son - from opening the nearly 6 x 4 x 3 feet box to unpacking the carefully packed pieces to assembling the loveseat and center table with a few screws. The included tools are basic and a power screwdriver will make the assembly go much quicker.The color of the wicker is advertised as Brown/Tan but there is a gray highlght in the color. The gray accent cushions seem to be a good match. An added benefit for us was that the dark brown color blended into our existing brown pewter dining table set.The set is low to the ground and is a great set for a deck. The seating is deep enough to be comfortable for extended lounging. My favorite is the the chair-ottoman combination. The cushions are plush enough and are a secure fit in the furniture.Spring showers on the first day tested the furniture out. It dried up quickly. Pollen remains an issue compared to fake wicker - it gets into the nooks and crannies and though it was not difficult to get out with a water hose on new furniture, I am sure that it will get more difficult as the wicker ages/dries/cracks. Lastly, bugs and spiders get into the nooks and crannies and you need to be careful especially with young children.The wicker furniture is on the pricey side, but not out of range for such a well-constructed set.Recommended!

The Belkin TrueClear is one of the few privacy guards available for touch screen laptops.As with all adhesive related installations, it is important to have a clean environment and surfaces. I use the iKlear iK-26K Complete Cleaning Kit to ensure that I have clean non-static surfaces. Installation is simple - stick a micro-suction tabs to each corner of the privacy guard. Remove the protective coating and attach to a "clean" laptop bezel. Cannot emphasize how important it is to have a clean, grease free surface. These micro-suction tabs are tacky tabs and not "suction" tabs.I have it installed on my Dell XPS machine and there is no lag in touch response. The privacy guard does require your brightness to be slightly higher which marginally impacts my battery life. The privacy aspect works very well. You have to be directly in front of the screen as once you are 30 degrees or more off the center you cannot see anything on the screen.The issues I found were that the privacy guard is heavier than most I have used. It may not sound too heavy at 2 ounces, but add in the micro-suction tabs and it only compounds the issue. I wish Belkin used the old 3M attaching concept where you permanently attach the tabs to your laptop screen and slide the privacy guard in and out. The other issue is that the micro-suction surfaces get clogged with dust and though you can clean them with sticky tape, they do not seem to retain their initial tackiness.If you are the kind of user than installs and forgets it, it'll work for you, but if you are the user that needs to remove it daily (like me!) it will not work for you. I am trying to find the old 3M plastic tabs so that I can rig up a solution to make this privacy guard work.Size: 11.32" width x 6.75" heightPros:* Works well - screen content cannot be seen 30 degrees off center* Touch Screen functionality works as expected and does not require a heavier touch* Easy to Install* No glareCons:* Expensive at $50* Heavy for a privacy guard - 2 oz* Micro-suction tabs are advertised to be reusable, but they lose tackiness after a few installs and removals

The Bobble Presse is the new kid on the 'on-the-go french press' block.The Bobble Presse is a 5 piece construction - the 3 wall insulated cup, the stainless steel plunger, the screw mesh filter, the silicone seal on the plunger that prevents coffee and grounds from getting in between the plunger and the cup, and the silicone cap. The outside of the cup seems to be laminated and provides a good grip.The Bobble Presse is a wonderful travel accessory - good for camping, etc. But I have been using it primarily at work where the coffee is just bad. Having this as work, gets me a great cup of coffee in less than 5 minutes. Just add medium-grind coffee, hot water, stir, wait 2-3 mins and press down. Voila! The Bobble yields about 12 ounces of coffee.With the grounds being at the bottom, the coffee does become progressively stronger. I notice this even though I am a fast drinker - within 15 minutes. When I desire a consistent taste, I pouring the coffee into a separate cup.Cleanup is easy with the steel and silicone components - just rinse and air dry.The seal around the plunger is tight and it is difficult to pull out when the cup gets cold. To alleviate the issue, pull the plunger as soon as you finish drinking or add hot water to heat the silicone seal and make it more pliable. The Bodum Insulated Stainless-Steel Travel French Press Coffee and Tea Mug, 0.45-Liter, 15-Ounce, Red has a plunger which pulls easier and is a worthy competitor. I prefer the Bobble because it looks like a normal coffee cup.Recommended.Pros:* Well designed cup has all technology under wraps - no indication that it holds a coffee press* 3 wall insulation keeps coffee hot for hours* Micro-mesh filter ensure that medium+ grind does not flow back into the coffee* All stainless steel and silicone construction* Easy cleanup - does not retain any odor* Durable and Portable - ideal for camping* Wide plunger/press might be easier to use for folks with hand ailments - arthritis, etc.Cons:* Silicone cap is unstable and becomes slightly more pliable and loose when hot - not recommended for use while driving* Folks might not prefer hot coffee floating around the silicone seal - easily remedied with pouring coffee into a separate cup* Might be difficult for some to press in/pull out the plunger

The Philips Wake-Up Light is based on the concept of waking up naturally in sunlight. It also adds in the option of chirping birds to complete the experience.The Philips Light seems delicately constructed but is robust. It does, however, have some stability issues caused by the location of the power cord on the stand. The screen and controls are centered on the light. Controls and the clock numbers light up in soft-orange and can be adjusted to 4 levels of brightness. In my opinion, the lowest 2 settings will be the most ideal for any bedroom.The wake-up light and sounds (2 nature and 1 radio) work together to provide an easy, low-stress waking up experience - a huge welcome from the angry beeping that my old clock-radio provides. You set the max volume (1-10) and max brightness (1-10) and the light will increase gradually over a 30 minute period prior to your wake-up time. At your set wake up time, the nature sounds (or radio) come on and increase to your max set volume gradually.You have an option for a 9 minute (fixed duration) snooze which is activated by gently tapping the top of the clock.Controls to customize light brightness, sounds, radio, volume and alarm are well-placed and intuitive.So who does this wake-up light really work well for? In my opinion, this works great for stomach sleepers who sleep facing in the direction of the clock - which I am! If you are a back sleeper, the wake-up light might not work for you. A positive externality is that your partner is not disturbed by the light.You will have to do a little trial and error to determine the best setting for you. My first day settings of light (5) and alarm (6) did not work. I need a setting of 7 for the light and 8 for the alarm.One last comment - this light will not work for everyone. Some people just need that rude awakening!Recommended.Pros:* Gentle, natural, stress-free way to wake-up* Great for people who do not face East when waking up or in regions with lack of sunlight* Well-constructed, well-designed light is a welcome addition to almost any room/decor* Light tries to simulate natural waking up - with gradually intensifying light and nature sounds* 2 nature sounds, 1 radio and light have 10 volume/intensity levels* Soft-orange numbers and controls are pleasant to the eye* Intuitive controlsCons:* Slightly expensive for an alarm clock, but not too expensive considering the benefits* Some stability issues caused by power-input placement on the stand* Light/Sounds might not work for everyone* Will work better for stomach sleepers versus back sleepers

The New Balance NBG2002 is a 'synthetic' leather (misleading on Amazon Description) soft-spike golf shoe.My normal New Balance shoe size is a Size 10, 2E width, but I opted for the 10.5 D as it gives me a firmer hold on the width and a little more room for the top of my foot. Being synthetic, this shoe will not expand and you need to ensure that you find a fit that can accommodate your foot swelling and be comfortable after the first few hours of play.Build quality is as expected of New Balance and the material does provide good stability.The waterproof microfiber uppers do not wick moisture as quickly as I would like, but it is not an issue for me since I do not perspire a lot. But I can see it becoming an issue for folks who do perspire and have warm feet - the synthetic leather does not permit good circulation.Lastly, the cost of the shoe is definitely a concern. My waterproof Nike leather golf shoes cost about the same and are much more comfortable. I will keep these shoes for those days with guaranteed downpours, but I need my real leather shoes for all other play.Pros:* Well constructed shoe provides good stability and flexibility* 10 mm drop midsole provides lightweight cushioning and ground feel* Cleats provide good traction even on wet surfaces* Waterproof* Microfiber lining wicks away moisture* Antibacterial treatment for reduced odorsCons:* Expensive at $145 for synthetic leather shoes* Wicking works well only in moderate climates - synthetic uppers can become uncomfortable, especially in a hot and humid climate* No arch support* Misleading advertising implies shoes are made of "Leather"

The Miele Dynamic U1 is a beautiful piece of German engineering and has all the curves and lines you expect in a German sport car. The U1 is designed as a modern take on classic Americana with all the functions of a modern vacuum. The U1 retains classic elements like the rotary dial and stainless steel accents while updating the suction and technology to state-of-the-art.At first sight the U1 looks larger and heavier than most other uprights. But it is only a few inches wider and taller than my Dyson DC25 vacuum - which is a good size for me (I am of average build). The weight is the biggest consideration - 21 lbs versus the Dyson's 16 lbs - as we carry vacuums between two flights of stairs.In function, the U1 is silent and powerful. It picks up everything, in a single pass, across multiple floor types without missing a beat. The weight does not seem to an issue for maneuverability as it glides when pushed and its swivel head makes it possible to maneuver around or under furniture.A 4-speed rotary dial rotates clockwise from `curtains' (lowest suction) through `deep-pile' and `low-pile' to `smooth' (highest suction). `Low-pile' is what I use for very efficient normal vacuuming. The telescoping handle, which works off a separate vacuum motor, accommodates the crevice tool, upholstery tool, dusting brush and the mini-turbo brush. The mini-turbo brush is great for carpeted stairs and also for getting into tight places - like under your car seats.So what do I not like about the U1? Well, with its fantastic suction the U1 picks up more dirt that you can possibly imagine. But for a vacuum that uses bags, it means changing bags more frequently. I am going through a bag a month - at nearly $5 per bag. I wish it were a bag-less vacuum like the Dyson.Recommended. It is expensive, but the 20 year life socialized by Miele makes it worth the cost.Pros:* German design and construction - tough and beautiful, this vacuum is built to last* Classic Americana design blended with modern technology* Single pass cleaning - vacuum picks up everything* Vacuum glides with little effort, Swivel head works effortlessly around and under furniture* Powerful suction - Among the very best on the market* Rotary Dial to control suction power* Dual set of buttons near rotary dial and on handle to control carpet brush rolling* Separate telescoping handle for hard to reach places - ceilings, curtains, etc.* Powerful LED lights are functional* All tools on-boardCons:* Expensive at 650 bucks* Bags fill up quickly - 4-8 weeks when vacuuming 1500-2000 sq ft areas 1-2 times per week* Heavy at 21 lbs to carry between floors

The Ellis mini set is not as plush or rigid as depicted in the Amazon photos. It is thinner and does not hold itself up quite as well.I tried to use it as a pen stand and noticed that unless they were at least 80% full, it kinda flopped in the direction of the weight. It would have worked well had the material been twice as thick or if they had doubled the material for the bins.I cannot find any purpose for a bin that cannot hold itself up.

The Philips PureRadiance Skin Cleansing System is an excellent beauty aid to deep clean pores and rejuvenate the skin through increased blood circulation.PureRadiance is fool-proof - similar to Philips Sonic Toothbrushes. Each cycle has three 20 second periods designed to clean each cheek and your T-zone. There is a pause between each cycle to let you switch areas. The great thing about this ~1 minute timer is that it is a quick cycle (which is not difficult to use even on those tiring nights) for deep cleansing and you do not over-abrase your skin.I have been using PureRadiance with Melaleuca Tea-tree products to control acne and it works wonders. I had been using disposable medicated wash cloths, but the difference between the medicated cloth and PureRadiance is like night and day. Within 2 weeks of use, the acne has subsided significantly and since I have not changed anything except my cleansing method, I feel that my cleaner and medication is getting in deeper for more effective, visible results.Recommended.Pros:* Philips brings its proven tooth cleansing Sonic technology to its skin cleansing line* Visible results in less than a week - skin feels cleaner, radiant and tighter* Deep cleansing of pores remove impurities and permit creams/medications to penetrate deeper* ~1 minute cleansing cycle should work for most people* Works with any face cleanser, lotions, make-up remover, etc.* Ergonomic design makes it easy to hold - even in the shower* Rechargeable - 5-6 hours for a full charge which yields ~30 cycles* Includes Normal and Exfoliating brush heads and a travel-case* Multiple brush types available for different applications - Normal, Exfoliating. Sensitive, Extra Sensitive and Deep Pore brush headsCons:* Expensive at $125* Charging stand does not hold up - have to lean it against wall when charging

The Fire & Rescue Fusel Lodge Trackset is Disney's twist on spring launched toys which makes it easier for young children (3+) to launch the airplane safely and with no help from adults.The toy requires adult help to setup. The tracks are delicate and it is critical that they do not bend or warp for smooth play. Once setup you attach Dusty the plane's harness to the track and use the action shifter to pulls back and fire the sprint loaded launcher. The launcher pushes the plane to the top of the track and the plane glides back to the launch pad. There is no reset required - just lift the shifter and pull back for continuous play. The toy is simple enough even for my 3 year old nephew to operate and he loves launching and watching Dusty glide back down. There are 4 fire targets that you can place on the tracks or along the flight path for Dusty to "put out".This is smaller than the Disney Planes: Fire & Rescue Piston Peak Trackset but is still a delicate and slightly unstable toy that you cannot leave it unsupervised with a small child. With its single play, older kids will tire of it quickly.The big difference with this set is that you can buy additional tracks (links below) that connect to this set for a more comprehensive game play. BUT the build quality of these other sets is questionable, for example in Disney Planes: Fire & Rescue Smoke Jumpers Training Base Playset, Drip, the skid steer digger, is just a hollow plastic shell - no wheels or innards. I would definitely expect a die-cast vehicle if I spend 12 bucks on a toy.* Disney Planes: Fire & Rescue Air Attack Training Base Playset* Disney Planes: Fire & Rescue Wildfire Rescue Playset* Disney Planes: Fire & Rescue Maru's Fuel Stop Story Set* Disney Planes: Fire & Rescue Smoke Jumpers Training Base PlaysetFun toy but delicate, pricey and fun is short lived.Pros:* Launcher is easy even for toddlers to operate* Well-designed track with turns and curves provide a nice flight path* 4 Fire targets can be placed on tracks for dusty to "put out"* Additional add-on tracks availableCons:* Pricey* Toy has a single play - pull back on action shifter to launch plane* Delicate tracks - if bent or warped will not work* Toy overall is a little unstable as the entire toy moves with each launch

The LG Electronics Tone Pro design is ideal for people who do not like having headphones resting on their head or having a ear bud constantly in their ear.Everything worked fine on this headset and I loved the convenience of larger, well placed function buttons. The headset is definitely conspicuous and placing it below my shirt collar helped with the visual aesthetics.After about 3 weeks of regular use, I left my LG headset sitting in my closet for 1 week. I tried to reconnect them and they didn't come on. I troubleshooted every possible scenario but could not get them to work. They are currently on RMA to LG. Might be a bum unit - I'll wait for the new one to arrive.

The Classic Brands Advantage mattress is well constructed and an inexpensive product at this sub $150 price-point.The Classic mattress was a replacement for a Sultan mattress from Ikea - which has provided comfortable support for the past 10 years. The Classic Mattress is similar in design and comfort to the Sultan.After unpacking, I gave the mattress 7 days to extend to its potential prior to testing. The mattress is a medium firmness - not too hard on the back and definitely not squishy. I did, however, purchase the highly rated Pinzon Basics Overfilled Ultra Soft Microplush Twin Mattress Pad. Though the coils weren't poking through, the pad provided the required comfort for me - I have always used some type of plush pad.The mattress, though lower on price-point has not compromised on quality. All materials are new, stitching is detailed & dense, mattreass has a quilted cover and edges & corner support is provided through firm coils.Recommended.

Phone Power is a great VOIP product with good call quality and comparable prices to its competitors (Ooma, etc.)Phone power was easy to setup...just plug into your router, power it and it is ready to go. I did have some issues setting up an account as the website froze up a few times, but I was able to get everything setup within 15 minutes.Phone Power plans depend on the duration of your commitment - longer the commitment, cheaper the plan. However, do add 2-4 dollars (based on registered address) to the plan cost for taxes, fees and surcharges. Even with these additional charges, Phone Power provides one of the cheapest plans - with better voice quality than its competitors.

Update - 2/2/15 - Star rating changed from 4-Stars to 3-Stars.Having installed a tempered glass protector I decided to get a slim, minimalistic case for my iPhone - The Spigen Air Cushion [ASIN: B00JH88D1O]. The edges on this case barely hug the phone...as a result of which there is a 2 mm gap between the case and the protector. The 2 mm gap by itself is not an issue, but coupled with the fact that this screen protector is cut to exactly the touch portion of the screen,  edge contact becomes a little weird - half on the Glass protector and half a few mm lower on the non-screen portion of the iPhone. You need a more pronounced touch on the edges to get a response - I am feeling this pain with a game that requires edge contact.  This wasn't an issue with my previous case which had thick overlapping edges. I just blamed the case for the difficulty in edge response.Not a deal breaker because of the great protection, but Zagg makes the same protector without the "case friendly" feature (not yet available on Amazon) that I would opt for.*~*~*~*The InvisibleShield Glass is a high quality, tempered glass screen protector.Zagg has been working over the years to improve their installation process and I believe that they finally have a winner. After ensuring that your screen is clean (steps below) align the InvisibleShield Glass and place carefully on the screen. The bubbles, if any, will disappear within a few hours. No squeegee required.The biggest issue when installing is ensuring that you have a clean surface and a dust-free environment. Flexible plastic screen protectors permit you to remove only part of the protective film cover when installing. In the case of the InvisibleShield Glass you have to remove the entire protective film prior to starting. The large, sticky surface is a huge dust magnet - and there are no second chances with this self-adhesive film. I would really focus on getting the environment as clean as possible.Recommended.Pros:* High-quality, 0.4 mm thin, Tempered Glass protector* Glass protector maintains the brilliance of the iPhone screen* Glass protector maintains original feel of iPhone* Oil resistant coating repels skin oils and is easy to cleanupCons:* Protector is designed smaller to accommodate cases, but might be too small for some slim cases* Installation is high-risk if you are not used to installing or good at aligning screen protectors - No second chances with this self-adhesive backed protectorMy Installation Process Steps:Tools:* Get a good screen cleaner - I use the Klear Screen iKlear 8 oz. Pump Spray Bottle for iPad, iPhone, Galaxy, LCD, Plasma TV, Computer Monitor and Keyboard* Tiny microfiber cloths do not work for me. Need a couple large microfiber cloths, like the AmazonBasics Microfiber Cleaning Cloth, (Pack of 24)* A roll of scotch tape - on a standing dispenser if possible Scotch Desk Tape Dispenser, 1in. Core, Black1. Find a clean, slightly humid place to work it [ Bathroom after a few minutes running a hot shower? ;o) ]. Seriously, this is important!2. Remove any case you might have on the iPhone3. Clean the entire screen and phone surface with the wet cleaner and cloth.4. Polish the entire phone with a new (or dry portion) of the microfiber cloth to ensure there are no residues, dust particles finger-print marks, etc. Ensure it is CLEEEAN!5. IMPORTANT! Lay the phone on the work surface for about a minute and see if it accumulates dust particles...if it does, you run the risk of a contaminated install. Find a new, cleaner location.6. Remove backing from the screen protector, align to the home button and drop it gently. In case you encounter dust/debris on the phone screen (DO NOT use on protector), pause install and use the scotch tape to lift it with your free hand.7. Squeeze out large bubbles with your microfiber cloth8. Clean once more with your wet cleaner and cloth and you're done9. Small bubbles should disappear within a few hours

The SK-II is designed to reduce the appearance of fine lines around the eye.SK-II is primarily composed of Pitera - a Sake yeast derivative. It comprises a blend of vitamins, amino acids, minerals, and organic acids to rejuvenate skin cells. It feels rich but is light in texture. It has a delicate rose fragrance.Application instructions are to apply sparingly and massage gently around the eye. Within the last few days, there has been a noticeable difference. Puffiness around the eye has reduced slightly and the skin feels firmer. The caveat here is that prolonged usage effects are yet to be determined.The SK-II is a high-end, luxury product line and the $125 price tag for half ounce is not very palatable for most folks. I have withheld 1-star for the high price.

Finding a hot beverage, besides coffee, for a Nespresso machine was exciting.Aldecoa produces coffee and tea pods for the Nespresso Original line and though I have not tasted the coffee, they seem to have done a decent job with the green tea "drink" pod. I call this a tea "drink" as the pods are a blend of green tea leaves, spearmint leaves, lemon flavor and green tea extract - not 100% tea leaves.I start my day with tea and consume 2-3 cups a day. My family is in the tea business and I have access to tea from the finest gardens in the world. Aldecoa's green tea is of better than average quality. However, a 30 second brew is not able to extract the full flavor potential of this pod. The green tea, spearmint and lemon flavors come through, but it is a watered down experience. It is not medium-bodied and well-rounded as a green tea should be. I did open a fresh pod, pour the contents into a tea ball and brewed it for 3 minutes. It did actually produce a more satisfying drink.When the Nespresso machine produces an espresso shot in 30 seconds, it is saving you significant time and effort (grinding coffee, prepping, cleaning, etc.) against a traditional espresso machine, but that is not the case with making tea. All it requires is boiling water, placing tea in a tea ball or opening a tea bag (most are hermetically sealed to preserve flavor) and waiting 2-3 minutes for steeping - relatively low effort.I can see using these pods on a late night when a guest might want tea instead of coffee, but definitely not for daily use.

The KiiTAG is a plastic bluetooth bi-directional finder that works as advertised.I habitually misplace my keys and was very interested in a similar product called the "tile". However, with the "tile" being a one-time use (~1 year) product I thought it was wasteful to use it. The KiiTAG is a step beyond the "tile" as it not only permits you to replace batteries (~ 6 months life) but also can ping the host device - in case that is misplaced.My car key is tiny. With keyless entry I am not required to remove it from my pocket to open/lock car doors. I often forget it in my jacket/pant/shorts/gym bag/etc. The KiiTAG is a life-saver for me. I have already used it about 3 times in the last 2 days.There are a few steps to getting started - downloading app, creating account and registering/pairing keys. Once paired, you locate the KiiTAG from your phone by visual concentric circles that grow larger as you approach the KiiTAG. The stated range is 200 feet, and I had no problems locating it in a large house. In case the KiiTAG moves out-of-range, you get an alarm. The software then displays the last location of the KiiTAG. In case you misplace the host device, you can trigger a chime from the KiiTAG that will help to locate the device.I do like the "exclusive ownership" and "community" concepts. If someone else finds my key, they cannot use it and the app provides an avenue for them to return it to me. Also, once reported stolen, the community can help find it. Of course, this assumes wide-spread dissemination of this product and it might be a few years out.What I do not like is the pricey apps. The camera shutter app - use the button on the KiiTAG to trigger the phone shutter - is expensive at $4 from the iOS App Store.Recommended.Pros:* Great concept Bluetooth finder has replaceable battery* Well designed fob is not out of place on a keychain* Easy Setup - need to download app, create account and pair KiiTAG* Locate your item by signal strength - up to 200 feet range* Out-of-range alarm* Last known location lets you know where the KiiTAG went out of range* Exclusive ownership does not permit anyone else to pair and use the KiiTAG* KiiTAG community can help find lost KiiTAGsCons:* Pricey Apps* KiiTAG is slightly bulky - makes it noticeable. Would prefer less conspicuous fob

The Arachnid Pro 750 is a wonderful addition to my new game room. The soft-tip darts keep it safe for a family with younger children.The Pro 750 is a well-constructed, pub worthy quality dart board with game options and choices than I can ever envision using. You can program the board to call out your name which is a great feature when drinking and playing with a large group - can accommodate up to 8 players.I had friends who have never played before complaining about the bounce-outs and stating that they would have done much better on a cork board. True, on a cork board, they might have done a little better, but as they improved over the evening, they realized that it was their skill level to blame over the type of board. The Pro 750 is built with thinner dividing segments to reduce bounce-outs and they worked - by the end of the evening we had so few of them, that no one even mentioned the bounce-outs.The only issue that seems to prevail was that some shots didn't register, primarily when multiple darts were thrown or darts were thrown in quick succession.The really great thing about this board over a traditional board is that your entire family can enjoy it. There are no worries about errant darts damaging holes or kids getting hurt or misusing them - as teens, my older brother shot one into my younger brother's behind! That was the last I saw of that dart board. :(Recommended - a little pricey at $200 but a worthy addition to a game room.Pros:* Well-constructed board does not feel cheap or plasticky* Good electronics - voice is clear (not fantastic!) for game-play* Can accommodate 8 players in 36 games with 175 options* Darts have Nylon segments for durability and improved playability* Thinner divided segments provide greater play area and reduced bounce-outs* Board call out your pre-recorded name for up to 8 players* Family friendlyCons:* Needs an electric outlet - no batteries* Little pricey at $200

The OXO Good Grips Covertible colander is a large hard-plastic colander that doubles in duty as a counter-top and over-the-sink colander.Quality is in line with expectations of OXO products - solid construction, smooth mechanism and well-placed rubber grips and skid pads. This is a big colander with outer dimensions, with legs folded, of 16" x 10 " x 5". The inner dimensions of 12.5" x 9" x 4.5" hold a 5 quart capacity. With extended legs you can use this as an over-the-sink colander as long as you have a 12.5" - 21" sink opening and space to accommodate the 23" length.The colander has sufficient slits to drain quickly. I do like this design over the traditional holes as it can be used for rinsing smaller foods like cereal grains, baby peas, etc.Though I like the counter-top capabilities, it is the over-the-sink capability that impresses me. The colander sits solid across the sink with its wide, non-skid feet. It does not move or shift even when filled to capacity.I would have rated this 5-stars if OXO had made this a collapsible colander like their OXO Good Grips Silicone Collapsible Colander with Two Handles, Gray, so that it could be stored compactly.Recommended.Pros:* Big colander will accommodate even the largest families* Well-designed, well-constructed, smooth mechanism and well-placed rubber grips and skid pads* Can be used in-the-sink as well as over-the-sink* Does not move/shift when placed over-the-sink use* Good price pointCons:* Bulky - should have been collapsible like the Good Grips Silicone Collapsible Colander

I am not joking! The un-boxing and reading the quick install guide tool longer than the TP-LINK took to get up and running.The TP-LINK TL-WA854RE N300 is a compact network extender than plugs into a electric wall outlet and enhances existing WiFi coverage or brings WiFi coverage to areas of your home than are presently just out of reach.Really simple installation if you have a WPS button on your router - most recent (2-3 years old) routers have it. Plug the extender into an outlet 'close' to your router, press the WPS button on your router and then press the WPS button on the extender. The extender takes a minute or two for finalize connectivity. Once the LEDs are lit and solid (except the Wi-Fi LED which keeps blinking), remove the extender from the wall outlet and plug anywhere in the house. That SIMPLE!If the above method does not work or you do not have a WPS button, you type in the extender URL (available in Quick Start guide) into your browser and enter your network information. The installation will finalize and you can plug and relocate to desired spot when the LEDs are lit and solid.My gratification was instant. I disconnected and reconnected my laptop and my signal strength jumped from 3 to the max 5 bars. I checked other devices (TV/DVD/Media Player/etc) on my lower floor that used to experience 2-3 (out of 5) bars of signal - they had all improved to 4-5 bars. I am very impressed!Recommended.Pros:* Excellent price* Compact footprint - NO cables!* Easy to Install* Takes the top electrical outlet while keeping the one below free* 300 Mbps wireless N speedsCons:* 300 Mbps wireless N speeds - might impact folks who have upgraded to AC routers

Though late to the retractable lightning cable game, AmazonBasics has produced an excellent product. The cable is very well manufactured and has a 24 inch length.Even if you are not a traveler, the need for carrying your lightning cable around has become a necessity. Phone usage has sky-rocketed and batteries seem to die so much quicker. The stock Apple lightning cable is too long to carry and I had been looking for a shorter cable like the AmazonBasics Apple Certified Lightning to USB Cable - 4-Inches (10 Centimeters) - White to use with my myCharge RZ30V-A Razor Plus Rechargeable 3000 mAh Battery. The AmazonBasics retractable cable, in my opinion, is better as it gives me the flexibility of 3 sizes - 10, 18 and 24 inches with the added benefit of retracting out of the way when done.The cable, connectors and retractable mechanism are high quality and well constructed. The cable feels solid in the hand.One thing to note is that the plastic around the lightning connector is very slightly larger than the stock Apple cable, and though it should work with 99% of all iPhone/iPad/iPod cases, there is a possibility that precise cut cases might not be able to accommodate it.Highly recommended!Dimensions: 3.25" x 2.25" x 0.62" - When coiled, this is the size of rectangle space required for storagePros:* Well constructed - product feels robust and connections are tight* Well priced* Light and compact profile does not take up too much space in a bagCons:* I found the central retractable unit to be slightly larger than expected (2.5" x 1.25")

The Pixma MG6620 is a photo printer primarily targeting the home enthusiast. The printer offers multiple ways to get you computer, smart phone and tablet photos on paper. Before starting, I would like to clarify that this unit does not have a FAX feature and the All-In-One designation eludes to printing from all types of sources(??)The Pixma is not the smallest printer on the market but Canon has tried to reduce the footprint from previous generations. The printer has a slightly larger depth than other printers in this class. The printer is designed for front loading and front delivery which would seem logical, but both trays being horizontal, you will find your copies on the floor. Also, the feed tray which is under the delivery tray holds fewer sheets (~45) and is difficult to close due to this design. Overall the feed tray is little flimsy and I keep feeling that I will snap it when pushing it back in.Setup was not difficult - as expected with all new peripherals, you have to disconnect and cycle the power a couple of times after the software install. I did assign it a static IP - which I find helps with keeping my wireless devices from losing connectivity.I do like the intuitive buttons (Power/Home/Back/B&W/Color/Stop) which work in conjunction with the 3" touch LCD screen. The LCD screen is very responsive and scrolls and clicks like any smartphone screen. From copying to LAN setup to Eco Mode to Quiet mode to selecting photos from the SD slot, this screen is your one-stop for on-device printing and customization.Regular printing is very fast and so is the copying. I copied a 80% covered color page - a B&W copy was out in 7 secs, whereas a color copy took nearly 18 secs - definitely faster than my current HP AIO.

The Japonesque Velvet Touch is a mousse style foundation that leaves an air-brushed, matte finish on application.A foundation brush is required for an easy and even application. Since the foundation is light and airy, a non-greasy moisturizer prior to application provides a perfect base. By itself, as long as you are close to your shade, it blends in for a nice , natural look for daily use. Since the product finishes matte, it also makes a great foundation to build on.Japonesque has eight shades for this product but there is no accurate color chart available (even on the website) to make an informed decision. For shade #5 of 8, it seems to be on the lighter side. I would have expected the shade to be slightly darker.There is a slight odor on application that dissipates after application.The product works as advertised but at 36 dollars a bottle is at the high end of this product range.Recommended.

The Juice Beauty Stem Cellular Cleansing oil offers a deep cleansing experience. It uses a blend of Grapeseed, May Chang, Ho wood and Sunflower oils along with organic fruit acids to brighten skin tone, skin texture and help dissolve impurities.Juice Cleansing oil is recommended to be applied to dry skin. One can apply it the face with fingers in a circular massaging way; or you can squeeze it into a warm, well wrung-out washcloth and massage your face with it.I prefer the washcloth as there is warm moisture being applied to my face along with the cleansing oil; and the washcloth can pick up impurities along the way. The finger method seems to tug at the skin and stretch it unnecessarily - especially near the eyes, where one has thinner skin.Juice Cleansing oil leaves the skin clean, nourished, non-greasy and smelling good - just like you do after a spa treatment!Recommended.Pros:* Spa like experience in a bottle* Organic product - all natural ingredients* Leaves skin clean, nourished and rejuvenated without the greasiness* Two methods of application - massage into skin or spray onto moist warm washcloth* Non-abrasive cleansingCons:* Seems to stretch thin skin areas - apply gently with care.

The AmazonBasics screen protector is a high quality, basic, clear, non-HD screen protector. It does not have any anti-reflective properties and its resistance to fingerprints is its biggest feature.Besides the 3 films, there is a small micro fiber cloth and installation instructions. The instructions are basic and do not provide detailed instructions for the curved iPhone 6.The install was a difficult one since the curved profile of the iPhone 6 does not allow you to align the film to any of the edges. You have to align to the home button or the receiver opening. The protector being a little heavy and rigid did make the install a little easier. To add to the difficulty was the larger size of the iPhone 6+. It did take a few tries, but I got the film aligned perfectly and managed to complete the installation, without any air bubbles or dust particles, using the same process (listed below) that I have been using for years.Recommended.Pros:* High-quality film is rigid with good weight* Crystal protector keeps the brilliance of the iPhone screen* Protector maintains original feel of iPhone* Fingerprint resistant* Film on front of protector protects against scratches during installCons:* Non-HD, reflective protective* No squeegee cardMy Installation Process Steps:Tools:* Get a good screen cleaner - I use the Klear Screen iKlear 8 oz. Pump Spray Bottle for iPad, iPhone, Galaxy, LCD, Plasma TV, Computer Monitor and Keyboard* Tiny microfiber cloths do not work for me. Need a couple large microfiber cloths, like the AmazonBasics Microfiber Cleaning Cloth, (Pack of 24)* A roll of scotch tape - on a standing dispenser if possible Scotch Desk Tape Dispenser, 1in. Core, Black1. Find a clean, slightly humid place to work it [ Bathroom after a few minutes running a hot shower? ;o) ]. Seriously, this is important!2. Remove any case you might have on the iPhone3. Clean the entire screen and phone surface with the wet cleaner and cloth.4. Polish the entire phone with a new (or dry portion) of the microfiber cloth to ensure there are no residues, dust particles finger-print marks, etc. Ensure it is CLEEEAN!5. IMPORTANT! Lay the phone on the work surface for about a minute and see if it accumulates dust particles...if it does, you run the risk of a contaminated install. Find a new, cleaner location.6. Remove part of the backing from the screen protector, align to the home button and drop it gently while using a squeegee card to iron out the bubbles. You might have to lift and realign a few times to get it perfect7. If you get a dust particle on the screen or protector, lift using the tab and clean with a strip of scotch tape folded over your fingers. The dispenser helps when your other hand is occupied holding the screen protector8. Clean once more with your wet cleaner and cloth and you're done!

This is an expensive coffee mug at 30 bucks, but its stainless steel construction inside and outside justifies the cost. Plastic mugs ruin the flavor of tea/coffee; and steel mugs with plastic exteriors cannot hold a vacuum seal as well as ones with full steel construction.The mug is aptly named `Forge' - it feels solid in the hand. The self-sealing cap is leak-proof and works off a spring mechanism that can be operated with one finger. This cap can be locked in the open position by pressing down a tab on top of the cap. Large hands can probably operate the spring mechanism and operate the lock tab with one hand, but it is near impossible for small to medium hands.The plastic cap is smell resistant and doesn't feel too plasticky when sipping your hot beverage. The center of the cap under the self-sealing mechanism can get crud after a few uses, but the designers at Camelbak made the mechanism flip open (only when the cap is off the mug) for easy cleaning. Genius!Now for the vacuum performance.  After rinsing the mug with hot tap water, I did two tests - one at 135 F (hot tap water) and the other at 212 F (boiling water) and I was very pleased with the results. After the first hour, 135 F mug dropped 7 degrees while the 212 F mug dropped 10 degrees and after 2 hours the 135 F mug was down by 12 degrees, whereas the 212 F mug was down by 18 degrees. The only caveat here is that I did not open the mug and sip any of the beverage during this test - so for a real life scenario, except a further drop in temperature as you will open the lid more often and air will replace the beverage you are consuming.Recommended - Pricey but worth it.Pros:* Double walled, all steel construction vacuum mug keeps beverage hot for long periods* Plastic cap does not make beverage taste plasticky* Built solid - advertised to function even after being dented* One hand open/close operation* Mug can be kept in the open position using a tab on top of the capCons:* Expensive at 30 bucks

Let me start by saying that the AC2400 has been the simplest install of a router since the Linksys WRT54GL Wi-Fi Wireless-G Broadband Router that I installed about 10 years ago. I have been through half a dozen routers in between that have just haven't delivered on speed or features. With the AC2400 I was up and running in less than 10 minutesThe setup is easy, launch the Linksys Connect software from the enclosed CD, connect the Ethernet cable from your cable modem, plug in the power and the software will install the router for you. Alternately, for advanced users, you can skip the CD - just plug in the router to your cable modem and type in 192.168.1.1 in your web browser to configure your options.The sorest issue with my previous USB enabled routers was that they were never able to network my USB printer. The AC2400 changed that and I have a 4 year old printer working flawlessly over my network. It requires downloading and installing a small piece of virtual USB port which took all of 2 minutes - it located my printer, printer drivers and set it up. Perfect!The AC2400 is near the top of the line of prosumer routers with a price to match. The 4x4 AC channel streams might be an overkill if you only have a couple of wireless devices and do not have a high bandwidth consumption - streaming, gaming, etc. However, it appears most average homes with the multiple laptops, mobile devices, tablets, game consoles and streaming services will benefit from this router. By dividing your devices, between the 2.4 and 5 GHz bands, you can optimize the communication channels for your devices. For hardwired connections you have 4 lightning fast gigabit ports.Networking USB printers and USB or SATA hard drives are simple using the USB 3.0 port or the combination USB 2.0/SATA port. The Linksys Connect software makes this a simple install.To test my setup, I streamed HD movies on 4 devices while surfing the web on 2 separate devices - the router handled the traffic flawlessly. There was no lag but my laptop that was furthest away did lose connectivity to the 5 GHz networkRecommended.Pros:* Easy setup with Linksys Connect v1.5 software* Expensive - high end of prosumer routers* 1.4 GHz Dual core processor for router management* 4 independent antennas provide 4 streams of data to optimize high bandwidth consumption* 2.4 and 5 GHz transmission* 4 Gigabit ports for hardwired connections* AC standard is backward compatible with N/G/B/A standards* USB 3.0 port and combination SATA/USB 2.0 port* On/Off switch on router* Ready for upcoming MU-MIMO standards that permits heavy traffic and high bandwidth activities* PC/MAC compatibleCons:* 5 GHz channel transmission is weaker than older Linksys routers - would expect this signal to be boosted* Antennas cannot be configured manually for individual bands

I have over-pronation, commonly called fallen arches, where your arches look normal but roll inwards when walking. About 10 years ago, this pain became unbearable and I went to an orthopaedic doctor and got custom orthotics. The orthotics were uncomfortable but did reduce the pain. The $300 orthotics only  lasted for about 3 months after which they collapsed and the pain returned.I came across these in a sporting goods store and decided to give them a try. My feet fell relaxed and the pain was gone INSTANTLY! I bought two pairs and have never looked back. Every shoe I buy, I buy a pair of these arch supports to replace the insoles.You might need a half size larger shoe depending on the style of shoe. I change these every 6-12 months depending on usage.Highly Recommended!Pros:* Instant relief* Firm support with soft upper* Inexpensive* Works for mid to high arches* Long lasting* Full foot length keeps feet comfortable* Easily customizable for different shoe typesCons:* None

It would also be a good resource for a Bible study group or you could use the questions in a Sunday School trivia game.
