Fits great, covers the whole phone front, not just the screen area, perfectly clear, seems relatively resistant to fingerprints. What more could anyone ask for? This will keep the entire front of the phone free from scratches without changing the look of brightness of anything on the screen.Application was very easy, just clean everything well with a lens cleaning wipe (I use the Zeiss wipes), peel the plastic sticker back about 1/3 of the way, position the protector and lay it down. Use the included shaped cardboard piece to push out the bubbles and you're ready to go.I'm very happy so far, and with four of these in the package, I don't see that I'll need to be buying another set anytime soon.

Continually starting background processes. Uses a lot of memory and processor power.I used an app manager to force stop this app...and within 15 seconds it was running a couple dozen background processes, one service, and using over 35 MB of RAM.I have uninstalled this app because of this.

Continually starting background processes. Uses a lot of memory and processor power.I used an app manager to force stop this app...and within 15 seconds it was running a couple dozen background processes, one service, and using over 35 MB of RAM.I have uninstalled this app because of this.

The good:1) You can create notes to yourself in One Note, Google Keep, Evernote. You can use voice input or a (really tiny) keyboard!2) Completely customizable watch faces. I use the Watchmaker app to create watch faces, but there are also sites and online communities where you can get faces designed by others. Literally there are tens of thousands of watch faces available. I add "On Tap" actions so a single tap on the date brings up my calendar, a tap on the weather icon brings up the full weather app with radar, a tap on the time display shows my daily agenda.3) Excellent integration with the phone. I can answer text messages without having to get my phone...just speak the reply to the watch and it sends it. The voice recognition is surprisingly good (it uses the Google voice recognition engine).4) Full, "OK Google" right on your wrist.5) The battery lasts all day with ease. I have the display "always on" (but that doesn't mean always bright). Because this type of display doesn't use any power to display black pixels, the less information you show on the "dim" setting, the longer the battery will last. I start the day around 6:00 A.M., use the watch all day for notifications (display and vibrate), Google Fit, reply to texts and emails...and the watch usually has 30% or more life left when I finally finish the day between 11:00 P.M. and midnight. No, it won't last two or three days like a simple pedometer, but this is so much more than a pedometer that it really can't be expected to do that. I just charge it every night because I don't wear a watch to bed anyway.6) Waterproof/water resistant. According to the specs, you could drop this to the bottom of a 10-foot-deep swimming pool and it will still work (provided you don't wait around too long to get it out). Rain is not an issue for this watch at all.7) Full notifications, but you can customize which apps are allowed to send notifications to the watch. Even when you can't hear your phone, having that vibrating watch on your wrist virtually guarantees you'll never miss a text or email.8) With the newest updates, the watch itself connects to WiFi and gets updates, so even if you leave your phone in the desk drawer you'll still get your notifications to your watch.9) Google maps with navigation right on your wrist. Very useful for walking from A to B in a city you're not familiar with.10) You don't have to have a Samsung phone to use this watch. It runs Android, it will pair with any android phone. (I've even read a few people saying they were able to pair it to an iPhone in a limited way.)11) You can use any 22-mm watch band.12) It's just really, really cool.The bad:Well, there just isn't anything. Everyone should have this as an extension of their Android smartphone.

This is a very good-looking band when paired with my Galaxy Gear Live. The chrome body of the watch blends right in with the steel of the band and makes it look like they were made to go with each other.The band is really easy to adjust for size...no removing links or anything like that. Just pop up the tension bar, slide the latch to the place you need it to fit your wrist, clamp the tension bar back down. Now you just have to hook the clasp on the latch and you're out the door with a watch that fits the way it's supposed to.The cut and polish of the band make it look good and the band is nice and heavy so I don't feel any fear of it breaking or wearing out.

It's a very nice book, but it doesn't match up well with the workbook By Claude V. King - EXPERIENCING GOD, REVISED - MEMBER BOOK (Revised & Updated) (7.2.2007), so trying to use both at the same time was a bit confusing and probably kept me from getting as much out of the study as I could have otherwise.I think a person should go through the workbook first because it goes into a lot more details about how to see God at work around you, through you, in your life and has useful exercises to help build that relationship. The book seems to be more about how things have worked for other people rather than a program for developing and expanding a personal relationship with God.

This is a really nice case and belt clip for the Galaxy Note 4, but it does have a couple issues.Good:1) Installation is really easy. Snap the two parts of the hard plastic together around the phone the put the silicone wrap around it.2) Very good drop protection. The silicone wrap is nice and thick and will absorb a lot of shock.3) Good screen protection. There is a built-in screen protector, and there is a nice-sized bevel around the edge of the phone that will help keep it from making contact with the ground if it falls face first.4) Nice belt-clip holster. I was concerned by the pictures about how tightly the phone would be held in the holster with just those four corner things and the clip, but it turns out it's held in quite tightly. There is a reassuring click when you push the phone in all the way (if you don't hear the click, you haven't secured your phone yet) and it's in there nice and tight. I tried it with a really good pull and the phone didn't come out of the holster, so I'm not worried about it falling out.Bad:1) Dark spots under the screen protector. (See photos) If I try to use a squeegee to smooth it out, it just gets worse. Maybe if I let it sit for a few days it will relax and fit to the screen better, but I don't have a few days to wait and see if that works. I need to use my phone every day, and I want it to look right when I do.2) There is one port that I cannot get the silicone outer wrap to sit correctly on. It's a small port, so I'm not too concerned about it, but it looks a bit off and it's one of those, "Once you notice it..." things.This is a good holster and case for the Note 4 and if I can figure out how to get that screen protector to lay down correctly and not be dark in some places and light in others, it will be a 5-star product.

There are two main coffee brands in Italy, Illy and Lavazza. In my experiences there, about 70% of bars (cafes) and restaurants use Illy, but about 90% of people use Lavazza in their homes. For my taste...Lavazza wins hands-down.The beans are perfectly roasted so they are dry enough to not ruin your burr grinder or automatic espresso machine, but grinding releases a kitchen full of aroma and a cupful of flavor.I would say this is a bold but medium flavor of coffee. It uses Arabica beans to smooth out the Robusto beans, and it's a very nice balance. Truely "Top Class" in all aspects. High quality beans, well roasted, and an excellent balance of smooth and robust flavors.This is an excellent coffee for making lattes and cappuccinos. The flavor works with the milk instead of one overpowering the other.It's not my favorite Lavazza for making espresso...that choice is Crema e Aroma Lavazza Crema e Aroma - Coffee Beans, 2.2-Pound Bag for its bold flavor, ample crema, and strong chocolate/licorice aftertaste.

The screen protector is not large enough to cover the screen of the Gear Live edge-to-edge. This means those edges gets caught on stuff all the time and the screen protector gets off. Once or twice when this happened I was able to just press it back down and it was okay, but usually it got stretched and deformed when this happened, and I had to use all three that came in the package in less than a month.I've generally had good experiences with Tech Armor, but this product is not very good.And Amazon...you really should have a policy that the seller isn't allowed to go around making "Not Helpful" votes on everyone who gives a negative, but accurate, description of the product.

A classic in every sense of the word. From the cultural icons of Long John Silver, pirates with peg legs, parrots on shoulders, and lively sea shanties being sung by a crew...Treasure Island is the place where most ideas of what a pirate looks like came from.There is violence...it's a book about pirates, after all...but nothing too graphic or gratuitous. Yes, people are shot and run through with swords, but you don't have the "blood spatter details" we're subjected to in so many media formats today. Leaving things to the imagination seems to be a lost art form, especially when everyone seems to feel the need to "one-up" the last book with even more graphic descriptions of violence...thankfully this book was written before that began, so you can let your teens or even tweens read this without having to worry about them being exposed to salacious details.Numerous other books, movies, even music have been influenced by Treasure Island. You really owe it to yourself to read this great adventure book and reinvigorate your imagination.

I bought this cradle to have one to throw in the glove compartment for those days when the battery decides (for some unknown reason) to run down in a hurry. This happened a couple times in the six months I've had the watch and I don't want it to happen again.Well, this is actually the best cradle I've had so far, and it's the other one that's going to be in the truck for "emergency" usage.This cradle fits on the watch firmly and securely but lets go easily (I push the tab toward the top of the watch screen instead of straight down because I think it's less abusive on that little locking tab that breaks so easily). The USB plug is very a very tight fit and doesn't shake out when the watch it charging in a moving vehicle.And mine came with a USB cable!I really like this charging cradle, and if I decide I ever need another one, this is at the top of the list for preferred replacement buy.

This is, for all intents and purposes, a "cryptic crossword" in reverse. Instead of having clues and filling out a crossword, then selecting letters from the puzzle to make the encoded phrase...you are given the phrase and have to take letters from it to fill out the answers to the clues (but it's not even in a crossword format).In fact, it's even a bit more simplistic than that. The letters always appear in a block in the answer rather than being spread out here and there...so if you have _ _ _ _ CH as the answer, you know you're looking for four letters IN A ROW in the quote that will make that a word.Works without internet access, so it's good for the kids in the car, or your bus or train ride to/from work.There is no exit button and the tablet back arrow left 11 processes running in the background. (-1 star)The developer makes a big deal about the lack of permissions, but there are still buttons for rating the app, more apps, facebook, twitter, about, etc. All the author has done here is made your tablet launch a browser or another app instead of having it done from within this app...so no need for network permissions. Does that seem less than honest to you? It does to me...so -1 star.There is a huge block of "Coming Soon" buttons for more puzzles...but after reading some of the other reviews, it looks like those have been there for a couple years, so it's hard to know if those are ever going to happen.As a FAOTD, this is a 3-star game. I'm not sure the simplified game play and the number of available puzzles makes it worth getting when it's not free, but if the developers actually follow up on all those "Coming Soon" promises, it would be worth 99 cents.

Makes it easy to have your Kindle library with you wherever you go. You can put this on any tablet and it functions just like it does on a Kindle...download your books, read them, they'll automatically sync among all devices so you don't ahve to hunt for the page you were on when you put down your tablet.There are very few phones that are large enough to read a book on (Samsung Note 4 being one of them), but in a pinch, it's better than just sitting and staring at the person across the aisle from you on the train.  :-)If you have a Kindle or use the Kindle for Desktop program, there are no surprises here.So if you want to have your Kindle library with you no matter what device you carry out the door with you in the morning, this is the app for you.

This is a fun, entertaining, and educational game. Given a limited number of pipes, elbows, T-junctions, etc., you have to connect all the pipe fittings on the edge of the game board. Sometimes it's not just a question of which ones you use, but the order (pipe-elbow-elbow-pipe may not word the same as pipe-pipe-elbow-elbow!) you put them on the board.I have seen similar games in the past (I don't recall any names) and this one seems at least on par with them. There are even board games based on this idea where you use cards showing the pipe pieces. I have always loved this kind of game, so I'm probably a bit biased, but the graphics are very nice, the gameplay is smooth, the tiles go where you want them (this publisher's Montezuma games were having some issues with tiles "jumping" an inch or two above your finger when you were dragging them...that hasn't happened on this game).There are 100 levels getting progressively more difficult by introducing things like pipes that go over or under other pipes, T and + connectors, etc.There are no permissions, no ad networks, no hidden code snippets, the game exits cleanly with no background processes, no IAPs. Oak Team really has it figured out when it comes to privacy.The game plays without WiFi or data connection, so you can take it with you on your commute, camping trips, or the kids can play in the car without burning through your data plan.There is the "rate-me" nag, but even on that, I have to give the developers kudos for not breaking into the game every three levels. It looks like they've learned their lesson and are only going to ask at startup. (And you can always try hitting the button then back-arrowing out without actually leaving a review...that seems to get rid of the nag on some tablets and phones.)There is a facebook button and a link to the dev's other games on the menu page, but given that they've removed ALL the permissions and security issues...I'm not even going to take a star away for that (THIS TIME. lol).Outstanding game play. No permissions. No privacy concerns.I wish every developer made their games this way.This will definitely go on my daughter's tablet because I know it won't have to worry about her privacy.

Couldn't be easier to set up or use.1) Plug everything you'll be using into the back of the switch.1a) Plug the device you'll use most often (cable/satellite box) into Input 1, the device you use next-most often (Blu-ray player) to Input 2, and the last device (game console or Roku/Fire TV box) to Input 3.2) Turn on all the devices you have plugged in.3) Insert the plug from the AC adapter to the switch.THAT'S IT!Now when you turn on the Blu-ray player or game console, the switch will automatically go to that input and pipe it through. Shut that device off, and it automatically switches back to the cable box!(One caveat here...your devices on Inputs 2 and 3 have to shut all the way down for the auto-switching to work. If they just go into standby/power-saving mode, they're still outputting a signal, so the switch won't know to deselect them.)There is absolutely no signal loss with this switch. The audio and video are exactly the same as having the HDMI cable going directly to the back of the TV.The lights on the front of the switch are kind of bright, but because the remote is IR and not RF, you have to have line-of-sight to use the remote, so you can't hide the switch in a cabinet. On the other hand, if everything is set up correctly, you should never need to use the remove...the auto-switching have worked perfectly for me every time so far.The only thing I don't have right now to test is a chromecast/fire stick/etc. "USB/self-powered" streaming device. As long as you have a power source close enough to the switch to plug in the stick, it should work fine.If you, like a lot of us, are finding that you have more HDMI devices than inputs on the back of your TV, this is a perfect solution. Even after we upgrade to a new TV with more inputs, I'm going to keep this switch set up for the satellite box and Blu-ray player because the auto-switching feature is so much easier than having to find out who used the TV remote last and where they put it then change the input on there.Unless you have a TV with 20 HDMI inputs, you *WILL* find this switch useful.

If an app has the words "Ad-Free" in its title, I expect it to be...well...free of ad networks! The developer of this app doesn't see it that way, and has included not one but TWO ad networks in this app. Namely, Charboost and Tapjoy networks.Oh...and Flurry analytics.AND In-app purchasing...in a paid app!Then every once in a while you get a popup that has some information about the game, or something to buy, or to like them on FaceBook and get your 50 free Golf "bux." Maybe it's just me...but when I'm playing a game and something pops up and forces me to stop playing and deal with the popup, it takes me right out of any fun I was having. I don't remember the fun I was having before nearly as much as I remember, "grumble grumble grumble stupid popup grumble click the X grumble..."  :-)The physics is a bit dubious (and I'm a physicist, so I noticed this right away). Specifically, the range (horizontal distance travelled by the ball) doesn't change enough with the change in launch angle. As you change the angle from 45 degrees, each step makes a small change in the range until you get to vertical and then there's a HUGE change.There is a practice tee...but no tutorial (at least none that I could find). I went to the practice tee and just started pushing buttons to figure out what did what.Overall, because of the ad networks, analytics, and IAPs...this is not an app you should have on your phone or tablet. The questionable physics and lack of tutorial just adds to that recommendation.

If you have an aquarium, you have to have a way of cleaning the detritus out of the gravel bed. A tank full of snails and algae eaters isn't enough to really clean up all that food and waste that accumulates at the bottom of the tank.This is a really great idea for cleaning that gravel (and the sides of the tank), but it's not without its drawbacks.You get two attachments, one for shoving down into the gravel so you can stir it around a little and break the stuff off of it, the other has a squeegee line that you use to clean the glass sides of the tank. Both cleaner heads produce good suction...and that's the first problem. You will occasionally pick up some gravel that may get caught in the impeller seriously reducing the suction. When this happens, you'll have to shut off the motor, let the rocks fall down the tube, and then start again. Which leads to the second issue. The impeller is at the to of the tube, and there's no way to prime it, so you have to have the entire length of the intake tube under water for the filter to operate. If you have a short tank, this can be an issue because the minimum length of the inlet tube is about 10 inches. If my water level is down much at all, I have to tip the filter sideways in order to get it started pumping; but once you get it started, you can move the unit around and even lift it up in the tank quite a bit and it will still work.The tube is two parts, one that slides inside the other to allow for extension for working with deeper tanks. The one real problem I have with this design is that there's no way to lock the tubes to keep the length constant...so if you push the head too far into the gravel, it can shorten the tube too much and you have to pull it out...but if you lift it too high while you're doing this, you'll lose suction and have to restart the whole process.On the other hand, having this adjustability means you can use one tool for several different aquariums.All things considered, this is a really good, all-around cleaning tool that any beginning or intermediate fish owner should have.

This is a really useful app. I've written a couple app scanners, and this one catches everything mine do (okay...and a couple things mine missed). The developers are getting really tricking about how they sneak certain analytics and/or ad networks into their code now, but this still catches them. It seems to be updated with new methods for detection on a fairly regular basis.Especially if you want to test apps for spyware/adware/tracking before putting something on your kids' tablets...this is the app to get.

I am very impressed! This app shows a lot of knots, has excellent, easy to follow animations of the knots being tied, and even has a bit about the history and applications of each knot.The fact that the animations are so well done AND you can adjust the speed, pause, replay, etc. is a HUGE plus.The app runs without WiFi (VERY useful if you're camping and forgot how to loop up that adjustable hitch knot or out on the boat and need to tie a running bow line).It's actually not that large a download considering how many animations are included. Kudos to the developer for going for efficiency rather than just bloating the app up.The app has ZERO permissions, ZERO adware/spyware/analytics, and exits cleanly via the tablet back arrow with no daughter processes.As today's Free App of the Day, there is no reason whatsoever not to get this app. If you only need to tie a real, utility knot once or twice a year...you'll want this app.Is it worth the asking price of $1.99 if you miss it as the FAOTD? It would be to me. I think it will be to you as well.

Comfortable fit, even across the shoulders. Nice and long so they stay tucked in.The material is very soft and comfortable...good for working out, running, working in the yard, or just lounging around the house.There's not anything bad that can be said about these T-shirts.

Yes, there are a couple issues (see below), but this is a well-designed nonogram puzzle with TONS of levels (actually infinite if you take the randomized, not-resulting-in-a-picture puzzles).Pros:- Hundreds of "picture" puzzles and infinite random puzzles. Lots of replay value just on the picture nonograms.- A nice tutorial that walks you through how to solve the puzzles.- Runs without WiFi or data connection, so you can play it on the bus or train ride to work...or around the campfire if your family likes to head out in the woods for vacation.- There is no "Quit" button, but the app exits cleanly with the tablet back button with no daughter processes running in the background.- It does have a button so you can brag about solving a puzzle on Twitter and/or Facebook, but no analytics or ad networks (that I could find, at least), so it's safe to let the kids have it on their tablets or phones too.- Only two permissions. Internet (for the Twitter/FB "brag on me" button) and access to the vibration function. No concerns there at all.Cons:- The music. OH THE MUSIC!!! Imagine the worst stereotypical "Chinese heroin den" music from an old Sherlock Holmes movie...then make it even more out-of-tune and irritating. THAT is the background music for this app. Turn your volume all the way off before you open the app (and then deselect the "music notes" icon)...you'll thank me.- The menus really need navigation buttons. Having to use the tablet's back button to go up a level in a menu is ridiculous.- The menus are not laid out in a very logical or useful manner. Settings are here and there, completely unrelated settings right next to each other and things that are related are in two different submenus.Summary:At $5, this app seems pretty expensive. But given the number of puzzles you get (plus the infinite number of random, just-for-logic-playing puzzles) it's really not that much. I've seen nonogram puzzle apps for $0.99 that only had 30 or 45 puzzles...you get HUNDREDS here for $5.As today's FAOTD...there's no reason in the world not to get this (well, unless you really hate nonograms. :-) )

Oh they sniffed around but looked at me like they were saying, "I'm not putting my mouth in there." but after a day or so they couldn't stand it anymore so they gave it a try. It did well and they seemed to be ok with it. It really does work well and the water is definitely cleaner than the other bowl of water that sat next to it. I think it is a good product if you are willing to keep it updated if you will and if your dogs accept it. It really does work well and of course is much better for your dogs to have fresh clean water at all times and this gives it to them. So  final statement, it definitely is a product that works and is good for your animals. I think it is well worth your consideration.

To me having certain things in the kitchen helps my mood and in doing so brings more peace into the household, even when it comes to dishcloths. This is a very nice product.  First it is very well made, sturdy and very useable for every need in the kitchen.  I love the color, it's warm and inviting and looks so nice on it's hook. It does one excellent job, is very absorbent  in many uses.  They wash well and dry well. All in all this is really a nice product well worth your consideration. I love them and think you will as well.

Made of wood, nylon hair, smooth use,  this product is perfect to use for your masterpiece.  Easy to control you don't have to worry about making that small paint dot that messes up your entire work because these are made for comfort and being  able to help you control where you go with the brush.  They are very sturdy however.  As I have said before during the cooler weather here in Florida we love to bring out our supplies and do some create painting.  These are perfect for both young and old, experienced and learning to use.  they really are great, nice  product recommended.  Product received for a honest review.

I just have to smile every time I look at this product because it just reminds me of giggles and enjoyment. You can dip them in paint (be careful) and decorate whatever you want to with them, or dip them in food coloring and use them that way. My Granddaughters decorated  the wall it looked really neat.  We also baked a cake and used icing and  put some all around the sides and on top.  We washed them real good first. We just had fun, and you will too, let your imagination go, enjoy, laugh and be happy, these are great to have.  Product received for a honest review.

This is a very nice product that is very well made and very easy to use.  Tips are great, paint does well with them. Structure is very good giving you movement that you need while you are working on your Master Piece. Different sizes give you a choice and a liberty while working because what you need is always close at hand. These are very nice and I'm happy to recommend them to you.  Product received for a honest review.

I absolutely love this Artists  Paint Brush Set.  First of all it is so elegant and beautiful that you are drawn to it. The set has different sizes for the job you set forth to do. They are not overly heavy, but very well made so you don't have to worry about them snapping, I have had that happen before I'm afraid to say. The tips are very good, will not get gooey but will help you to  place your paint where you need it. Many sizes to chose from for your purpose. I think these are great for younger painters to use as well because they could handle them better than a bigger brush.  Very nice product, well worth your consideration.  Product received for a honest review.

I was very happy to receive this product for a honest review and once I had the chance to give it a try I was double pleased.  First of all it is very well made and becoming looking, not too big and not too small, it's perfect size to fit in about any area you are wanting to use it at.  I used it with my phone, used it with my computer. I listened to music, spoke with it and just sat back and enjoyed the light show. I love lights I think they add beauty and grace to any product and this one gave me quite a show. Sound is crystal clear. My granddaughter and her friends came in while I was testing this, her eyes lit up and she smiled sweetly and said, "Grammie, I am getting this for Christmas right?"  Hum, I think not, hey get your own. *smile*....but anyway, they loved it so now I know this would make a great Christmas gift if you have teenagers in your life. This really is a very nice product. Works well, is becoming to look at and is reasonable priced.  I think you will like this one. Enjoy.Shirley Priscilla Johnson

I was happy to receive the Drift to Sleep Eye Mask because I use an eye mask every day both to block out light when I sleep and also for QiGong breathing practice.This mask is different from any that I own because it is molded, not soft and pliable.  It appears to be made from Styrofoam with a polyester covering.  The mask has deep indentations so that my eyes dont touch ever touch the mask itself.  Straps held by Velcro keep the mask firmly on my head.This mask is comfortable to wear.  It blocks out almost all light, except for the tiniest bit coming from where the material does not quite fit perfectly against my lower cheek.  The fact that my eyes dont touch the material of the mask is a new and welcomed experience for me.The front of the mask is black and the back is purple, not that the colors make any difference to me, but they may to some readers of this review.Bottom line: This is a genuinely comfortable sleep mask that is easy to fit on my head and does just what it is intended to do  block out light.  Recommended without reservation.

I was pleased to be asked to review this product because it appeared to be something I could use every evening after my shower.  I was correct.  With my hair still wet, I applied a few drops of the Body Oil to the palm of my hand, rubbed it in, and then massaged the oil into my hair, face, ears, and neck.The oil was absorbed quickly into my hair, face, and neck leaving my skin feeling hydrated and comfortable.  Also, I like very much the faint lavender smell of this oil.  Faint in the operative word  no need to worry that your hair and face will remind you that you have applied oil after showering.This morning, after washing my face, I again applied a couple of drops of the oil onto my hair, face, and neck with the same good results as last night.I was interested in the ingredients of this preparation, so I turned over the bottle and found the following: Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil, Ethlhexyl Palmitate, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Oil, Vitis Vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil, Triticum Vulgare (Wheat) Germ Oil, Tocopheryl Acetate, Parfum, Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil, Linoleic Acid, Linolenic Acid, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Oil.  Perhaps some readers are now asking: Where is the Jojoba Oil?  Good question.  I went to Amazon to read other reviews and found that Sara Ellis called the company about the missing Jojoba Oil on the label.  The company told her that the label was a mistake and that the product does contain Jojoba Oil.  Thanks, Sara.This all-purpose body oil will please most people who want an olive oil based moisturizer that has healthy and healing ingredients.  Recommended without reservation.

I walk every day so I jumped at the chance to get NUYU Health Meter to keep track of the distance I walk and I find that I just walked 1.76 miles around our block, which is accurate.When the Meter came I immediately took a quick look at the directions included with the device and followed them to remove the back cover of the meter and insert the battery, which was included in the package.  The back cover snapped back on again and I was good to go.I tested the meter by passing my finger over the display screen in the front of the meter and scrolled through the time, steps, distance, and calories burned.  The meter comes with a magnet device that allows the wearer to attach the meter to a belt or other article of clothing.  I decided to attach the meter to one of the three watch straps provided in the box.  I easily attached the meter to a black watch band and then put the watch/meter on my left wrist, with a little help from my wife to get a perfect fit.The watch/meter is small, comfortable, and actually looks pretty good on my arm.  Now, how does it work?Sadly, for me, not too well.  For whatever reason, the screen is not sensitive to my touch.  Again and again I am swiping across it and I am getting no response.  Ah, it just came on, but as quickly disappeared again.  I am disappointed.  I wanted to like this meter and I would use it every day if it worked properly.I went back to Amazon and read John Greens fine review and I learned that John has had no trouble with this meter.  Also, he explains well all the ins and outs of getting the meter to work, noting that the instructions that come with the meter are incomplete and not much use.  He gave us a means of getting a full instruction booklet online which I, unfortunately, did not find  just lots of advertisement for NUYU.Bottom Line:  Sorry, mine works sporadically.  I will watch as other reviews are posted to see if anyone else has the same problems I encountered.Update 1: John, the top reviewer, gave me some good advice concerning swiping the display.  If I lightly swipe the bottom of the display with the ring on the left and the snap button on the right, the display does work.  As John points out in his review, the instructions that come with the device are incomplete and not very helpful.  I will continue to look online for a complete user's guide.  If I find it I will report back to Amazon readers.Update 2: After experiencing frustration trying to find a useful manual, I went to PC magazine to see what one of their top reviewers had to say about the NUYU.  I quote: "The Nuyu Personal Activity Monitor isn't a great device, and its flaws became apparent after just a few hours of use. The activity tracker function is impossible to figure out how to use, and the screen takes some frustrating rubbing to wake up. There's no community, and no ability to track calories consumed or connect to apps that can."Comments welcomed.

I am holding in my hand the Lucien Piccard Women's LP-40031-22S Misty Rose Analog Display Japanese Quartz Silver Watch.  It comes packaged in a handsome, brown box that includes directions for how to set and use this attractive watch.This watch is advertised as a womans watch, but as every Amazon reviewer notes, it is large, perhaps too large for some women.  The diameter of the watch measures 2  inches and the stainless steel band is  inch.  Other specs for this watch are:  60 second sub dial, silver dial with silver tone and white hands, silver tone hour markers and blue Roman numerals; luminous; stainless steel crown with black enamel cabochon; sapphitek crystal; stainless steel case and bracelet, Japanese-quartz Movement, Case Diameter: 38mm, water resistant to 99 feet.I gave this watch to my wife who immediately put it on her wrist.  Of course, the band was much too large, but that is not a problem.  Our jeweler adjusts watch bands for ten or fifteen dollars.My wife liked the watch very much, but said it was just too big for her small wrist, and she is certainly correct in her judgment.  She thought the watch would be perfect for me and I think she is right.  In my opinion, this watch can easily be worn by a man and, in fact, it is so large and heavy that some men may find that it is just too big for them.Summary: This large, attractive, heavy watch can be worn by either men or women, but it is, perhaps, most appropriate for a man who wants a big, heavy watch with a wide band on his wrist.

Harness the Power of Behavioral Science to Transform Your Working Life sits right above the title of Caroline Webbs new book, How to Have a Good Day.  This book is suitable not only for people out working for a living, but for students and folks who are retired  that is, just about everyone.  Caroline delivers on her promise to show us how to use behavioral science research in our daily lives.  I think she has done a fine job of explaining basic principles of behavioral science and then showing how they can be best used in our life and work.Caroline starts at the beginning with our priorities and our goals.  Much like Stephen Covey in The Seven Habits of Successful People and Alan Lakein in How to Get Control of Your Time and Your Life, two famous books I highly recommend to readers of this review, Caroline asks us to think hard about what is most important to us and then to start with activities that help us punch a hole in our top A1 goal.  She suggests that we make a brain friendly to-do-list; that is, dont overload our brains capacity and build in rewards for ourselves.  Good advice!Multitasking is the buzz word much in favor today and Caroline completely debunks it with the latest research that proves that our minds do not multitask effectively.  Instead she suggests that we batch our tasks so that we are doing similar things one at a time.  For those people who work best in the morning, that is the right time to be working on high priority goals and objectives.  Caroline suggests that there is often a best time to get work done and we should seriously consider when that is and then schedule our time accordingly.Taking breaks to renew and refresh ourselves is high on Carolines list of suggestions for getting the most done each day.  She knows that diet and exercise are critical not only for our overall health and well-being, but also for our success at work.  Mindfulness and concentration are part of her plan to help us become reflective and thoughtful about our work.She suggests taking small steps to keep the job and our stress level under control.  Also, she asks us to take stock of our talents and abilities and to seek employment working at what we do best.  She advises us to just say No to activities that waste our time and she shows us how to be graceful even as we are avoiding work that is not right for us.  Sometimes, of course, we must work on tasks we would prefer not to do, but Caroline shows us how to establish boundaries to prevent this from happening.  She suggests that we picture the benefits of the activity we are putting off until tomorrow and reward ourselves for doing something to start work on the project we are hesitant to begin.In Part three of her book, Caroline discusses the importance of relationships at work and in our personal lives.  In order to build rapport with others she recommends that we ask open ended questions and try to set collaborative goals that allow for both sides to achieve some benefits.  She knows well the power of a positive mental attitude and a smile, in contrast to a frown, to enervate and inspire people.  Often, we are our own worst enemies and we must do some self-analysis to understand our own biases and shortcomings before we attempt to help other people with their problems.Active listening is a foundation for healthy relationships.  Those open ended questions previously mentioned give people a chance to say what is on their mind instead of having them attempt to figure out what they think we want to hear.  Nonverbal supportive behavior is a key to good listening.  We have all been in conversations where the person we are talking to is constantly looking at his or her watch.  Caroline suggests that maintaining eye contact is one of the keys to good listening and she is certainly correct.Part four of this book discuses Thinking and ways to become our smartest, wisest, most creative self.  Those open ended questions we ask others work just as well for ourselves, exploring options and opportunities by avoiding absolute positions on any problem we are trying to solve.  Banish always and never from our vocabulary and move away from constraints that paint us into a corner.  Caroline suggests that we ask: What could I do? Instead of What should I do?Influence, resilience, and energy are the concluding subjects Caroline covers in her fine, well written, and thoughtful book.  As mentioned in the beginning of this lengthy review, Caroline directs her attention to people at work, but it would be a serious mistake to think that this is the only audience suitable for her many suggestions about how to live a rewarding, productive, and fulfilling life.Everything in this book is grounded in solid research in the behavioral sciences, but readers of this review should not think that this means Carolines writing is stuffy or difficult to understand.  Quite the contrary.  She writes for the general public and includes many interesting examples taken from her consulting experience to illustrate the points she is making in her text.How to Have a Good Day is not a book that should be read quickly, but slowly and deliberately.  Francis Bacon says: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested: that is, some books are to be read only in parts, others to be read, but not curiously, and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention.  Carolines book is one of those special books that should be chewed and digested.  Recommended without reservation.

I ordered this new Toshiba Satellite laptop because I had recently upgraded my Dell laptop from Windows 8.1 to Windows 10 and I was not completely satisfied with the upgrade.  I wanted a machine with Windows 10 operating system factory installed.  I own a HP laptop with Windows 7, which I like very much, but I am not happy, like many others, with Windows 8.1, even though the Dell is a fine computer.Out of the box the Toshiba Satellite is the fastest and easiest computer to set up and get running that I have ever owned.  Within five minutes I was connected to the Internet and using Windows 10 without any problems.I immediately connected to YouTube to play some music for concentration while I tested the new Toshiba.  The sound I heard coming from the laptop is the worst of any computer I have ever owned  thin, tinny, most unpleasant sound.  OK, its a laptop.  I plugged in a small external speaker and now had decent sound.Now I started to surf the Net for a bit and noticed that the touch pad was so sensitive that I was sizing and re-sizing the large, 17 inch screen accidentally.  OK.  I installed without a problem a wireless mouse.  Now I was comfortable moving around the screen and exploring Windows 10, which has many similarities to Windows 7, but not Windows 8.1.  The Toshiba is not equipped with touch-screen technology.  That is a bit of an inconvenience, but not a problem for me.I took a look at the Quick Start Guide and noticed immediately two warnings.  The first told me that the Toshiba contains chemicals including lead, which can cause cancer, birth defects, or other reproductive harm.  I was warned to wash my hands after using the computer.  The next warning told me to avoid prolonged contact with the underside or surface of the computer.  When I read this, the laptop was sitting comfortably in my lap, like always.  I wondered where Toshiba expected me to put the laptop if not in my lap.Again, not a problem.  I do have a special base where I place the laptop when not in use.  It is thin and protects the computer from overheating.  I put the base on my lap and rested the computer on it, which is good advice given the next warning Toshiba gave me, which is that the base can become hot and  to avoid prolonged contact with the skin to prevent injury.  Everyone reading this review knows that some laptops do get hot, but most of us would agree that this is a design flaw that needs to be corrected.  Neither my Dell or HP laptops overheats.  Perhaps I am spoiled.Using this computer with Windows 10 is easy and effortless.  I brought up a movie from Netflix and watched it on the big 17 inch screen.  I was satisfied with the picture I received.  I then downloaded Google and Chromecast without difficulty and used Chromecast to project a music video from YouTube and then a Netflix film to my TV and I accomplished this without a any problems.The Toshiba Satellite is slower than either my Dell or HP laptops, but not so slow that I would consider it a problem.  Windows 10 works well so far and appears to be a dramatic improvement over Windows 8.1Many other reviewers on Amazon have criticized this computer and I wont repeat everything they have said.  My own conclusion is that the Toshiba Satellite is an inexpensive computer equipped with the latest operating system.  It works well, but a few more dollars spent will buy much faster and better computers.  The Toshiba is OK, but not any better than that.  The old adage, You get what you pay for is certainly appropriate for this laptop.Update 1: Please note my original comment about being slow. This is by far the slowest computer I have ever owned and used.  It is hard for me to believe that this is a new machine -- it is that slow.  I will turn it off, store it, and give it to someone who is willing to wait for the computer to work.  No reviewer on Amazon is enthusiastic abut this mediocre, budget computer.  Having had a chance to work with it, I can see why.

This is a difficult review to write for my Amazon readers because Vichy Laboratories has not been forthcoming about the ingredients of their Magistral Elixir.  This is all the information that is provided on Magistral Box: Contains a unique blend of oils rich in 10% Omegas 6-9 to immediately nourish the skin with moisture and help replenish skin with essential lipids. Paraben-free.  Folks, thats not good enough.  With some difficulty I found that the Magistral Oil contains Safflower Seed oil, Rice Bran Oil, and Shea Butter.  OK, thats better, but still not enough.  Additionally, much of the box containing the Magistral oil is written using the Cyrillic alphabet.  Vichy is a French company owned by LOreal.  Why the box has Cyrillic writing on it is a mystery to me.What about the oil itself?  It comes in a one ounce bottle with a useful dropper to dispense the golden colored oil.  I placed six drops of the oil in the palm of my hand and rubbed it gently into my face, hair, and neck.  The oil has a light, flowery smell that is most pleasant.  It is immediately absorbed into the skin.Almost all of the Amazon reviewers have positive things to say about this product and I must agree with them.  I like it and will continue to use it.  I will return in a month and update this review for Amazon readers to comment on the long term effects of using this product.

When I was asked to review this organizer I immediately said yes because I knew exactly how and where I would be using it  in the bathroom to organize the surprisingly large number of products that I use every day.This organizer is well built and made of a light black metal mesh.  I count nine separate compartments of various sizes and shapes.  From one end to the other I measure it at 8  inches and it is 4  inches wide and 4  inches deep  just the right size to place on a shelf in the bathroom.  The organizer does not take up much space, but holds all that I need within it.For example, I have toothbrushes in one compartment, floss in another, toothpaste in a third compartment, razors in a fourth, scissors in a fifth compartment, combs in a sixth, tweezers in a seventh, vitamin C oil in the eighth compartment, and in the ninth, a handy drawer that pulls out of the base of the organizer where I have spare floss saved.  Everything I need is efficiently organized and easy to get at and use.Obviously, this organizer would work just as well in my office, but it is much more valuable to me in the bathroom.  I am delighted with this product and recommend it without reservation.

When I saw these earrings advertised on Vine, I was impressed by how attractive they looked; but as we know, sometimes the pictures we see on Amazon look much better than the actual product.  That is not the case with these 18k Yellow Gold Plated Sterling Silver Round Filigree Lever Back Earrings.  I am looking at them now in their presentation box on my desk and they are beautiful.  Of course, they looked even better when my wife modeled them for me.Her first comment was to say how much she liked them, but then she asked Are they too big?  She answered her own question by saying, I dont think so.  I agreed with her.  But the point I am trying to make is that these earrings are medium to large size, at least by our standards.  How large?  The diameter of each earring is exactly one inch by my measurement.  They are thin and very light.The earrings are made of sterling silver and are gold plated.  The attachment for the ear has a locking device which my wife liked.  The chances of these earrings slipping out are nil.For earrings of this attractiveness and quality, the price seems reasonable.  Recommended without reservation.

I was pleased to receive a bottle of Thyme Essential Oil to review because I use aroma therapy in my work and I have read on the Internet that Thyme can be used to stimulate the mind, strengthen memory and concentration, and calm the nerves.This morning before I started work at my desk, I placed three drops of the Thyme Essential Oil in my diffuser.  It has a pleasant, woodsy smell with a hint of oregano, a bit like a freshly cut Christmas tree.  Does it help with concentration as I write this review?  I think so.For me, anything I can do to make my working environment healthier and more conducive to productivity is worth some time and effort.  I am pleased to add this Thyme Oil to my aroma therapy collection.I have not mentioned the many other uses for Thyme in addition to aroma therapy.  On the Internet I found that Thyme can help us lower blood pressure, stop us from coughing, boost immunity, disinfect the environment, use as an insect repellant, boost mood, add to foods like pesto sauce, and so forth.This Thyme Oil is advertised as 100% Pure Therapeutic Grade.  I have no reason to doubt this claim.  I will continue to use it and am pleased to recommend it on Amazon.

I was pleased to be asked to review these Rivacci Sunglasses.  They come in a handsome and effective leather carrying case with a small special purpose cloth for cleaning the lenses of the glasses.I carefully measured the glasses and each lens, top to bottom, is an inch and three fourths and from side to side the lens is a little over two inches at its widest point.  The frame itself measures five and a half inches at the top at its widest point and not quite two inches from top to bottom.  These sunglasses are medium sized and perfect for me.  The black frames I ordered are definitely for men, but certainly women can wear them as well.The arms of the frames are somewhat stiff and pull rather than snap open.  The frames appear to be well made.  Of course, everyones head is different, but as luck would have it, these glasses fit me very well  no danger of falling off and not tight, but genuinely comfortable to wear.The lenses are polarized and also have full UV 400 protection.  This is most important.  Study after study has demonstrated the importance of protecting our eyes from cataracts and skin cancer of the eyelids.  We can protect our eyes by wearing sunglasses like the Rivacci Wayfarers when we go out in the sun..These sunglasses look good, are extremely comfortable, very affordable, and do a good job protecting our eyes.  Highly recommended.

I should know better.  For the most part, Amazon reviewers are a savvy lot and they warned me that the Brita Pitcher I ordered was badly manufactured and poorly designed.  I went ahead and ordered it anyway, hoping they were wrong.  Sadly for me, they were not wrong.When I received the Pitcher I tried to do just what the instructions tell me to do; that is, thoroughly clean the pitcher with warm, soapy water.  Easier said than done.  As Sydney and Darcy, two different Amazon reviewers, warned me, it is not possible to thoroughly clean the pitcher because the top portion that holds the filter cant be removed from the much larger bottom portion that actually holds all the filtered water.  Darcy tells me that because it is impossible to clean between the filter portion of the pitcher and the bottom well that holds the water, the pitcher becomes contaminated with mildew.My wife and I did some serious problem solving.  We tried everything possible to remove the top portion holding the filter from the bottom portion which contains the water and we failed.  This pitcher must be thoroughly cleaned before it can be used and the design of the pitcher makes this task impossible.  One star.  Read all the terrible reviews and dont buy this cheaply made pitcher.

I was pleased to get the plastic container of Herseys Snack Mix and Reeses Snack Mix to review because we like to have a quick and easy snack available to us when we are taking our various walks on Cape Cod, where we will be next week.I have at my desk both packages of snack mix open.  Lets first look at the contents of the Hersheys snack mix.  First there are small almonds, then pretzels, Hershey candy pieces, small round candy balls with that are crunchy and taste a bit like those old time malted milk balls.  Thats it.  Sweet and salty.  Not quite a candy bar in a package, but close enough.  Both the almonds and the pretzels are fresh and crunchy.Next comes the Reese Snack Mix.  Crunchy peanuts instead of almonds are the nuts included.  Then the pretzels, M&Ms, and Reeses peanut butter cups.  Again, this snack mix is not far from a candy bar in a bag.By the handful, both snack mixes are a tasty treat.  The Reeses Snack Mix tells me that it has 280 calories, 6 grams of saturated fat, 230 mg of sodium, and 18 grams of sugar.  The Herseys Snack Mix has 270 calories, 6 grams of saturated fat, 320 grams of sodium, and 17 grams of sugar.Now everyone reading this review knows that these snack mixes are a sweet indulgence, not health food.  I will keep them handy when my grandkids come for a visit.  The two ounce packages wont last long.For the adults reading this review who like candy, you have come to the right place.  Those looking for a healthy treat will be avoiding these snack packs.

I was delighted to receive the Yoga Straps to review because each day I do QiGong and Tai Chi and both require flexibility.The straps I received are six feet long and an inch and a half wide.  One end has a well-made plastic buckle and at the other end the belt is turned over and sewn shut to allow the belt to be attached tightly to the buckle.  The straps are made from thick and durable cotton.  They will last for many years.For readers of this review what I wish to mention is the support given by HF Yoga, the maker of the straps.  They sent me a beautiful PDF file which illustrates several most useful stretches using the straps.  I will just mention one that I immediately tried  the forward bend pose.  This stretch helps to lengthen the spine, very useful in both Tai Chi and QiGong.  I highly recommend that anyone who decides to buy the straps request the PDF file from the sellers of this excellent product.These are high quality cotton straps that I definitely recommend to anyone who wants to get some help with stretches for exercise.

I was happy to receive these Duduma sunglasses for review because I rarely go outside the house without my sunglasses on.  Here are five reasons why anyone reading this review should also wear sunglasses outside:1. UV Protection. The sun's UV radiation can cause cataracts; benign growths on the eye's surface; and photokeratitis, sometimes called snow blindness, which is a temporary but painful sunburn of the eye's surface. Wide-brimmed hats and caps can block about 50 percent of UV radiation from the eyes but optometrists say that is not enough protection.  The Duduma advertisement tells us that these lenses block 99% or 100% of UVB and UVA rays UV 400.2. Blue-Light Protection. Long-term exposure to the blue and violet portion of the solar spectrum has been implicated as a risk factor for macular degeneration, especially for individuals that are sun sensitive.  The ad for these glasses does not mention protection from blue light.3. Comfortable vision. The sun's brightness and glare interferes with comfortable vision and the ability to see clearly by causing people to squint and the eyes to water.  The Duduma glasses are dark and reduce the impact of bright light outdoors.4. Dark adaptation. Spending just two or three hours in bright sunlight can hamper the eyes' ability to adapt quickly to nighttime or indoor light levels. This can make driving at night after spending a day in the sun more hazardous.5. Skin Cancer. Cancer of the eyelids and skin around the eyes is more common than people think. People should wear sunglasses outdoors whether they are working, driving, participating in sports, taking a walk, running errands or doing anything in the sun.  Everywhere you search on the Internet, you will get similar advice.  Wear sunglasses when you step outdoors.These Duduma glasses are large.  Top to bottom each lense measures 2 inches and side to side 2  inches.  The frames are made from a black plastic material with a matte finish.  The glasses are light, but appear to be durable.  Time will tell.These glasses fit me well and are most comfortable.  I hardly know I am wearing them.  I just looked in the mirror and the one thing I would like to again emphasize is the size of these glasses  large.  The price is reasonable for sunglasses of this make and quality.  Recommended.

The ViewPoint Backpack 250 is an outstanding piece of gear.  Yes, it is expensive, but in this case, you get what you pay for.First, the size of the back pack.  As it sits on the floor it is 18 inches tall, 11 inches wide, and 5  inches deep at its widest point at the bottom of the pack.  I would call it a mid-size back pack.  This pack can be easily worn by an average size middle-school student and a small adult.  My wife weighs 110 pounds and the pack was just right for her.  I weigh in at 180 pounds and the pack is also fine for me.  A big guy might find this pack a bit small.The harness is contoured with padded shoulder straps. There is a sternum strap for extra support and stability.  The back of the pack has three pads for comfort when the pack is being worn.  The pack itself appears to be made from light but sturdy nylon.Three major pockets are provided in the front of the pack.  The first placed at the back of the pack is thin, perfect for an IPad or notebooks.  The second pocket is the largest and has compartments for a variety of gear.  The front pocket gives convenient access to those items that are most likely to be often used and wanted.Additionally, there are pockets placed conveniently on both sides of the backpack.  The larger of the pockets has no zipper, the small pocket does have a zipper.  The front of the pack also has an open pocket and a strap for hanging things from the backpack.I think everyone reading this review now gets the idea that Lowepro, the makers of this backpack, have gone all out to design and produce a backpack suitable for anyone who wants to be able to carefully organize and carry a variety of different types of gear.  Recommended without reservation.

I am holding in my hand the At-A-Glance Weekly and Monthly Planner 2016.  This planer has a beige, thick cardboard cover with 2016 Weekly Planner printed right in the center of the cover.  It has a sixteen ring binder which allows the pages to lie completely flat on desk or table.  Tabs identify each of the months and make it quick and easy to get to the month and day desired.The first page of each month is a complete calendar of all the days in the month with a small space to make notations.  After the monthly calendar come individual pages that have the day and date noted with the page divided into four quadrants leaving plenty of room for notes for appointments or to-do-lists.  One quadrant is reserved just for notes.The length of the planner is 12 inches and the width is 8 and one half inches.  I took a piece of paper from my printer and placed it over the planner and noted that the planner is just slightly larger than that printer paper.This planner is attractive, well-made, and just the right size for use in an office or at a desk at home.  Recommended.

I was asked to review Tough Rides China Season One and I said yes because I knew so little about China and this series of films might help me learn more about this large and important country.  I was not disappointed.Colin and Ryan Pyle are two brothers; the younger, Colin, lives in Canada, while Ryan has been living in Shanghai, China for ten years.  He is a seasoned veteran who knows some of the Chinese language; also, he has traveled extensively in the country.  Ryan has convinced his brother Colin to take a motorcycle trip around the circumference of China, a very long and what will turn out to be an arduous trip.The two brothers plan to take approximately sixty days to go completely around the country on their brand new BMW motorcycles.  They have a trailing vehicle with much of the gear they will need to make this long and difficult trip.  Also, a person in the trailing vehicle will shoot video footage of Colin and Ryan on their bikes and the scenery they pass through each day.  The boys have their own video cameras on their person and film their adventure as they are riding along and also when they stop at places of interest along the way.It is fair to say they found many places of interest in China.  I was most interested in the Chinese cities they visited.  Throughout the entire trip the Chinese people the boys met in the cities and on the road were friendly and welcoming.  They invited the boys into their homes for dinners and socializing.  When the boys had mechanical problems with their bikes, they found mechanics who often were able to fix the problems.Tough Rides is reality television.  Anyone who decides to buy this DVD should understand that often the pictures will look like they have been taken by an amateur, not a professional filmmaker.  Also, the weather did not help with the filming. Sadly, the boys encountered much rain along the way, which was both dangerous and uncomfortable riding their bikes and made getting good film footage difficult.That said, the film the boys and their crew shot was on balance very good.  The boys were more impressed with the scenery they encountered along the way than I was, but they were on the ground in person and I was watching on TV.As mentioned earlier, what I was most impressed with was the people and their cities and towns.  Ryan, the older brother who turned thirty-two on the trip, loves China and it is easy to see why.  It is a large country, just a tiny bit smaller than the United States, if we include Alaska.  1.357 billion people live in China, whereas we have 318.9 million - that's over a billion more people in a country just about our size in terms of space available to live.  The boys discovered that any stereotypes we have about the Chinese are wrong.  There is tremendous diversity in this great country.I watched the entire series of films at one sitting - not quite three hours of viewing.  The time passed quickly because I was most interested in the subject matter and it was easy for me to relate to the boys and their adventure.  For anyone interested in China, the land and its people, I don't think they will be disappointed with this series of reality television.

I was pleased to accept the White Mulberries for review because I remember well a large mulberry tree in the lot behind our house that once a year gave out a bumper crop of delicious red mulberries.  These white mulberries, even though they are sun-dried, do taste quite similar to the red mulberries I have eaten in the past.I am looking at one of the white mulberries that is sitting on a dish beside my computer.  The dried berry measures a half an inch long and a quarter of an inch wide  that is, about a fourth of the size of a typical mulberry from our tree.  The white mulberry in my dish has a stem attached to it.  I removed the stem and put the mulberry in my mouth.  It is dry, yet easy to chew and has a sweet berry flavor.  Certainly these mulberries will go well as a topping for morning cereal  hot or cold  and of course, hot or cold green tea, one of my favorite beverages.  In addition, this evening I placed a small cup of the berries next to me and nibbled on them while I watched a program on TV.On WebMD I found the following information: White mulberry is often tried in order to help treat diabetes. It is also tried for treating high cholesterol levels, high blood pressure, the common cold and its symptoms, muscle and joint pain such as from arthritis, constipation, dizziness, ringing in the ears, hair loss, and premature graying.I went online to find out more about the Immortalitea Company that sent me the white mulberries and I discovered that their main business is tea.  The white mulberries are the only product that they sell that is not tea.100% dried while mulberries are the only ingredient listed on the package and the country of origin of the berries is Turkey.  The berries are USDA organic.Summary: These berries taste good and they are good for us.  Readers of this review who decide to buy this product need to remember that many of the berries have their stems attached to them.  I removed the stems before I ate the berries.  Recommended.Update 1: As mentioned in the first review, these mulberries are good to eat out of hand; they are crunchy and have a sweet berry flavor.  The berries are much more flavorful when a handful of them is put into your cup of hot green tea.  Now the berries soften up; just a bit of crunch is left.  But more important, the hot tea brings out the sweet flavor of the berries.  Delicious.  NB  I removed all the stems before the berries went into the tea.

I was delighted to receive a bag of Goji Berries from Healthworks because of their value to our health and well-being. Web MD tells us that: "Some studies using goji berry juice found possible benefits that included a feeling of well-being and calm, better athletic performance and quality of sleep, and weight loss." That's just a start. Many sites on the Web describe in detail the health benefits of these berries.The advertisement for these berries on the Amazon site tells us that: Healthworks Certified Organic Goji Berries are soft and chewy berries that can be added to many recipes or enjoyed on their own for a Vegan-Friendly, Gluten-Free, and Low-carb option! Adding a nutrient packed energizing ingredient like Healthworks Goji Berries is a decision your body and taste buds will be happy you made.I am sorry to report that the advertisement is not correct.  The Goji Berries in the bag I received are hard and difficult to chew.  Few people, I think, will choose to eat these berries out of the bag, no matter how healthy they are for us.  Additionally, these berries have very little taste.  Right now I am thinking hard about how to describe the berries I am eating.  The best I can do is to say they have a slightly sweet berry flavor, certainly not at all flavorful.To be fair to Healthworks, if these berries are placed in hot oatmeal and allowed to sit for fifteen minutes, or better yet, overnight, the berries do soften up considerably.Yes, these Goji Berries are a good, wholesome food and if used in hot green tea or hot cereal, the addition of the berries will add nutritional punch, if not much flavor, to the beverage or food being consumed.

This chair comes unassembled with seven pieces, not including the wheels, which are easily snapped on to the base of the chair.  All the various screws are shrink wrapped and conveniently numbered.  A large Philips screw driver is needed to assemble the chair.  An Allen Key is provided in the shrink wrap.The directions to assemble the chair are reasonably clear; it takes thirty minutes from start to finish to put the chair together.Now that the chair is assembled, two mechanisms allow the user to control the height of the chair and the backward tilt of the chair.  Both work reasonably well.The chair does tilt back easily when so adjusted, but the tilt is slight, at least in my opinion.  When I adjusted the height, it was perfect for me.But what about comfort?  This chair is uncomfortable because of the lumbar support padding at the back of the chair that forces the user into a completely upright and unnatural sitting position.  My experience is the same as all Amazon reviewers who do not like this chair.  It is badly designed and unpleasant to sit in.For readers of this review, take a close look at the pictures provided on Amazon and you will see immediately what I am talking about concerning the lumbar support.  Now that I have the chair and look again at the pictures on Amazon, the chair actually looks uncomfortable to me, and it is.  Not recommended.

I collect headphones and have tested and reviewed many for Amazon.  I was delighted to receive these from Vine to test and add to my collection.These headphones appear to be designed for teenagers.  The orange/red color does not appeal to me, but what do I know?  They are plastic and look inexpensive, which they are.  After making adjustments, the fit is tight for me and I have a normal size head, I think.  The ear pads are small and appear to be made of leather or some leather lookalike.But how do they sound?  Good.  I tested them first with a variety of music on my IPod.  Bob Dylan sounded great with Johnny Cash on The Girl form the North Country.  Yes, Bob Dylan can really sing when he wants to.  The music was crisp, clear, and well-defined. I then tried these headphones on my various computers.  In fact, I am listening to music to help me concentrate on YouTube as I write this review.  The sound I am hearing is free from distortion, rich, full, and most enjoyable.Look, everyone, these headphones cost $40.  Its not fair to compare them with the Philips A5 Pros that I recently reviewed that cost $363.00 or my favorite Sennheisers.  We know we get what we pay for.  That said, I think many teenagers are going to find these headphones acceptable.  3.5 stars is about right, I think.

I was delighted to receive from Sabai their Lavender Oil for testing because I am a collector and user of these healthful, precious oils.Lavender oil is well known for its benefits to our health and well-being.  Many sites are available on the Internet for those who want to know more about Lavender oil.  This brief quote will give the reader of this review a good idea concerning the information that is readily available for research and study: The health benefits of lavender essential oil include its ability to eliminate nervous tension, relieve pain, disinfect the scalp and skin, enhance blood circulation and treat respiratory problems.  Also, Lavender is considered the most useful of all essential oils.  Known to help relieve headaches, insomnia, tension and stress, its therapeutic properties have been well documented all over the world.  Much more information is available concerning this useful and great smelling oil on the Internet.But what does Lavender smell like?  The best way I can describe it is that it has a piney, flowery smell, with a hint of camphor.  I placed a few drops of the oil in my diffuser and now my office has a very light piney woods smell  good and clean and healthy.The bottle of the oil is open and right next to my keyboard as I write this review.  I now pick up the bottle and place it under my nose.  The smell is powerful and delightful.  Just as advertised, it is relaxing and stress reducing.  The scent remains in my nose for several minutes after I put the bottle back down on the desk.For those people who are experimenting with aroma therapy or those who just want their work space to have a light, piney aroma, this lavender oil is one that I recommend that you try.  I am delighted to add it to my collection of precious oils.

Like many readers of this review, I am always looking for the perfect meal replacement bar, or at least one that is suitable for a healthy snack or to take on a road trip.  The number one ingredient in this bar is Hemp Hearts, and that is the taste that comes through when eating this bar that looks like a thin, elongated brownie.  That is where the similarity ends.  My wife said, "It tastes like grass."  I asked her, "What about Apple Cinnamon?"  The box tells us that these bars should have that taste.  My wife said, "Nope, I'm sorry.  Grass."I use ground hemp in my oatmeal in the morning so I was prepared for the earthy taste of this bar, but somewhat less prepared for the sweetness that came with the earthiness.  No surprise.  The second ingredient is coconut sugar and the third ingredient is organic brown rice syrup, another sweetener.  Dried apple and cinnamon come at the tail end of ingredients, which is one reason it is hard to taste them.But listen, everyone, hemp is good for us.  Good for our heart, head, weight loss, digestion, and skin, to name just a few important reasons to add hemp to our diet.  I do taste a bit of apple with the hemp and I think this bar tastes reasonably good -- but that's just me.  Others disagree with me, but I must say that health food is not often the tastiest food option available to us.  I don't like the added sugar, but the bar would probably be inedible without it.I'm going out on a limb to give this bar four stars.  I'll come back later after I have finished every bar in the box and update the review.  So far so good.Update 1: I have been eating these bars every day and I like them.  I split the bar in two and have one piece in the morning and one in the afternoon.  I do taste the apple cinnamon and the sweetness does come through.  Perhaps these bars are an acquired taste.

I was delighted to receive and review the beautiful Lucien Piccard watch now being sold on Amazon.  The watch arrived in a handsome presentation box that included the very few instructions needed to set the watch.  The battery was included and the watch was running when it arrived at my door.After following the instructions and setting the watch, I now examined closely this lovely timepiece.  The watch itself measures an inch and a half in diameter. The description of this watch follows:  White mother of pearl dial with white crystal accents, gold tone hands and white and gold tone Arabic numerals; gold ion-plated stainless steel bezel encrusted with white crystals; sapphitek crystal; gold ion-plated stainless steel case; white leather strap.I checked online to learn more about Lucien Piccard and this is what I found: Lucien Piccard has been handcrafting fine watches for generations. Founded in 1923 in Switzerland, Lucien Piccard timepieces have adorned royalty, dignitaries and celebrities world-wide.Thats just a start.  One of the goals of this watch company is to make good watches affordable.  Readers of this review must decide for themselves about the cost of the watch, which is expensive.I immediately gave the watch to my wife who put it on her wrist and then admired it.  We both agree that it is an attractive watch.  Recommended.

The first thing I did when I received the Swaddle Me blankets from Amazon was to put them in the wash, as directed, and then in the drier to see how much the blankets would shrink.  They came out of the washer smelling fresh and clean.  I measured the blankets after they came out of the drier and they shrunk very little.  They are just short of a 40 inch by 40 inch square.The picture on the box the blankets come in shows a baby being swaddled in one of the blankets.  Some interested readers of this review might ask, why swaddle a baby.  Here is the answer: Swaddling is the art of snugly wrapping a baby in a blanket for warmth and security. It can keep your baby from being disturbed by her own startle reflex, and it can help her stay warm and toasty for the first few days of life until her internal thermostat kicks in. It may even help to calm your baby.These blankets will serve that purpose well.  They are constructed from light muslin and appear to be well made.  One of the blankets has a colorful blue green stripe pattern.  The other two blankets look quite similar to the picture provided on the box shown swaddling a baby on the Amazon site.These blankets are designed for swaddling a baby, but they may be just as well used as a light summer blanket for a baby or anyone else for that matter.  Recommended

Our old wheelbarrow was rusting out on us and it was time for a change.  We decided to purchase this Rubbermaid carry all and we are happy we did.First let me say that Commercial is the wrong description for this wheelbarrow clone.  It has been designed for light duty around the yard, not for carrying huge and heavy loads.  My wife puts her tools and other lawn gear in the Rubbermaid and easily either pushes it or pulls it around the yard.  She loves it.We paid $58.00 for our Rubbermaid on Amazon and I notice that the price has risen dramatically.  The Rubbermaid was delivered completely assembled in a large cardboard box.  Once out of the box it is ready to use.  It is perfect for grass clippings, leaves, yard debris, trash, tools, etc.  The handle is high enough to push and pull comfortably and it moves easily over the lawn.  It appears to be well made, but only time will tell about its durability.  So far so good.

I have tried many shampoos sent to me by Amazon Vine and this one by Nexus compares favorably with all of them.  Nexus tells us that this shampoo is enriched with babassu and marula oil and 100 percent pure, concentrated elastin protein which richly cleanses, replenishing lipids nourishing hair within.  If that sounds like hype to the readers of this review, I agree.  Such is the nature of advertising about all these hair care products.But does the shampoo work as advertised?  Yes.  When it comes out of the bottle it looks like a creamy lotion.  I squirted a small amount of the shampoo into the palm of my hand and then messaged it into my wet hair.  It has a light and pleasant smell which I liked.  It does not produce lots of lather, but just enough to get the hair washed clean.  It rinses out easily and completely.  After toweling dry, my hair felt soft and comfortable.  Right now as I write this review my hair feels clean and soft, very pleasant to touch.This is an expensive shampoo, but it is high quality and it does what it says it will do.
