Seems too good to be true? It is!. The SDHC card standard is valid up to a max capacity of 32GB. "Scarlett Star" is just the newest name stamped on this line generic fake-capacity cards. These cards offer high capacities at seemingly great values, but only deliver the potential for massive data loss.*** YOUR DATA IS AT RISK ***Beware of fake capacity SD memory cards. This and many other cheap, apparently-high-capacity SD memory cards are often low capacity 8GB or 16GB cards that have been hacked (controller chip settings altered) by dishonest Chinese suppliers so that they show a false inflated capacity - anywhere from 32GB up to 256GB and sometimes more. That is why their price is so low. These cards are then redistributed by many clueless resellers and by many other fully-aware resellers who are out to make a quick profit.Such cards will show their false capacity both in your phone and in Windows properties, and they will even work normally under low usage.  However, once their true (low) capacity is exceeded, they will quietly lose or corrupt your valuable data. Files will look okay in their folders, but will be corrupt when viewed, played, or otherwise read back.  Your photos, videos, music, contact list, and other data will be irretrievably lost.Be especially wary of cards with a stated capacity of 64GB or above marked as "SDHC" (not "SDXC"). The SD card association controls and licenses the SD card standards and they define "SDHC" up to a maximum capacity of 32GB. For larger capacity cards, only the "SDXC" standard is valid.Good 128GB SD cards are out there, but they will conform to the SDXC standard and will be clearly marked as such. Expect to pay roughly $25 and up for 64GB (as of Q3 2015) and at least twice that for 128GB cards.If you do buy a low-priced card, the first thing you should do is test the capacity using a utility called h2testw. This will fill the card with data and then verify that it can be read back intact. The write phase usually completes without error. It is the verify phase that exposes the fake capacity. Testing the first 32GB is usually sufficient.You can also test by filling the card up to at least 30% with videos or other large media files and then *most importantly* check to see if they can be played back. If the capacity is faked, the first few will play, but past some point, the rest will be corrupt.Search for "fake capacity flash" using your favorite search engine for more information.

It is interesting how about once a week, a "new" seller appears offering what appears to be identical (fake) products that differ only in the fictitious brand name stamped on the outside. This is yet another appearance.FACT: Nobody makes 256GB micro-SD cards - NOBODY. The market is, however, filled with hacked, fake-capacity drives that advertise huge capacities, but deliver only false expectations and the potential for massive data loss.You risk losing some or all of your valuable data If you buy this card. Read on...Beware of fake capacity SD memory cards. This and many other cheap, apparently-high-capacity SD memory cards are often low capacity 8GB or 16GB cards that have been hacked (controller chip settings altered) by dishonest Chinese suppliers so that they show a false inflated capacity. That is why their price is so low. These cards are then redistributed by many clueless resellers and by many other fully-aware resellers who are out to make a quick profit.Such cards will show their false capacity both in your phone and in Windows properties, and they will even work normally under low usage. However, once their true (low) capacity is exceeded, they will quietly lose or corrupt your valuable data. Files will look okay in their folders, but will be corrupt when viewed, played, or otherwise read back. Your photos, videos, music, contact list, and other data will be irretrievably lost.*Nobody* currently manufactures 256GB micro-SD cards. The technology is simply not there yet to pack that much memory onto a single chip. As of Q3 2015, the top capacity for micro SD is generally 128GB. (The one exception is a very expensive 200GB micro SD card recently introduced by SanDisk.) Good cards are out there, but anything 64GB and up will conform to the SDXC standard and will be clearly marked as such. Expect to pay roughly $25 and up for 64GB (as of Q3 2015) and at least twice that for 128GB cards. The 256GB cards (full size SD cards only) run over $100.If you do buy a low-priced card, the first thing you should do is test the capacity using a utility called h2testw. This will fill the card with data and then verify that it can be read back intact. The write phase usually completes without error. It is the verify phase that exposes the fake capacity. Testing the first 32GB is usually sufficient.You can also test by filling the card up to at least 30% with videos or other large media files and then *most importantly* check to see if they can be played back. If the capacity is faked, the first few will play, but past some point, the rest will be corrupt.

There are precisely two flash drive models on the market that have 512GB or genuine memory (made by Kingston and Corsair). This drive is not one of them.You risk losing some or all of your valuable data if you buy this drive. read on.Beware fake capacity flash drives. This and many other cheap apparently high capacity flash drives are really low capacity 4GB or 8GB drives that have been hacked (controller chip settings altered) by dishonest Chinese suppliers so that they show a false inflated capacity. That is why their price is so low. Such drives are then redistributed by a few clueless resellers and by many other fully-aware resellers who are out to make a quick profit.These drives will show their false capacity in Windows properties, but will quietly lose or corrupt your valuable data once their true capacity is exceeded. They will seem to work at first and files will look okay in their folders, but you will eventually find some or all of your data unusable when played, viewed, or otherwise read back. Your valuable data will be irretrievably lost.Only a few manufacturers such as Kingston and Corsair make legitimate 512GB drives and those cost several hundred dollars (as of Q3 2015). The lion's share of this cost is the memory chips themselves. The circuit card, case, assembly costs, packaging, and distribution only add a few dollars.The Chinese are great at producing a wide range of interesting generic and novelty designs, but they don't have a magic supply of cheap memory chips. They also do not have the ability to make a 512GB drive using a single chip design as is contained in this drive. The technology is not there yet.Be especially cautious of sellers that offer the same style in multiple sizes, but where each doubling in size is only 25% to 50% more than the size below.  For example, if the 64GB drive is only $5 more than the 32GB drive, or where the 128GB drive is only $10 more than the 64GB.  Real memory is not that cheap.If you do buy a low-priced drive, the first thing you should do is test the capacity using a utility called h2testw. This will fill the drive with data and then verify that it can be read back intact. The write phase usually completes without error. It is the verify phase that exposes the fake capacity. Testing the first 32GB is usually sufficient. For reasons stated above, you cannot trust the capacity displayed in Windows properties.You can also test by filling the drive up to at least 35GB with videos or other large media files and then *most importantly* check to see if they can be played back. If the capacity is faked, the first few will play, but past some point, the rest will be corrupt.Do not trust the capacity or space remaining shown in the properties display - that is exactly what is faked.Search for "fake capacity flash" using your favorite search engine for more information.

A gazillion reasons why I love this:storage for my stuff while remodeling: I have my paint swatches, tile pieces, a pencil, tape measure, and calculator inside, with my "to buy" list on front for when I go to the home supply store (and return home to buy on Amazon). A really great design to keep everything together.My son also uses one for school stuff.
great for study and research, but pretty basic. I didn't feel like the glue was very strong on these...some fell out when that usually never happens.
Basic. Colorful.  Filed things as expected.  No fireworks.

The slider pieces fall off quite easily. Which makes these essentially worthless, once they fall off. I will stick with regular ziploc closures. If someone had arthritis or a hand problem, these may be helpful, but they weren't for us.

They call this a basic leather strap belt, and that's what it is. Basic. Which is GOOD.  Sometimes it's hard to find a simple and traditional men's belt without bling and without funky embroidery. This is a classic style that any guy could use. The silvertone buckle is classy, and these look great with Wranglers or Levis, but also with khaki twill pants.  A good casual belt.The stitching is all monochromatic, and is well secured on all points.Edges are beveled down so as to be soft at the belt loops and not just sharp leather edges.  Very pleased.I rec'd a sample for review and comment. My husband loves.

I'm super pleased with this shampoo and conditioner set.  First, it has no yucky fragrance like some do that irritate your senses and collide with your fragrance.The keratin is for smoothing and repair and it seems to do that. My hair had bad split ends (still does, I'm sure) but this has a soft feel that seems like the ratty edges are smoothed down. Feels full too, with volume.I like buying in pairs so they're always handy, and I like this brand, having used it before.There's not a ton of lather, which is fine for me.  The conditioner only requires a small amount as compared to some brands. Combs out well with a wide tooth comb while wet and dries nicely.  Gives me two good days before my hair needs shampooing again (for me, that's long!).I rec'd a sample for inspection and review.

These are thin rolls. I'm not sure why, I've used this brand before to great liking, but these are half the thickness of the previous rolls I bought here on Amazon.  "Choose a size" doesn't mean much if you are choosing from small rolls that barely last.I like the product, my dermatologist said Viva was the only towel safe enough to use on my face, so it is soft and clothlike, but this didn't feel like a good buy.

This is amazing stuff. Use it like you would any contact paper, and then use it as a chalkboard. Cover a box with it, Install it on pantry walls.  Use in an office.  Whatever works, it's super easy to apply (grid on back for straight lines) and easy to remove. Not as thick as some chalkboard rolls, but it does the job. The chalk marker is all you need for notes, ingredients, whatever.I'm using this in bathroom drawers, and using a ruler and the marker to make lines in the drawers for my kid so he knows where each item (lotion, soap, toothpaste) should go, like parking spaces. Then I let him color in the other parts.  A novelty, yes, but enough to keep him interested in neatness.I rec'd a sample for inspection and review.

Sadly, not as strong as Secret. My pits NEED Secret, but I'm burned out on it after years of use. This works for a few hours, but a rough day of activity, forget it.  It has a nice scent, very light, and the price was right.  I'm going to continue a few months and see if I can go back to Secret.

These are amazing!  Forget the little chalkboard stickers you see, this is a great way to use empty wall space for a great command center for the family. Keep lists of chores, things to buy, schedules, anything. And you can move it, it's not permanently applied and won't hurt your walls.Also, for homeschooling, it works great for the kids to practice their spelling or math on, and getting up and writing it makes it more memorable than constantly sitting and doing paperwork.Athletes can use this in the garage to keep track of strength routines, repetitions, and goals.A handyman can use this to keep track of tools he/she lends out. No, wait. NEVER LEND OUT TOOLS!I rec'd a box of this for comment and review.
has an odd "cookie dough" scent and not in a good way.  Very thick, hard to spread or lather up.  Got for my young son who is breaking out, but it still seems to irritate his skin.

When I first got this, I wasn't sure how to use it.  I didn't have any suspicious nannies to keep an eye on, and my pets are not that entertaining. I didn't want to use it outside as it is far too nice and I didn't want to risk the elements getting to it even if I had it in a covered place (I thought fog might be too dangerous).But I find the genius idea:  since my house is going up for sale, and lots of people will be going through my house on open house days or caravans.  There's been numerous thefts in the area when these events happen. So I set this up in the large room in my house where the only things of value are (I hid the most important things before the Open House days).  I set it up to be able to watch later what people were looking at and saying about my house. It was an amazing idea. The realtor didn't like it but I made it subtle. I figured, it's my house so I can film if I want.Nothing was stolen and it was interesting to hear what people were saying: they liked my windows and blinds and exterior, and hated my fireplace!  Good to know.  And would be great if someone were prowling around when the realtor was out of the room.I can't seem to get the video uploaded from my computer but I assure you it was crisp and clear and within forty feet it was flawless, you could practically read a book.I rec'd a sample for comment and feedback from manufacturer.

On my patio I have some wood strips that go across to a pergola style beam.  I used two sets of these to criss cross across the side strips so that it made a starry ceiling like effect on my patio.  With chairs underneath and a glass of wine, it looked elegant, like I needed to have a party. I can see if I buy more of these I will be able to add more lines to fill in and that will look even better.The way to get the most length out of these is straight pieces and not wrapping around too much or you lose length.  This method made me get quite a bit of starry lights for overhead.  I was thinking of doing the same on a handrail that we have outside in the yard that has no exterior lights. It would at least let me see where I am walking!  I'm a big fan of these lights for so many options (go to Pinterest for many more ideas!!!)I rec'd a sample for inspection and comment at no charge.

I've been obsessed with fairy lights now!  I've used them indoors and around trees and shrubs.This set I used differently. I have a big eave on the front of my older house and my house doesn't have many outdoor lights. So I used this (VERY CAREFULLY) with a staple gun to run the length of the eave.  Then I tucked the solar panel on the side of the eave that doesn't show from the street.  I put them way up where the eave meets the wall.Now for curb appeal, when you drive up, you don't see the lights, you just see a lovely glow, like strip lighting, under the eave. You don't see until you are right under the eave. This makes my house look like something in a magazine or a fancy new home: from the street the glow is substantial and isn't enough to keep you up at night but makes the front look glowing. You don't see the individual colors on this application.  If you look at home magazines, many have this style.  Driving up to my house at night, with the lights around a big tree and on the garage, as well as wrapped around a big ceanosis bush, it looks very elegant.This is a way to get that look that is cheaper than strip lighting, no wiring, and easy to do.  Removable too. I just HIGHLY suggest to be careful with the staple gun so it doesn't pierce the wires.I rec'd a sample for feedback and comment from manufacturer.

Super cute dragonflies that didn't get to fly outside!  Why?  I got creative. My son has a room inspired by bug decor of all sorts.  I saw these and wanted to figure out a way to incorporate them.  First problem: they are solar.  Then I realized, that's great, no worry of him getting shocked!So I took a big glass bottle (sort of like a huge Mason jar) and wrapped these inside (like a bug collector jar).  Then I put it on a very high bookcase in his room. It was a piece of cake to open the screen just a bit and wind the LED solar panel outside and on to the sunny facing roof. You could hardly see the cord going outside the window. I then closed the window gently.The result?  At night he has a nightlight up high that goes with his bug decor, shuts itself off, and is unlike any other nightlight you can imagine.  It really does look like a bug collector jar, so next to it I put a little picture of a magnifying glass and a stuffed dragonfly plush he had.  Looks super cute. I hope it shows in the photos well.He loves it, and also how the lights reflect up to the ceiling.  I'm going to try and put it on Pinterest.I rec'd a sample set to try for comment and feedback to manufacturer.  Be sure to think outside the box this year because these lights are versatile ALL the time.

I'm not sure if other places have this, but in CA people are using these sorts of lights year-round. Mostly in the yard wrapped around trees and shrubs. Especially restaurants and stores.I have rec'd some of these to try and I adore them.  I have first started with wrapping one set around an old oak tree, It was easy to do as they are wrapped well to unwind (some other brands come in a tangled box!).  I just rolled around each limb and up to the leaf line. I used two on one big tree, and made sure the solar panels (little flowers) were visible in bright light (I tucked them on top of a rock beneath the tree and secured with rubber bands.That night, after a full day of light, it was gorgeous. Not so much Xmas light style but just a glow that went up into the top of the tree and looked fantastic.  I like that it's not electricity and I don't have to remember to turn them off!I rec'd a sample from manufacturer for comment and review. Huge like. PM if you have questions.

I had completely given up on screen doors.  Let me tell you why.We live in CA with Santa Ana winds that come and basically feel like tornados...they are hot winds that come on at night. With metal screen doors like we previously had, we'd find them twisted and bent in the morning.  You could tell when the winds were coming but not much to do about it unless you wanted to completely uninstall a screen door, which is a nightmare.Next, we had little kids with our last metal screen door.  Literally ten minutes after installing it, my husband stood back proudly (having spent most of the day working on it, leveling it, etc) and our 5 year old rode down a hill and right into the door, dinging it inwards and forever ruining it. Sad face daddy.When you use installed metal screen doors you have to screw into all your trim boards around the door.  So when those doors are gone, you may find your trim is full of holes that need patching. A series of doors over the years have left my front door trim look like an agitated giant woodpecker went nuts.  So I had to putty them all and paint and you can still tell something was bolted in.So we gave up. Forget it, keep the doors shut, even when there's a breeze.Until I was offered a chance to sample this.  Wow.  First big deal: installing it involves NO bolts or hardware that will tear up your wood trim around the door. Second big deal: Easy to remove if you have big winds coming.  Third big deal: It shuts itself, even after my dog runs in. There's more than 20 magnets that just instantly connect. The flies don't have a chance to come in.  They are in awe.Also, if you are a renter, you won't be tearing up the door area or trim.It's very sturdy and installed with thumb tacks and velcro.  Not a security door, but if your kids are going in and out all day and leaving the door open, then it's perfect.  It's black so it goes with any decor.  It comes in other colors but for me, this was perfect. It comes with everything.It's also so nice to have a cross breeze coming in.....our CA summer has really made this an ideal benefit.I rec'd a sample at no charge. Will buy more, including one for the garage, since it gets so stuffy.

I have this entire product line I think. I love STX for so many reasons.  Here we go!1. The silky poly and mesh pieces (shorts here) are super soft and loose, so that my son with sensitive skin is comfy in them.  He can barely wear jeans because of the contact friction.  These are long and loose and great for sports, but also every day.  In fact, he's taken to sleeping in his favorite pair.  I guess when your skin doensn't hurt, it matters even to a kid.2. These wash really well and dry fast.3. The elastic waist is folded wide and strong with various seams so that it stays put and will not come undone after several uses.4. The colors in their product line all coordinate: limes, yellows, oranges, etc.  It makes it easy for him to dress.5.  The price is very reasonable compared to other athletic brands like UnderArmour for kids and Nike and Adidas.  I believe it's the same mesh/poly but the price is right. You can often get a shirt/short combo for less than one piece of a higher end brand.Very pleased, and highly recommend

I have been trying this with a whole bunch of curiosity.  All of us in the family have been sick and one of things we were told was that probiotics help immunity. Since three of us have been hospitalized with pneumonia, I'm going over anything that can help with immunity.These are a simple gel that even my young son can take.  The first thing I looked for was if it would upset my stomach as Activia and other probiotics have done.  I realize it is meant to work on the "digestive" areas and that some upset and unpleasant occurences may happen upon initial use. But so far, taking two per day, at different times (total of 2), I haven't been sick in any way.Another big criteria for me with any supplements or vitamins is if they have an aftertaste, make me burp, or make me nauseated. That happens with many.  So far, not with this.I will update this review if I find in four weeks that we're doing better.  It matters as this winter season is rough on everyone.

I have a bunch of STX products and like them all (except the cotton shirts). This is a poly spun "performance" shirt which means it is softer and lighter, more for an athlete as it dries fast and allows a wide range of motion with larger arm holes.The color combo is great and it fits perfect. My son has skin sensitivity issues and this feels good on his skin. I used to do all cotton for him but some cotton, cheaply spun cotton, often agitates his skin to the point of a rash.  For example, he can never wear madras or twill and even a polo shirt at times (that kind of interweave) feels terrible to him and leaves a rash.These are loose and super soft. I wish they made these in Mom sizes.  I've heard that they tend to hold BO in when you wash them, but he's not at the BO stage yet so no worries.From here on out, it's this type of fabric for him.  If you're not familiar, it feels like a swim rash guard fabric with a lighter fabric and less slickness.

Gorgeous. Beyond gorgeous.  The ultimate coffee table book, except that this should be looked at and coffee table books usually just gather dust and coffee cup rings.It's an oversized hardback and it's split into different continents with the natural wonders of each.  No text, other than the location, which is great.  Some are landforms, others are animals, and some are weather phenomenon.  All are stunning.I have a young son and we don't travel like we did 20 years ago before he came along. Much of these pictures reveal a world he'll likely never get to go see.  I love for him to see how gorgeous the earth is, so he'll want to care for it.  The fact that you don't see people makes the images magical (people screw things up so much!).After this, Slovenia is on my list of places to go, at spot #1.  The rivers are too beautiful. It's almost like solar eclipse beautiful: don't look directly at it or you're blinded by it.Great gift for some, for me this will be my anti-anxiety meditation.

My son loves this fabric, the softer fabric that hangs better than cotton. I used to buy all cotton all the time but he likes this fabric and says it's cooler.Sizes are perfect and the colors are great shades of grey, black, and orange.  I have this brand in other pieces and they wash really well. Not so much the STX cotton, those don't wash well. These are different and dry fast.My son has skin sensitivities too and this doesn't bother his skin or tug too much in anyone place.

This is an item I'd expect to see on Shark Tank. It's so simple, but so cool. Sunflower seeds are my weakness, but it looks pretty gross eating them and putting the shells on a napkin (or worse, spitting them!).  If I'm curled up with a book and seeds, I can lose all track of time and end up with a mess.So I saw this and first was, "HUH?" because I really didn't understand how it works. I thought it was a deformed chip and dip dish.  Once I saw a picture though of the pistachios in it with shells being put underneath, I thought it was awesome.  My first reaction was SEEDS followed by how great this would be when we play cards.  Everyone likes nuts when we play poker and cards but it's a messy table to do all that. If you buy one for each person, they get their serving and their trash can, all in one.  Of course, you can separate them too if you wish, but there's no need.Versatile too though, if you need dishes for another reason.  My son made miso soup and used this to drink the soup out of it, leaving the lid container off.I got the green one, and it's very cool. I plan to get one for each in our card club.  It's melamine and could probably go in the dishwasher but I am not going to try that, it's easy enough to wash simply by hand.I rec'd a sample to evaluate and review from manufacturer.

This is a tough cookie when it comes to speakers, but I'm not going to do anything too rough with it. Hiking? Pass. Showering with it? Um, no.  Cycling?  Who does that?  Except for fit people, I mean.I'm using it in the most ordinary way possible, hooked on to my backpack.  I can use it and leave my phone in my pack and have this playing music right from the carabiner clip attachment.  I am confident it'll handle rain, but I live in CA so that's not really a big risk.  And I'm not willing to throw it around to test it because it just looks great and I don't want it dinged up. I'm confident it would survive, as I've used other Soaiy products before.  I'm just not a person that needs alot of "shockproof" items in my life!The sound is very clear.  A two hour charge had it going all day when I ran errands and between classes. The sync up is very easy, just took seconds.  I also like it better than the speaker on my laptop so I use it at home too when I hang my bag.Phone features are standard and sound good, easy to control as well. My Android approves.I rec'd a sample for evaluation and comment from manufacturer.

So I had this a few days but hadn't had the opportunity to test it out. My son wanted it for his bicycling but I actually wanted a flashlight by my bed for winter.  There's never one when you need it!Last night, my neighbor's teenage kitten got outside in the dark. It was FREEZING cold and the kitten was acting very teenager-ish, she did not want to come in the house.  She was apparently looking for a party.  So I took this out and tried everything but she'd scamper out of sight whenever she could. Finally I played with the adjustments on the front, the way you can narrow it and widen the light.  This interested her enough to come closer. My husband threw tiny rocks into the bushes while I put the light on them and she heard the noise and was eager to either meet a big mouse or Mr. Tomcat because she headed right for the light and noise. And then ran away.So then we tried the strobe effect. This too caught her attention, and I basically used it to walk her closer to the front door where she finally sat down and decided she was cold and wanted in RIGHT THAT SECOND.  She's a brat. Good thing she's cute.Anyway, it comes with a rechargeable battery so you can use it immediately. Has the bike clamp and adapter to recharge in the wall.  The whole kit is ready to go.  Just keep the cats in!I rec'd a sample for evaluation and comment from manufacturer.

This is something I've wanted for a long time.  I've had trucks spill gravel out and break my windshield TWICE in less than six months.  So I was eager to try this out.  Now, I'm not a tech savvy person, so I needed my sons to help me get it hooked up.  All you need is a SD card, it comes with everything else.  They had it up and going and testing it in fifteen minutes.The suction cup is really secure and doesn't vibrate like you'd think so you get an even picture.  The size of your SD card matters, so go big if you can.  I like that each image is date stamped so the next truck that does it, I will have their license plate AND the time so I can get my windshield replaced free.It's also very small, which makes it nice if you see something weird. I have crazy neighbors and one day they were up to something (I could see from far back on the road) by the side of the road. I leaned over and just tilted it a bit to view a bit more to the right. As I got closer, they weren't doing anything, but I did get a nice vision of all of them flipping me off.  I'm sure they didn't know the camera was there (and I'm a nice person!).You notice more on playback when you hook it to your laptop (see picture 2), and you see more details.  With anything, I think the detail would be helpful. These are required in Europe, it's about time for us.  And I had a friend who put one in the back so he could observe his teenager's driving habits, and the kid never saw it back there.  Very sneaky!I received a sample to test and review and provide feedback.

Perfect as a mask, it makes cleaning the bathroom very nice!WHY?  Because once a week I put this mask in my hair, comb through and wrap it up. Then I clean the heck out of my bathroom. When I'm done, I do a shower and rinse it out and then do full makeup, blow out, mani-pedi, eyebrow plucking, etc.It's like a spa but not.  You take what you can get.This feels great and my hair was softened even more from this. I use Luseta's shampoos and this was a great accent for that.  It smells divine and is light enough to leave in.I'm very pleased.I rec'd a sample for review and feedback.

I like this set very  much, but I still like the Keratin and Coconut Milk versions better.  This has a nice feel to it, and is definitely a high end shampoo. My hair knows.It doesn't have a big lather, which is fine for me, because it's not stripping my hair of natural oils. The argan oil doesn't add oil, it just helps with repairing and softening hair.  Argan oil is big right now in beauty treatments for it's softening benefits.  And there's no discernible fragrance to conflict with your perfume.My hair was definitely soft and light and styled well. I styled with B&B's Repair Blow Dry cream and my hair was perfect for three full days.I'm hoping Luseta comes out with a comb-through hairspray next!I rec'd a sample for review and feedback.

This is NOT a heavily scented coconut product like you'd find at Bath and Body Works. I can't even go into that store for the heavy fragrances!  This is much more subtle and nice. Considering my favorite perfume has a vanilla edge to it (Pacifica), this goes perfectly. Light scent, not a conflicting scent.I love getting this in a set, even though I will run out of the conditioner first because I have long hair.  My hair is light and bouncy with this shampoo, and doesn't feel stripped like some shampoos.  I've used high end (Phyto and Bumble&Bumble) and low end (Suave) and this is the best of all worlds.  I would consider this a high end product and you don't need a lot.This was a treat to try!  I was given a sample for review and inspection and comment.  I hope they do a Vanilla scent soon!

We are homeschoolers and having clipboards around is SO helpful for taking notes outside, in the car, on field trips, or even in front of the TV. I buy the longer legal size because I can write instructions below where the bottom of the paper would end. For example, on one I put Capitalize and Punctuate with a sharpie underneath, just as a reminder because those get forgotten.I also find that younger kids, when writing, have a hard time holding down a page with one hand so it doesn't move and then writing with the other hand. This simplifies it a bit, holding the paper still so they can focus on writing.I also use household twine and tie a pencil to the loop on top with about 24" of length so that there's always a pencil handy. The hook also allows you to hang it from the wall if you wish.  I have three for different subjects and they are just awesome.

I acquired this out of curiosity.  This had 7 crickets and a few legs.  I didn't really study the body count.Nutrition facts:Serving size 1.4 gramsServings: 1Calories 9Total fat: 1 gSodium: 1 mgTotal carbohydrate: 0.2 g (0.07 g of Sugars)Protein: 0.5 gIngredients: Crickets, Lactose, Sodium Diacetate, Salt, Malic acide, citric acid, vinegar powder (malto-dextrin, modified food starch, vinegar solids), silicon diocide (to prevent caking).Appearance:Yup, they're definitely crickets.  You can even see their beady little eyes.  Likely through shipping the legs separate from the bodies.Taste/Consistency:If I blindly ate it, I would have thought it was a combination of popcorn, popcorn kernel husks and maybe an un-popped popcorn kernel.  It has a subtle taste of vinegar.  It's not terribly salty to me, and I am very salt-sensitive when it comes to it be added in my food.  I am willing to try anything ONCE.  Once is more than enough.Conclusion:It's worth trying as a novelty.  There is not much nutritional content unless you eat 10-12 boxes.  My conclusion is that these are mostly bought as gag gifts, and these are probably not eaten by most owners recipients.

What comes in the box?AC AdapterMicro USB cableSpeakerThe packaging is reusable as a carrying or storage box.The UE Megaboom by Logitech is a very powerful speaker system.  I have purchased this based upon ready reviews prior to purchasing.  The battery life is incredible, and it exceeds the battery life of anything in its class.  It is simple to operate and pair with your Bluetooth enabled device.  The large volume buttons are easy to handle and adjust, especially with wet hands.The construction is solid and it is waterproof.  The access ports for the input jack and the Micro USB cable are sealed.  At the bottom, there is a hook that makes for a good way to hang the speakers out of your way.The sound quality is incredible.  It has a covers bass, midrange and treble equally well.  The bass is more vibrant than average speakers.  I plan to acquire a second speaker  to get more of a stereo effect outdoors.  However, the sound coming from this single speaker is nothing short of immersive in an enclosed room.  Placing it close to a wall, allows the sound to reflect back towards you giving a unique effect, also.

The pack is comprised of white chocolate and milk chocolate covered crickets and larvae.  You get 3 of each.Outside of the thought of eating an unconventional food source, you will get to experience eating what has the consistency of eating a chocolate covered pretzel.  Given that insects are all around us, they do make a viable, easily accessible food source.The quality of the chocolate can be better as this chocolate tastes like the conventional lower grade Easter or Christmas candy.  If they paired up with Godiva or even Whitman's, this would be perfection.  The aftertaste of the chocolate is somewhat bitter at the end.Bon Appetit!

I have a Big Dog Comfortmax Treestand.  I wanted a safe and secure harness.  The harness is comfortable and the different points are easy to adjust in size (chest, shoulders, waist, legs).  This accommodates for ammunition.  There is a pouch that allows the user to rest his or her legs if suspended.  The back pouch allows tangle free storage of the harness.Attaching the harness to the tree is very easy and secure, and it can be done quickly.  This can be worn over your gear or under it.Overall, I'm very pleased with the harness.

I have a dark brown oiled Latigo Orion leather belt.  Because I liked the other so much, I purchased a second model in black.  For a different look, I decided to get the double strap version.Background:  You would think that belts by big name brands such as Polo, Ralph Lauren, Tommy Hilfiger, Alexander Julian, or such would be good.  They're usually not.  I have owned belts by more "rugged" makers such as Columbia and others, too. This, being my second belt, makes the best brand and make of belts I've ever owned.  I will no longer settle for anything less.This belt design conforms to the variety of aftermarket belt buckles that you will see in Country and Western Apparel stores.  This is the reason I like these belts.  I have a few buckles that I like to interchange based upon the occasion.  Interchanging buckles is an advantage for variety and not having to purchase many different belts.  It is the Lego equivalent of belts.What I am amazed by is the thickness and weight of this belt.  It's a heavyweight belt that rivals belts designed for carrying holsters.  The color is natural and the tanning is high quality.  I also liked the high gloss buckle, though I replaced it with my own Cowboy buckle.Unsnapping the snaps for replacing the buckle takes effort, which is a good thing. It is secure in its mechanism.This is a solid and well constructed belt.

This is a beautiful, yet simple, designed charm comprised of an interlaced, symmetric weave pattern, framed by circular ring.  The front part of the charm is convex and the back is concave in design.  The charm is supported by a thick teardrop shaped attachment that keeps the charm from rotating backwards or tangling up the chain.The chain, although delicate, is well made.  The clasp is easy to open and close, and it is quite secure.The material of the charm and chain are rhodium plated upon sterling silver. It has a shine that gleans well in light, and to my eye, brighter than my white gold wedding band.  Rhodium is a precious metal more expensive than gold which gives a bright shine.  However, because Rhodium is sensitive to abrasion, it should not be polished with silver or gold polish or an abrasive polishing cloth.  A microfiber cloth is all that is needed.  I have been told by a local jeweler that the finish will last 7-10 years with proper care.Overall, it is a simple design that will give the user many years of service.

This is a gift pack with full sized varieties of pancake batter, sample sized bottles of fruit preserves and two sample sized bottles of honey.The batter is a high quality product.  Pancakes are light and fluffy, and the different flavors capture the nuance of each respective flavor.The honey was not as fragrant/aromatic as other maple syrup that I have tried.  Taste was good but not as robust as I'm accustomed to experiencing.  It is also with a more watery consistency.The preserves were excellent.  You can see the chunks of fruit and they're all very tasty.  I tried them on the pancakes without and with syrup.  Definitely a high quality product.As a gift, this would make a great idea.  The gift box is nice and the items are packaged nicely.Overall, the sampler pack was excellent with everything but the syrup was the less favored component of the pack.

I love Popcorn from the movie theater.  A popcorn popper like those in the theater take up a lot of space.  They're also a lot more effort to clean up.  The airpoppers work fairly well but the taste is not quite the same.  The butter doesn't always uniformly coat the popcorn.I read the reviews and compared the designs of the different stove top popcorn poppers on the market.  This is one of the simplest designs of popcorn poppers on the market. First of all, this is a 5.5 quart stainless steel pot.  It is a high quality pot.  The lid is a clear glass lid with small peripheral gas openings, and there is a 4 centimeter port with an unfitted silicone cover which allows the user to pour melted butter, caramel or other desired toppings.OperationI use a gas stove top on medium to high heat.  It heats the oil and when it begins to boil, the kernels will begin to pop.  In a matter of a less than 30 seconds, the entire 1/3 cup of kernels will pop and the popcorn expands. As the size of the quantity of popcorn gets bigger it gets harder to turn the crank one handed.  I had to stabilize the pot by gripping the handle, turning the crank and listened for the popping to stop.After lifting the lid off, you simply pour the contents into a serving bowl.  Only 4-5 kernels went unpopped.Cleanup is a breeze.  The entire setup is dishwasher safe.Overall, it is a high quality product without too much effort to operate, assemble or clean.This gets two thumbs up for me.

I have a standard professional watch repair kit from China.  One of my major concerns was the fit and effectiveness for my watch band adjustment tool.Alignment of the tip of the band link remover is critical.  Not doing so will result in a bent pin.  Once I punched the pin out, I used my punch to push the pin through to the other side.So this makes an excellent replacement.  As for durability, if properly used, they're going to achieve your purpose.

This is a stunning 3 stone cluster blue topaz pendant set in a two tone gold and silver mount. The gold plating upon silver is a beautiful contrast upon the silver base.  The sterling silver cable-styled chain is secured by a lobster claw clasp.The stones sparkle beautifully and are crystal clear.  The chain is well designed.  My daughter and wife were very impressed with the quality, particularly for the price.

This is a flawless work of art.  With the stones inlaid within the ring, it adds an add touch of class.  The centerpiece stone is clean and sparkles with a great array of color.  The Rhodium plating is equally stunning and is a durable metal in its own right.Overall, this is special piece that would serve well as costume jewelry, as well as formal show jewelry.  It's an elegant piece with clean beautiful styling.

What comes in the box?Premium carrying caseSmart cord with mute functionDetectorSticky cup and mounting bracketThere is an Escort Smartcord Live that allows Bluetooth connectivity between the phone and the detector.  As of this writing, the street price is $94.23 through Amazon Prime.  This allows connectivity with the Escort Live App.  The app costs $5 per month or $50 per year.  Since my commute is only 15 minutes one way, it is not worth the investment.  I checked out the app, and I found a lot of nice features such as the speedometer and direction.The menu is easy to navigate and the added bonus of the mute button on the Smart Cord makes operation very simple.  The recessed screen in the housing minimizes glare and washout of the display.  The sticky cup is much easier to mount than other suction cup mounts, though I prefer a dash mount over window mounts.Use.I was impressed with the city function. I didn't have quite as many false alerts as in my older models of radar detectors.  A nice feature is that it learns false alarms, also.  Monitor colors can be customized to the user's liking.ConstructionA plus and minus is the size.  It is bigger and longer than the Escort counterpart.  The window for detection is the same size, as my older Escort.Overall I'm very pleased.

I have used many radar detectors ever since I started driving many, many years ago.  One of the biggest gripes I have is with false positives which put most users on edge.  Additionally, I have found many radar detectors to be blocky and too heavy for mounting on a window.  On a hot and humid day, the suction cups have almost always been less than adequate for me.  There are a few things about this model that have made life a lot easier.What comes in the box?Premium zippered caseMini USB DC adapterRadar detectorVelcro mountsWindow mount (Velcro)Window mount (suction cup)What you will also need?Smartphone with Bluetooth capability (I have an iPhone 5)FeaturesScreens for X, K, Ka and laser speed detectionAlerts for red light and speed camerasCobra iRadar app (must be downloaded) giving additional capabilities over the unit-SpeedMute : Mute alerts when traveling below a selected speed-AutoCity: Detects city or highway based upon GPS data and speed-AutoMute: reduces alert volume after 4 seconds-Voice or Tone Mode-QuietDrive: Mutes audible feedback-Phone Mode: allows alerts to be transmitted to phone or your Bluetooth output-iRadar Community: Network of users who have confirmed legitimate threats in the area.The App is easy to navigate. The menu system is intuitive.  When connected, the display on the detector will indicate direction and speed.  There are additional functions that the application allows that are not accessible through the detector itself.Alerts are given in color codes based upon threat level and the type of threat detected. It does not, however, indicate direction of the threat, unlike the Valentine One.  There are three types of visual alerts: 1) Signal strength (1-5 based upon signal), 2) Frequency Display (indicates type of radar and specific frequency), and 3) Frequency advanced (height of bar indicates likelihood of threat). All Laser threats are deemed to be positive, in general.In my experience I have noticed intermittent episodes of a low lit indicators, followed by a nondetected alert, followed by a gradual crescendo in terms of a true positive.  With false alerts on the highways, it is infrequent that I have experienced that phenomenon.  The regions I have driven have not used a Laser.  I have also not been in an area where aircraft have facilitated speed detection, either.  It has almost invariably been with State Troopers for the majority of our violators in the region.Given the smaller size, I have found it much easier to just remove and pocket the detector in a small camera case.  Because I have chosen the option of a top of the dashboard mount, it has not been a target for thieves scoping out what to steal, unlike other window mounted devices (e.g. GPS, radar detectors).  The Velcro has been more stable for me, and it is more inconspicuous than window mounting.I love the premium case but wish there were a smaller carrying case just for the detector.  Even a drawstring bag would be good just to prevent scratches and dust.The Unit, itself, is quite compact. It is about the size of my palm. The front has the display screen, and the rear has the detector window. On the back righthand side of the case is the Mini USB port.  The top reveals the speaker and the control buttons.  The mute button is luckily at the front center of the detector which is the most important button, apart from the Report/Menu button. The report button uploads the data to the network to confirm threats. It is the most import duty that you have to make the iRadar Community work.  The Dim and City buttons work for stepping through the menu systems. The City button toggles between city and highway.  The power button serves as the volume, also.Overall, with the integration of the iRadar community, this is a hard system to beat.  Taking into account the smaller size, yet effective internal algorithms, it is an excellent system.

These are solid clear acrylic nunchucks.  They have a nice clean design.  The handles are connected by chains and are fitted with ball bearing pivots for smoothness.  The weight is above the average for conventional wooden nunchucks.  The handles can be slippery with sweaty palms, though.The set is durable and worthy of consideration.

I was looking for a modern set of Nunchucks.  This set has nice hollow metal handles.  They have a ringing sound when they are in motion.  For a demonstration pair, this is an excellent set.  However, if you're practicing, they can get annoying with the sound.The weight is average for a pair of nunchucks.  Durability is good.Overall, I'm pleased with my set, apart from the noise when practicing.

What attracted me to this particular stand was the seat.  I have a similar design for some patio chairs, and I knew how comfortable these seats would be.  I like the shooting rest which moves up and down, helping with stability.  The foot rest is an added feature (which folds out of the way), that helps with comfort, too.  The footing is wide and deep which helps with stability.  The ladder is fairly wide and it feels stable once it is secured.  It's best to have the foot rest retracted with egress and entry to prevent yourself from falling 18 feet.The finish is just acceptable.  There are parts that are chipped off from transit and they didn't package it very well.  It doesn't affect function but that is attention to detail that is a turn off.  However, in the scheme of all things, it doesn't matter.Putting this stand up against the tree really needs three people.  We did it with two, and it was a major struggle.  I have a hilly terrain in the back of my property with rocks, bushes, and large stones.  We found a nice Poplar to set the stand up against it.  These straps to hoist this son of a gun up worked but it wasn't fun or very easy.  The stand is wide and tall, and she is quite heavy.The accompanying Harness is just a bunch of straps that wrap around your waist and hips.  They're not comfortable and once taken off, it will be like a Rubik's cube.  Tip: Throw them into the trash where they belong and buy yourself a good harness.The instructions and setup are the biggest pain in the "you know what".  It's a photocopy of instructions and you can't distinguish what the lines for the legend are trying to identify.  I looked at the PDF and they were marginally better.  What is most annoying is that the parts are not labeled with any stickers to say what is what.  Just as annoying is the instructions for assembly and the marginally helpful illustrations.  You actually need an English Standard and metric ruler to work with this since they have used a combination of the two (which is beyond me); for example, 1 3/5, 8 mm.  Who does that?  Insane!Tip: lay out all the parts and count them up.  It's likely you'll be missing some parts.  Call the company to ask for those parts or you'll be in for a bit of frustration, as I had.  It took exactly 7 days from when I called to get the parts.Assembly of the seat was the biggest headache.  They supply you with 1 1/4" screws which are not long enough to pull the mesh chair supports close enough to tighten the bolts.Tools recommended:Rubber malletRule (ENGLISH STANDARD and METRIC)Open end wrenches and ratcheting driver.PatienceOnce set up and assembled it's a great stand.

I had a moderate to severe blockage in our shower drain.  The Zip it Drain tool was not adequate. I had a more serious problem.  This has two different length rods.  I only had to use the 18 rod.Whereas the Zip it took about 1/4 of the drain burden, the Weasel took care of the rest.  A hairball the size of my fist came out despite the Zip it giving me 4 empties with 4 passes (after an initial decent haul).  The second pass was a smaller volume of hair, but then the third and fourth passes hauled out additional disgusting gobs of hair and debris.  One big tip: when doing this disgusting evolution, I recommend having the shower on to clean off your hands.  It was disgusting but "fruitful".The crank attaches to each rod by a fitted slot.  Then you slide the guard over the connector, insert the rod into the drain, and then turn the crank.  This is a most highly effective way to clean out a shower drain.  I do recommend running the shower so you can see and hear the progress of how much more you must explore to rid yourself of a high grade drain stenosis.  If you can clean off and remove the debris, it is reusable but there are replacement rods that can be purchased, too.It is highly effective, and I definitely recommend it.

I'm more of a do it yourselfer. I have replaced toilet assemblies, installed my bidets and have done other minor plumbing work.We had a bad shower drain problem.  I knew I needed a tool to put out a clog.  I used this tool and it removed only 1/4 of the clog.  Despite four to five passes, I had no yield.  The drain was still slow.  It's ok for a minor issue but I had a bigger problem.  Luckily I purchased a second item, the Drain Weasel.

My daughter loves costume jewelry and she performs on stage at her high school and local productions.  One of the things about a lot of costume jewelry is how dull they look.  I was looking for something bright,which would sparkle while she was performing.I was amazed at how bright this sparkled out of the box.  Craftsmanship is excellent.  The rhodium plating is also quite bright.Amazing look.  I now have to look for some necklaces and a tiara.

I received a genuine Belkin cable.  Frequently I have resorted to purchasing cheaper cables in the past with much disdain. Many times I would get messages that a particular cable is not supported.Why would anyone want a 6 inch charging cable?  If you have a multi- USB AC adapter, you will notice that extra long cables can be cumbersome and confusing.  Even with cable ties it can be hard to tell which is which.  If you are leaving a device for the sole purpose of charging, then this cable will more than be sufficient for your needs.As for unlicensed cables, it is best to purchase them from reputable merchants and retailers.  Price is usually the dead giveaway since they are frequently significantly priced lower or they charge excessive shipping for the product.  As they say, "You get what you pay for."

This is solid and fundamental instruction for learning how to pick and play the banjo.  Progressively, practice exercises build upon learning principles to help the student develop the skills necessary to understand how to read conventional notes, as well as tablature.  He emphasizes memorizing notes and discourages, playing through sections until the student has mastered the earlier sections.Unlike other books that jump into advanced techniques, chords, and picking from the Get Go, this is more of a systematic curriculum on how to progress.  The spiral-bound book fits nicely on my music stand, as this is quite a thick book.Excellent instruction on the fundamentals of learning.  It is more of a textbook with short, clear instruction than alternative texts on self learning.  Two thumbs up.

I was looking for a durable and genuine sling for my 1942 Mosin Nagant.  Installation is very easy as it fits perfectly through the slots under the fore-end and the rifle buttstock.  The fittings are solid, and the sling is easily adjusted.For the purposes of carrying or achieving necessary stability when shooting, then this will serve you well.

I acquired this for shooting my 0.177 and 0.22 caliber air rifles.  The item is preassembled and the base is stable.  A centered hit on the face will spin the target.  Anything less than that with just move the spinner.  It has high visibility stickers that are easy to see at 25 yards, the minimum safe distance.  It's a much easier target system to hit than my Gamo resetting system, so I would place this in an intermediate to advanced category for skill to hit these.No issues with this product's ability to withstand pellet rounds, as it didn't even have a dent on the target face.  There are splash marks from the pellet's impact but nothing more.  The back arms of the base swivel out to accommodate for different leveled shooting surfaces.  You will still need a strong backstop for this, and I wouldn't recommend this for a small residential setting unless it is legal to do so.Overall, it's a high quality durable product that makes air rifles a lot more fun.

This is a versatile set for target shooting.  It has various spinning targets, a stand for a paper target and the capability to shoot balloons. If it were not for the orange stickers, I would struggle to see the targets from 25 yards.  The targets are very small and you need a high level of stability and skill to shoot these.  I was using a Stoeger X20 suppressor 22 caliber.The targets hold up well, and there is no dent at all.  The impression of the pellet is all I see so they hold up to impact.The stand is stable in the ground, and the setup was frustrating without documentation, though I figured it out.Great target for an advanced/expert shooter.  This is not for beginners or novices.

This is one of the best screen protectors that I have tried on my iPhone.  There is a dust remover, cleaner and drying cloth.  No issues with bubbles after installation.  It preserves tactile sensitivity, clarity and crispness of the retina screen.

I practice martial arts and we do a lot of pivots and rotations which can be a strain on the knees.  I found these, as recommended by a friend.  Now, I find myself wearing these all the time for support.  They're very comfortable and stay right where they need to be.  The fit is exactly right for me and it doesn't feel like it's too tight.I have full mobility without excessive strain on my ligaments and tendons.I will purchase a second one for the other knee.  They are superior to other knee supports that I have used in the past.  The construction is well made, and the stitching is seamless without perceivable threading or tension.  The 5mm thickness is just right, and it is not hot or a chore to wear.Two thumbs up.

This is a multifunction color printer, copier and scanner.  There are some exceptional features that put this into the next step in technology.  The scanner can upload images to a cloud.  You can set up an email address to print to the unit, remotely.  The device can accept up to 4 different Wifi devices for printing (iPad, iPhone, smartphone, and tablet).  Functions can be tracked electronically through your online account, and the primary user can receive notifications.Unwrapping the unit takes about 10 minutes from all of the packing.  The initialization takes 7 minutes.  Registration is linked online and the user has 30 minutes to enter the information.  Once initialized you receive and email address to print directly.  This is done without even installing the software or connecting the USB cable.In addition to the network capabilities, this also accepts memory cards for direct printing, as well as through a USB connection. Copying and print quality are excellent.  The printer is relatively quite, and the movement/vibration of the unit is negligible.The menu system is comprehensive and the user can do almost every function without a PC or notebook.  Once connected to the network, updating the firmware is seamless and takes very little time.  The menus are intuitive and user friendly.  This operates by a touch panel but not a touch screen.  The LED touch screen is clear and easy to read.As for printing, there are capabilities for printing onto paper, photo paper, and DVDs.Overall, this is a solid performing multifunction printer.

This is a soft and cuddly puppet/stuffed animal.  The details of the eyes, nose, mouth, flippers, and tail are excellent and realistic.  The fur is ultra soft, and the nose is made of a synthetic vinyl material.The mouth opens and closes and the seal rotates the head and neck.  The arms do not articulate.  Neither does the tail.Overall, it's a beautiful rendition of a seal.  The puppet is made in Indonesia.

I acquired these Capos after reading the excellent feedback on reviews that I read here.These are well constructed and easy to use.  These are quite durable, and they have a non-marring interface which I consider very important.I had no issues with the tuning of my banjo and it did not alter the tuning when I removed it.  They attach from the underside of the neck but since I'm still new to the scene of playing, it did not cause great consternation.Overall I'm very impressed.

The Mosin Nagant has an unpleasant recoil to say the least.  I wanted an effective method in an economical way to relieve the discomfort.The construction is a solid rubber design.  It has a ribbed back and channels in the back to act as a buffer.Installation involves using the pre-existing Buttplate screws.  The attachment fits perfectly.  There is about an inch added to the length of pull.  It is comfortable and definitely reduces the felt recoil significantly.I'm glad I made the change.  It's an excellent addition.

This is an ambitious system whereby speakers are integrated with a personal trainer. There are two programs that are downloaded from your respective App Store, The Jabra Sport App and the Music app. For the system to work, you need the Sport app. Use of the app requires registering an email. The use of the app can track your position by GPS, even when it is not operating. You also enter biometric data, such as your age, height, and weight, as well as your birthday.Selecting an activity is limited to cross training, running, hiking, biking, walking. This is not a waterproof system but it is going to work when you sweat.The initial menus test your fit and ability to hear a quality sound. There are several sized ear gels that fit into the ears, as well as ear wings that attach to your headphones for a snug fit. I wore the standard set which worked very well. The Menu system is intuitive, and they're easy to navigate. Each workout is tracked and a log/journal is kept.I used this for boxing, and karate. No issues with the headphones shifting or coming out. The fit was perfect, and quite stable. The lightweight makes them almost imperceptible. The headphones fit specific to each ear and the cable wraps around the back of your neck.There are three buttons: Power on/pairing, volume up/forward, and volume down/repeat. A micro USB port charges the headset. It is red when charging and turns green when it is fully charged.As for sound quality, these are above average. I tried instrumental, classical, vocals, rock, country, bluegrass, jazz, Opera, Hip Hop, R&B, rock, and Pop music. The various ranges are covered very well. It also, keeps a lot of environmental sound out which could be a danger so one must be careful.Overall, this is a solid set of headphones, and the integrated software is solid.Two thumbs up.

I have been learning to play the banjo for about 4 weeks, and I have made rapid progress through the techniques in the book.  The DVD helps the learner by playing segments of songs in progressively faster speeds.  Each song in the first half of the book describes the proper techniques and allows the student to learn parts of each song, before proceeding.The video is high quality and easy to understand.I had to buy a music stand to play while reading the notes.  It's a great book on techniques, though it's short on music theory, such as specifics of the Fretboard, scales, and such.  However, it gave me a great head start as I learn more and more from other teachers, methods, and books.Highly recommend.

Living in the South, it gets hot and humid.  When I saw this item, I wasn't sure what to expect.  The documentation was sparse.  The package says it doesn't need batteries and I was not sure how it was going to work.The principle by which it works is that it works by a pressurized chamber.  The pump at the top increases pressure and pushes the water through a mister at the end of a silicone tube.  The pressure is controlled by a stopcock.  Essentially it functions like a chemical garden sprayer.There is a clip that allows it to attach to clothing or strap.  It holds 16 ounces of fluid.  The reservoir or chamber is secured in a nylon bag with a strap.  One flaw that I see is that the nylon bag doesn't allow pumping when it is zipped up.  The pump has to be exposed for the piston to work.  Maybe it was designed that way.The more you pump, the higher the pressure.  However, the pressure dissipates after a few minutes so you have to pump again.  For sporting events, playing sports, gardening, shopping outdoors or picnics, this works well for staying cool. Great invention.  It works well enough for me.

This is a comfortable pair of standard blue jeans with flared bottoms to account for work boots, hiking boots or cowboy boots.  The pockets are all standard sized.  Stitching is solid, and the construction of the zippers is excellent.This works well for casual or outdoor work. The styling is not flashy but still fashionable for shopping, going out to bars, working in the field/yard, or just lounging around at home.  The fit is comfortable; however, I find it too snug to wear it for concealed carry (inside the waistband).  The flared bottoms more than accommodate for my hunting boots or Cayman Cowboy boots.Overall, these jeans exceed my expectations for my use here in the South.Two thumbs up.

This is a comfortable casual work shirt made of cotton.  The versatility of wearing as a long sleeved shirt or a short sleeved shirt makes it useful for all seasons.  There is a button that allows the sleeves to be rolled up.The pockets are spacious and useful for various articles to carry.  These are secured by velcro, ideal for any situation except for hunting, given the noise.  A strap also allows for hanging sunglasses or goggles.The cloth is soft and comfortable and with additional washing it will get better with age.  The buttons and stitching are high quality.This makes for a comfortable casual or work shirt.  In my area of the country, it fits into our business casual.Two thumbs up!

Our house is already a smart house with numerous gadgets using WiFi signal.  I acquired a DVD/Blue ray player that requires an Ethernet connection.  Rather than routing cables throughout the house, I decided to try this Power line out.  Hooking it to my router and then plugging it in, followed by pairing the devices between two rooms, I was up and running faster than any wireless extender set up.I was amazed.  Enough so that I purchased an additional unit for the wife, and I will get more for other televisions in the house, plus I plan to expand the capability in the basement.This was the fastest and most economical solution for extending my Lan capabilities in the house.  I was skeptical but instead, I was amazed and easy and simple this was to set up and operate.Definitely a two thumbs up!

Our hands connect us to almost every hobby, sport, instrument or musical instrument.  I have a diverse set of hobbies, including Karate, archery, marksmanship, banjo and golf.  I have used everything from rubber exercise balls, Chinese brass exercise balls, the grip master, spring-loaded exercisers but this one takes the cake.  First off, this is small and portable.  It can easily go with you anywhere.  Next, it has a quiet operation.  Lastly, you can adjust resistance on each station, as I arbitrarily call it.  My pinky and ring finger definitely lag behind the middle and index fingers.  This allows each finger to be exercised incrementally.The construction is solid and it is well made.  I find my self using this everywhere I go.  The advantage of this over the Grip master is the more compact and flatter size, plus the adjustability of each station or finger.  It is a well designed product and I only wish I had one sooner.

I had to replace a lesser model thumb pick which had broken so I was searching for an upgrade.  These picks are very comfortable to wear.  The actual is a few millimetres longer than I had but I haven't had any issues with precision or accuracy.  The smoother surface gives a cleaner, crisper sound to my ears.  The picks are a few microns thicker than standard plastic picks so they feel more robust and durable.I am glad that I chose the upgrade.  I am certain this 12 pack will last me a while.

The Neotech strap is a great system for a banjo.  Once you have secured the attachements, you can easily unsnap the body of the strap for storage or cleaning, as well as interchange the strap if you have other models.  For me, the hardest and most time consuming process is attaching a strap to the banjo.The design is easy to use and the strap is very comfortable to wear.  It is also easy to adjust the length.  The stitching is solid and I am confident that this will last for years.

Being new to learning a stringed instrument, I wanted to make sure my equipment is in tune, at all times.  I have two banjos:  Deering Goodtime Special and a Recording King Starlight Open Back.This tuner clips onto the banjo without marring the surface.  The angle can be adjusted and the display can be rotated to suit any mounting position.Turning on the tuner involves a button on the side of the unit.  It is a small button and hard to remember which one it actually is unless I look right at it, but that will come with time.  I changed the key to G which is where my banjos are tuned.  Once set up, it detects the sounds and indicates on a chromatic scale where your instrument is set.  As you adjust, the colors indicate whether you're sharp / or flat.  When in the appropriate pitch, the indicator shows a green ring.  The operation is simple.  The indicators are responsive.The beauty of this is the energy conserving features where the screen goes dim after a certain period and it will automatically shutdown if no tones are detected.  Accessing the battery is through a slide cover and battery is a CR 2032.Prior to this, I had been using a tuner App on my iPad.Overall,I couldn't be more pleased with the size, convenience and responsiveness.

Destruction derbies have been a great past time for decades.  This system takes that game one step further, Weapons mounted vehicles.  The goal is cause massive destruction to your opponents vehicle, and anything goes.  Collisions, shots and combinations of the two.  So how does this work?  Each vehicle is able to keep track of where the other one is, and the cars are App driven in the arena of your choosing.  The cars can operate on hardwood floors, ceramic tile or carpeted surfaces.The App, which I downloaded from the Apple AppStore, pairs your device to one of the cars.  If you have another bluetooth capable device, you can pair it with the other car.  However, if you're alone, it's ok, since you can have artificial intelligence battle against you.  You can pit yourself against varying levels of skilled drivers, one more ruthless and brutal than the other.Pairing just involves holding your device right over the car.  No synching through the Setting and doing pairing mode.  I wish more devices paired this quickly.  Resetting the cars is just as easy.Each car is powered by 4 AA batteries.  The batteries are secured by a Phillips screw head.  The battery compartment is a removable tray.  The only switch is the power switch on each vehicle.Once paired, it will update the firmware.  I suggest doing so for each car.  They have to be done separately.  Playing as individual involves pairing the vehicle, then clicking onto the AI menu on the app.  Highlight the vehicle and then select your opponent, followed by clicking the VS icon.You can go into the My Car menu which allows you to choose different weapons which have different levels of damage and rate of fire.  So, not only can you crash into the other car, you can shoot at them.  Damage levels are shown on the app, and are also reflected by the indicator light on the top of the car.There is virtually no lag from one selection screen to another.  Controls are, well, very responsive to the lightest touch.  You can fire as many virtual weapons but the indicator light turns red, and then there is a latency period for your weapons to reload/recharge.If you had more cars, you could even have a more extended variety of opponents.Operation of the cars takes a learning curve.  The vehicles are loud.  The AI will indiscriminately crash into obstacles such as furniture or walls so be careful.  The AI becomes more ruthless as you go up in levels.Overall, this makes an excellent system.  It has a high replay value.Two thumbs up.

I have a Recording King Starlight Open Back Banjo, which has narrower spaces between the strings.  The factory bridge was not adequate for me.  I upgraded to this and I was very pleased.  The inserts are very stable and the strings maintain their tune, as it should be.Installation involves loosening the strings and fitting the bridge under the strings.  Then just tighten and tune them and you're off and running.  I am a beginner and I had no issues having to install this.Great product.

This is a handy stool for workbenches or when playing guitar, or banjo.  It has rollers that slide well on carpet or hardwood, without marring the surface.  It doesn't roll smoothly on ceramic tile at all.Assembly took less than five minutes.  The rollers screw in.  There is a wrench that comes with it but it bent after one use.  I used Loktite to secure the screws for safety.There is a pneumatic mechanism that adjusts the height.  Overall, it's a smooth, albeit Spartan, stool for working.  I had no problems with the assembly or operation of the stool.  It's not luxury, but it works.

This is a pedometer, calorie tracker (based upon activity) and sleep tracker.  Running on the latest iOS, I found the App in the App Store.  As I did this, I used the USB charger to charge the device.  Pairing the device took no time at all, I was off and operating.  I cannot for the life of me, figure out how to get it out of sleep mode.  So I shake it or touch the electrodes and it comes on randomly.  If it actually stayed on all the time, I'd give it another star.  The sleep mode was useless since this sleeps itself.The setup comes with 2 silicone watch bands, a Velcro enclosure for sleeping and a belt attachment.  It measures movement in three planes so I will guess it has its own accelerometer.  It is not waterproof or water resistant so it has to be taken off.  The read outs are clear but getting this out of sleep mode puzzles me.  It went through a few iterations of syncing with the tracker when I went to see the readouts on the iPhone app.I was still puzzled, personally, on what button they're actually talking about.Regardless, it's a handy device if you can get beyond the quirks but I'm not entirely sure it's ready for prime time.

I have a Resonator Banjo with a tone ring (Deering Goodtime Special) which I am using to learn the Scruggs style of picking.  I have decided that I will also take up the Clawhammer method of picking which is popularized in my region of the country (Southwest Virginia).After reading the previous review, I was excited to try this particular model.  The banjo is well constructed for an import.  The head is a Mylar type of cover.  The yellow color of the head is close to natural maple.  The neck is finished with a rosewood fretboard.  The edges are done in a tortoise colored plastic or Formica. There is a steel tone ring which adds to the richness of sound.One minor issue was that when I received mine, the bridge was not set up.  I had to loosen the strings to fit the bridge.  Mind you, that I purchased an open box special and whoever used it did not properly set it up.  There were more grooves than what were needed so I didn't hold this against my own rating.  However, regardless of that fact, the bridge is very low quality.  I installed a Golden Gate GB-3 Deluxe and it made a world of difference for maintaining the tuning.  I have considered upgrading the strings but I will hold off until I break the current ones in to see how they perform.The action is good and doesn't require a great deal of effort to play a chord.  The strings are much closer together than my Resonator Style Banjo.  The configuration is more suited to Clawhammer over picking with a Scruggs style approach.  With respect to sound, the volume is lower than a resonator style.  The pitch is a little higher, and the tone is brighter/higher.The very light weight makes it great for a traveling banjo.  This would work great for a youngster or beginner.  Overall, I am pleased with my purchase apart from a minor issue with the bridge.For the price it is hard to beat.  Another similar model to try would be the Recording 1930s style banjo, or you can go up to the Deering Goodtime (Open Back) which is much more money.

Allergens at home are becoming a widely known issue for those suffering from Allergies or Asthma.  Sloughed off skin serves as a food source for dust mites and their excrement contributes to some degree of this particular health issue.The Dyson V6 Mattress is a handheld vacuum and Hepa filtration system that works on upholstery and mattresses.  Our couches are actually vacuumed on a weekly basis.  Well, to my shock upon using this vacuum, there was a lot more hiding in the couch than I cared to know.  There was a great amount of dust, dander and debris that likely sits just under the upholstery surface.  I was completely disgusted.  I ran this on maximum suction and it only runs about 5-6 minutes per charge.  Charging takes about 3.5 hours.I ran this also on one of our mattresses and again, the same result.  A lot of skin particles, predominantly, and more than I care to think about.  I ran it in high mode which gave me much more time, about 15-17 minutes on a charge.  It didn't work for me, while plugged in by the way.The Vacuum is a handheld variety with a trigger mechanism.  If you're doing a prolonged job, then it's best to hold it at the handle and along the nozzle, as this still gets heavy and tiring.  The pistol like shape over a DustBuster design allows the user to get a lot better control as there are a lot of angles and directions that you're positioning the nozzle to clean.There are a few accompanying attachments that also allow cleaning between the mattress and box spring, or between cushions on a sofa.Bear in mind it is not a vacuum designed to pick up large debris, so it is not a vacuum designed to pick up huge spills of dirt, broken glass, or potato chips spills.  It would damage the primary purpose which is for microfiltration.Maintenance is a bit of a chore, as there are three components to clean, monthly.  These pieces must be out to dry for about 24 hours, as again, this works on microfiltration.  Any moisture or remaining water will likely minimize or offset any effectiveness of its design.The vacuum is relatively lightweight and ergonomic.  Given the power, I cannot see how something this powerful can be realistically much smaller.  Indicator lights indicate the charge remaining or if the battery much be replaced.Surprisingly, this has a 2 year warranty.  Other handhelds I have owned have only had 6 month or 1 year warranties.I do wish it had a storage case to put the parts away without having to use the factory box.  That would have been a nice touch, especially since there is no "on board" storing of attachments.Overall, I'm glad I have this.  I was amazed at how much a conventional cleaning is really ineffective at cleaning.  There is a lot more than meets the eyes under those covers and upholstery.  If you have allergies or asthma, this is something you most likely need.
