The George Foreman lineup of grills/griddles has finally gone portable.  This uses a self contained propane tank (similar to those that you take camping).  Ignition can be started with the integrated igniter or a match through the right front match hole.Looking like a briefcase, when closed, this is relatively compact with the exception of having to carry the propane tank.  When open, you fold out the wind guards to minimize the chance of flame ups.  Just like the standard or indoor George Foreman grills, you have a drip pan to drain the grease and oil from meats.  The nice advantage of this system is the ability to use it like a grill or a griddle.  So it is great for camping, cookouts or when the power goes out at home; however, this is a device for outdoor use only, and it is not recommended inside a recreational vehicle or boat, either.Cleanup is easy and having the draining bin for grease and oil makes it convenient.  Overall, it's an innovative design for a compact/portable grill.

I have tried every pillow from foam, to styrofoam filled to air inflated pillows.  I never found one comfortable or portable as this set.First and foremost, the memory foam adjusts to the shape of most users.  It is very comfortable when supine or seated.  I have used this for road trips, sleeping in a waiting room and obviously, when flying.  It has a higher support around the back and sides that other pillows lack.  There is a nylon cord that improves the fit around the front.  A small pocket for a standard sized smartphone without a case, allows the user to sleep to music.  As others have mentioned, this works well for ear bud type headphones but not full sized headphones.The pillow is compressible and easy to store.  It's a very compact size that can fit into a backpack, carry on back and can easily just be attached to the outside of your bag, also.  A nylon bag with a Velcro fastener allows for additional compression.Great pillow.

I have been starting to play banjo at home.  We have an open floor plan and the acoustics is optimal for a concert.  However, the sound of my Banjo with Tone Ring and Resonator is quite loud.The sound of the banjo projects throughout the house.  Getting complaints from the wife and daughter has lead to me resorting to desperate measures.  1) I bought an open back banjo 2) I bought one of these mutes.I read the reviews, and based upon what I read, it was what my house needed.  This is a brass U-shaped frame with nylon bristles.  Because it is OPEN on one side, it has to be placed with the curved end upwards.  The bristles will hold it to some degree.If you notice a light or loose fit, then clamp down on it more.  I noticed that my Brass Mute was still pretty loose for a fit, so I placed it under a carpet/rug and pressed down upon the hinge which gave a more snug fit.The volume is reduced by 1/3.  Overall, I am happy to have purchased this.  On my open back banjo, I place a sock or knee brace inside the pot against the rod, and it mutes the banjo a bit more. The combination of the two allow me to use my picks as opposed to strumming with just my fingers.Very good item, but Mike's Banjo Mute works better since the assembly screws onto the strings and bridge.

For those on a budget, this makes an excellent choice for a laser rangefinder.  I have been primarily a Leopold and Nikon laser rangefinder customer in the recent past.This has one primary function: instantaneous distance only, as opposed to a scan feature.  The response time for a reading is very accurate and fast with a couple of caveats. Targets in the shadows may not give me a reading, and neither will darker objects in shadows despite a relatively near distance.  Realistically, you can expect true limits to be about half that of manufacturer specifications.  The closest target that I can reasonably range is 5 yards.  The furthest realistic distance was a large oak at about 300 yards.  Additionally, the Region of Interest is large so objects partially covered within the rectangular reticle will not give a reading or give and errant reading.The body of the rangefinder is relatively larger than average.  The contours are great for retention and operation, even with gloves.  There are no rubber adornments that aid in a non-slip grip.  Additionally, there is a lanyard hole without an included lanyard.  The nylon case is a good fit, though, I prefer to hang these devices from my neck or within closer reach.One major flaw is that the battery compartment is secured with a flathead screw.  It can be opened with a dime but not without some sort of tool to access the compartment, unlike other brands.  As for the battery needed, it is a 9 volt battery and there is an LED indicator to let the user know about remaining power left.Last, there is no backlit display.Overall, though, it is a responsive and compact entry level rangefinder that will more than adequately do the job.

I love to travel and watch travel documentaries, so I was excited when I was offered a copy of Extreme Treks: Sacred Mountains of China for review.  The title, Extreme Treks appealed to me even more, so I decided to give it a try and I really enjoyed it.  Unfortunately I do not have a Blu Ray player, so it took awhile to watch it.This was the first time I had heard of Ryan Pyle, a photographer and host of this series who sets out to travel around four of the sacred mountains in China.  These are in the remote Tibet region, so this is not your regular tourist info guide.  This is a hard-core climbing adventure that could be very dangerous to an inexperienced adventurer.The disc consists of four episodes, each dedicated to a different mountain.  The format is basically the same for each one. These are roughly 45 minute made-for-TV episodes without the commercials (which I love). He begins each climb by giving us the background of this sacred mountain while preparing for the trek. Then we watch him and his crew, as they encounters obstacles ranging from weather to exhaustion and hints of altitude sickness. Along the way, we get breathtaking shots that few people will ever see in person.This is one of those adventures where the viewer thinks, I dream of trying something like this, but I never would actually do it.  These treks are really grueling, but his spirit is inspiring.  Im glad he did because the shots are absolutely beautiful, and I doubt Id ever learn about this region any other way. The shots are in HD, and the scenery is truly amazing.Ryan has a lot of passion for what he does, and he is a true adventurer.  He includes a support crew made up of locals, which adds to the flavor of the region.  Along the way, he talks to us in the camera or with voice over so we get a feel for what he is going through.I certainly learned about these mountains and the culture surrounding them while I was watching.  If you like true life adventure with fantastic scenery, this is a great show to watch.I was sent a copy of this Blu-Ray in exchange for my honest review. I have no financial or personal connection with the manufacturer, seller or their employees

I got this for my wife because she loves necklaces, but she does not like gaudy jewelry.  She was thrilled with it and it certainly exceeded my expectations.The picture does not do it justice.  It is much more vibrant in person.  The color combinations of stones will match multiple things you wear.  It comes with approx 18 inch chain  just the right length.  It is not too big - just the right size to stand out without looking like it is costume jewelry.

This is really a nice hat - especially for the price.  Free shipping makes it even better.The eagle and flag are nicely embroidered and really stand out.  The fabric is lightweight, but seems very strong.  The had is comfortable to wear with Velcro adjustment strap in the back.I would suggest sending a note to the seller for your color choice.  I order the light blue, and they sent me the navy color.  I thought is was black because it is so dark.  I contacted the seller about the color, and they sent me a replacement and told me to keep the first one.  It probably is not worth the cost to ship it back.  Unfortunately, the replacement was also the navy color.  After getting a free replacement, it was hard to complain.  I like the hat and the seller was great to work with.

1:45 Mins In the past, I have used basic latex gloves from Walmart for working on my car or any household jobs that get my hands really dirty.  My hands are large, and most latex gloves are too tight.  They are also prone to tearing easily.  These nitrile gloves are much larger, and they really hold up well under heavy use.I was not expecting them to be this strong, but I could reuse them if I could wash them.  They are worth the little extra price because the quality is so much better.

The first thing to know is that this shower head does not come with a hose.  It cannot be connected to your shower without a hose or some type of flexible connector.  It is made to be a hand held shower head, so most people will use a hose.Connection is very easy and only takes a minute.  It looks a little space-age with the clear section and the little balls. Another thing to be aware of is that if you open the filter (Im the curious type), the balls will fall out of the top section.I have heard from Dr.  Oz and others that the skin absorbs chemicals and you should have a filter on your shower.  I had a filter on my shower before, and had to change it every 3 months. The amazing thing about this is that it lasts for a year or more without changing the filter balls. Im not sure how this actually works, but I did so some research and it is a great concept..The shower head does a great job and seems less restrictive than my old one.  The settings are great and actually create different effects.  I really like the Mister setting and the Rain setting.I have to say, I was a bit skeptical before using this, but it really does just what it says.  I will recommend this to my friends.A discounted/complimentary sample was provided for a candid and honest review. I have no financial or personal connection with the manufacturer, seller or their employees.

My car is not Bluetooth ready, and I am not fond of talking on a phone while in traffic because it takes your attention and your hands from the wheel.  I do use the GPS on my phone a lot by putting it in the audio mode so it can direct me while I drive.  Unfortunately, the small phone speaker is hard to hear while on speaker phone. I dont like the earpieces, so this is the perfect solution for me.I am not the most technical person, so I like things that are easy to use.  This was very easy to set up. You plug the adaptor into your power outlet or cigarette lighter and position your receiver/microphone. The buttons are easy to use, and the cord is long enough to use in any car. The power adaptor is USB and comes with an extra port so you can still charge your phone or other devices.The sound quality is much better than my phone, and the quality of the product is very good.  I now feel comfortable using my hands-free system to make calls while traveling.  I have tried similar devices in the past and been disappointed by the quality. This is an excellent product, and it actually exceeded my expectations.A discounted/complimentary sample was provided for a candid and honest review. I have no financial or personal connection with the manufacturer, seller or their employees.

The foil around the top of the bottle can be a pan to open.  It can also look really ugly and not impress your guests.  In the past, I would use a steak knife, which can be a bit unsafe.I was skeptical that this would really work that well, but it was worth a try,  To my surprise, it worked so easily that it was like the foil was not even there.  You just slip it around the top of the bottle, give it a turn, and it is done.  Simple, effective, easy to use.  I love things that so what they claim.A discounted/complimentary sample was provided for a candid and honest review. I have no financial or personal connection with the manufacturer, seller or their employees.

I have tried and listened to several portable speakers over the past couple of years.  Some are really amazing for the sound they put out in a small size.  The problem with most is that you still sacrifice true high quality stereo for the convenience of size and sometimes Bluetooth capability.My favorite speaker before this one was my Turtle speakerOutdoor Tech OT1800 Turtle Shell 2.0 - Rugged Water-Resistant Wireless Bluetooth Hi-Fi Speaker (Black).  It is larger than many, but has very good quality sound and is very durable.  The problem I had with it were, lack of true stereo sound, due to lack of separation in speakers.  Most small speakers use either one speaker for both channels or two speakers right next to each other.This speaker is a bit larger than many others (still compact in size), but the sound quality is well worth it.  The two channel speakers are placed on the ends of the bar, with a sub woofer in the center.  The sound is the best I have heard from a small speaker like this.Of course, it has Bluetooth, and other capabilities plus an FM radio and an SD card slot. It connects easily to my mp3 player with a jack and Android phone with Bluetooth.Many others have some of these features, but what sets this apart is the sound.  Even at the highest level, I dont notice distortion like my Turtle (which cost twice as much.  For the money, this is a real bargain.A discounted/complimentary sample was provided for a candid and honest review. I have no financial or personal connection with the manufacturer, seller or their employees.

I have tried foam mattress toppers in the past, and not been all that dazzled with them.  Most are the egg crate style, which actually feel a little strange to me.  I am not an expert on foam or mattress pads, but I think everyone has their own preference for comfort.This was my first time with a memory foam topper, and I just love it.  Usually, it takes me a few days to get used to a new sleeping surface, but that was not the case with this.  Right from the first moment, it felt perfect.I am a side sleeper, and normally, I toss and turn a lot during the night, which tends to affect my sleep.  I notice that I rarely turn with this mattress pad.  I sleep more soundly and feel much more refreshed in the morning.This does fit with the regular sheets, just like it said it would.  That is because it does not extend all the way to the sides, which does not matter to me.I am so thrilled I found this mattress topper.  When you spend 1/3 of your life sleeping (or trying to sleep), it is a good investment in your health.

This is a good hi-quality cover. I have an oval table with 6 chairs and this fits nicely over the entire set. The fabric feels very durable and it looks nice. The elastic keeps it more snug than others I have used. I believe it will endure a Nebraska winter with little or no difficulty.The cover I am replacing was a Classic Accessories Veranda Patio Table & Chair Set Cover 70932, Large, Pebble for Rectangular or Oval Table up to 108 Inches Long, which has held up nicely.  It seems a bit sturdier than the Amazon Basics, but this one fits better and will probably keep the elements out.I had previously bought a cheaper cover from Kmart and whenever it rained the cover would have pools of water on it. We already have had several heavy rainstorms and this cover was completely secure and the water rolled off it without leaving any puddles.  The real test will be time, so I will try to remember to update this next year.

I lost my son 7 years ago, and it was hard at time to really keep my faith.  I questioned so many thing in life, including God and why thing happen the way they do.  I think the reason I was so attracted to this book is because it started with the first chapter asking, "Can God be trusted?"As the first chapter unfold, it suggests that the reader may even question if God exists.  I felt like the author was talking directly to me.This book has a way of helping you think about your life and your place in it, rather that just telling you to blindly follow the crowd.  Of course, there are several references to the Bible and other sources, but they are more guiding than directing.  I think everyone has to find their own way and their own beliefs.  At least, that is the way it was for me.This is not a long book, and is easy to go through quickly.  It probably depends on how much reflecting you do along the way.  This may not be for everyone, but it really helped me find more clarity.

Okay, I have to admit it.  As a man, I sometime envy my wifes ability to carry so many things in her purse when we are traveling.  Having said that, I am not about to start carrying a purse.  What I will carry is this.This is really a nice quality, attractive all-purpose bag.  The combination of leather and canvas is both casual and classy, without being too flashy.  It has plenty of room for books, papers, camera and other larger items plus several zippered pockets for pens and smaller items.  The pictures her make it appear bigger than it is.  It is actually a nice size without being too big.There are two large snapped pockets on the front for additional items.  The leather handle is large and sturdy, as well as the nice wide shoulder strap.  There are belt style straps on the cover, which are very attractive, but I thought they would be a pain to open and close.  Then I saw that the buckles are attached with snaps, making it very easy to open.The headline does say it will accommodate a 14 inch computer, which is what I have.  Unfortunately, the bag does not have any padding like a computer case to protect from bumps.  I would not use it for my computer without a padded sleeve.  If you are looking for a laptop case, I would try others first.  If you are looking for something to carry your stuff in style, this will do it.

I have had mice in my basement every winter for the past 3 years.  I have used several traps, which worked well, but I couldnt find where they were coming in from.  This seemed like a good idea if it would work.I was concerned about the high-pitched sound bothering my dog.  I turned it on in the living room while she was there and she did didnt even seem to notice it.Iit is unique in the ability to repel several kinds of pests.  There are 4 switches for ultrasonic, negative ion, electromagnetic and night light.  The switches are a little hard to tell when they are on or off.  Other than that, it seems solidly built.  The size covers up both outlets, so you nee dot use an extension cord if you want to plug something else in at the same outlet.The big question is, does it work?  Well, I have my traps set, but I have not seen a mouse since I plugged it in a week ago.  I will update this post if anything changes, but so far I am very pleased with it.

I have to say that this is not exactly a heavy duty mop.  It comes in pieces and assembles easily in less than a minute.  The handle screws together and has a soft rubber cover at the joints.  The bucket system is light weight materials as well.The mop itself does a good job.  The microfiber head is full and absorbent, and it comes with a replacement mop head.  The mop heads snap on easily.  This is a larger mop, much like the old fashioned kind.  It holds a lot of water, and the hands-free wringing system does a decent job.The neck has a 360 swivel system to allow it to get into tight spaces.  I found the swivel to be a bit too stiff to work as well as it should.  Perhaps a little more use or a shot of WD40 will help.If you like this style of mop, this is much handier than the traditional bucket with the wringer. This is probably an ideal mop for small apartments because of the light weight and easy storage. I plan to keep it in my camper.

I have been exercising all of my life, but I have never tried kettle bells before.  The instructor, Lorna Kleidman is the creator or KettleX and instructs classes and private sessions nationwide.  Lorna is a 3-time World Champion in Kettlebell Sport, so who could be better to learn from?The tutorial was really nice for me, since my wife and I are new to this.  Lorna does a very thorough job of explaining what each exercise does and how to do it safely.  The video is professional quality, and Lorna is an excellent presenter.  There is a menu with each exercise, so you can select the ones you want or play them all.The video suggests 10  15 lb. kettle bell for women and 15  20 for men. We followed this advice and got a set of three.  I am really impressed with what a great workout this gives you.  I am becoming a fan of kettle bells and Lorna Kleidman.

When I first looked at this, I thought it was a bit gimmicky.  Then we tried it and it actually does work.  In fact it works quite well.  I have never had a problem folding clothes (one good thing I got from the Army), but my wife has always had a harder time with them.She really likes this board, and I have to admit that now she fold clothes better than I do.  If you need help folding clothes, this makes it almost automatic.

I have to admit that when my wife first put these gloves on, I had to laugh because they look like the hands of a cartoon character.After a good laugh, we tried them out and we were really impressed.The main thing they need to do is protect you from burns, and they do that very well.  The silicone strip provide a great gripping surface to avoid dropping large trays when removing them from the oven.  They are big enough to use them like hot pads for removing hot pans or to protect the table from hot casseroles.I have big hands, and I wasn't sure if they would work for me.  They are a little snug to pull on, but they do stretch enough to fit almost anyone.  Once I have them pulled all the way on, I can move my hands just as though they were cotton gloves.  They are surprisingly flexible for the protection they give.They are fantastic for the grill because they allow me to move hot pans around while still being flexible enough to flip my burgers and dogs.  No more singed hands.  I will not be without them now.

I have been using this case with my Samsung Galaxy tablet for 3 weeks.  I wanted to use it for a while before writing a review to test it's durability.  So far, it has held up pretty well.  The fabric is heavy nylon, much like what is used for suitcases.  The zipper is sturdy, and has a nice big handle.The size is generous enough for most 7 inch tablets.  I have a cover on mine and it still fits in perfectly.  The inside lining is soft and will not scratch the screen.  The mesh pouch on the front has a Velcro closure, and is big enough for my Galaxy II phone.The lining has a surprisingly dense (and thin) foam cushion.  It is probably more protective than it first appears.  The one improvement I would like is more padding for protection from drops.  For the price, it is very nice.

I have been devouring books like this since my son died seven years ago.  I think we all want to know what the dead have to tell us, if just to know that our sprit lives on.I have enjoyed other books by Mike Dooley and I really wanted to love this one.  Unfortunately, it didnt happen for me.  It starts with credibility on the subject.  People like John Edward and Rebecca Rosen have demonstrated their ability as mediums.  What is Dooleys demonstrated ability?  He starts by asking and answering that question: How do I know?  I just do.  In the same way you know you are loved without hearing it.  I was hoping for more.The writing style is a cross between entertaining and annoying at times, as I caught myself thinking, Please stop rambling and get to the point.  It seemed much different from some of his other works.  I thought it would be more of a scientific approach to death and dying, but I didnt really see anything new that I havent seen in so many new age books on spirituality.I can understand why the reviews for this book are all over the board.  The author tells us that there is a God, but not like religious teachings traditionally tell us.  God is part of everything including us.  There is a heaven but no hell.  For people who just want to believe that we live on and want a feel good read, this will do it.  For people who are looking for more scientific proof, or people who have strong religious beliefs, a lot of what the author says will seem a bit empty and unsupported.What I did like about the book is the positive, upbeat approach to a sometimes sad subject.  It offers hope and faith about what lies ahead for all of us.  There are also good suggestions on how to live our Earthly life while we are here.  In the end, we are probably all looking for that.

I have been using Armor All on my cars for years, and I wanted to try this to see how it compared.  I sprayed one side of my dash with Armor All and the other with Chemical Guys.  I have to say it does a great job - better than Armor All.  The Armor All leaves a nice shine, but it can also create a glare when the sun hits it.  It can also be uneven, because some parts of the dash do not shine as well as the others.This leave a nice matte finish, and has a nice smell to it.  One thing I like is that it does not leave the surface slick like other products.  It does cost a bit more, although not that much.  If you like the shine, try other products.

These work great for listening to audio and for watching movies. I at first gave them to my husband because I thought you had to be blue tooth user to use them. I'm not and he is. He used them and told me I was wrong, that they worked just fine as regular headphones. So I began to use them and they work great. They are also attractive, in blue, and the ear pieces are very well cushioned. I have even slept with them on as I often listen to audios as I go to sleep. So they are quite comfortable. I recommend these.

This show was very promising in its pilot episode.  The lead is very good as a bachelor who is still on the prowl who suddenly finds out he is both a father and a grandfather. He is not even 50 and has never gone steady, been engaged or, perish the thought, married. He was just looking for his next good time when this was all dumped on him. He is carrying this whole show on his shoulders and his comedic timing and delivery is impeccable. The rest of the cast is good but at this point did not deliver the laughs. They were clearly supporting the lead as his straight men and women. Besides this new family of his, there is also his restaurant, which is for the hip, trendy and littered with A-listers here and there. Usually some other strong characters need to emerge to make a sitcom a hit but it is too early to tell who that might be. I think it is too early to tell if this can make it all the way to becoming a long running hit sitcom.

This season shows the most startling changes in all of the characters. First and foremost, our two female detectives are not getting along. They both want the same job. They both are sick of one another's private lives and problems. There is no actual cat fight out in the street but it is a close thing. Next, their superior officer, a woman who has always been tough as nails and totally competent, has progressively become an alcoholic. It is seriously throwing off her ability to do the job. The two detectives have always admired her greatly so are they going to have to be the ones to turn her in to the higher ups? Romance blooms off and on for these two as well but one gets the feeling that long range it will always be more off than on. This is totally realistic for being in the police force as is their superior's alcoholism. This show is immensely gutsy for not ducking these issues just because our leads are all women. As usual, they are excellent at solving their cases since that is the one area of their lives where they do excel without fail. I have always enjoyed Lesley Sharpe in everything she's done for the BBC (the blonde on the box).

I'm running into a problem with tv viewing. There are so many shows which are excellent that I can't take on anything new unless it is also excellent. This did not used to be true before tv got so good with the entrance of all of these new providers, especially top film makers and writers now making tv shows. I also saw the movie version of this and liked it extremely well. That got 5 stars. This show does not compare favorably with the film. It especially does not have any of the deeper concerns that the movie version had.I love all of Philip Dick's work. If you read it, it is very intellectual. He never intended any law and order procedural to come out of his work. His eye was always on the bigger picture. That is what this show is missing. So the people behind the camera are the ones who really did not understand his books.This is a so-so rendition of a law and order version of the original movie. It has gotten the special effects down, which the movie had too. But everything else about this is not of same caliber. I suspect Spielberg needs to actually be the one in charge of this show in order for it to be special.

This is one of my favorite Scandinavian series. I've read all of the prior books and enjoyed them all. This one continues the excellence level. This time the Department Q investigators go to an island to investigate why a policeman killed himself when their department said they couldn't take his case.This sets off a long journey into the past. The starting point is the title, the Hanging Girl. The dead policeman was obsessed about a case from 17 years ago involving a young girl who was murdered by a snow plow like vehicle hitting her and throwing her body up into a tree. She bled to death there. The people and places this story goes from there is in every intriguing direction possible. There are cult members and ex lovers of a charismatic hippie from back then named Frank and alternative medicine practitioners. And so much more too.Although this is Danish instead of Swedish, the two countries have a lot to do with one another and the police have to cooperate a good deal. Department Q is located in the Copenhagen Police Department as is its cold case unit. I recommend reading this series in the order it was written. You can follow the mystery if you read them out of sequence but you really won't understand the personalities of the characters who make up Department Q.

This is one of the most ambitious and original shows I've seen in recent years. It deals with issues which are not usually seen in series tv. There is the judge himself, played by Ron Pearlman. Normally he's law and order type but when his son went into an irreversible coma, all sorts of different things began happening to him. He began having visions, speaking in tongues, having liquid trails to follow to lead him to the guilty, a defendant who became his right hand man. In the hands of a lesser acting talent this could have been a complete disaster.But Pearlman is great in this role. He also walks a line between someone whom you might despise ordinarily yet at other times he elicits empathy. Dana Delaney plays his wife and does her usual solid job. The "pastor" is someone who has turned to this line of work after being an actor in a soap opera who was written out of it. I thought that was a hilarious touch to the series.Amazon seems to be bringing some solid tv series to streaming viewing and I am really glad to have these streaming alternatives.

There has been a scarcity of good sitcoms recently. This did not sound like a particularly fresh idea but its script was excellent and the delivery by its actors perfect. Thus, the concept of two people who were "just having fun" while he's visiting London ending up having a baby together works. There are some scenes which appear in the first episode that immediately engage you. These are:There is a pre cancer condition involved. The doctor explaining this mangles it up so much telling the couple that all anyone can think of is having cancer itself. She doesn't have cancer. She just has cells that bear frequent testing.There is acquaintance from hell who has them over for dinner. It turns out her husband is even worse than she is. For anyone who has ever had a nightmare of getting to together with another couple, this one really tops them all.When he finds out she is pregnant is when he is back in the USA, blithely having a first date with someone else. He takes the call from her at the restaurant and pretends it is his mother calling him.Rob Delaney who plays the guy is especially good at deadpan comedy which is not easy to do.

What happened with this show is that it was cancelled by AMC at the end of the third season. It was picked up by Netflix for the concluding and fourth season only. The third season had left us hanging off a cliff. Since the talent behind this show went in with this idea in place, everyone was focussed on bringing this show to a good conclusion. This is unusual in series tv because typically no one knows if the show will have another season or not.If you do not already know this: this show was initially an english language remake of the Danish show of the same name. When this version began, it followed the Danish show scene by scene. Gradually they started deviating from the Danish version. By the time we got to this final season, the only thing the two had in common was a woman detective. The best invention was of her male partner, Holder. He was a great addition to the show and the Danish version could have used him. There is also a lot of magnetism between these two leads.So these two have to finish off their murder stories and then find some kind of personal lives to resume or begin anew.Just to show you a key difference between the Danish show and the American: in the Danish show the woman starts off with a rather obnoxious male partner. To call him a male chauvinist pig would be to upgrade him.Anyway, because these other police people are not as in to guns as we are, the are tracking a killer one night and he has no gun. He, of course, ends up dead early in the show. So much for the males on that show.The American version is completely opposite. Holder is the feeling one of the two. He is compassionate and understanding. BUT he certainly carries his gun! So Holder is an equal character in this show, which is why they are shown together on the poster. In fact, most viewers are going to relate to Holder as their favorite character. Considering he didn't exist in the Danish show, this is quite a leap.I liked the third and fourth seasons best because by that point the show was its own and the viewer could forget about eh Danish version. So I think seasons 1 and 2 are good but seasons 3 and 4 are terrific.

I enjoyed this film. I know a great deal about this case so I was also curious to see how graphic the content would be. I think overall they were probably as graphic as most of the Lifetime cable tv audience can handle. So I can't really fault Lifetime for that. It gets across the basic tension between the killer and victim. She wants love and marriage. He does not or at least not with her. He wants to marry a "nice Mormon girl." Even though Jodi Arias converted, it wasn't enough.Travis actually does a lot of very crude and obnoxious things in his real life self but that is not shown here. For one, he sent out pictures over his phone of his states of arousal which were very specific. These had to be shown in court and the courtroom was stunned. The way he talked about her to everyone was also crude and offensive but that has been very toned down too. I would not have wanted to know him because of his very damaged way of perceiving women.The film accurately shows that he was primarily interested in a sexual relationship while she was interested in his being "the one." She became increasingly obsessive and compulsive about this. His fatal mistake was that he kept going back for more sex even though he knew there was something wrong with her. She was slashing his tires, stalking his new girlfriend and became more and more obsessed about their (non-existent) relationship.Did he use her? Yes and if you go through the evidence, he used her in much worse ways than shown. He was not a beater or batterer but he was emotionally abusive to her. The film could have been a little more ruthless in its depiction of him and bring it closer to the truth. But I'm quibbling. I think it got the essence of their problem down fairly well.The law in this was not fully presented but I doubt the movie audience would be interested in hearing the arguments expounded upon at length. Essentially her defense tried to expand the battered wife or girlfriend defense to emotionally using someone and using someone for sex rather callously as a good enough reason for justifiable homicide to apply. The argument that won was the prosecution's, i.e., we cannot start excusing people from murdering others when they get into bad relationships and are dumped or are used over and over again...but give their consent to being so used. This was not a rape case, not a domestic violence case. It was a case where the man wanted sex and the woman wanted marriage and neither would budge. It is too bad that neither one of them got the psychiatric help that they both could have used. They were sane but they were really damaged people in their concepts of relationships.All in all this was a good job but if you want the full graphic nature of the two of them you will have to read about it. It is fascinating reading as they were absolutely toxic people to one another.

The Brits are very good at changing their casts around in their series tv. It is a tricky thing to do and mostly series close when cast members are substituted. This show is one of the successes in series cast changes. There have been only two Barnabys and this second one has been quite good. I've lost track of the assistants there have been so many. This new assistant is perhaps the most attractive of the bunch although we've had some funnier ones. This Barnaby also has a darling Jack Russell dog which I've appreciated too.There are four episodes and, as usual, they all revolve around grisly murder(s) in the most bucolic and lovely English villages. It is the contrast which makes this show. There is the prim and proper villager going about his or her duty with a stiff upper lip--and one of those folks is murdering someone with outright abandon and glee. Our detectives have to catch this wolf hiding out in a Burberry. Here are some quickie summaries of the episodes:A murder by a toy roulette wheel sent to an illustrator's home. She operates it and is killed. Her writer partner was the late George Summersbee, writer of the Jed Dagger novels. Fittingly enough, a village crime fiction festival is going on run by the crime writer's sister-in-law. So we have murders going on while a crime fiction festival is going on. It is very tongue in cheek and thus hilarious.A Pub landlady is crushed to death whilst assisting a magician. The magician has been linked to Satanism by the village's curate, who is also murdered on a pagan altar where seemingly midnight rituals occur by robed Satanists. This show never has a supernatural element so the answer has to be yet another traditionally clad Brit living the life of an English villager.Another episode involves a folk festival in a village. What has enraged villagers is that the festival organizer is planning to move it. This will also remove the money it brings into the village. So, of course, this organizer is found dead, his head held down in a bowl of water containing eels and eggs, something only the Brits would consider eating.Finally, there is a winery in a Midsomer village winery. It holds a launch for its new wine while a ruthless wine critic is present, Nadia. Several guests at the party end up poisoned by the wine but not fatally. Turns out the wine critic is the suspect in chief for the hit and run killing of a little girl by a presumably drunk driver. Certain people have not forgotten that she was never tried for the killing.These are all immensely enjoyable, just like their predecessor episodes were.

This was a spin off from "Waking the Dead", about a cold case unit. The lead here was the pathologist in that series. However, she was not a strong character in that show. I was rather surprised to see her step into the lead in this series as she seems far more capable of supporting actor work. I did not appreciate, until seeing this spin off, how important it is to have a strong, almost overwhelming actor in the lead. Trevor Eve was that lead in "Waking the Dead". He played one of the most obnoxious people imaginable. Yet he was very effective as the leader of the unit. With his not being in the spin-off, it was as if the air had gone out of the show, like a balloon.  Trevor Eve juiced up the show and made it compelling. Sometimes you wanted to throw the set at him but you never wanted to turn it off. This spin-off never had anyone like that in it. So I learned something: nice characters without that strong personality have a hard, almost impossible time, getting series tv off the ground. I fully expected it to last only one season and that is all it did.

I was about to give up on this show. I have hung in for all of the other seasons. But at the last minute I decided to watch it. I'm glad I did because I find myself enjoying it. The first challenge was using fabric from Mood which had been draped all over Madison Square Garden. Several of the designers managed to turn the yardage into great looks and there were some terrific bombs as well.The second challenge was the unconventional materials challenge. This involved going to a Hallmark Signature store in NYC and letting the designers load up on cards in a mad dash. They then had to construct a garment out of the cards. There were quite a few really great outfits in this challenge. Almost all of them used entirely cards and nothing else. Several were quite sculptural with a wedding dress made out of cards the most sculptural. That wedding dress was out of this world. Since it is only going to be worn one day, cards as material actually makes sense.Zack Posen and Nina Garcia do the hard core judging as they really understand how fashion is put together. Zack Posen can actually spot ANY detail on the garment which isn't right. Out of all the judges, he is the king of garment construction. Heidi and Tim are best in their respective role of Heidi as host and Tim as helper to the designers. Of all the people who have tried on his role in the spin offs of this show, no one comes close to being as effective as Tim is at it. Another reviewer here mentioned she thinks she's gotten used to Heidi. I think the same thing has happened to me.  The guest judges are hit and miss. Some are quite good whereas others are barely in the fashion design world.Tim also has his "Tim Gunn Save" again this season.One thing which changed on this show is that there is no more designers fighting over models. They have the model they are going to use at the start of the show. That never changes. So there are no more distractions over someone "stealing" someone else's model. The models seem roughly equivalent to one another as well. I can't say the model ever was the one who managed to win the show for the garment or got the designer kicked off. Besides, these judges know how to look past the models to the garments.It is still the same formula and the same show, which 14 seasons on is not as fresh as it once was. That said, I am enjoying it way more than I expected to be enjoying it.

I can't give this a bad review but I also have to admit that I eventually gave up on it. You may do the same if you have some of the same issues I have. If not, this may be five stars for you.First problem: Clive Owen's doctor character has a drug addiction. This problem begins to take over the episodes. This happened for one season of "House" and I almost gave up on that show because of it. I know drug addiction is bad but as a 66 year old person I don't need that hammered home to me constantly.Second problem: The surgeries in here are absolutely grisly. Medical practices compared to the ones we have today are downright barbaric. I am not usually squeamish but people are lost under hideous surgeries. I am so glad I did not live then. No wonder life spans were so short. "House" was antiseptically modern, clean and "state of the art" in comparison. If you actually like grisly surgeries though, this show will appeal to you.These are my two objections. As to what is right: Clive Owen is always a wonderful actor. I have never seen him in anything where he wasn't great. He is the Number One asset of the show. If you need a Clive Owen "fix", you will probably love the show. The writing and direction are also quite good. If you can get past my two objections, then you probably have a good viewing experience ahead of you.

This one really keeps you guessing. The lead character has a fling with a guy while on vacation in the Florida Keys. She returns to New York and arranges to meet him again at his apartment. The man who opens the door at that apartment though is not the same man, although he is the one who actually goes by the name she was given. She discovers the guy she met in Florida was using this guy's name and identity. He was someone else and she has no idea who that could be.Meanwhile this new guy gets in an uproar about he has been the victim of identity theft. He insists she talk to security at his brokerage firm as this other guy may wreck his career. She does so and the entire firm goes into a tailspin over this identity theft. Then she tries returning to her normal life but things begin happening to her. She believes the guy from the Keys is back in New York and now set on harming her.That is the premise and you will not be able to put it down until the end.

This film was under appreciated at the time of its release. Unfortunately, just about anyone who was doing an homage to Hitchcock was in for it critically as Hitch's work was still very fresh in their minds. Also, Meryl Streep's being the Hitchcock type blonde enigma was at that time considered a bad choice since she did only "heavier" work. We now know that she delights in trying just about any role once and being the Hitchcock Kim Novak or Grace Kelly or Tippi Hendren alternative must have been quite the lure for her. She was certainly up to the challenge. She does her usual excellent job in the role of the enigmatic woman. Is she a murderer? Did she murder her father? her lover?The late Roy Scheider plays the dead man's psychiatrist. That's is how he and Brooke come together. She was his lover and returns his watch to his psychiatrist so he can give it to the widow. That she and the dead man worked in an auction house is fascinating too and something Hitch himself had used. Remember Cary Grant's having to get away from James Mason and Martin Landau during an auction in "North by Northwest?" Certainly director Robert Benton must have remembered that.The cinematography is absolutely gorgeous and mood it sets is wonderful. Unless you've taken a vow to never see any substitutes but the real Hitchcock himself, this is certainly well worth your time.note: This review is here to help you decide whether you want to view this film in ANY format. This is not a review of the disc but of the film.

These are terrific shoes. I recently had total knee replacement surgery. I had a serious complication with my foot where my toes did not move for months. The toes have finally been coming back and I have been able to get into regular shoes again. I got these to protect myself from falls and other perils of my moving about. They have been wonderful. I just bought a second set. I usually fit a 7.5 shoe. That's what I ordered these in and the fit perfectly. These are also very attractive shoes. They are very bright and colorful which I like. I have been able to move around quite well in these and that is saying a lot. They cushion and support my foot and leg very well. My leg has been through every torture imaginable and these give me a feeling of protection. I've never bought Nikes before and now I may buy nothing else.

I enjoyed this book so much that I promptly read an earlier one of hers and now have started a third book of hers. The other books are set in Washington, D.C. where the lead character is a prosecutor. However, in this book she returns to her home town in Michigan because her sister Jody is being questioned by police as a person of interest in the murder of the town hero, a football coach. The police believe Jody was carrying on an affair with the married coach. However, there are conflicting stories about the coach as to his preferences as to partners. There are rumors that he might be a Jerry Sandusky type, interested in the underage.Anna believes strongly in being a prosecutor. She came from a domestically violent home with an abusive father. Incredibly, she finds herself stepping up to become her sister's defense attorney. She hates criminal defense attorneys! The bulk of the book then is a complete reversal of Anna's usual role which is as a prosecutor.I frankly will be surprised if I like the other three books as well as this one. I've already read Book 3 and liked it but not as well. Seeing Anna forced to act as a defense attorney back in Michigan was very interesting to me. I also liked her relating how the people in Michigan were coping with all of the economic fall out which has taken place there. I also liked the cast of small town characters better than the big city ones which I just read about in Book #3. So if you have decided to try this author, this is the book I'd pick for you.

I've been enjoying watching some of these shows.  The recreation of the crime with stand ins is ok but the better part is the actual evidence which nails the killers. This type of evidence has a tremendous range but, as you'd expect, the big gun is a DNA match. I particularly like how some of these cases have laid dormant and only now the science is making it possible to prove who did it and convict that person. There are also cuts to detectives and pathologists to get their views on the case. If you are worried about a gruesome factor, there really is no blood and guts as part of the show. You are never shown the real crime scene or body. Although, I suppose that it is softened down to this extent, might hamper someone who is really trying to increase their skills. I'm a lawyer and I wouldn't mind being taken through some real life crime scenes, with blood spatter and everything. I doubt that will happen though. This has been made as palatable as possible to pull in the widest range of viewers.

This novel has an interesting premise and thus it moves very quickly. It is set in Miami where a surgeon murders his wife and children. This doesn't seem in much doubt, which is why he uses the insanity defense instead of not guilty. The lead prosecutor for the case is the biggest political opportunist imaginable. He is first chair and the lead character is second chair. It turns out she has a history herself of suffering damage from a murderer. This is why she became a prosecutor but it begins causing her serious problems in handling this case. The lead chair is having a fling with her but does not know about this history of hers. There is a more sympathetic male in the plotline. This is the lead detective on the case. I found it very engrossing. I'm frankly unsure about the ending, how well I like it. Many reviewers have called it predictable here. That's one way of interpreting it and perhaps that is the valid way. There is an alternate way of interpreting it ,which is more interesting. I think the author needed to be clearer about which interpretation was the accurate one. I can live with the ambiguity but some will not like that aspect.

Susanna Clarke's research into this facet of England, the fairy and magical lore of it from centuries past, is formidable. That she has turned that research into fiction is all the more remarkable. How well you like this book compared to her novel, "Jonathan Strange and Mr. Norell" will depend on how you feel about short stories vs. novels. This mines the same material as the novel, fairies and magicians in England past, but it does not build in a huge interlocking story. If you like short stories, you will love this and you can speed right through it. I read it very quickly. It is very entertaining. Her fairies especially are enormously well delineated. Any prior conception one might have had about beautiful young women in long gowns with wings are upended. Clarke's fairies are nothing like that popular conception of them. Clarke is quite the academic. That she can give us the academics behind her stories while still vastly entertaining us is an incredible talent.  Unfortunately, the two books are "it". Clarke's research takes so long that her fictional output is that limited. I read online that she had suffered from bad health in more recent years too. So this may be all we get but it is magnificent stuff.

I agree with another reviewer that the calorie count of this product puts it on the do not buy list for the future. When we eat soup, we are typically eating it for nutrition in part. If we want calorie laden food, I'd rather have a nice juicy burger.  A single 8 ounce serving has 150 calories and there is no way either one of us going to eat just 8 ounces. The calories got jacked up by adding heavy cream and other caloric additives. There are a bunch of similar tomato soups available which are less in calories and higher in nutrition. These soups are carried in almost identical packaging by Trader Joe's, Aldi's and Walmart. They are very good and I am sticking with those. Aldi's is actually called "Tomato and Basil" and is a terrific bargain.

This is a very good woman's fiction novel of romance, suspense and paranormal mixed together.  It is not the hard boiled crime thriller for which the reader turns to Harlan Coben or John Sandford. That only means that I doubt there would be many men interested in reading this, unlike the Coben and Sandford books.The book has a very solid paranormal aspect to it where the heroine is able to see the ghosts of children. The mystery does involve a child, one who disappeared in Bayou country in Louisiana. She moves down there and stays with the family while researching the case as a journalist. It has come to her attention from the family who now want to write a book about the event. While staying with this family she runs into romance as well and that too is a very strong aspect of this book. If you like romance with your mystery, this book is probably just the ticket for you.

We now have this stored in the center console of our car so either one of us can get to it quickly from our front seats. I have worried in the past about cutting that seat belt off or smashing my window open. Having this product along now has given me some peace of mind on these two issues. Our possibility of needing those functions are low so the manufacturer gave us some other features which are nice extras and means we don't have to wait until an emergency. These are:  a tire pressure gauge, an LED flashlight and a red map light. We're already using those functions even though we picked this product for the emergency uses. I really like that I can use the AAA batteries with it. I am very well stocked with those and prefer them over other options. I also really like the white light which is very nice for inside the car, trunk, or under the hood.

I was starving one morning and needed to get something into me fast so I didn't move into a hunger headache (which I am prone to do). So I had a bowl of this with some whole milk. It quieted those hunger pangs instantly plus it tasted very good but not overly sugary. So it was healthy and satisfying; good tasting but not junk food. Those are all positives so I recommend this product.

The only detrimental aspect to this product is the price. It is very expensive and I am not used to paying this for shampoo or conditioner. I don't buy cheap shampoo but over $30 is up there in the stratosphere shampoo wise. That said, the product is very nice and does do what it claims to do. It does both shampoo and condition your hair at one and the same time. So one shampoo and you are done and ready to go. But Is it better than the Nexus product line, which I also use? I think they are roughly comparable and the Nexus, while not cheap, is not over $30. So the product is superior but I can't say that I won't buy the cheaper and probably as good Nexus the next time I need shampoo. I should add that my hair is very short and not damaged which lessens my need for constant conditioning. If you have damaged hair, that might make the price more palatable.

Julia L-D does my favorite season of VEEP so far here. She is President this season but it will only be for a very short while as she is up for reelection very shortly. Her staff, as usual, is always on the edge of disaster in handling both her presidency and her reelection campaign. Her most competent staff member is her secretary.Every season there has been a surprise guest star. This season it is Hugh Laurie from "House." He comes in about half way through until the end and is terrific. Many viewers don't know he spent most of his acting life as a comedic actor before he got "House." So he is up to handling the quicksilver comedy of Julia L-D.I first became a fan of Julia's on SEINFELD. There was nothing inept about her character on that show. However, she got to really go to town on the characteristics of shallow and self absorbed. No one will ever forget her yelling at the "Soup Nazi", "Next!" as she finally got the upper hand with him.Thus, VEEP always falls to her as to whether it will make it or not as a tv show. She is VEEP. Her medium has always been tv. She has done movies and been ok but they never seem to work out long range for her like tv does. Lucille Ball had a similar history in films vs. tv as did Mary Tyler Moore. TV is definitely more tolerant of the aging woman and all three comic actors have richly benefitted from that perspective.As for her staff, Gary is my next favorite. He is the one most devoted to her. He has such huge screw up potential, which he realizes regularly. He and Selina even square off for a heck of a fight this season. But they back down after a sharp exchange because no one else is as devoted to either of them.I also watched the English series upon which this was based. They are very different even though they are both political satires about the ineptness of politicians always trying to satisfy their fickle voters.  I like both series and recommend both series.

I picked up this Linwood Barclay book with the expectation that I'd be meeting characters I'd known before who were engaged in another very fast paced mystery. I was not disappointed. I ripped right through it. We met the lead character in this story in an earlier book. That book all revolved around the woman he was married to at that time. I could barely put it down. This time David Harwood is helping his cousin Marla, who is trying to get over a devastating loss, the birth of her stillborn baby. He goes to her house one day with some food from his mother for her and discovers that Marla has a "new" baby. He immediately suspects she's stolen the baby, calls his mother and finds out this is the second baby she's stolen since having the stillborn!With this set up we are off and running because there are twists galore after that. Finding the baby was only the opening salvo in a plot that takes one big twist and plunge after another. That is this writer's strength: plot and pacing. You might find other works which have better developed characters or a more thought provoking theme but that is not why one chooses this book. I picked it for entertainment value and that's what I got.There are some other characters who repeat in here. Derek is the college student who was the baby's father. In an earlier book, Derek had a leading role because he was stuck hiding in a house where a whole family got murdered. He had stayed behind and no one knew he was there. That was also a pretty thrilling book. I would recommend the books he's been writing in this last decade as all pretty good reads in this genre.

I am a big Denis Leary fan so just tune in to anything he does. As usual, he exhibits great talent here as an almost down and out rock and roller who used to be the front man to the major group. He is now dying on the vine and he can't do anything else. His former bass player who now works with Lady Gaga is better known than he is. He has a great scene with his agent whose clients are all D List. Denis is bringing up the rear on even that roster of clientele.Leary has made it a specialty of his on tv to play obnoxious guys. This is the third series to use that type of character. The first two were "The Job" and "Rescue Me" as a cop and fireman respectively. He was always the bane of his squad on both shows, the king of misbehavior, albeit talented at what he did. This is that same kind of role. I will say that I miss the days when he was allowed to do vehicles like "The Ref". He did not have to play the obnoxious character in that. He was a thief worn down by Judy Davis and Kevin Spacey as his hostages. He's also played some other great roles in movies. In one he was in a mental hospital as a patient yet there was a sci-fi aspect to the tale.And of course his stand up comedy act is always a prime thing but he probably is tired of doing that.Give it a try as Leary is a heck of a talent.

I have not watched Martin Clunes play Doc Martin so I saw this without making any comparisons between the two roles. This is a romance between these two characters but there is nothing cloy or sentimental about it. They have their difficulties getting this romance off the ground and they have some considerable misfires. One considerable hurdle they need to face is that he is in the business of death, funerals, whereas she is in the business of life, nurse midwifing. These two are also quite ordinary looking which lends credibility to the series. The acting by both is top notch and they do an excellent job of catching the many nuances of a relationship's taking hold for two people who are deciding to go the long route. If you need this type of show to be glamorous, it may not be for you. Anyone else should love it. It is a UK show and the UK does consistently go for a more realistic slant to its tv programming straight across the board.

I love this play and have also seen the stage and tv versions. They are all excellent. But it is hard to beat Walter Matthau and George Burns as the leads, which is what is available in this movie version. They show how truly funny two old codgers can really be. They play two old Vaudevillians, who were comedy partners who cannot get along in their last years. They are in an instant at one another's throats over just about anything. Matthau here is as strong as he was in playing Whiplash Willie (Fortune Cookie) or Oscar Madison (The Odd Couple). Although we got used to seeing him paired with Jack Lemmon, George Burns proves as worthy an adversary in this film. Burns was the former straight man for his ditzy wife Gracie Allen in the early years of tv and radio comedy. He is just as effective with Matthau. They have both been gone for awhile now and it has not been easy finding their comedic, modern counterparts in films.

I was offered a discount on my purchase, and only asked to write a review.  So here it is!I ordered the 42 inch to be a gift for my nephew.  I have a 38 inch waist and it latches on the last hole when I wrapped it around my waist over a sweater and pants.  There is about 3-4 inches of a tail making the 42 inch belt.  I think this is true to size.It feels pretty nice and has solid stitching.  Looks like it will last a while. I will update this review if he says it does not fit or what he finds wrong with it.

I received a discount in exchange for my review.  I got the Queen size and it fits perfect.  I also love the packaging: neatly packaged in a black box which is wonderful for gift giving.  The pillowcase is so luscious to feel...I want to stay in bed a bit longer.What I like and do not like:super yummy to touchfeels awesome on the skinmy hair seems to not matt upthe zipper is not intrusive and love that it keeps the case on the pillowonly one case in the box [not an issue unless you are expecting 2]great product presentation and box...great for gift givingI cannot think of anything not to love about this case.

I ordered the XXL because I have a 38 inch waist.  It is a snug fit but the main belt does fasten with the velcro.  The extra smaller wings add extra support and snugs it up well.  The images I posted as showing how it really pull in!  The extra curve is actually my lower back view [left picture]; the right picture is mostly the belly angle but you can still see the extra curve it gives.  These pictures are with the band rather snug.  It did not cause any pain and I have full motion while wearing it.  It gives me great support.I did receive a discount to purchase this belt but it does not affect my opinion.  I receive discounts because I write so many reviews, that is all.

Very nice!Lightweightcome with small, medium and large ear budsplugs in securely into the my phone - I was able to test in the iPhone 5 and 6long cord - my phone can charge and I do not need to sit on top of the power sourceNo sound distortionsgreat while on a conversation.  No complaints when I talk - they say I am clearmusic sounds great tooOverall a great headset.

I have been having a few issues with my ankle as of late -- every now and again when I step on the foot I get a sharp pain in my ankle.  I was offered a discount coupon to get this Aegend wrap and happy agreed to test it and write a review.This wrap is easy to put on as it uses hook & loop [velcro] to secure it when we put it on.  As the images provided up in the product description show, you just fit it on the foot [heel into the hole], wrap and secure on foot, wrap and secure on ankle, cross wrap for added support.  Thats it!I wear a size 8 womans shoe. I think this wrap would work fine for smaller and larger alike. Not sure you can see it in my photos but there is plenty of material to wrap around as well as the cross over straps are long and can secure to themselves if for a smaller foot.It is lightweight and does not hinder me wearing my walking shoes. Oddly, to my surprise, when I wear it, I have not experienced that sharp pain.  Coincidence?  Maybe.  I will keep wearing it and let you know if stops being helpful.

These sort of bags are designed for our convenience in mind and this one seems to do the job it was made for. I was offered this pouch in exchange for a review.  I find listing out what I Like and Do Not Like gets straight to the point.What I like and do not like [ in no particular order] :Like... no zippers... I have had several versions of these sort of pouches and it seems the zipper usually breaks well before the pouch ever does.NOT...  You can see into it!!!!!. I do not like knowing others can see what cash I have around my waist line. So this requires me to use yet another wallet inside of this wallet pouch.Like...Velcor and Zip-loc Technology!  Seals up great!Like... belt has an adjustable Adult size and it is easy to snug upLike... it says it is PVC material... it sure feels good and it looks like it will last a long timeLike, I put it on and stood in the shower... kept the paper inside it dry!Overall, Like this pouch!  I would give it 5 stars if at least part of it was opaque so that I could tuck some cash or credit card without it being in plain sight.  But that is my opinion.Overall a good pouch that keeps things dry.

I received a discount coupon and was asked to try it out and write a review when I was done...so here it is:Simply put, this is a great hose.  If you have never tried an expandable hose you HAVE GOT TO TRY ONE!  They are so awesome! You pull it out, hook it up like other hoses, turn on the water.  Stand in awe as you watch the hose fill up and grow into a full grown big hose!  Use as any other hose.  When done: Turn off your water, depress the water hose handle to let out the water in the line [as any hose] and stand and smile as you watch the hose shrink back into a Baby Hose.  Uncouple from your faucet, curl it up and store it away!It is super light and easy easy easy to use and manage.This hose comes with a spray nozzle, which is a bonus as many hoses do not.  I have been using the hose for couple of months now and it is great!  No dripping or leaking from the nozzle.  No issues with the hose either.My experience with expandable hoses is that... you CAN NOT leave them out in the sun.  OKAY?!  Just do not do it!  And DO NOT step on them when full of water!  haha I busted my previous hose that exact way!!!  Please learn from my mistakes.I have high hopes for this baby that it will be around for use for a long, long time.

Love to Infinity Times 2!!This winter accessory is PERFECT for my style.  I love black, white and red.Add to that...it is SUPER SOFT and feels totally YUM-I-LISHEOUS!!!!  I wish internet had a way to share the feeling...I try to share in my photos how it looks on... please ignore my lack of color coordination... I was taking images of the scarf...not me.It would make a great gift for those who also love this sort of stuff!  It stays on!  No more scarf ends falling off and down instead of keeping my neck warm.  Awesome!I got this with a discount and was asked to review it... my first thoughts were okay, never reviewed a scarf before...hmmmm... this will be interesting,  but..... Now that I see and touch it... I LOVE IT and nothing you can say will change my opinion!!!  :-)Yes, I get offers to receive stuff to review.  No pressure, obligations or requirements.  Simply put... we Top 1,000 or so, are sent stuff and are asked to use it and then write our opinion with an unbiased review.So here it is:  I LOVE THIS!!!!

Great headlamp!The headband is easy to adjust but holds well.  Now...this is NOT a fashion statement; however, if you need light in the direction you are facing and need your hands free for other things...this is pretty darn cool!I work on computers from time to time [used to be my main job] and when I need light... boy oh boy is it difficult to get light just where I need it when both my hands are elbow deep in a chassis!I tried to show in the photos the range of light as well as where the batteries go. By turning the dial on the light you can narrow the beam.  Batteries are easy to put in and it is easy to turn the head light on.  One press is ON, Two presses is Flashing, and Three is OFF.Overall a great little light.  I am tucking mine in my tool bag and plan to use it when working in dark spaces as well as when I need extra light when I paint minis!I was provided a sample for review and I do not promise a good rating in return, nor am I affiliated with this company or compensated in any way. I am just a regular Amazon customer who shops a lot on Amazon.

Simply LOVE IT!Arrived in one HUGE box.  Pulled the seat part out and then the few attachments [ two arms and the screws to hold them on, and the base the chair sits on with its couple of parts].I was able to assemble it in under 30 minutes by myself.  With only 6 steps it was pretty straightforward and you do not need any tools [allen wrench / hex key included].The seat is decent.  It is not a fluffy couch but it is not a back breaker like some chairs.  It does not rock forward but it does go backwards.  I am 54 and I like using a foot stool [ottoman] to help me stay in a relaxed backwards lean [that sounds weird...].Setting up the sound was easy for me.  There are several image diagrams showing various ways to hook up your devices. Since I want to sit farther away from my TV, I chose to set it up wirelessly.  Super easy since they include cables in the box.The chair does REQUIRE POWER... so have an extension cord handy if you are not putting this near a wall.  The ON / OFF button is easy to press; all the controls are on the right side of the seat.After setting it up I just had to put in my Borderlands 2 and play and check out the sound quality.  AWESOME!!  There is even vibration in the chair!  I am THRILLED at how much better my games sound and I feel more immersed! The sound seems to be right there around me...even my cat looks around fast when there are foot steps and other sounds!  So COOL!!!Are there any CONS?  uhhhhhhhhwait....mmmmm  okay, it needs power at the chair?  lol  if that is a con...I mean how else would it get juice?I see some do not like the handles...I have not noticed it as I do not rest my arms while gaming...and if leaning up and put my elbow on it it feels fine to me.  No there is no padding on them, but it is not an issue with me.mmm... okay they could make the seat more yummy to sit in... as in sink down into it like a yummy couch...BAHHAHHAH  well come on, right?  But seriously, I do not experience any discomfort sitting in it for several hours.OH I GoT OnE...... bare legs stick to it!  yes... that is a con... I have to go put on sweats or pants or... cover the seat with something to sit on so my thighs do not stick.  Of course... I think that is common with chairs like this...I mean look at it all shiny and sleek.And OnE MoRe.... the wireless box that transmits the signal to the chair is powered by batteries and does not include an AC adapter... dudes really???  I really think they should include a way to keep the juice flowing freely from the get go without requiring us to hunt down an adapter on our own.Overall.....I am VERY Happy with this chair and look forward to several hours of gaming in it!

These work great!  Easy to install and hold small TVs and Monitors well [we use them for 24 size].We use them to install commercial on our job sites (AV installations).Since it is just shy of 2.5 inches off the wall, consider that if you need to access ports. This might not be the mount you are looking for.  Also... it only tilts and turns...it is NOT Free Movement.I think this is best for what it was made for...static holding of a VESA mountable monitor/TV close to the wall.If you need something more dynamic [changing the angles a lot or need to access the ports in the rear of your monitor/TV then this is not for you.

So, I was offered a discount coupon and asked to review this insulated bottle.  It is so cute, how could I say no?After getting it I chuckled.  It is pretty cute and small.  Holding about 8 ounces of water, it is perfect for me as that is all I drink.Does it work, you may ask?YES!!!!  Amazingly well!!!  I filled it with hot tea around 5 pm and at 7 pm it was still HOT!  at 10 pm it was a pleasant warm!I was FLOORED!!!  I really did not think it would keep my tea so hot for so long!!  I have tried other thermoses in the past and often my drink is only warm after an hour.Sorry for all the exclamation marks but I do not know how to express my amazement and excitement on how wonderful this little thing it!This is a KEEPER for me!I was provided a sample for review and I do not promise a good rating in return, nor am I affiliated with this company or compensated in any way. I am just a regular Amazon customer who shops a lot on Amazon.

Creates Steam QuicklyIt creates steam quickly and is pretty easy to use.Pull out the water container in the rear, add distilled or filtered water,plug it in and then turn it on.Steam feels great on the skin, it opens the pores and feels fantastic!I also enjoy breathing in the steam for respiratory health.The water tank [container] in the rear is a super snug fit and it might take a little getting used to on figuring out how to pull the tank out.Overall I really like this steamer.I received this product in exchange for providing an unbiased review.  I write reviews because I like helping shoppers get some insight into the product they are looking at.

I have had the pleasure of trying several of the Luseta Sets of shampoos and conditions.  They are ALL heavenly!!!!This Coconut retreat leaves my hair feeling soft and clean.  The smell is soft and faint -- no over-powering aromas, which is wonderful to my nose.  I have very long hair [over 3.5 feet] and I only need about 2.5 - 3 pumps of each to cover my hair.  Any more than that and it seems like a waste.I have struggled a long time trying to save money and used to purchase other cheap hair products from local stores.  I always ended up adding lots of other products to try to get shiny and soft feeling hair.  Overall, I think I have spent more $ over time because of the extra products I have needed to use.  With these Luseta products I find I only need to wash and condition--no additional hair creams or masques needed. My hair is soft and feels great right after I rinse and it stays that way after it dries.Overall, great hair products!Disclaimer:  I did receive a discount on this product with the request to write an honest review.

LUV IT!I was not expecting much from a Cube, boy was I surprised to the quality of the sound that comes out of this small thing!Really easy to use:Charge it with the Micro-USB it comes with,Turn on [toggle on side easy to push]Pair to DeviceBAM!  Play music or talk over the speaker phone!The speaker phone is most impressive to me compared to other devises with one  Everyone says that I sound clear and clean  I hear others very well without needing to max out the volume  Range is about 30 feet, clearest with a line of sight [if an object gets between the phone the speaker there is some garble]Sound Quality is Excellent and it looks Awesome too.I received a discount in exchange for providing an unbiased review.  I write reviews because I like helping shoppers get some insight into the product they are looking at.

Wonderful Bamboo Fiber Cloths!!!!!!!I am very impressed with the softness and durability of these washcloths.They came in a clear plastic zip-lock sort of bag which can be used for storing theses cloths or repurpose it so there is less waste in our landfills.Super soft right out of the bag.Feels gentle and rinses out with a flash.Great Product!!I received this free or discounted product in exchange for providing an unbiased review.  I write reviews because I like helping shoppers get some insight into the product they are looking at.

Love It.  Looks sleek and sexy!Has an adjustable head so I can angle it to  the position I need to light up my miniatures as I paint them.The LEDs are a pleasant white light, which really helps me with reading and painting.The switch is easy to use to dim and turn off and on, just by tapping the power icon on the base.It is a nice addition that I can use the base to charge my USB powered devises as well.My camera is not working so I cannot add pictures right now, but I will update this posting when I can to add images.Overall a great LED desk lamp.DISCLAIMER:I received this item without obligation as a promotion to test.  I was only asked to write an honest review if I was so inclined to do so.

OH MY GOSH!! LOVE IT!!!!!!How cool is this!?!?!?!?!Solid, sturdy, and clear smooth plastic in the shape of a head.  Holds headsets and fedora hats!Up until this stand, my headset hung on a hook or laid on my table.  Now my gear looks flipping cool and is super easy to FIND!Totally recommend this stand!
