Not just for the functionality but for the COOL FACTOR as well!

Great Organizer!The four Vertical compartments (on the sides) keep glasses, pens, paint brushes, and the such standing up straight and easy to reach.The top horizontal part has 4 small compartments that are great for little things like correction tape, eye shadow, dongles, etc.  There is one drawer that fits pens and glasses diagonally or a small box of crayons, post-it notes and so on. You can pull the drawer all the way out.It feels strong and sturdy enough to last a long time. I tried to squeeze the sides like a soda can and I cannot dent it.Overall, I think this is a good organizer for the office, art room, or anywhere you need small caddy.DISCLAIMER:I received this item at a discount without obligation.  I was only asked to write an honest review if I was so inclined to do so.

Hands Down, with or without a discount coupon...this stuff is amazing!I have very long hair (nearly 4 feet long) and it gets dry at the ends.  I got this and immediately put some on my hair.  A little goes a LONG Way!!!!!  I did not rinse it.  It soaked in and oh my gosh....... It feels so soft and smells wonderful!!!!!  I use it regularly but not as described.  I literally rub it on my dry hair and let it absorb.  That is all.I would give it 10 Stars if possible!I did receive a discount coupon to check it out without any obligation; only a request to write an honest review.

I have only owned a few vibrators over the years; this is the best one by far that I have experienced.The boxing that it arrived in is discrete and classy--making it a great gift to yourself or someone special.As for its ability, it does the job well! Great stimulation!  Press the button on the end once for low, again for medium, again for high, again and again and it will vary the stimulation pattern.  To shut it off, just press and hold for about 3 seconds.The vibrator has a nice feel to it: not too soft, not like a solid stiff plastic, it is just right. I have tried one that was super soft but it was so sticky everything stuck to it...gross...but not this one!  This one stays clean after washing and does not hold the fibers from the towel.  It is easy to clean and stow away.  Also of note, the sound of the vibration is not as loud as others I have experienced.Overall, two thumbs up!

This fit nicely on the iPhone 6S.  Slide the backing off, place the outer edge on the phone then slide the backing into the slots of the edging.  That easy!The anti-slip backing is pretty cool.  It feels like PU leather pillows.  I put the phone on the table and ran it.  It was virtually silent from the vibration and barely moved compared to another standard case, which rotated in a circle and made that "zzzzzzzzzzz" sound.I think this case would be great for professional who need to keep a phone within sight on a desk but need it to be silent [such as in a meeting].I ordered the Pink; it looks pretty much like the Pepto Bismo pink you see in the stock image.Overall, I like the case as it feels nice in the hand, easy to put on and off, and silences the vibration of the rattling on the phone on hard surfaces.

Pretty cool if you are in the market for this sort of thing.  They come with the metal circle thing (that you put the keys on) separate; so you have to assemble.The plastic coil fits a Small wrist.  I have a medium (about 7.25 inches) and the coil is snug.  I feel it and it leaves an impression on my skin.Overall, they are cute and could have several functions.Disclaimer: I did receive a sample to test and was only asked to write an honest review.

Disclaimer:  I received these earrings at a discount without obligation, but was requested to write a review if I were so inclined.They came in a nice blue earring box, which includes a small cleaning cloth.  Would make a nice gift box.I put them on immediately and am happy to report that there was zero irritation or inflammation from the posts.The backing to the studs are secure; they have a wide plastic rim that helps balance the weight of the cube stud.I wore them for about 10 hours without any discomfort or irritation and I received a couple of complements on how pretty they were.Overall, I really like these earrings and give them 5-stars

Very impressed with this shaper.  I ordered the 4XL which according to the size chart fits my waist as expected.  Stitching is excellent in my opinion and the material feels wonderful.  The outside feels like Latex and the inside is soft cotton.This one does seem to snug up my waist a bit and looks close to the product images (gives a bit of hourglass going on).PROS:No rolling upNo muffin rollsBoosts up the BustSmooths the back rollsLooks sexy onCONS:It is hooksalways a challenge for me to do upIs a workout to hook up!  haha I guess I really struggle with the hooking part!Frankly, I think it feels great on (once I get it on) and looks GREAT and Sexy!Disclosure: I received this corset without any obligation and without reward.  I was asked only to write an honest review if I wanted to.

WOW AND WOW!I never knew wearing something like this could feel so good.  I have to say, I was impressed when I pulled it out of its bag.  The texture is great to touch and fees just as great to wear it.  This surprised me as I expected it to feel stiff or too restrictive.  This is not so.  now, I did order the 5XL ... I was about a 39 inch waist upon ordering.  I am in my menses at the moment, and just got the corset.  My waist is now 41.  Looking at the chart they provide in the images... I should wear a 5XL or a 6XL in my current state.  But....  i think I should have went down a size to a 4XL.  See, I can easily get the corset on the smallest/closest hooks and there is room to snug it up. So... it is comfortable, but not really "snug".  Of course, I am not complaining!  I am just saying, as I lose some weight the 5XL will be too big and I will need a smaller size.  So, for me... I would prefer the snugger 4XL on the largest setting so that I could snug it up tighter as needed or wanted.  And I cannot do that with the 5XL.So, to me, this is a bit larger and I suggest you go a size down if you are on the low end of the size [example you have a 38 in waist and 5XL is for 38-40, that you go with the 4XL, one down, so that the 38 is the wide and you have room to snug it up].  Of course, if you like a relaxed fit... ignore everything I just said!!!  [smiles]PROS:I love the craftsmanship of this corset.Material feels great.Feels good on.CONS:Does not seem to pull in the waist as much as images suggest.Sizing is a little too big for me, I suggest go one smaller if waist is on the small end of the sizing increment.Hand wash only.**I received this corset to test without any obligation.

As I seem to need more and more charging cables, I was very happy to be offered a discount to review this one.I really love that the cable is LONG... 10 feet long!  I can now have my iPad or phone charging while I sit on the couch or in bed with ease.In my opinion, every home should have a 10 ft charging cable for their device... there is no way to understand how the extra length can be beneficial until you have one. We do not need them at every USB port as often 3 footers or less will do the trick at the desk or the stand where you walk away and maybe use the Bluetooth so cable length may not be an issue.  But for the times when you need to stand or sit over 3 feet from a USB Hub... this is what the doctor ordered!Disclaimer:  I did receive a discount with the request to write a review of my opinion of the product.

I received this product free of charge with the request to write an unbiased review.First off, watch the sizing as listed in the product description.  The Large wraps around 43 inches, the Medium fits about a 39 inch girth and the Small fits about a 37 inch.  I was happy to get the product to test.  It is really nice material:  feels soft yet has support.  The extra band really helps secure and really can pull in a bit more.  Even the hook & loop part is easy on the skin and is not scratchy.  There is nice strong stitching and overall it is a wonder quality.The label is not in English, but I think the symbols say to wash cool-warm water, hand wash, line dry or lay flat, and do not iron.Overall I really like this support girdle but remember to order the right size for you.

Disclaimer:  I received a discount in exchange for the request of an honest review.What can I say about a washcloth?!??  First off, the are soft but not "ultra soft" until I had washed them.  Not a deal breaker...I usually wash towels and bedding before using them anyways.  It measures 9 3/4 inch x 9 3/4 inch after washing and is perfect for both baby and for us adults.  As advertised, the clothes are not scratchy.  There is a silky tag on each washcloth; I do not think they are scratchy at all.I do not notice any smell or any dyes.  The packaging is nice and would be nice as a gift.The only negative is that one of the clothes, after washing, has developed a few threads that look like... a snag.  They might catch on finger nails and thus, I give it a 4-Star, as I think they should not snag.I gave one washcloth to a friend of mine.  She said that are nice, but after washing, hers also shown snags.  She said she liked them being bamboo but would also rate them as a 4-star for that Snag...as she did not like the idea it would catch on the baby's finger.

In a nutshell... Fun and Functional.  My toes are small on my chub feet so socks with any toes never really fit well and I do not expect them to.  I find with these, only the piggy and the one toe next to it do not fit fully but at least they are not fully following out either like with other socks.The little grippers on the bottom work well when stretching and doing yoga and I have not slipped yet.Overall I really like these yoga socks.  The Full Toe sleeves are awesome ... always have loved full toe socks.I did receive a discount for the request of writing an unbiased review.

In a nut shell, super cute!They are small but cute. The colors are festive.  They look just as the images presented on the product page. and you get a nice gift bag as wellIt took me a few times to get them in my ear but then I figured it out.  Very pleased with them.

I live in east Texas so I was happy to find this towel. It is super easy to use: use as a regular sport/travel towel or soak it in cold water, ring it out and use.  It looks just like the product images on the product page.  The material is soft and very absorbent.I do not know if it really gets up to 30 degrees cooler; however, it is cool to the touch after wetted and twisted dry.  So far it is working well.

In short, this is a great whisk!The whisk comes in the package as seen in the product images and it looks just like the images presented.  A soft blue silicone coats the whisk part.To use it:Place the whisk in your beverage, hold the handle and gently press down.The whisk spins as you press down.As you release your pressure, the handle will rise up and the whisk spins the opposite direction.Simply continue to press and gently release to create a constant mixing.I LOVE it!  I use it for my tea as well as for my Bullet Coffee; I am sure you can use it for any beverage that needs mixed.I rinse it off immediately and let it air dry.  Because of the bamboo handle, I would suggest you do not put in the dishwasher.I think this would make a great gift to oneself or to others.

Overall this bag is great, does what it claims, so I give it a 5 Star!There was a learning curve for me.  At first, I thought the bag did not work as well as it stated but after I tried again, I learned how to use it to keep my stuff that is side nice and dry.The Right WAY to use it:Fold it down (roll) it about 3 or 4 times, then... bend that top back away from the direction you rolled it and press together (snap) the .When I do this, air is trapped in the bag and it keeps the water out.  My paper and towels that I used to test it with remained dry.The wrong way:Fold it 3 times or less and or bend the rolled top "into the folded side" to snap/clip it closed.I did this first.  Then I laid the bag in my shower.The result of how I had folded and closed it up caused some water to seep in and get the top of my tester paper wet.Now that I know how to fold it up, I am convinced it will work well on my next trip to the beach.Note: I received this bag at a discount and was asked to write an review with my opinion.

I hope my pictures come out for you so you can see these them.  The colors are bright, the size is as described.  They are easy to clean and easy to store.  Compared to other collapsible dog bowls, these have a nice solid, sturdy feel as well as a solid plastic rim.  They sort of "pop" when you collapse to each level.I have several dogs: large (90 lbs), medium (35-40 lbs) and some puppies that are about 15 lbs. I strongly recommend not leaving these bowls unattended with puppies.  HEHE  I am sure you know why!  As for the medium and large dogs using the bowls, there are no issues that I see. Just as with any bowl, it can be tipped over.  The collapsable element adds to the potential that a side might be pushed down by a nose or paw; however, these bowls compared to a couple others have a strength to them so they hold up pretty well and do not collapse easily.I personally keep two in the house and use them for snacks.  What can I say?  I like them!iVivo provided bowls at a discount for evaluation and review.

Great oil diffuser with a small footprint.  Came in a great box that can be repurposed easily (no branding) to be a gift box or used to store other items.  Really like that it has minimal waste.The diffuser looks like the product images.  A warm, soft light is emitted.  I found it odd that is powered via a USB cable...but then I think that is pretty cool as that is becoming more and more my main plug! The plug goes under the unit and there is a small channel on the base so that the cable can run out to the plug.I love that you can gently press the Light button to lighten or turn off the Light as well as you can press the Mist button to alter the set of time it will mist.  The opening for the mist is in the back of the unit on the lid.  I also love that the lid twists on and locks, which helps greatly to reduce possible mess if you bump it while it is full of water.  Another cool feature is that while it is lit, you see the waves of the water within the unit as it mists.  I find that quit soothing and relaxing.Overall two thumbs up!  I found it easy to get out of the box.  It is already assembled with the exception of the power cable being plugged in.  I never bothered to look at instructions.  Just flip it over without water in it and you will see the hole for the power adapter to go into.  Run the cable through the small channel so the cable does not make the diffuser teeter while sitting.  Then twist the top off.  Fill with water.  I used Filtered or Distilled.  I did not measure it but it seems like 1/2 up or so.  Add your Oil if you want aromatherapy. Put the lid back on.  Sit it on a solid stable flat surface near a USB power port (I have mine about 3 feet from my iMac).  Tap on the Light to desired setting.  Tap on the Mist button to desired duration.  Sit back and enjoy!!!!!I did receive a discount for this product without obligation. My review is my genuine, unbiased opinion. This diffuser is solid, well constructed and I like it a lot!  It merits 5-stars as it does exactly what it says it does as well as it is a well-made product.

I HATE that I cannot PUT THE BAG DOWN!Why do they make these things taste so GOOD?!?!?!?!?!!?I need a 12-step program to help me stop eating these!  the cookie is perfectly... buttery and crisp...and OMG tasty... and the overlay of Dark Chocolate that melts as it hits the tongue and blends perfectly with the cookie....wait...wait...Okay I had to go grab another one to satisfy my fix.Where was I??Simply put... if you have had these before... OMG what are you waiting for, go get another bag!  And if  you have not.... what are you waiting for????  Go grab a bag!!!  If you love dark chocolate and crisp cookies ... you are in for a treat!  If you prefer milk chocolate... why why .... ????sorry... I mean...This cookie will not be for you milk chocolate peeps. This is rich Dark Chocolate-LOVE & Heaven in one sweet blissful crunch!And seriously... never mind the 12-step program... i am going to order another bag of Milano!!!!!

Love it!Love them, both the roller as well as the hand mitt.  I have small hands, 3.5 inches wide. I have no issues at all with using these.  The nubs are a perfect size for massaging.  The plastic does not feel rough and does not cut into or scratch.  It really massages!I love using it at night time or whenever I want extra circulation in certain areas... thighs, arms, back-boobs, tummy, etc.It feels great to use and I see blood circulation immediately.  Feels wonderful while using it too!I have tried a couple other mitts in the past but they seem to leave a scratching sensation or feel too plastic-y in the hand.  In the end they have stayed in the box under my sink.  This one, i like so much I have it within easy reach and use it daily.I think this is a wonderful set!  The roller...When I first took it out I was apprehensive but boy-oh-boy just one stroke on the thigh and I was a believer!!!  I use it mostly on myself but works great when someone else is willing to give a massage.  I have treated my sister to a "spa" session and she said she loves it too!We even use the roller on tight shoulders as a way to help massage away the stress.

What can I say?!?!?  Does EXACTLY what it says it does.It was super easy to install.  I mean... plug and play mostly!!!  Follow the easy instructions and Wha-La!  It took... minutes... literally a few minutes and my iMac was surfing the Data Waves and Backing Up my stuff.I also love that it looks super cool!  Not a clunky flat black or black and blue box with wires crawling out of it or rabbit ears sticking out!  No... super slick and futuristic Art!  Can be mounted on a wall or tucked on a shelf; either way it looks fantastic!And it not only looks great but the darn thing works!!!  Immediately!  Amazing!  Look, I used to be a PC woman.  Setting up my cisco or Linksys router and running cables and plugging in an external backup and running backups and ... you guys with PC's know the routine I bet!  I switched to Apple and ... I am amazed and glamoured!!!  I am a believer... I will never go back to a PC and devises such as this are just one more reason to never look back.Thank you Apple for a wonder ingenious product.

Yum.  yum.  Yum!!!!!!!Great concept!  i LOVE that I can toss this into my purse or my travel bag.  At the hotel I was so happy to not need to use those powered bags that are never enough creamer for me!  No more calling for Room Service for more Cream and Sweetener!!!I took this container on holiday with my sister.  We used it three mornings and I had used it for 2 days prior to the trip.  We both drank 2-3 cups a day.  So.... it lasted 8-12 cups.  i like my coffee pale and sweet, my sister likes it dirty looking.  When I both this it was about $3 and I am very pleased with $3-$5 price range saving me from calling for room service and giving me the taste I love while away from home.  I am willing to pay a bit more for the convenience of the Creamer.  And convenient it is!!!  I do not think this is a solution for home use.  But if you are going out of town and want your control over your coffee... this might be what you are looking for.  It works for me and my sister!Hope that gives you an idea of what to expect.

Love these things!Large enough to hold at least a tablespoon of substance such as powder.  Holds small shards of stones or other items well, just need to be small enough to fit into the mouth of the bottle.Cork is strong.  Do not press too keeping into the bottle until you are ready to leave it alone. The cork may chip off if not careful when it is seated snuggling.  I broke off a piece of the cork being too eager to re-open the bottle.  Learn from me, take your time... be patient and gently lift and twist / wiggle.  It will come out without breaking but you have to go slow.The corks hold little eyelet hooks well.  Again, twist the hook in carefully, do not be aggressive or super fast.  Think of it as Art and take your time and you should not damage the cork.  I did not damage any corks; however, I learned my lesson from twisting too aggressively on smaller vials.Ordering another set.  I only bought one set of 24 but after filling them... I wanted MORE!!!I will try to add photos later... I was so into the crafting I did not think to take any photos!

Love it!It comes wrapped up neatly with a band around it and the two ends have protective caps that you can reuse.Well made cable.  Feels and looks of high quality materials.I like that the color stands out.  I tend to lose things...hehe...so the different color helps a lot!  The one I got is called the color Red...but it is not really red to me...more of a... well, it looks like the color in the image... an off tangerine red-orange sort of color.  It clearly is not Red.  But in other reviews I see their images are red. It does not matter to me as I like it, but it might be something you may need to consider.I used the cable with my iPhone5 and my iPad and ti works perfectly.  I did receive a discount for this cable for the purpose of review but it did not influence my opinion.

I find this pillow case a nice addition to my rest regimen.  The case is soft and pleasing to touch and the zipper is small and hidden. It looks and feels of high quality.I have not experienced any negative effects.  I have really long hair and oddly, I do not have tangling as I get with my flannel pillow case.

The bulb looks like the image on the product page and it has a nostalgic feel to it.  It fits into regular light sockets and has a nice glow, white. I put it in an overhead light for my wash room.  I do not have a way to test if it work in a dimmer.I have not experienced any flickering.

I recently got these.  The packaging is nice, a cardboard box with a white sleeve over it that has the bar code and other info.  Slide the sleeve off (or tear it to shreds) to get to the box to open it. I like the plain box as it makes for easy repurposing.Inside you find the ear phones, extra buds and hooks, a short micro cable, and a manual (with multiple languages).  It really looks just like the product pictures.  The green is attractive.As for functions:  Pairing is easy. Came with some charge as well, so it was ready to pair and use for a while.  I paired it to my iMac.... I work from home and am on my MAC most of the day.  I like how I can use these to focus on my music and have the environment noise reduced.  I still can hear what is going on around me, but with the headset it makes it less distracting.On the right ear, you will find the Function Button and the Vol +/-.  I seem to always struggle with ear headsets and their buttons.  I really think it is me...not the device.  I do find the Function button easy to press and it is quick to react.  The Volume buttons work great for changing tracks but... I cannot seem to get the actual volume to change using the buttons.  Not a big deal as I can use the device to change it.  I know it is me... me and my 40-something brain.  heheheCalls are okay and works when you need them to. My friends say they hear me well but it is not like my Plantronics Headset (and I hope not... these are not dedicated for phone calls...so I do not expect them to be as good or better than my $100'ish phone bluetooth earpiece with a boom mic).Overall, I really like this headset. It is pretty comfortable in the ears, pairs quickly, has a long battery and look pretty cool on too.  My review is my genuine opinion.  I received a headset for the purpose of reviewing.

Okay, funny thing, I received the package and after opening it up I was like, uh where are the lights?  hehehe  Silly me!  As you can see in the product images, this strand of lights are super tiny lights!  Super Duper Tiny!  I literally stood there and stared at the coiled up wire and thought, "wait...what?  These are the lights?" With conviction that LuckLED was not leading me a stray, I peeled off the plastic from the solar panel and set it outside on the porch.  There is a button that needs to be pushed to turn them ON/OFF.  They worked the first night out of the box and only after a few hours in the sun!LuckLED offers several decorative, solar powered light strands.  I like the extra uniqueness of this strand as it stays in place well (copper cord is bendable) and they are more like stars to me as they are so small.  Love that they are solar powered so I dont have to run electric cords everywhere. Received for an honest, unbiased review. I really like these lights.

Super cute and work anywhere you have some sunlight to charge up the cell.  I love that we do not need electricity.  No Daisy-Chain needed with masses of cords where you do not want them.  These lights are great for atmosphere lighting!  I took a couple of pictures but they do not do the lights justice.  They feel well made and there is little waste with packaging.Simply put, these are well constructed lights that look and feel as if they will last a long time. Received for an honest, unbiased review.

Super cool!  I was surprised when I opened the box to find that this globe is quite beautiful. Another amazing thing is how quickly and easily it charges. I have taken pictures to show you the various colors it cycles through.I keep my house on the dark side, so I figured I would have a challenge getting this lamp to recharge.  However, to my amazement, the indirect light that comes into my room is sufficient to charge the solar panel.  However, I think it will be easy enough to move the solar panel to more light if needed.As you can see in the product image, there is a solar panel mounted in a "lid".  The lid is a separate piece so you can take it off and set it in the sun.  Also of note, the light has the opening at both ends so you can flip it over to whichever side.This solar powered light is beautiful and would make a great gift.

Solar powered lights are a wonderful design.  Love that I can put them anywhere where sunlight is and not worry about needing an electrical outlet.  Love that they are indoor/outdoor hearty too.  I have not had these long enough to know how well they hold up to the cold or to rain; but they look and feel well built.My pictures do not do them justice, I apologize. The lights look like the images on this page, I was trying to show them lit.  In my test for this review, I like how we have an option to set them to blinking or to be solid.  There is also an OFF setting in the event you do not want them on at all.Super easy to set up and get working.  I left mine out in the sun one day then turned them on.  They worked immediately and perfectly.Discounts for lights provided by eTopxizy for the purpose of review.

I need as many lightning cables I can get.  I swear I just cannot keep track of the ones I have, they are like my reading glasses...  I use it and put it down and then... I can't find it!  I keep thinking someone is playing a game with me... hide my glasses, hide my cables.... I mean really?I like the 3 ft cable for the car but for other places, like at my desk and nightstand, I prefer longer cables. This 6 foot cable is a decent length that works for my needs.  Works well at the desk if the computer is on the floor.I tested it with my iPad 4th Generation and my iPhone 5.  Works great with both.I received the cable from NetSun for the purpose of testing and an unbiased review.

Love it!What is there not to love?Holds my phone most of the time but I also started to use to get my iMac keyboard. My kitty loves to walk on my desk and she secretly has been IM'ing people when I am away.  I find this a bit disloyal of her as I thought we had an understanding.  I was wrong.  Sadly, I need to now tuck my keyboard up and off the desk and I discovered this stand does the job purrrrrrfectly.

I was very surprised to receive the package with the red Ruban wallet inside.  It comes in a very nice gift-giving box and looks very classy.I love the dual color with Red as the main color and white as the accent.  The stitching is well done and feels like a well crafted phone case.  No, it is not leather. It has a magnetic front closure that is easy to use.  Simply push and pull it to get in to hold closed or to open. The wallet does not interfere with the camera, the power port or the audio port.It also comes with a pen stylus.  Pull the cap off to review a ball point pen.  It also includes a screen protector for the front and back of your phone.  I have the iPhone 5 and it fits perfectly.This has become my favorite phone case as I can shove a credit card and my driver's license in the inside pockets and go.Wallet provided by Ruban in exchange for an unbiased review.

I find these strips easy to use and to read.Make sure you collect the urine in a cup and do not dip the strip in the urine deeper than the MAX line on the strip.Easy to read...two lines = positive you are pregnant.  It is easy to see the colored line on the snow white paper strip.If your vision is in question, grab a magnifying glass.I personally think this strip is more than adequate for the job, the width of the paper does not effect the results.I was given a sample to test and give my unbiased review.

Easy enough to use:  just pee in a  cup or even on the strip (direction on package shows using a cup), Dip the strip in the urine in the cup and then wait 5 minutes, read the results.  No lines at all = Invalid, so redo.  One line = the Control Line is Positive, and Two lines = Negative.I agree with others that it seems more intuitive to see that a Iine on the strip would indicate a positive...that is what a pregnancy test does... line = positive.  So to see that this test uses no line to mean Positive means we need to learn the new interpretations.  And seriously, it is not the end of the world... just re-read the directions and the result indicator.  And when it is important to know if you might register as positive....I think you will take the time to read the instructions and double check the results.Overall, an easy to use test.Given a sample for the purpose of a review.

I find this test super easy to use and read.A really easy way to help you learn when you are ovulating.Each test strip is in its own sealed package to keep it clean and ready to use without contaminating other strips.These strips do everything they say they do, so I give them 5-Stars.I was sent a sample for the purpose of an unbiased review.

Simply love it!Holds the iPad at any angle I put it at!  A marvelously delicious design!Anti-slip support (I try to slide the iPad and NO GO!)Does not slip on the table (little anti-slip pads on base)Feels and looks durableLooks great next to my iMac (lol...as if that matters)Overall a wonderful Stand that is solid and functional, let along looks great too!  I recommend this stand to anyone who needs this sort of device.I did receive a discount for this product without obligation.  My review is my genuine, unbiased opinion.

Like it a lot!PROs:Lift the opaque measuring cup up to washTap on the handle to change Tare and unitsLarge capacityEasy way to covert volume to weightLightweightUses a common watch battery so it is easy to change out when neededCONS:Need my reading glasses to view LED screenPlastic (but it seems sturdy enough but not same as metal or glass)This was my first time using this sort of measuring cup so it took a while getting used to it.  I do not have a food scale so this is very functional and useful in my kitchen.Overall, I think this is a cool concept and it is very functional.I was given this kitchen digital scale food measuring cup at a discounted price in exchange for an honest review.

Love it:Charges with USB cableUSB Cable includedAfter charger, unplug and you have LIGHT wherever you needWorks will plugged inDimmer button on front, hold finger on button as it dimsTurn off via Dimmer by letting it dim to lowest setting then tap the button onceTurn on the toggle at back to use when unpluggedLight head pivots up and down 180 degreesPerfect for single work spaceCons:Does not shine light up to the ceiling as in the product imageOverall I really like this lamp and especially that it is portable.  Great for reading with or doing homework at the desk.I received this lamp from Minger at a discount for the purpose of testing and writing an unbiased review.

Update:  Been using the Screen protector for a couple weeks now.I notice that I am "ignoring" the bubbles as I no longer focus on them and look past them.  So, I am adapting and adjusting. With additional consideration, I think the main reason to have a protector is to help prevent scratches...as our screens are subjected to possible sliding across things...such as when I put it in my purse or if using it, or it may fall down when the kitty decides to get on my stuff and freak out...causing everything to scatter!I adjusted my review from 3 to a 4-star rating................................................................This is my first iPad screen protection Glass and I am not sure where I stand on it.  Look, I am not about to hit my iPad with a hammer to test this screen for you.  I know... selfish of me...but seriously, I would not ask you to either!  So I wonder, I have survived all these months without a protector screen and then I wonder....just what does one have to do to NEED one of these indestructible things? I mean...what the heck are you doing with your iPAD?????Still on the fence, I got this in an awesome looking display box that says the box contains the "glass film, a cleaning cloth, a card planning tool, a home key, and a professional screen wipe to welette". ... uhhh... okay, so no.... as we look at the product description here...we only get what I got .... the screen and a wet and a dry towelette.To install, it seems simple enough but I have to tell you... I have no clue how to NOT get BUBBLES under the screen.  I personally am disturbed by these thumbprint sized air masses that look like smudges...which drive me nuts!  I took the screen off and repositioned it but alas even more bubbles.  I pressed and pressed... and still bubbles.I do like the idea of a screen protector in the event I .... well... I can imagine maybe dropping my cup of coffee ...well wait...no I can't.... okay how about.... I accidentally use my ball point pen on the screen instead of the stylus... nope... I can't see that either... honestly guys... why do we need these???  Are we really not taking care of our stuff?So, I give this protector of the screen a 3 star.... it is "okay" because well... it is okay but I personally do not see much of a need for it and I really do not like the bubbles.  My nephew told me bubbles are normal...but I really, really, really do not like them on my screen.I will update my review if I grow to liking in more or find it beneficial.I was given this Screen Protector in exchange for an unbiased review.

I received this case with a discount code from JOTO in exchange for an unbiased review.Overall, a good charging case.  It feels nice and I do not find it heavy.  The kickstand is a nice accessory and it feels sturdy so I expect it to stand up to time as long as not abused.  I like that you can turn on and off the case at will.  As others have noted, there is no screen protector, so you will need to add your own if you want one.The audio jack is deep.  It takes the Apple audio cable well but does not accept some others.I recommend that with these sort of charging cases, to sync with your iTunes to remove your phone from the case.  I seem to have issues with every case I try when I plug it into my iMac.  There are no issues when just plugging into the power to change them up.

I think the product images are misleading. The board looks almost as wide as the computer monitor in the one image and the other image with the man, the board is as long as his torso and wider than his body, not to mention the HUGE board in the pictures with the steps.When we look at the description section, however, it is 6 1/4 inches wide and 16 1/2 inches tall.  Which is accurate (at least that is what was sent to me).Pros:White board worksComes with two magnetic buttons that workSides feel sturdyCons:Does not come with  a dry erase markerNo place to hold a markerCork board area is smallOnly large round key-rings fit on the key holdersBoards move when you press on themI personally think this is way too small to be effective for a busy home or people looking for a tool to aid in organization.  It might work for a young person or to leave a quick grocery item.It is too small for my needs.I received this message board from Perfect Life Ideas and was asked to write an unbiased review.

The mats are light weight and easy to manipulate.They come with removable edges on two sides to make it a smooth edge (no jagged edges unless you want them).Easy to create a large or small mat to work on, a pad for underneath a bed roll, or even to help get the old pup off the hard floor and give him/her a softer bed to lay on (I lay out a couple to do jumping jacks on too).  I tested their durability by folding the corner over on itself and it sprang back into place.  I even tried to tear with hands (average womanEasy to lay down and pick up.  I wipe them off with a damp cloth to clean.  There is a slight odor but nothing that is obnoxious or overbearing (I only smell it when I put my nose up to it).  Overall works well as a floor covering/mat.  It absorbs the shock of me doing jumping jacks as well as other exercises. I have not had these mats very long so I do not how well they hold up over time.  But I expect they will last a while if I take care of them.I received 6 pcs at a discount for the purpose of an unbiased review.

Excited to receive this stand I quickly pulled it out and checked it out.  Here is what I found:PROs:Comes packaged in a gift-giving box (clean and simple design)Stand matches the iMac brushed aluminumParts that touch your watch and phone are protected with a silicone substance (no scratching)Watch charger fits in snugly, no worry about it falling outCan remove plastic off the 4-cushions on the bottom to secure in placeCONs:No cable managementNot enough room under the phone for the lightning cable (the cable push the phone up off the standOverall, I like it but wish it had more room under the phone (1/8 inch would do it) as well as I prefer some sort of means to keep the charging cables under control.  Not a deal breaker, as it seems most stands do not offer cable management.This stand was provided at a discount for the purpose of review.

What I love about it:--Excellent packaging to make for a nice gift/present--Clear, smooth glass--Double insulated to keep tea hot and the hands not--Can watch the infusion--Super easy to drain tea, just pull out the glass infuser--No mess, sit the infuser on the lid--Holds 10 ounces--Washes up great--Infuser works in other cups as well--10 oz. cup can be used for all your beveragesCONs:--None that I am aware ofI think this is a fabulous design and simply just love it! Takes the place of a coffee cup, tea cup, and regular cold glass. Love it.This cup was provided at a discounted promotion in exchange for a genuine review.

I was looking forward to using these leg sleeves since my calves have been cramping a bit and I had also received another pair from another company and wanted to see what the difference was.  I thought I ordered large but there is no indication on the sleeves themselves nor on my receipt.At  first I thought, there is no way my huge leg is fitting into those.  As you can see in my photos they are snug on my arm. I was not even going to try to wear them but changed my mind when I sat down to write this review.  I was going to tell you that they are small and tightbut . I decided to give it a go and see how bad it would be to see if my leg would even squeeze inside.To my amazementand I mean surprise they pulled right on!  There is a bit that stays under my heal though, I think that is due to my leg not being that long.  In the stock product image they snow it fits from knee to top of ankle.  It fits me from knee to below ankle. and unfortunately even though it feels pretty good on the calf as you can see in the photo, it makes my feet all swollen up.Sadly, this sleeve does not do well for me.  it may be due to me receiving the wrong size but I cannot confirm what size I ordered (which is very strange).  They do wash well I used cold water and line dried.  The stitching is excellent too!They are strong, flexible, and made of breathable material.  I really just think I got the wrong size.Overall, I think the compression is high and I recommend you watch the sizing when you order.Received this item at a discount in exchange for an unbiased review.

Very pleased with this item.I added pictures to show how it came as well as to show some details, I hope they help.  There is an ON/OFF button on the left side.  Just push it in.  It is powered by USB so you can plug in to any USB power supply or even your Laptop course it will drain your Laptop faster.  There is a second USB port so you can charge another devise.It is lightweight and the lights look pretty cool when they running and they are very quiet! I like how we can adjust the angle/height of the stand for comfort or viewing. Changing the height is easy, there is a metal bar that you raise and put in the slots.  It looks like the product image.Overall, I really like this laptop cooling pad.  I do not have a lot of experience with laptop fans so unfortunately I cannot say if the current price point of $40 is a good value or not.Received this item at a discount in exchange for an unbiased review.

I have not had a lot of use for this product aside from adding it to my coffee and smoothies.  Depending on the amount, it makes it as chocolaty tasting as I desire and packed full of nutrients.Other reviewers have detailed the benefits of cacao and a quick WWW search give you more than what you wanted to ever know about it.All I can tell you matter-of-factly is that cacao tastes goods!Sample was provided in the exchange of me writing an unbiased review.

Cacao Nibs are sort of fun and cool.  Smells and tastes chocolatey and is said to be packed full of nutrients.I like sprinkling it on my salad or even nibbling on a couple.  I have added a few my smoothies too.I love that we can order this online as I cannot find it at my local grocery store.I have had the bag of nibs for several months and they are as fresh as when I first received the bag.I do not know if the price is good overall, I think it is as I cannot find it locally.Sample provided in exchange for an unbiased review.

Chia seeds can be added to a lot of recipes.  They are wonderful in salads with a light nutty flavor or in smoothies.The package is sealed well so the seeds arrive safe and sound.Other reviewers have done a great job talking about recipes and the benefits.  I just like them.  :-)Sample was provided in exchange for a review.

I have been looking for a way to get more MCTs and found it.  I like Bulletproof Coffee and find that consuming more MCTs (medium-chain-triglycerides) has helped.PROs:OdorlessTastelessStays liquidSubstitutes easily with other oils in recipesLong shelf lifeNo Tummy issuesCONS:NoneI have been interested in MTC oils since I read about MCTs decrease appetite, is not stored as body fat when consumed.  I like mixing with it with my coffee (bulletproof) and not only does it taste awesome but I find I have energy when I used to not as well as I tend to not feel hungry after using it.

Crayolas Color Alive Easy Animator Studio app has been a big hit at my house over the weekend. My daughter has spent over 10 hours in the last two days coloring her characters, animating them, and making the scenery in which they live. So the iPad Crayola Easy Animator app gets a 5 star review. The problem is that I will give this product on Amazon a 3 star review, not primarily because of deficiencies but because it adds only very little to the free iPad app.Let me explain why you dont really need to buy this at all to play with it. The box contains the following items>1.A coloring book with characters and backgrounds2.Retractable crayons3.a stand for your iPad4.A character to do stop motion animation in the appItems 1-3 are really pointless. You probably already own crayons. You can print the coloring sheets from the free iPad app. The stand to hold the iPad adds very little. We just hold it.So basically you are buying the character which you can mold to do stop motion animation. The app itself has a bunch of pre-made movements for the characters (either imported that you color or remade) can do. With these pre-made movements you can string together a movement series and provide voiceovers.The stop-motion mannequin is a great ideaand remember it is really all that you are getting in this package that you cant get for free. However, it is very buggy. If the lighting isnt perfect the different markings to indicate which block is which and how it is oriented do not register on the iPad appropriately. And even still with much help given to my daughter, the iPad still cannot accurately ascertain the position of the mannequin far greater than 50% of the time.In my opinion, just download the free app, print the sheets, and play. I would not recommend spending the money on this physical set.

As a juice alternative this is pretty good. There is a subtle and not overwhelming fruit flavor. However, in my opinion it is far too sweet. It is sweetened with erythritol and stevia. So the net carbs is only 1 per bottle, but to my tongue it is sickeningly sweet. I personally do not like it but everybody else in my family really does, so I'm giving it four carbs.When I dilute it 2 parts PACt and 1 part water it is better as the flavor and sweetener is muted a bit.

This is classic battleship with a Star Wars twist. Instead of hunting ships on the sea, each side is either the Rebel Alliance or the Empire hunting enemy starships. The concept is a winner in our household where my daughter absolutely loves Battleship and all the kids (and adults) are huge Star Wars fans.This should have been a homerun. How could you go wrong with Star Wars and Battleship?Well, the implementation is cheap and pretty poorly thought through:1. The starships sit above the peg holders. This makes it so that it is really hard to put the pegs in place. We are always knocking over the ships. It's pretty frustrating2. Many Battleship games include two separate boards so that each player can sit it on his/her lap. In this one there is only one game board, so you have to actually work hard not to accidentally see the other player's ships.3. The stickers to apply to the board are difficult to apply correctly. Forcing us to put these on just adds to the "cheap" feeling.This game could have been awesome. Surely Hasbro has figured out how to perfect Battleship through the years. I've played versions of Battleship that are very well done. In comparison, this version is frustrating to play and feels cheap. The only reason I'm not giving it two stars is because Star Wars is so cool. For implementation of the classic Battleship game this deserves one or two stars.

Our kids don't mind the flavor, but unfortunately these packets have 16g of carbs, 1g of protein, and 0 fat. This is not a well rounded meal for a toddler. If I mix it in whole fat Greek yogurt it rounds it off and is a convenient way to add organic veggies on the go.  I mixed one packet in a smoothie and all of my kids, 1,4, and 7 enjoyed it. I'm just not sure when I would have to use one of these packets instead of adding fresh fruit and veggies to their meals.

Chocolates of this quality are not an everyday treat. These are incredibly high quality, well-presented, and super good chocolates. You probably already know the Cailler name, and these live up to the name. Opening the box is an elegant experience, which would certainly make this a well received and special gift. Once you get through the wrapping paper to the main box, you encounter an airtight plastic seal that certainly contributes to the super fresh taste and feel of these chocolates. And once inside, the chocolates look, feel, and taste gourmet.We were able to avoid the melted-chocolate plague (even in Arizona in October) that has plagued so many others. But we also were able to get the box inside immediately upon delivery. I would not recommend you order these to a place where the box may end up sitting outside or in a mailbox. These are chocolate and will melt

You know when you wrap a towel around your waist so you can walk around without showing everybody your nakedness after a shower? Then you know how just when you pick up something with both your hands your towel inevitably comes lose leaving you standing their in all your glory in front of God and everyone? Well, with this, those days are no more.Basically this is a waist wrap. It has velcro and holds securely around your waist. I use it after taking a jacuzzi or swimming in my back yard. I can slip my shorts off and let them dry outside. Then I can continue to dry off with a towel or clean up outside without my swimsuit or walk inside without dripping all over the floor and not have to worry about holding onto my waist towel with one hand. For me, for this purpose this is perfect.This is NOT a towel. If you are expecting to use this as a towel and then wrap it around your waise you will be disappointed as it is not designed to nor does it function well as a towel.But then again, a towel never functioned super well as a waist wrap. So this lettle thing fills in the gap in between, letting a towel be a towel and not have to leave you naked when you try to use it as a waist wrap. The amazon page should not say "super absorbent" as if to communicate that this thing is a towel. It is not thick enough to be an effective towel.I honestly do not understand the bad reviews. I love this thing!

0:19 MinsMy kids and I have been having a blast with these Bag Toss boards and bean bags. They are truly well constructed. My 50-pound, 4-year-old son has stood on them a number of times without them breaking (I do not recommend this and am actively working on training him not to as I'm sure it will eventually break), so the boards and stands are not flimsy.The game itself is simple and you probably know it: Throw the bean bags into the holes (or at least try to get them on the board). It's a fun backyard game for kids or adults just for fun, but particularly at bbq's, carnivals, or family get-togethers. I've included a short video of my kids playing with it so that you can get a sense for what the game looks like and how the bags interact with the boards.I'm not sure if I got a newer version of this but my experience is very different than many of the reviews:  1. The kickstands are made out wood and seem plent thick and sturdy for long-term use.  2. The boards velcro together and have handles for easy transportation and storeage. This is very nice as even the bean bags are stored between the boards making this a self-storing, easy-to-transport set.  3. There are 4 bean bags of each color (blue & red). There are some reviews that say that the bags just slide right off the boards. This is not my experience. My kids play from pretty close but I've thrown from 30 feet. In all scenarios I end up with plenty of bags on the boards. The holes are just the right size to make it hard but not impossible to get a bag in the hole.In my opinion the price point that it is currently selling for on Amazon is appropriate. They are well designed, well made, easily transported. Highly recommended

It's a fun classic game from my childhood that I am having a blast playing with my 7-year-old daughter. It is a word game that is simple enough for an early speller to figure out (great for 3 and 4 letter words) but that can be complex enough for a Words-With-Friends, Scrabble addicted logophile like me to get into.Basically it is like a simple scrabble, build words sideways and up-and-down, but you can stack letters ontop of other letters changing the words.If you've already played Upwords, you know the game is fun. This is a good set. If you haven't played it, if you like wordgames, you will love it and should absolutely give it a try

These paper towels are very similar, if not the same quality of the Sparkle paper towels that are sold at the grocery store. The sheet size is about 3/4 of a large sheet. I actually prefer the paper towels that are perforated at 1/2 the size because there is less waste. Regardless, these are a good value and the packaging is great for a business. If you are using them in the bathroom for hand drying I'd stil recomend finding a different brand, like these viva paper towels, Viva Vantage Paper Towels, Choose-a-Size, Regular Roll, 6 Count (Pack of 4) because I think most people would only use one of the half sheets to dry their hands = less waste and less trash can emptying. If these are for clean-up the packaging may proove to be convenient. I really appreciate that each paper towel is wrapped seperately to keep them clean. Brawny also offers paper towels like this, Brawny Individually Wrapped Regular Paper Towels Rolls, White, 30 Count All in all these are fine quality, but I'd recomend price comapring with the other two options on amazon.

Super fun game. Kids can use this just to play catch by bouncing the ball to themselves or others. But adults can have an absolute blast with this especially on the beach with sand, playing a sort of volleyball/catch to one another. It's flexible in use and unique.When not on vacation, it can be stored pretty compactly, but even used inside or on the grass. Our kids (4 & 7) can play with it without assistance indoors without making a mess, but it is best outside where you can run, jump, and dive for balls.Setup was a bit difficult, sort of like setting up a trampoline, which involves getting the net attached to all the bars and then stretching it tight. This limits the "storability" in that it can take 5-10 minutes to set up each time you'd want to play it after taking it apart to store.The worst part however, is that the plastic is pretty flimsy. In less than 2 weeks, one of the plastic pieces cracked and the set became totally unusable. It just went to the dump this morning. It's sad because with a little higher quality (better plastic or metal) this would be a very fun set. I don't suspect that anybody will get much more than a few months of use out of this. It appears designed in such a way that breaking is inevitable

For sweeping our pool this pole works great. It is solid and strong and much less prone to bowing and bending than the cheap aluminum one that we were given by our pool builder. It is strongest when short and at 8-10' reaches most places in our pool. But even out to 16' I'm not worried about it breaking.I appreciate how easy the locking and unlocking mechanism is to use, and once put in place it holds tightly.After a few months of use, I highly recommend this pole if you are looking for a pool brush or net pole

In the medical field I use gloves everyday, but medical gloves aren't tough enough for some housework projects you'd rather have gloves for. These gloves legitimately are heavy duty without feeling super thick like your mom's thick blue rubber gloves. For my wife, they work well for cleaning with chemicals she'd rather not have on her hands. When wet they don't get slippery due to the textured fingers.But beware they are real latex. I didn't see that when I ordered them. I have a latex sensitivity and, sure enough, after using, my skin broke out. I (Jacob with the extra large hands) was planning on using these but can't due to the allergy. My wife's hands swim in them. I am actually using them without breaking out by using a Nitrile glove (large) over my hand and then putting these over the top of them.

I have no idea why so many reviewers are saying that these don't change colors. These have been great for us. We have seen anywhere from light (small) to deep (large) ketosis measured with these in a way that corresponds well to the way we've eaten, exercised, and are feeling. I've been eating and living a ketogenic lifestyle for about 2 years and know ketone test strips well. These are as good as any I've tried.Since so many of the reviews say no color change was seen, I've attached a photo demonstrating the color change.

This game is basically a remake, in a Pinkie Pie pony version, of crocodile dentist. Basically,Taking turns each player puts balloons into the cake. If Pinkie Pie pops out when you put your balloon in, you win. Our kids enjoy the unnerving feeling of both crocodile dentist and this game. It's really cute, but there is no strategy involved. I appreciate that it's a "board game" that they can play without adult help. Each round takes about a minutes I have them do 15 rounds and whomever gets the most wins is the ultimate winner.

I was pleasantly surprised by this little set, except for the super bright orange color. The picture doesn't to it justice this is like fluorescent poster board orange.  The quality of the fabric reminds me of some of my expensive Under Armour shirts. Our 4-year old loves these sets because he can easily find a matching outfit and put it on without any help. The reasons this set gets 3 vs 5 stars is the quality of the sewing. It's not a big deal, but at the elastic waistband some parts of the fabric are gathered into the stitching. Most people wouldn't notice or care and for play clothes I don't really care either, but wanted to comment on it in case someone does. And I knocked a star off for color. I just can't believe how incredibly bright it is.

Unfortunately, this conditioner was thick and even though I rinsed it multiple times it weighed my hair down. Oddly, after drying my hair felt dry and like it needed a conditioning treatment. But the real kicker was the fragrance. It's very strong and lingers.
This shampoo won't replace the professional stuff I use on my color treated hair, but my husband and kids love it. Pleasing scent, cleans without leaving residue, and a great price.

Use this as directed and you will be pleased. I have fine short hair and the only time it has volume is the day I leave the salon. This stuff is a game changer. I'm not going to lie, it freaked me out. It's like super thick lotion. The directions tell you to rub it between your hand prior to applying. It became super sticky. Against my better judgement, I rubbed it in. Now my hair was sticky! What am I doing? I figured I had nothing to lose, so I blow dried my hair with a round brush. I couldn't believe it! Volume and soft hair. For the price you can't beat it.

I really wanted this too be good because I love white tips and wanted to do them myself. It went on sorta like white-out and didn't cover well at all. When you are doing tips and need 4 coats. Not worth it.

For the price this conditioner does a great job. It isn't heavy, but moisturizes my fine, Arizona-dried hair well. My hair feels soft, not weighed down and I love the scent. I am generally super annoyed by strong scents and this one is fine. For the price this is a great buy.

Our son loves remote controls cars and was super excited to open this one. Unfortunately, we didn't have al the required batteries #designfail. 2 The remote control requires AAA batteries (not included) and the car requires 4 AA batteries. We were out of AAA batteries. I just wish they included at least a cheap set of batteries. The car runs well and out 7 and 4 year old enjoy playing with it indoors on our wood floor. It can't go over rugs as it is very low to the ground and I could forsee it being an issue even on a sidewalk, as a small piece of debries my stop it. Regardess, its fun to look at and fun to play with.

It really works! When I first saw this I thought it was a practical joke or the perfect white elephant gift, it is,  but it's more than that. It really does work. I don't know that a review for this product needs to say much more than that, but I guess I can add that it smells  a bit like natural mosquito repellant or essential oils. I was concernt that it may leave a weird film on the inside of our bowl, but it hasn't. I'm planning on putting one of these in all 3 of our toilet rooms.

TriCalm wasn't very calming. My son has dry skin and frecuently some kind of dermatitis or another. He is used to using lotions to soothe and heal. Unfortunately, Tricalm felt like it was burning his skin. It was effective at helping it heal, but there are other options that don't sting. In case you still wan to try it and want to know Tricalm has a neutral odor and goes on light

Our daughter has hair that is the length of her back, and it gets tangled quite easily. We have tried tons of detanglers, and most of them work to varying degrees. We are very happy with Milk & Co Natural Detangler because1. It works2. It's natural3. It's scent is pleasant.First off, and most importantly, this works. It makes detangling hair quite a bit easier; in our opinion it is among the best detanglers we have used.Among the effective detangler's we have tried, this is the most effective "natural" one we have tried. We don't like sacrificing effectiveness for "natural," but when you can combine natural and effective, we will take it: The best of both worlds.I know many other reviewers have been put off by the scent. In our family, we thought the scent was mild and pleasant, reminding us of essential oils.

Works well as a boat cleaner on fiberglass to get muck, grime, and grease off. It is nice and thick, and does a good job of staying in place doing its job through rinsings with water. The smell is a bit harsh, but not overwhelming. Used outdoors, it's not bad at all, however, I personally don't think I'd like to use it in a super confined space.It's also good to know that it does claim to offer some UV protection. For boats and other outdoor equipment, this is nice to know that they will be protected against the sun's rays. However, based on only a month's use, I am unable in a review to vouch for its effectiveness.

The main things I'd want to know before order a potholder and oven mitt is, 1. Does it keep me from getting burned, 2. does it fit well, and 3. does it look good, in that order. Check, check, and check.Not surprisingly these function as well as any basic entry-level kitchen oven mitt and potholder. They aren't magical, but am able to reach into a 400-degree oven and grab a tray. By the time I put it down on the stove across the room I can feel that there is something hot in my hand, but by no means am I burnt or even uncomfortable.The fit can fit both me (large hand) and my wife with her relatively small hands. It goes on and off easilyThe look is nothing spectacular but attractive. I like it

For labeling suitcases, bags, boxes, and really anything else in a durable, easy-to-read and ultimately cheaply disposable manner, these labels are great. I was worreid about the paper ripping off for items handled pretty roughly. This doesn't happen. The supports are super strong. And compared to the other Avery labels that I tried, the wire on these is incredibly strong.They work best when you use a super dark thick Sharpie to write on.Also for gifts or party favors these make a very "crafty" or "arsy" base to hand-draw labels.The wire doesn't give it the artsy look that the strung version of this gives, but rather it has a more utilitarian look. If you are looking for artsy labels, get the "Strung" version. If you are looking for moving, garage sale, shipping labels then these are tougher and probably better.I was surprised at just how many uses these have...and with 1000 in a package, you'll have plenty to experiment on.

For labeling suitcases, bags, boxes, and really anything else in a durable, easy-to-read and ultimately cheaply disposable manner, these labels are great. I was worreid about the paper ripping off for items handled pretty roughly. This doesn't happen. The supports are super strong.Also for gifts or party favors these make a very "crafty" or "arsy" base to hand-draw labels. It's an old-fashioned, rustic label that actually comes across not looking cheap, but rather quite stylish.I was surprised at just how many uses these have...and with 1000 in a package, you'll have plent to experiment on

Each night my nightstand is clutter with my iPhone and apple watch and each' charger. I have wanted something to help decrease the clutter and organize the devices each night. Based on reviews I bought this stand.Now I have one more piece of clutter. It truly doesn't help organize and the wires feel like they go on cumbersomely. The iPhone stand in particular is just really poorly conceived. The cord won't stay in and when the iPhone is on the stand it always wants to knock the stand over. Each morning as I take one or the other device off the stand, it tips over. Many times it seems to spontaneously fall over during the night.It does look good when you get the devices on just right, but it is not worth it. I'm thinking I'll be throwing this away.

If you have atrial fibrillation (or really any other regular cardiac arrhythmia) you should probably own this monitor. Instead of just looking at your heart rate, this is a full ECG monitor to guide your doctor's treatment of your atrial fibrillation.I specialize in anesthesia for electrophysiology focusing on the treatment of atrial fibrillation. When patients have an AliveCor and make regular use of it, it helps us so much to know what we are trying to fix. Any time a patient has the symptoms they feel, they can take an EKG on their own and we can see if the source of the problem is the heart rhythm or something else. This guards patients from getting unneccessary ablations and medications, and it can also guide our clinical decision making on what treatments to provide.I've had several family members and friends with arrhythmias (irregular rhythm). I have recommend the AliveCor to every one of them. And I have one of my own just in case I ever have any questions about my own heart rhythm.This device is so easy to use. It pairs up to your cellphone (Android or iPhone) and can take as many EKG's as you want, and you have the ability to save them or email them to your doctor. You can also have AliveCor send the EKG to a specialist to read for you. Revolutionary Device

These are light-weight Push Up Bars. I personally prefer the rotating perfect push-up-style push-up assisters. However, for this I was just looking for bars that would let me do push-ups without touching the floor. These do that.They are adequately strong to support my 220 pound frame without difficulty. The padding on the handle is comfortable. The height is just right to allow a very full range pushup (much better than hands of floor).These are light enough that I can drop them in a backpack for easy and light portability.

Exactly what is advertised. There are 2 25-ft coax cables with adapters at each end. They worked well, screwed on easily and were sufficiently shielded to yield an undistorted image.What else would you want in a coax cable?

I got this as a gift for my 10 year old nephew. He wanted headphones that looked cool and sounded good. I don't think I could have found a better solution than this. There is certainly a difference between these and very high end $300+ phones. But the sound is honestly comparable to some Beats Audio headphones that cost 10-times as much.These sony's look good, feel comfortable, and the price cannot be beat.

For abdominal training, I don't know of a more complete workout than an Ab Roller. I own multiple. This one is a good value, quite inexpensive. However, I find the handles to be a little uncomfortable compared to others I have used (CSX Ab Roller Wheel with Extra Thick Knee Pad Mat and Comfort Foam Handles is more comfortable for example). Yet, for the price I highly recommend it.It works just as well as more expensive simple Ab Rollers. In my opinion the Ab Rollers with the Assitance springs are just a waste of money. You get just as good of a workout with this ten dollar one. So save you money and get this one, or spend a bit more and get one with a bit more comfortable handles. But don't worry about wasting your money on one of the high-end units

I've put these all over my home for whole-house audio and perfect wifi throughout. When I built my new home I ran cat5 cable to most rooms. The airport express can easily hook into those CAT5 cables (all running from a switch at the Network Box) to extend the wireless network. Furthemore, each of these rooms can then have it's own Airplay speaker. So now, I have 12 different airplay speakers throughout my house, allowing full house audio from my MacBook (or just play the audio to whichever room I want).The Airport Express sets up in less than 60 seconds using an iPhone or iPad (just look for it on the wifi setting screen) and autoconfigures to match the main base station. Setup could not be easier. And once it is setup it extends the wifi network so that the wifi connection is just as fast in that room as it would be if you were standing next the base station. Basically I have full power wifi throughout my home. If you don't have a CAT5 (ethernet) connection in the room you want to put this in, it can just as easily function as a wifi extender. This isn't quite as fast, but works quite well as long as it can get a good signal from the basestation unit. Apple Customer Support will walk you through setup for free

I had some Flak Jacket's that were about 5 years old. They were obviously aging and finally the earsock simply fell apart. I'm glad I found this replacement rubber set. Even though these aren't exactly the same color as I previously had, it is a perfect fit and by replacing all the rubber pieces together, it is a perfect match. Now my 5-year-old sunglasses look brand new.They are a bit difficult to put on, but ultimately only took about 5 minutes to get the earsocks fully onto the earpieces.Couldn't recommend any higher.

This three pack including 9 gels total is the best value I'm aware of for purchasing replacement gels. It is possible, as other reviews have indicated to prolong the life of your gels with alcohol-based cleansers. Nevertheless, you will eventually need to replace the gels for maximal results (recommended is 20 sessions).These replacement gel pads work well. I haven't experienced the problems that the other reviewers speak of with the gels not adhering to the belt appropriately. I purchased direclty from Amazon.com. Make sure you are getting genuine Slendertone and in my experience you'll be alright.The threepack at the time of writing this review makes each set cost just over $6. This is about half the price of the currently listed one-pack. I use the Abs Toner multiple times a day while I am working at my desk, so it is good to be able to have low-cost high-quality replacement gels.

The Slendtone alone will not make you ripped, give you a six-pack, or make you skinny. However, as I have looked at the research it seems pretty conclusive that at the very least, regular use of the Slendertone will give you more abdominal muscle strength, endurance, and tone. I base this conclusion on my initial results from using it and published research. If you want to read for yourself, search for at least the following 3 articles which clearly demonstrate that this is a legitimate method to strength and tone abs:  -"The effects of neuromuscular electrical stimulation on abdominal strength and endurance and core strength" (Olsonl) -"The Effects of Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation Training on Abdominal Strength, Endurance, and Selected Anthropometric Measures" (Porcari et al) -"Electrically elicited minimal visible tetanic contraction and its effect on abdominal muscles strength and endurance" (Alon and Taylor).I use the Slendertone each night. It is not painful to wear, but when used appropriately, I know it is working. I intentionally set the output pretty close to my maximal tolerated, and at times I have to stop what I'm doing as my abs contract vigorously. I end each session aware that I "worked out".  I have had a few hard cramps especially initially or if I do a double session. With each stimulation, it is easy to see the abs tighten. In short, this actually works my muscles out. I have found that I can tolerate and benefit from two sessions each day, one with the belt placed lower on the abdomen and another with the belt placed higher.Unlike the studies cited, I do other abdominal exercises, yet I have noticed that since started the Slendertone my abs do feel more toned during the day (my wife agrees) and I have more endurance for ab exercises. That said, just as no single abdominal exercise will give you six-pack abs, this could be one part of an overall diet and training regimen to help increase ab strength, endurance, and tone.The pads can be placed on the belt to accomodate a variety of waist sizes. My wife and I share, so for my the pads are probably a bit more medial than is optimal (losing some of the lateral stimulation) and for my wife they are just a bit too lateral. But we can both feel contractions throughout. The only downside to sharing is that if you want to progress through the recommended regimen, you will have to change the settings manually. But this is not a problem, and even if you don't adjust settings between people, it will only mean that you increase strength a bit more quickly than you otherwise would.The belt has 99 different strength settings. I have found that as time has passed and I got more used to the contraction sensation and less prone to cramping, I can tolerate a higher level of stimulation corresponding to both more discomfort and a harder contraction. The buttons are very easy to learn and control. The manual is well written and easy to follow.The stimulation pads need to be replaced about every 20 sessions or so. The best deal I have found is buy the three pack of pads on Amazon: Slendertone Replacement Gel Pads for All Slendertone Abdominal Belts, 3 Sets (9 Gel Pads). Each set at the time of writing this review is about six bucks, which makes each session about $0.30 if gel pads are changed at recommended frequency.Overall, I am very very happy with my Slendertone and plan on using it for as long as it works. This is a proven way to increase abdominal strength, tone, and endurance. I enjoy and have benefitted from using it. Thus, I recommend it.  If I get any more insight as the months go by I will update the review.

This is a fun puzzle that my kids have already put together twice in the last two days. The colors are brights and the colors of each dinosaurs different enough so that my kids (4 & 7) could piece it together with help without too much frustration. Then, in the dark you get a really bright glow-in-the-dark image of the dinosaur bones. Tha's a nice feature that makes this puzzle extra fun, making them want to "do it again!"On the backside is a black and white design that can be colored. We haven't done it yet, but this will add some additional fun too, making a custom-colored puzzle.

I haven't ever tried any Proactive products until now. I'm in my mid 30's an my face recently appeared to be going back through adolescence. I've used this cream for about a week and there is definitely a notable difference. Not only does it work in the blemish department, My skin feels hydrated without feeling greasy. The cream goes on light and has a light fruity/floral scent. I am usually very sensitive to scents and this one is refreshing and not lingering. I highly recommend this product.

The Man in the High Castle has a solid script, good acting, great directing and beautiful design and cinematography. It's hard to watch sometimes because of the brutality, but it's true to the scenario, in which the Axis powers won World War 2.  It's also true to the spirit of Philip Dick's writings.

I bought this because it was supposedely fragrance-free... I don't like products with added perfumes... but whatever is in this product, it needs something to cover up the truly weird smell... no, stink.  For a supposedly "natural" product, it had the weirdest smell I've ever experienced... like a cross between rotten eggs and something that had been dead for a long time that a dog might have rolled in.  I have honestly never smelled anything like it in my life.  Unbelievable. Is this how it's supposed to smell, or did I get a bad batch? Whatever, I just used it today for the first time and won't be trying it again.

On the plus side:1) It works fine2) It does a good job grinding the beans3) It's easy to use4) It's powered by muscles, not electricity.Some folks might prefer an electrical appliance, but I kinda like the feeling of involvement when I take a minute or two to grind my own coffee.

To be honest, I can't tell the difference between the different brands of MCT oil. They all seem fine to me.  I prefer NOW's product because it comes in a glass bottle.  Ergo: no plastic contamination, no plastic taste.  IMHO all food oils should be sold in glass.  So -- my thanks to NOW for ignoring the temptation many oil sellers have succumbed to, to save a few pennies by switching to inferior plastic containers.

WHAT I LIKE:It works well, and quickly.  I took some a half hour ago. My sinuses are much clearer now. It really does seem very pure, and fast-acting.WHAT I DON'T:The price, and the labeling, which is a little misleading. Each capsule is 125,000 spu.  (One "serving" is two capsules.)  So it's almost than three times the price of Doctor's Best, which costs about $25 on Amazon for ninety 120,000 spu capsules.  I don't resent the company for charging what they feel it's worth (or what the market will bear); people are free to buy less expensive products.  I do resent their hiding this information in the small print; my eyes are good, but I found it so tiny as to be barely readable.

I've had my AeroPress for a couple of weeks. Here are my impressions off the top:WHAT I LIKE:1) The tactile element. I start out by grinding the beans with a hand grinder, then press them through the AeroPress, using muscle power to control the speed at which the water is pressed through. The design makes me feel involved in the process.... like the difference between opening a can of soup and heating it up in a saucepan, and making it fresh from your own ingredients. The main appeal of the product to me is actually that it's fun to use.2) The price. Most people would find it affordable.3) The filters. Coffee filters can be one of your main expenses if you make your own coffee every day. AeroPress filters are about a penny apiece, and if you rinse them out (as the manufacturer recommends), you can reuse them a dozen or more times. I use mine five or six times before swapping them out.WHAT I DON'T:1) I grew up drinking piping hot coffee that was almost too hot to drink (yup, I drank coffee as a kid), and still like having it that way once in a while; you won't get that with an AeroPress.
