I was able to identify the source of the leak, do a quick temporary repair, and arrange for a plumber to come on Monday to do a permanent repair.  The leak was spraying out water at a pretty good rate.  If it hadn't been for Wally, we would have come home from our weekend vacation to find a flooded basement.  Traditional water sensors (the kind that sound an alarm when they get wet) wouldn't have done any good, since there wouldn't have been anyone home to hear the alarm.  Thanks, SNUPI/Wally, I owe you guys.][SPECIAL NOTE FOR ANYONE HAVING CONNECTION ISSUES:  Back when my Wally hub was plugged into a surge strip and I was having troubles with connectivity, I fiddled around until I could make connections under the worst of circumstances, and I thought it might be helpful to share my workaround.  For example, before I figured out the surge suppressor issue, I was having trouble getting signals from two of the sensors in my basement, relatively far from any house wires (there are only two outlets in the basement).  So I took a heavy gauge 25' extension cord and ran it from a wall outlet straight across the basement floor.  Then I put the Wally sensors along the extension cord.  It wasn't a first-best solution, but the sensors reliably and continuously sent data even when the Wally hub was being blocked by the surge suppressor.  Nothing was plugged into the extension cord, so I just fastened the open end up high on the opposite basement wall, so there wouldn't be a problem if there was a water leak in the basement.  If you're having troubles with dead zones, and if you've already made sure your Wally Hub isn't plugged into a surge strip, then this might be a workaround for you.]Bottom Line:  Unobtrusive sensors (beautiful design).  Extreme battery life.  Accurate readings.  Excellent alerts.  Great reporting interface.  Excellent smartphone app.  This is what a home sensor system should look like and work like.

I saw a demo of this product at Apple's Worldwide Developers Conference.  That's how cool this product is -- Apple gave them airtime at their big conference to show off the product.  The technology is very impressive and showcases the convergence of real and virtual gaming.  The cars are much more than updated slot cars in two ways.  First, the cars are really Software Defined Race Cars, meaning the attributes of the cars are defined by software, not built-in and fixed.  As you race the cars, you can level up and add capabilities, just like in a computer games.  Second, the cars can be autonomously controlled by their own software, meaning that some of the cars on the track are competing on their own, rather than being driven by other players.  Insanely cool.The downside of the product is that once you get past the initial feeling of "Wow, this is amazing technology," the fun of the racing game wears off.  The racing game should get more engaging as you level up the cars, but the overall range of functionality is pretty limited compared to completely virtual computer games, and the novelty of a virtual/real hybrid isn't strong enough to keep it really interesting.  Also, the game takes up floor space and requires that all players have iPhones/iPads to play.  My college-age son spends many hours gaming online, but this race-car set pretty much stayed in the box this summer after the initial novelty wore off.Bottom line:  This game showcases some amazingly cool technology, and virtual/real hybrid games will probably become increasingly popular, but this early example offers limited entertainment for gaming/toy dollar in its initial form and at its current price.

These bags are AWESOME for moving and for car vacations.  Basically the bag is just a lightweight tarp fabric sewn into the form of a bag with two sets of handles (one long, one short).  We recently used this set of five bags for a family vacation that involved only driving, no flying.  Instead of messing with luggage or boxes, each person got one blue bag.  The bags are much roomier than our usual luggage and duffel bags -- each one holds about twice as much as a standard laundry basket, and easily held a week's worth of clothes, biking gear, hiking gear, etc. for each person.I've also been using them to help the kids move into new apartments.  They're much better than boxes for two reasons.  First, they're flexible and can be filled beyond the top.  Second, the handles make moving so much easier.  When hauling stuff up five flights of steps, I find it much easier to carry bags at my sides than to carry a box up at chest height -- the box is harder to grab and it blocks my view of the steps.  Also, I can carry two bags at once.  Last, but not least, they fold down and take up almost no space when not in use, so I can leave a set with the kids for future moves (unlike boxes, which are a pain to store, even when torn down).The handle design is great.  There are actually two sets of handles on each bag.  One set is short, for carrying the bag in your hands.  The other longer set can be used like a shoulder strap, for carrying the bag up high.The material is plenty durable for everyday use.  I wouldn't drag it over gravel (it wouldn't survive the abrasion), but it has no problem carrying heavy loads (excellent strength).  I expect them to last for years, but not forever.  Given how cheap they are, I plan to buy another set for when these wear out -- I expect two sets to last until well after I'm too old to lift them any more.These bags are a tote design, with an open top.  There's a different model that has six sides and zips closed, but it's five times more expensive.  The fabric is sturdy enough to stand up when packed, but the sides will flop over when it's empty.Never thought I'd get excited about super-sized totes sewn out of tarp fabric, but these things are incredibly handy.

These Canari liners are made from a good durable fabric, the sizing is good (and the fabric stretches), and have good grippers at the bottoms of the legs.  The gel liner is not as thick as I'd like, but it absorbs impact pretty well for its thickness.  The seams where the liner is sewed to the shorts are the weak link in this liner.  The seams are rough and they chafe.  For me, that's not a huge negative, since I usually wear a pair of ExOfficio boxer briefs under the liner; but worn against skin those seams could create real problems.  These liner shorts are quite cheap compared to alternatives.  Given the price, four stars (but only three stars if these will be your "base layer").

One of the great joys of living in the e-book age is easy access to the writing of a wide variety of new authors.  Based on the number of great reviews for this author, I decided to give her novel a try.  I read most of the book while sitting on our porch in Maine, and thoroughly enjoyed it.  The writing is both engaging and technically proficient (unlike many non-edited works), the characters are well developed (I had no trouble keeping them straight, since each has a distinct and memorable personality), and the plot development hits the sweet spot of being complex and intriguing without being convoluted.  The plot, with its layers and deceptions, reminds me in some ways of Asimov's classic Foundation series, or, more recently, some of Peter Hamilton's epics.  The novel creates a rich, engaging, intriguing world.At one point in the story, a character exclaims "This isn't a romance novel."  It's an amusing self-referential nod from the author, since the novel is definitely (in addition to being a well crafted sci fi story) a romance novel.  The romance novel aspect of this book was dialed up a bit too high for my taste, and was the one area where the writer's style was too repetitious and formulaic (I noted 42 passages about Caleb's eyes, before I stopped counting, and at least an equal number of references to his evil grin and quirky smile).  Almost cost a star, but that's my preference.This author has the vision to create a rich story and the technical writing skill to tell it.  This was one of my favorite novels of the summer -- along with works from Hugh Howey (Silo, Sand), Lee Doty (Out of the Black), and David Weber (Dahak) -- and I'm eagerly awaiting the sequel (yes, as you can guess from the fact that this novel has "Book One" in the title, the story is really just ramping up by the last page).

I needed a rear rack for a week-long bicycle tour on fire roads and carriage trails in New England.  This rack was a fraction of the cost of other models, and I liked the simplicity of a rack that simply clamped around the seat post, since I wasn't sure which other racks would fit on my ten year old mountain bike.  The only thing that gave me pause was the number of reviewers who complained about the rack not fitting snugly on the seat and as a result sliding around.  On my mountain bike, I used two of the plastic sleeves and tightened the clamp using my regular bike Allen wrench tool, which has about a 4" handle and provides some leverage.  The rack clamped easily and tightly around the seat post and doesn't move at all, either up and down or side to side.  I've done some rides on bumpier hiking trails with roots and rocks, and the rack hasn't budged from where I clamped it.  So, although you'll still need to take into consideration the experience of others, on my bike this rack was easy to install, is solid as a rock, and has provided a very cheap solution to carrying an extra gear bag in the rear.  Very happy with the Schwinn rear rack.

After reading the wide variety of reviews on this product (from one to five stars), I wasn't sure what to make of it.  But it was fairly cheap, and I needed a solution for carrying my iPhone 5s on my Raleigh mountain bike, so I gave it a try.  It works great.  The iPhone 5s fits perfectly in the case -- snug, so it doesn't move around, but very easy to insert and remove.  The top plastic layer works with the iPhone's capacitive touch screen, so you can use the phone right through the plastic, without removing it from the case.  The velcro straps fit perfectly around the frame of my ten-year old Raleigh mountain bike and the pack stayed firmly in place through a 25 mile trail ride -- no wiggle or shifting at all.I'd been looking for something like this that would protect my iPhone while riding.  Popping it in the handlebar pack would subject it to too much pounding on aggressive rides, and putting it in my jersey pocket would subject it to too much sweat.  Also, I like to be able to check the phone easily when it chimes, rather than having to dig it out.  This pack works perfectly on all counts.  The phone sits in a suspension cradle with the case sides providing lots of shock absorption, and the phone is completely visible and usable right in the case.  As a bonus, I can stuff my ID and a couple of energy bars inside the case.Based on my own experience, this is a five-star product, hands down.  I think the variation in reviews probably has to do with the fact that people's phones and bikes vary a lot.  There are multiple sizes of this product available on Amazon, and I had to search to find the one that would exactly fit my 4.2" iPhone 5s (the product titles use generic terms like "large" and "larger", so you have to read the detailed descriptions to find the right size for your phone).  Also, if your bike has vary narrow tubes you might have to trim the velcro, and if you have one of the newer and more expensive bikes with very large, more flattened tubes, you might have to buy a few strips of velcro to use as "extenders" to fit around your frame.Bottom line:  If you pick the right size, and if your bike has a fairly standard frame, this is a great, super convenient product for protecting your phone and making it readily accessible during rides.  Wish I'd found it years ago.  It will be a permanent fixture on my mountain bike.

I originally bought a Surco spare tire bike rack, since it was a bit cheaper and got great reviews.  Unfortunately, the Surco won't fit on a 2006 or later RAV4, since Toyota added a small, semi-cylindrical tire support bracket on the spare tire mount.  I subsequently found that only a couple of spare tire racks have been re-engineered to work on vehicles that have a bracket on the spare tire mount.  Between the two leading contenders, from Thule and Yakima, I decided to go with the single-post Yakima.  I installed the rack yesterday.  Installation was very simple -- took about half an hour, and I could do it again (now that I'm familiar with the process) in about ten minutes.  The only tools you'll need are your tire iron to remove the spare and a hex key (included by Yakima) for optional adjustments.The rack comes with three different posts -- the piece that fits horizontally into the mounting bracket, and onto which the vertical bar mounts.  For my RAV4, I used the short post.  For bigger tires, there are medium and long posts.The Yakima rack is very sturdy, and the three-point tie-down system really holds the bikes securely.  My mountain bike didn't shift or sway at all on the drive to the trails.  It has a handy integrated lock loop, and Yakima includes a 5' locking cable to thread through your bikes (or you use your own).  The knob that screws the bike rack onto the mounting bracket also has a lock that prevents removal of the rack itself.  The rack lock and the cable lock use the same key, which is very convenient, and Yakima includes two keys.Bottom line:  Great design.  Sturdy construction.  Easy to use.  Looks good.  And, most importantly, is engineered to work with vehicles like my RAV4 that have support brackets on the spare tire mount.

I turned to this novel after finishing (and thoroughly enjoying) Howey's Silo saga.  This novel is quite different from the Silo series, showing Howey's versatility as an author.  It's a tighter, shorter, less sprawling story.  For those old enough to remember Golden Age sci fi, this novel felt like a modern channeling of Heinlein, Silverberg, etc.Early in the story, I feared it would be "Lord of the Flies" set on an unnamed planet.  Instead, a better comparison would be Heinlein's "Tunnel in the Sky."  The difference is that the underlying theme is one of hope, not despair, and the characters are teens who are becoming adults, rather than adolescents who are pretending to be.As usual, Howey's writing style is a joy.  With many Kindle sci-fi books (especially self published works), I read for the plot and little else.  In Howey's books, including this one, I find myself re-reading and highlighting passages just to enjoy the play of the words.  There's art in this man's writing.This is a memorable book.  More than a beach book, it will stick with you.

We've been using these All Free and Clear pods for a couple of months now. They're super convenient. You just throw one of the packs in the washer. No measuring, no drips, and no standing the bottle upside down to drain out the last of the liquid. I thought pods were a goofy invention to solve a trivially minor inconvenience, but I have to confess that they've turned out to be a wonderful little bit of luxurious convenience when doing laundry. They've also been great for our kid at college. Instead of carrying a full jug of detergent to the laundry room in the dorm basement, he just carries one or two tiny pods. Again, super convenient.I bought this 84 load package because it's more convenient on the shelf than the smaller packages, which are just plastic bags. When the tub is empty, I'll probably refill it with whatever size package is cheapest.We like the Free and Clear detergent, either in pod form or in a bottle. It doesn't have any dyes or perfumes. Gets the clothes really clean without leaving a fragrance. Good for allergy sufferers, or those who just don't like fragrant clothes.The container arrived well packaged and in good shape.

Having read the complete Wool series over the past year, I had to try Sand.  The book does not disappoint.  Author Hugh Howey has an amazing ability to imagine and bring to life future worlds that occupy the uncanny valley.  Worlds that seem so familiar because the mundane machinery of life goes on, but that are disturbingly different because some aspect of the characters' world is fundamentally at odds with what we know on our Mother Earth.  In Sand, as in Wool, a sense of mystery and intrigue pervades the story, as we try to figure out how the world got this way.  But the real focus is on the people and how they live -- what the human condition looks like in this world on the other side of the looking glass.  This is what sets Sand apart from many typical dystopian novels.  The world of Sand may be bleak, but it's the world the people live in and have always known.  They actually live their lives, rather than simply being grist for the dystopian mill.  Last, but not least, Howey is a good writer.  I routinely find myself highlighting passages because they were so nicely crafted and styled ... not just words to advance the plot.As stated in the review title, this was a five-star book for me, even with what I saw as flaws.  I'm guessing the author will say these were choices, not flaws, but I wish that he had:- Eventually provided at least some explanation of how the world got to be the way it is in Sand.  Maybe Howey plans a prequel, like the Shift series before Wool.- Expanded more on the characters of Violet and Rob, both of whom were hinted to have extraordinary potential.  In the full omnibus, we receive little more than glimpses into these characters.  Maybe Howey is saving them for the sequel (again following the Wool model).I'm eager to know more about this world of Sand and how the characters fare.  I really, really hope that there will be another book or two to extend the story.

This soap is an excellent value, and better than most of your grocery brands.  I found the soap itself to be a bit drying for every day use.  A package of 4, shipped for free with Prime, for a total of $9 does make a great value, however, and I use these soaps for camping, etc.  Good set of ingredients, and 4 bars will last for quite a while.

Creepy is the best and most appropriate word to describe this movie.  I give it 4 stars not because it is an amazing movie, but because it is an amazing movie if you are sitting with the right person.  My movie date gets very frightened and that makes this a blast!  I have to admit a couple scenes made me jump as well.  It is hard to get good movies in this genre, and so much is rehashed and repetitive.  Not that different in this movie, but it is executed well, and it works.Setting is excellent, a farm in Illinois, where I wouldn't dare set foot, and the two young actors as the twins do an admirable job.Cast is decent:: James Ransone, Shannyn Sossamon, Robert Sloan, Dartanian Sloan and Lea Coco - but you will notice the missing star power of an Ethan Hawke.Director: Ciaran FoyWorth seeing, make sure to see it late at night.  It is quite spooky, and they have done an excellent job creating a 'multi-sensorial' experience.

I struggled with whether to give this a 4 or 5 star rating (tough problems, I know!). I finally ended up with a 5, because I really like this device. I love that it has a light, so it works as a nice little night light, with two settings. It was super easy to use, and I ran it through my computer with the accompanying USB cable. Note, it does not come with an AC adapter. It functioned like it was supposed to, and the 2-3 drops of oil I used lasted for hours.There were only two things I didn't like, and they don't affect performance at all. First, the instructions are very difficult to read. I spent 5 minutes tearing apart the box and twisting parts of the diffuser after reading "Use the measuring cup to fill the reservoir with water". Ah, now I know they mean the measuring cup in my drawer in my kitchen :) Lots of really bad grammar in the instructions. Second, there is a safety feature that turns it off when it gets dry, it would be nice if that same safety feature turned it off when the lid was removed. But neither of these things affect performance, and I really appreciate this little device!I was given this diffuser to evaluate and write a review based on my experience.

These are the best headphones you will find in this price range!  I would give them a 4.5 if that was available.  They are easy to navigate, and easy to pair with phone or laptop.  The range is surprising, and being able to walk upstairs and around without losing connection to my downstairs phone was nice.  Sound quality is nice, with *great* treble and high range, equalized nicely.  They fold up nicely and can fit whatever other case you may have sitting around.  They are fairly light, and quite comfortable on the ears for extended wearing.The only reason I don't give them a 5 is that based on the advertising, I was expecting a bit more from the bass - the bass was fine, just my expectations had been set for more. Second, the stitching on one ear piece started coming undone just a bit (which I am sure the manufacturer would replace, and was super easy to just tuck in a bit).  But honestly, I have not seen a better pair of headphones in this price range. The next step up would be 100+ headphones.I received a pair of these headphones complimentary to review.Overall, this is a very, very solid pair of headphones, and since I gave mine away to a DJ who loved them, I plan on getting another set.

2 bathrooms, 11 people and not an ounce of Poo-Pourri to be had!  Yikes!  Amazon to the rescue, though, and a delivery in under 24 hours to a sleepy little beach town of less than 200 people, and we were saved!  It felt like FEMA had come in after a disaster...one of the best packages I've ever received!This stuff is amazing, and seriously, don't leave home without it.  This package even comes with a tiny little package for the purse, which is super helpful when you are out at a tiny little restaurant, there is only one bathroom, and you know there will be 3 or 4 people waiting in line after you. The purse version, though, is a bit difficult to spray.We are big fans of Poo-Pourri, and it works like a charm - a magical charm against stink!  We have it in several different scents - this one is nice, but definitely try some of the others!

Hmm, 5, or 4 stars?  I am tempted to give it 4 stars, just because it was insanely difficult for my old eyes :)  But I kept with it, even though I still can't find the shirt with the smiley!  I asked a couple kids to help me out, and they enjoyed it, and found things a bit faster than I did.  I can't imagine what it takes to illustrate something like this!  Book is good for hours of fun, engaging, and I like the fact that there is a small story with it, as well as answers and a few other things to find besides just the cutes, but rather an added list of hard to find things.I got this book for free as part of Kindle Unlimited - such a great service!

Much tougher than anticipated!  This is my first United Cutlery item, and it certainly won't be my last.  Backpacked with this hanging off my pack for three weeks, with it's great little blade guard.  This thing lasts - it is durable, and not the cheap stuff you get elsewhere.  If I had not traded this to a local guide, I am sure I would have had it for years.

If you loved Bridget Jones diary, this movie is for you, with much of the same kind of storyline.  Add in some great sports and up the raunchiness factor a bit (OK, a lot!), and you have a Trainwreck in the making!  This was a fantastic, laugh out loud movie, and the audience was responding throughout in the theater I saw it in.Basic premise is simple - Amy plays a woman who sleeps around, avoids commitment, drinks WAY too much, and is just plain awkward.  She comes from an American broken home where the father slept around with pretty much everyone, but now suffers from MS. Her sister is perfectly married, and has a goofy step-child named Allister, who actually ends up being a bit of a darling.  She hates sports, and gets stuck interviewing a sports doctor, played by Bill Hader, falling in love, falling apart, and finally reconciling.Tons of cameos here - Marisa Tomei and Daniel Radcliffe, though this part gets a bit long, John Cena and Lebron James are both excellent, especially LeBron who is a bit of an unexpected comic presence.  Chris Evert, Matthew Broderick, Marv Alpert all play a small role.The jokes and gags in this film are excellent, and Judd Apatow, as usual, I think does an excellent job of making it all work, and giving these great people the room to play, along with Amy Schumer's script.  There are even some tender moments in here that work, and may tug a bit at your emotions.  If you are a fan of Amy Schumer, don't miss this excellent movie, you just might want to leave the kiddies at home.

I had made up my mind to skip this movie, even though I am a fan of the actors, the genre, and have seen every other Marvel movie.  If I hadn't looked at the well-written, comprehensive and positive reviews here, I would have missed what is undoubtedly one of the best Marvel films to date!  You can read all these great reviews here, so I will keep this short and sweet!.This was a joy to watch, innovative, with just the right blend of action, tension, family, incredible special effects, etc.  Michael Douglas was fantastic as always, Paul Rudd took a strange role in a genre he is not used to and made it his own.  Michael Pena was brilliant, and added some excellent comedic timing, with the lip syncing bits practically stealing the show.  And Evangeline Lily, you simply have to appreciate for the ability to portray a strong, sexy woman who can hold her own, can still show some emotion, and all without relying on tactics like butt shots and thigh high slit skirts. As she was referred to in the film - "the mean pretty lady".You'll laugh, you'll be astonished, you might even tear up a bit (not me, but maybe you), you'll cheer.  As with all Marvel films, wait for the final credits to finish, and let the anticipation begin!

Making the impossible not only possible, but believable.  And like a mouth full of Pop Rocks - this film is intense!  This is easily the best since the first Mission Impossible.  Cruise is in top form, and an inspiration to anyone from a fitness perspective - can you believe he is 53 years old?  I need to stop writing reviews and hit the gym more!  This film is nonstop action, you won't want to miss a minute.  Make sure to get there on time, because it jumps into intense action immediately, well before the opening credits.  This opening scene with Tom Cruise hanging onto the side of a military style plane sets the tone for the entire movie.Simplified premise is that the IMF has been disbanded after being implicated in the destruction of the Kremlin, they are absorbed by the CIA, Hunt is acting as a rogue agent, the Syndicate is out there, and not only do they need to be stopped, but the IMF has some pride in its mission and wants to clear any doubt about its efficacy.  There are plenty of double dealings with the main characters, espionage, and a water tank scene that will literally have you feel like you are running out of air.  More than that would be considered a spoiler :)Cast:Tom Cruise.  He really has become the king of action films.  In this one, I love the balance with the other characters - it is not just a showboating Tom Cruise, but a cast that works incredibly well together.  Sean Harris is a brilliant bad guy as Solomon Lane - calm, cool and collected.  Simon Pegg is a major player here as Benji, and is absolutely fantastic and totally in his element adding a touch of comedy. Rebecca Ferguson as Ilsa Faust - where did she come from?  Wow!  And she will keep you guessing throughout the film.  Ving is back as Luther (although limited), and Jeremy Renner plays a major role - I like his role here much better than previous roles such as Hawkeye in the Avengers.  Alec Baldwin is perfect as a political cog in the machine - the head of the CIA..Visually stunning, the action never lets up, the stunts are amazing, and the settings diverse.  Opening in Belarus, you'll spend time in Vienna and Casablanca, accompanied by the very suitable soundtrack by Lalo Schifrin.I had only one small complaint, and that is that I felt the congressional hearing to disband the IMF was a little too reminiscent of goofy Keystone Cops humor, and almost threatens the seriousness of a movie like this.  But you get through that scene quickly, and back into the action and storyline, and it is soon forgotten.I loved this film, with its incredible energy, a cast that really played off each other, real "set the bar" stunts, and diverse sets and locations.  The action never lets up, and it will certainly become a Friday night favorite for years to come.

I really enjoyed this story.  Stephen King is such an excellent writer, and it was truly a joy to read.  It was clear, came together well, made sense, and had a very appropriate ending with a few minor unexpected twists.  The characters are well thought out, complete, and developed in a way that few authors can rival.  Pace is excellent, and everything here happens for a reason - there are no loose ends or extraneous scenarios that leave you wondering "what was he trying to do here?".  This is a thrill ride that is hard to put down.You do not need to have read the first book in this 'series', Mr Mercedes.  King is a master storyteller, and the characters are so alive that you don't need the additional context.The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is that I felt that it was a bit too predictable.  I found myself pretty much anticipating everything that happened ahead of time.  Luckily, King is such a great writer that I looked forward to it.  Still, I also enjoy surprises and not knowing what is going to happen.

Very effective product.  This is 40% DEET.  It worked for mosquitos, black flies, etc. for a recent trip I took deep in the Amazon.  One can lasted approximately two weeks of heavy use, with a few occasional borrowers.A few tips:*Hard to use upside down, have to generally keep  can upright to get it to spray out correctly.*Use in a well-ventilated area - it is strong stuff.*Don't get it on your glasses - it is corrosive, and will eat away at any special coatings on your glasses.*Spray it on the ground around your tent to discourage ants and such.*Use sunscreen first, even if just applying at night, then apply the DEET if you are applying to skin.  This will help it not absorb as readily into your skin.*Buy through the Add-on program, much cheaper that way.*Be careful what you touch - it is tough on plastic, the fire retardant coating on your tent, etc*Apply liberally to ankles, collar and sleeves.  I also spray on hands and run my fingers through my hair.  If you have great hair, maybe you are better off with a hat :)

Excellent pillow, and for the price, excellent value.  I appreciate that it comes in a small storage sack as well.  I have used this camping, hiking, and on multiple airplanes as both a pillow and something to sit on.  For something to sit on, I usually have to push a bit of air out or it is too full.  Self-inflating works well, and only occasionally do I need to actually blow into it for added volume - e.g. using it as a chest pillow if reading while laying on stomach in tent.My only issue with it, and that is not a big issue, is that if you are tight on room in a small pack, this is probably not the pillow for you.  I carried it attached to a carabiner on my pack inside its storage sack, otherwise it would take too much space.  There are other options if you just need a very small bit of extra comfort that take up less space.  Personally, I find it worth it in most cases to hang this and take it with me.I also am not 100% enthused with the texture and material - it is not bad, but it has that kind of slickness to it that you would not get with a real pillow, for example.  But honestly, not bad, and I haven't come across anything else durable that would make me give up a real pillow :)

Rating a weak 4 stars.  Premise is that animals are rising up against humans.  One scientist was on to it, but died early on, and his son remains to carry on, trying to find and understand his research, find the answers, and participate with the gorgeous French scientist, his tough straight forward African friend, and anti-social animal scientist, played by Billy Burke, who you might remember from Revolution..If you are a fan of the book, this has very little to do with it.  Name and overall premise are the same, but most everything else is different, and in fact, kind of hard to recognize.  But if that doesn't bother you, or you haven't read the book, it is entertaining and fun - and to be honest, the book wasn't fantastic, so I doubt there is a lot of story loyalty stickiness there anyway.  If you are vegan, you will probably absolutely LOVE this series :)  I actually like this show better than I did the book, although the pace does sometimes drag a little if you are waiting for something to happen.Acting, writing, etc., is generally not anything great, or inspired, but it is entertaining.  I do enjoy Billy Burke's generally anti-social, sarcastic character.

This thing is SUPER bright!  Throws off more light than most larger flashlights at 1050 lumen on its brightest setting.  You do have to get the separate batteries for it, which can be a bit inconvenient, but worth it.  love the fact that you have 4 brightness settings, easy to use with a simple accessible push button.  This allows you to lower the brightness to conserve battery, or avoid blinding other people.It is sturdy, and very solid and well made.  I have dropped it many times, and have had no issue.  I have had it roll into the edge of the river, and it still works no problem.  Toss it in a backpack, and rolling around inside through tough hikes, etc., no issues.  This is a quality product, and worth getting a couple of them for the price.Also has a great little belt sheath for easy carrying and a loop for connecting to your beaner or pack.  Battery life is not days at high power, however, so you should take extra batteries.  Allow for about 2-2.5 hours on brightest setting, which gives you quite a few late night bathroom trips.  Note that the end of the light does get quite hot after a few minutes.  I rarely use it on high power, however, I usually use the 2nd or 3rd setting unless I am trying to spot in treelines.
Used this multiple times to tie up a two person hammock - didn't need to be doubled or anything, worked great.  Easy to coil back up, didn't tangle, super strong, easy to use even when wet.

You hope you never have to use it, but if you do, it is generally effective, at least minimizing symptoms if not getting rid of them.  It doesn't eliminate all symptoms in every case, so it isn't magic, but this along with some Cipro (ask for a prescription from your doctor if you are travelling off the beaten path), are just the ticket if you are out in the jungle, and want to minimize your use of banana leaves.

Dudes go trekking in the Amazon, and you and your mates will appreciate that you took your Dude Wipes with you!  These were great, and two packages were perfect for 3 weeks in the rainforest!  There were times when it was either bathe in a pool of electric eels, party with the piranhas, or apply Dude Wipes.Unscented, so they don't attract bugs - believe me, this is critical!  Especially in the areas you are most likely to be using them!Come out of the package easily, and as long as you don't yank them out, they don't tear.  Packaging seals back up nicely.Effective, didn't even use deodorant.  I am sure those were just wild pigs we smelled...Biodegradable, so theoretically could be buried, although I packed mine out.Highly recommend this product for anyone doing camping, beach, or just roughing it somehow.  Helps avoid the awkward question of "Did you bring baby wipes?"Now, if only they could add an anti-itch component for taking care of bug bites, this would definitely be a massive home run!

Fantastic product, but wicked expensive, thus the 4 stars vs 5, specifically just for value.  You can find alternate brands that are much less expensive.  However, these taste fantastic, and most importantly to me, they are a great travel companion.  They do not take up a lot of space, and can handle high or low temps with no problems - an ideal snack that also gives you a bit of hydration at the same time.  I had two packs of these Trekking in the Amazon, and believe me, when it is 100 degrees, humid, and you've drained your two water bottles, stopping for a rest and breaking out one of these was like a little slice of heaven.Tip: watch for sales.

These are FANTASTIC!  Used them for hours per day on an extended camping trip in the Amazon.  Ended up trading them to my indigenous guides because they were so enthused with them.  They charge easily, can get dumped in the water (or float), and last for hours.  They have multiple modes, although I really only used the main light at full power.  They pack down into less than half an inch high.  I will definitely be buying more, I wish they had a 20 pack.

These are FANTASTIC!  Used them for hours per day on an extended camping trip in the Amazon.  Ended up trading them to my indigenous guides because they were so enthused with them.  They charge easily, can get dumped in the water (or float), and last for hours.  They have multiple modes, although I really only used the main light at full power.  They pack down into less than half an inch high.  I will definitely be buying more, I wish they had a 20 pack.

Tiny little gear ties, this was the perfect accompaniment for an extended camping trip!  They are also great in the garage for keeping things organized, and I also use to twist up sets of electrical cords when charging a bunch of items so things don't get tangled.  Very nice set for the price, and so, so practical.

There truly is no other for camping.  This towel went through several weeks in the Amazon jungle, took a licking and just keeps on going.  I would use it to dry off at the river, and by the time I have walked back to my campsite, it is generally completely, or almost completely, dry.  The fact that you get an awesome little hand towel/washcloth and carrying bag is a real bonus!  It dries much better than I anticipated, very thorough and absorbent, wicking the moisture away easily.  I have been totally converted.
Super rugged and useful.  Not a lot else to say about it, these are a life saver if you need to hang things from inside your tent, gather cables together, or attach to a branch.

I was very happy with this overall.  Charging during the day, the light lasts for hours - in fact, I never had it go out, even at high power.  I love that I can charge a USB device directly while it is charging during the day.I give it 4 stars vs 5 for 2 reasons - first, it should come with a cable for non-solar charging, mine did not.  Second, even in direct sunlight, it takes the entire day to charge something the size of a cell phone.

These batteries are fantastic, and last a long time.  They take a bit longer to charge than I had expected - I had to leave them charging for 2 hours before the light turned green.  But I used all 4 (one at a time) in my flashlight on a trip to the Amazon, and they lasted for 3 weeks, with 1 barely used.

I have read this book twice now, mostly because I actually forgot I had read it - and it is generally a good book.  It is simplistic, but more complex than other books of his you might be familiar with, such as Maximum Ride.  I found the pace generally good, albeit sometimes a bit disconnected.  The overall idea is excellent - our overuse of tech and plastics has caused an evolutionary step change in animals.  If one were to look into the science behind this, it would be completely fabricated and not based on reality in any way - in fact, ridiculous.  But it is still an eventful read and intriguing, left completely open for a sequel.I would give this a 3.0 for the writing, style and characters, but feeling a tad generous with a 4 because I love the promise of the overall premise, and the story develops quickly, making it hard to put down.

I have been happy so far with these bottles, and have bought multiple sets now to store oil in. They have a great fit, consistent in quality, nd a fair price.  Oils should not be kept in clear bottles, so your choices end up being these blue bottles, or the standard browns, and I chose these for a slightly different look.  The dropper is a great feature, and I have had no issues with them at all.  I only give it a 4 because it is really  good quality bottle for a fair price, and meeting all my expectations, although I have found a couple so far that have leaked slightly.

Excellent choice for an unscented deodorant/anti-perspirant.  I bought this for a camping trip into the Amazon - bees and other bugs are attracted to things that are scented, so using my normal Axe was not advisable.  This is an effective product, and great value in the six pack.  I give it 4 stars only, because I do not quite feel the same fresh feeling after a day - it feels like it kind of runs out of power, but it is also a bit more humid and strenuous here than I am used to, so I might not be being totally fair...

We are big fans of this dog food.  More importantly, however, our dogs like it.  It is fairly priced, great ingredients, and not full of grain fillers.  We add a little bit of additive to it, along with some occasional fish oil.  We have been on this food for about the last two years.

Most comfortable underwear ever.  I love these, and if they weren't so darned expensive, I would replace all of mine with these.  However, they are expensive, and they don't come in discount multi-packs.  They are great for home use, but for travel they are fantastic.  Very gentle seams make it comfortable to be in a plane (or at least less uncomfortable!).  They are great for washing at the hotel room or on the trail - they dry super fast, just a few hours hanging in the hotel room and they are done, whereas my cotton and other blends can take 24 hours+.  They are even faster hanging out in the sun on the trail.Highly recommended, just have a hard time buying too many at this price.

Great staple for the first aid kit - car, home, travel.  I am a big fan of Benadryl in all its forms.  This one is nice, because while Benadryl usually makes a person a bit drowsy, this really has no side effects that I have ever noticed, and does an excellent job with bug bites, plant rashes, etc.  Highly recommended that you have this around.  Note that you should still carry Benadryl tablets as well in case of potential allergic reactions, or camping and needing to sleep better at night after itchy bug bites.

UPDATE:  Just put this chair through its paces on a trek in the Amazon.  3 weeks of sand, forest, jungle, even using it for bathing at the edge of the river.  It held up perfectly, and at the end, one of our indigenous guides traded me a lovely handmade war club for it.  One thing would make this absolutely perfect, and that would be the ability to telescope the legs a few inches to adjust the height within at least a 3-4 inch range.  Sitting for an hour or more in this when your are taller than about 5'8 - 5'9 can get a little tiresome.  There are some more comfortable chairs on the market, but none that beat the convenience, weight and size of this one, which can easily fit in a backpack water bottle holder.  You can bet that I will be buying another.I love this chair!  I am 225#, and have had absolutely no problems with this little lightweight camp stool.  Well, other than the fact that my butt might be just a touch over the edges.  But I feel comfortable, sturdy, and it is the simplest thing in the world to fold out and set up.  In fact, there really isn't anything you can do wrong, to be honest.  It might not be the perfect comfy chair, but it a) fits in a pack for hiking and b) is a heck of a lot better than the ground, a rock, whatever.Tip: put this right up next to a tree for your backrest, and you'll be comfortable for hours.This is great value for the money, and truly practical.

The ultimate staple for first aid kits.  I keep some of this in my house, my car, my travel first aid kit.  It is the perfect thing to take for bug bites, allergic reactions to dog or cat fur or plants, etc.  One of the best things about Benadryl is that it also makes you drowsy.  So if you are itchy at night from all those mosquito bites around the campfire because you refused to use a good bug spray, this will do the trick - reliving the itch and putting you right to sleep for the night.The 48 pack is perfect, so you can easily split it up for home, car and travel.Note, I find that the worse my allergies are, the less drowsy I get as a result.  Your mileage may vary.  I tend to take this when having problems, not as a preventive measure.

We really enjoyed this lovely game for 3-8 players.  It is quick, so a great game for people who don't like to commit or have short attention spans :).  It is small, so it is easy to bring with you.  Because of the level of randomness and partner play, you can play with a wide variety of participants at different skill levels and still have fun.  We play it with multiple people who have English as a second language, and it flows well for that.  You can be playing this game within 5 minutes of getting it.Two things prevent me from rating it higher.  First, much of it tends to be a bit easy for true word nerds.  Second, the deck of cards is fairly small, so play time is somewhat limited - you'll get through all of the cards easily in a few nights of play.Two tips:Tip #1 - save the little plastic bag that the dice and small cards come in - it is useful later to store pieces, since there is not a nicely compartmentalized spot in the box to separate them out.Tip #2 - this game is for 3-8 people,  We modified the rules to go with 2 people and it is still fun.  Just do the following:* Don't use the partner die.  Just play every turn as if it were solo.* Us vs them simply becomes me vs you, and you play it that way.

There is no argument that this is the world's best e-reader already, so the discussion is really around what version to buy, since having one should be a given.  It is far beyond any competition.  And although I LOVE the feel of a book, I have learned to love this even more, with easy word lookups, marking passages, finding relevant information and incredible lighting and reading experience for my aging eyes.  And several thousand books in a 7.2oz package is awful nice.UPDATE! Just figured something out that many people probably know already.  Was travelling in Brazil, and learning Portuguese, and stopped in a store to get a book.  They are 3x the price in the states, so I thought, "I wonder if that is on Kindle?"  Well, I am happy to say that all the Portuguese books I could ever want are on Kindle Unlimited.  But the best thing is it also automatically downloads a dictionary, so when you hold down on one of the unfamiliar words, BOOM! there is the definition, what an ideal tool to round out language study!  Loving it!  Chapter 5 of Harry Potter, here we go!DON'T HAVE A KINDLE PAPERWHITE?  If you don't have an e-reader, have a different brand e-reader, or have a Kindle that is not a paperwhite, then this version is a valuable upgrade to you.  It is light, easy to hold, simple to operate, and is the closest thing to a book 'experience' as you can get.  It is incredibly easy to read at a beach with no glare, or at night.  I use my Kindle everywhere in many conditions, and have never looked back.  The price gap, at least for the moment, is only $10 between the new Kindle PW and the previous version, so it makes sense to buy the new one.  However, keep an eye on it, and if the price drops further for the previous gen, it is not really compelling enough to spend the extra $$$ for this brand new one.ALREADY HAVE AN OLDER PAPERWHITE?  So, if you already have a paperwhite, is this 2015 upgrade worth it?Consider COST first  it is $119 w/ special offers, no 3G.  Then you add $20 if you want no special offers, and another 70 (plus about 5% extra weight) for 3G.  That extra $90 buys a lot of books!*Buy 3G? I find internet access pervasive nearly everywhere, and have not used my 3G at all.  I buy the books ahead of time, and if I actually ran out of books on a trip, it would not be unanticipated, and I would certainly have some internet access at some point.  I simply don't find the 3G to be something I need, even for a small price.*Likewise for SPECIAL OFFERS...they do not interfere with reading at all, they are pretty unobtrusive, and I have even found a couple to be of interest and have made a purchase decision from that.Then COMPARE.  I love this compared to my original paper white.  There really is no comparison, and if you have, and love, your original, this is a great upgrade.  It is lighter, crisper, has great adjustable lighting, more memory and features, it is well worth $119 to upgrade, and give the other to a family member or friend.BATTERY  life.  I started with this new Kindle PW and my old Kindle PW charged up fully.  After using each for a couple hours, I noticed no difference in the battery degradation.  Obviously this is not a scientific test, and the chance for variance is high, but Amazon says you can still get several weeks of life from this new Kindle, and I see no reason to doubt that.  Mathematically, the battery spec provided by Amazon shows a slight decrease, but I still charge my Kindle once every week or two just to make sure I don't run out, and that has always worked out just fine for me.CLARITY: If you have the 2nd generation paperwhite (late 2013): it is a more difficult choice.  Personally, I think it is worth it, but definitely not compelling if you are short on funds.  The increase in PPI from 212 to 300 is noticeable, as is the pleasant new font Bookerly. The main thing for me, however, is actually this new Bookerly font.  It is much easier to read.  I started wearing reading glasses about 6 years ago, and in comparisons with my other PW, I can read effectively at one size smaller font due to font clarity and gentle contrast on a better screen.  That may not seem like much, but I appreciate less page turning and interruptions.  YMMV.Big IF - If your eyesight depends on HIGHER CONTRAST, the new Kindle PaperWhite is actually not as bright as the last gen PW.  I have included side by side pictures to demonstrate this.  The new PW seems more like a book to me, with its nice gentle light.  In the pictures, I have used the same font, same brightness, etc., so that you can see the detail for yourself.  The new Kindle is on the right.OVERALL, this is a worthwhile upgrade for anyone who does not already have a 2nd generation PW.  If you have a 2nd generation already, it might be something you do only if the specific need is there, or if you want to give your old one away.Finally, what about the WARRANTY?  When these devices were $399 plus, maybe getting an extended warranty was worthwhile.  But with the prices continually falling, and the likelihood that one will actually fail extremely slim (I have had only one instance, and Amazon replaced it immediately), I would personally recommend against the purchase.  Seems silly to insure a $100 device that has a low failure rate, spending an extra $19 for year, or up to $39 for 3 years of extended coverage.TIPS:Do yourself a huge favor and get a case.Password protect your screen.  If someone gets your Kindle, they can spend your money and make lots of problems.SMALL UPDATE:  I have been using this to send documents to for reading, mostly PDFs.  It is functional, but if you require good reading of PDFs, then you probably won't like it that much, and you would be better off with a traditional tablet.  The issue is that the font is exceedingly small, and there is no way to expand or enlarge that I have found.  You can make the font slightly larger by entering landscape mode, but then the flow is off.  I also end up with an occasional crash of the browser.

This movie was really funny  but not continuously, more of a few hugely funny storms followed by some dry spells.  You need to be stoned to truly appreciate it  since only 41% of critics liked it, I conclude that 59% were not stoned.  There were at least 5 people in the theater with vape pens  welcome to Washington State!Directed by the infamous Seth McFarlane, who also plays Ted, this movie is about Teds journey to become a person.  After Ted and Tammy cannot conceive (Ted is not quite anatomically correct), they decide to adopt, which puts them square onto the radar of the government, who decides Ted is not a person and annuls his marriage and denies their dreams of parenthood.  Amanda Seyfried is a young lawyer who ends up taking the case pro bono.  A bit of a side story involves Hasbro toys, and their evil plot to make millions of Teds, but the real play here is about Ted, and what makes a person.  It is actually well done from that perspective.There were several things to really appreciate and watch out for here.  First of all, Mark Wahlberg and Ted are magic, just like in the first movie  in fact, their relationship and interaction continues to grow and seem more and more natural.  What an amazing job Wahlberg does, as well as the animators.  Second, I absolutely love Amanda Seyfried, who steps into this perfectly  from lighting up during the first meeting to touching moment of her singing the song about the moon above a pot farm.  She is an incredibly good sport with the Gollum references  wow.  There are amazing comedic moments.  Without giving anything away, watch for the Kardashian comment (groan), as well as the moment when the theme from Jurassic Park starts playing.  Finally, there are some amazing cameos and other appearances throughout.  Morgan Freeman is brilliant, Jay Leno is just plain awkward, Liam Neeson makes a completely pointless cameo, but nonetheless well worth it  especially if you wait until the absolute end of the credits, Tom Brady sketch is brilliant (super awkward, but I am sure there are many women out there who would volunteer!), during which Ted is sporting a Paddington style raincoat - very clever.  Finally, Jessica Barth as Tammy (Teds wife) is incredible, and probably my favorite part of this movie.There are also some things not to like so much, which is why I only gave it 4 stars vs 5 for the original Ted.  First of all, most of the jokes were a bit tiresome.  Funny, but then repeated ad nauseum.  Of course, I mostly forgot that it was a repeat and laughed anyway '  There was way too much focus on the black humor, and that quickly ran out of juice, so to speak.  Finally, this whole thing with Donny and Hasbro being resurrected just didnt add a lot to the story.Overall, a great romp, fun, definitely not something to see with the kids, or even sober.  But given the current themes where dolphins and orangutans have recently been granted non-human sentient status by various gov entities, it actually gave rise to quite a bit of follow on discussion the next couple evenings about what defines a person.  Rated R.Tip:  If you are watching this at home, you may also want to get the following cookbook, which is a great companion to any Ted movie - http://www.amazon.com/Baked-Over-Tasty-Marijuana-Treats/dp/1931160805

Had an instant connection to the characters.  The series, interestingly, is created and written by the two stars - Rob Delaney, who plays Rob, and Sharon Horgan, who plays Sharon.  It is witty, funny, refreshing, awkward all at the same time.  The characters are honest and insightful, and I was laughing all the way through every episode!  It is too bad these episodes are only 25 minutes, because this series is a winner.  Well acted, you really do believe these are two strangers who ended up pregnant after a week long one night stand, or as Rob puts it "I'm not a stranger, more of a familiar acquaintance".  They are truly ordinary people in an awkward situation amid all the strange friendships that get even stranger when mixed with both UK (British and Irish) and US perspectives.I love the dialog...here are a few examples...In regards to having a baby: "We could do this and not f* up the kid too horribly"Regarding birth: "You see that little troll come tobogganing out of your wife, on a wave of turds, and you'll hold her responsible"Regarding the best friend's naturopathic remedies:  "My guru cured himself of prostate cancer with walnuts"  Rob: "Give me a break!  What did he do, jam them up his a$$?"The other characters are excellent - his irresponsible model-loving friend, her best friend, Rob's mom who continues to research how to get out of this mess, etc.  You'll see several people you'll recognize, such as Carrie Fisher, and that Captain from the show Outland, for example.I highly encourage you to give this show a chance - watch it all the way through, take in the catastrophic proposal, the bachelor party, the wedding night. It is NSFW, and not kid friendly.

I was looking forward to this book, and ordered it MONTHS ago.  So yesterday, when it showed up on my Kindle, I was excited to read it.  I actually haven't been reading too much, and this series has dropped off my radar for quite a while, so I missed a few in the middle.  But I am a big fan of the world, and Anita Blake.However, this book is still simply trying to show and develop the character of Anita Blake, with literally nothing new that I could tell.  Yes, she is tough and sexy, just the kind of person I would like to have as a friend (definitely not enemy) in real life.  But the story here was pretty much just her, with little happening.  I found myself growing a bit bored, to be honest, and disappointed that I picked up this series again when there is so much else out there to read this summer.  It seems to have lost its purpose - it wasn't sexy enough to be really sexy, it wasn't tough enough to be real adventure, it wasn't introspective enough to be thoughtful, etc.  It was just kind of lost in the middle.

I might be just a bit generous on this rating, but I have been reading Brooks since the 1977 Sword of Shannara, and I absolutely love this universe, the history, the detail.  Terry Brooks novels are never like a wild ride through the rapids, with excitement at every turn, but rather more like a hike, with beautiful vistas and a slowly unfolding story (at least until you meet the bear in the woods :)). This story was no different, although a bit less complex than others in the past.Paxon Leah, who we met in the last book, continues on in his role as protector, and we still have Arcannen, the evil sorcerer who escaped.  The wishsong is the focal point of the story, and the intent is to find the source of the magic before it can fall into the wrong hands (obviously that is Arcannen).  The story is a bit slower, and feels sometimes a bit more awkward than other past novels.  Perhaps after reading so many books, the formula is showing a bit of its age at this point.But this is still a great story, perfect for taking on vacation and losing yourself in.  But while this story would be able to be read standalone, there is a lot of history and character affinity that you will miss out on.  If you have a nice summer vacation ahead of you, I would highly recommend grabbing some of the other books, starting with the amazing first, and getting lost in this universe.  You can find the author's page at: http://www.amazon.com/Terry-Brooks/e/B000APZAHI/ref=sr_tc_2_0?qid=1433865231&sr=8-2-ent, and in fact, the first trilogy, Sword, Elfstones, and Wishong of Shannara, is only $8.99!
